events.name: Hackathon@ Startup Asia Jakarta
events.about:
Hackathon

  • Hackathon Location: 12th Floor, Annex Building, Wisma Nusantara Complex, Jl. M.H. Thamrin No. 59 Jakarta 10350, Indonesia (Annex Building behind Hotel Pullman)
  • Date & Time: Starts Thursday, June 7, 2012 at 1.00pm, ends Friday, June 8, 2012, at 2.00pm.
  • What it is: Double-fist Red Bull and coffee while you hack a totally brand new Android app in 24 hours with your team. To add to the fun, we have a bundle of APIs for you to hack with, ranging from server, social and location, and monetization APIs.
  • Why you should participate: Meet new developers, explore new APIs, and put your hacking skills to test against other developers from around Asia. Plus, you can win some cool prizes!
events.address: Kompleks Wisma Nusantara, Jl. M.H. Thamrin No. 59

events.name: Vodafone xone™ AI Hackathon
events.about:
Vodafone xone™,  in collaboration with one of its incubating start-up partners, Expertmaker, is hosting a ground-breaking developer Hackathon event - Vodafone xone™ AI Hackathon.

The event is focused on Artificial Intelligence (AI) and analytics for developers and entrepreneurs to tackle the issue of content and news overload on mobile devices. All participants will be able to use Expertmaker’s premier AI platform to create the most intelligent solution for the challenges we face in a data-flooded world.

WHAT:          

Expertmaker and Vodafone xone AI Hackathon to address and help solve information overload.

WHO:             

Developers, front-end designers, university students, entrepreneurs, product marketers, data analyst, computer scientists, programmers, etc. are invited to develop a new generation of intelligent apps using AI and big data analytics. No previous AI experience is needed, as the Expertmaker platform is designed to allow easy integration.

WHEN:          

Friday, June 8           5:00 p.m. – 12:00 a.m.       Registration/Q&A Session

Saturday, June 9      9:00 a.m. – 12:00 a.m.       Hackathon – All Day

Sunday, June 10       9:00 a.m. – 4:00 p.m.         Hackathon – Complete

5:00 p.m. – 6:00 p.m.         App Demos/Presentations

6:00 p.m. – 7:00 p.m.         Judging/Winners Announced

WHERE:        

Vodafone xone

275 Shoreline Drive, Suite 400

Redwood City, CA 94065 USA

PRIZES:         

All participants will receive a free one-year Expertmaker license to power the Hackathon app and any other AI powered apps they choose to create. In addition, cash prizes will be awarded to first, second and third place teams as judged by Expertmaker, Vodafone and Verizon Wireless:

  • 1st Place:  $10,000
  • 2nd Place:  $7,000
  • 3rd Place:  $4,000 

*Many prize awards must be included in taxable income. Winners should consult with a tax professional at your own cost regarding the potential tax liability of this award.

 REGISTER:   

Space is limited. Participants must sign up by Friday, May 25th.

REGISTER NOW: http://www.expertmaker.com/hackathon/

For more information, please visit: http://expertmaker.com/partners/vodafoneaichallenge

Stay updated on Twitter at #AIHack for the latest event developments.

https://twitter.com/#!/VodafoneXone 

**All meals provided for contestants throughout the day Fri-Sun.  (Vegetarian meals will also be included).

events.name: OpenIt4Africa
events.about:
Pourquoi OpenIt4Africa?

A lheure où les innovations américaines, européennes, asiatiques occupent une large place dans lespace médiatique international, linnovation Africaine, fait quant à elle figure de grand oublié. Pourtant son potentiel nest plus à démontrer. Les idées et produits les plus novateurs de ces dernières années ont débutés en Afrique et ont été exportés bien au-delà du continent comme M-pesa, Ushaidi ou encore Mxit.

Quest-ce quun Hackathon?

Le Hackathon est un événement au cours duquel des équipes se réunissent jusquà laboutissement de leurs idées. Lobjectif étant de mettre linnovation et la collaboration au service du développement de projets.

Hackathon dédié à la création de projet technos pour lAfrique

Le 8 juin 2012, OpenIt4Africa lancera un défi aux ingénieurs, développeurs, entrepreneurs, gestionnaires et spécialistes chevronnés Montréalais : travailler ensemble et donner vie à des projets liés aux nouvelles technologies. 

Durant un Hackathon de 48 heures, les équipes auront pour mission de concevoir, développer et présenter un projet novateur adapté à lenvironnement africain, dans le domaine de leurs choix (Agriculture, Transport, Commerce, Santé, Éducation, Énergie). 

Le Hackathon OpenIt4Africa aura lieu à la Maison Notman et débutera par une conférence où des organisations, compagnies et institutions œuvrant en Afrique seront invitées à partager idées, études, et réalités locales. Les participants seront ensuite mis au défi de travailler en moins de 48 heures sur leurs projets. Les solutions proposées, devront pouvoir être réalisées rapidement sur le terrain et être en corrélation avec les spécificités locales.

Montréal, une ville dinnovation

Entre Toronto, New York, Washington D.C., Paris et Londres, Montréal attire compétences, créativité et diversité. Véritable carrefour entre lEurope, lAfrique et lAmérique du Nord, Montréal affirme année après année sa position de ville orientée vers le savoir et linnovation.

events.name: XHack 2012 "Hack to the Future"
events.about:
XHack is excited to host its inaugural event in San Francisco.  The Bay Area is a hot bed for creative, talented and adventurous hackers and there’s no better place to organize a gathering focused on building for the future.  XHack will bring together the best API’s in photo, video, audio and social to enable the hackers to have free reign to create the most exciting new hacks. 

Our theme is “Hack to the Future” playing off of the legendary movie Back to the Future.  You’re encouraged to dress like the iconic characters and have fun with the theme.  There will be prizes, entertainment and contests that even Doc Brown would appreciate. 

Who Should Come?:  Developers in the photo, video, audio, mobile and social space that want to build a cool hack

What Should You Expect?:  An awesome time.  Eat, drink, hang out and HACK with the most amazing mobile and web developers and designers in the Bay Area and beyond. 

When & Where:  June 8-10th at RadiumOne Labs.  55 Second St. 18th Floor, San Francisco, CA. 

Additional Details

  • Awesome API’s
  • The best developers from the best companies
  • Food and drinks throughout
  • Killer sponsored prizes
  • Cash prizes
  • Costume contest
  • Music and entertainment
  • Friday happy hour and Sunday after party
  • Ample opportunity for developers to meet, mingle, showoff, collaborate and have fun with other amazing developers. 
  • Presentations from some great guest speakers
  • An industry-leading panel of judges

On the weekend of the event, we’ll be using HackerLeague and our Twitter account to post all relevant news and updates.  When you’re ready to submit your hack, you can create an account and do so on HackerLeague.

For more information, go to www.xhack2012.com.

events.name: AT&T Mobile App Hackathon - Education (Palo Alto)
events.about:
Have an app idea or need an app built for your business?

This very special AT&T Mobile App Hackathon Education, an event produced by the AT&T Developer Program and AT&T Aspire, is designed for attendees both technical & non-technical to build apps/mobile apps to benefit our education system.  We will have free food compliments of Amazon Web Services, great speakers, and some awesome prizes provided by our sponsors.  Developers, teachers, and students are heavily encouraged to meet new people, scout for teammates, and collaborate to help improve education.

Our hackathon will introduce you to the latest cutting edge tools to help deploy your own app with a website backend, fully hosted in the cloud. As far as platforms are concerned, feel free to code in the language you feel most comfortable, whether its Objective C, Java, Javascript, HTML, C #, Dot Net, or XNA. Even if you are rusty with your programming, we will have live developer support from local senior developers as well as from AT&T, Exadel, and Apigee to help you code that much faster.

Event Schedule.  The following is a list of the weekends agenda:

  • 6PM - Friday Evening. AT&T Mobile App Hackathon. Kickoff event with drinks, networking, and developer dating which leads into idea pitches and team formation.
  • 10AM - Saturday Morning - AT&T Mobile App Hackathon. The fun continues with an all day hackathon. Work with the teams that you formed on Friday night to produce the app spec’d out the night before. Senseis will be available throughout the entire event to help you code up your solution. App submissions will be accepted throughout the day with a deadline of 7PM.
  • 7PM - Saturday Evening. Promptly at 7PM, teams will begin pitching their ventures. Pitches are limited to three (3) minutes per team.

Prizes. The following prizes, provided by our generous sponsors, are geared towards accelerating you towards successfuling completing your app and improving our education system:

  • TBA

Judging Criteria. Apps will be judged based on the the criteria below and weighted accordingly.  

  • 33% Weight - Ability to clearly articulate what your app does
  • 33% Weight - Originality of idea
  • 33% Weight - Use of Node.JS, Sencha, cloud9ide.com, Heroku, and other technologies

Speakers

Alex Donn is a Developer Evangelist with the AT&T Developer Program and is based out of sunny Seattle! His passion is educating developers young and old about mobile application development best practices through events like hackathons that fuse the collective interests of multiple technology and business leaders.  

Lucien Vattel, GameDesk’s CEO, is the senior scholar and driving leadership for the Institute. His historical expertise in design, learning, and computational sciences has focused on transformative new school models, simulation and game learning, and digital curriculum development for at-risk populations

Banny Banerjee, Associate Professor at Stanford University, is interested in realizing the design field’s potential in catalyzing systemic change. His focus is to develop transdisciplinary processes to bring about rapid change and large-scale impact. He is the founder of the “Design for Change Lab” to address issues of sustainability, technology futures, and the dynamics of rapid change.

Gregg Alpert, West Coast Developer Relations Manager, Future Technologies. Gregg is passionate about education reform, technology, and business and believes many of the major issues in education can be improved through innovative technologies. He has an MBA with a focus in entrepreneurship and finance.

Senseis 

  •  TBA

events.name: Open Mobile App Hackathon at START
events.about:
We are pleased to announce the launch of the first mobile focused co working space - START.

Shocking yes right here in Houston!

 

 

Join us for 12 hours of adrenalin pumping redbull downing app development and be prepared to demo to win major street cred with your peers. The winner or team will receive 3 months of complimentary usage of space at START.


Come build teams or preview the space on Friday June 8th between 6pm-9pm. 

Open house for folks interested in signing up for desk space on Sunday the 10th from 12pm-6pm.

What you need to bring: Design/Development skills, laptop and mobile device of choice.


Parking: There is free parking available on the street all around the space.

events.name: HackMTL 2012 - HackDays.ca
events.about:
HackMTL 2nd Edition is the 2012 Montreal-based edition of HackDays, the one-day API programming hackathon events that take place across Canada.

For one day, teams of 1 - 3 developers work on integrating with one or more of the sponsors APIs. Judges from the local tech community judge based on awesomeness and technical difficulty, and we award fantastic prizes (more details on prizes coming soon!).

Well start with a mixer on Friday night so people can find development partners and meet everyone else, and then you have one day on Saturday to code your entire application. Well keep you fed and pour you a beer at the end of the day, and then the presentations and judging occur.

 

 

For more information, follow the HackMTL category on the HackDays blog »

events.name: That Conference Chicago Hackathon
events.about:
Can you Build a Web, Mobile or Cloud 

App in 24 Hours?

Developers: caffeinate and get ready to dominate! Bring your laptops, phones, gadgets and dev tools to the That Conference Chicago Hackathon for the inaugural 24-hour coding challenge. Develop your own web, mobile and/or cloud app, present it and compete for your share of prizes. Winners will walk away with mad props and cool loot.

And to add even more fun, your citys reputation is on the line. That Conference is running hackathons across multiple cities to find the best developers. The top two teams from each city will get to compete to win the audiences vote during That Conference in August.

What to Expect

Competition

The Chicago event kicks off on Saturday, June 9th at the Illinois Technology Association and runs through the night until Sunday afternoon. Developers are free to use any technology to build any kind of web, mobile and/or cloud applications they choose. There are no limits on team size, but wheres the fun in going it alone?

Any Technology, Any Platform

 Participants do NOT have to be here the full 24 hours, though we certainly encourage it (itll be a lot of fun!). We do ask registrants to indicate which times theyll be at the hackathon so we can plan food, etc.

Judges will be on hand on Sunday afternoon to pick the top 2 teams.  Feel free to invite your friends to watch you present. 

What to bring

Bring your laptop (and powercord), phones, gadgets and development tools and anything you need to be productive.  And your A-game. Youre going to need that.

Space is limited, so RSVP soon!

Food, beverages and refreshments will be provided.

Hosted By

 

 

Sponsors


 

Community Sponsors

events.name: DEP and Gravity Centre present City 2.0 Hackathon, hosted at the AT&T Foundry
events.about:
Dallas Engaged Professionals and Gravity Centre our proud to present our City 2.0 Hackathon. Our collaboration piece, following our meeting with Tech Wildcatters and Startup Texas, will be hosted by the AT&T Foundry in Plano on June 9th.


We will start things off promptly at 1:00pm with an opportunity to develop our ideas and meet the coders and developers. Our hackathon will last 8 hours and will be a competition featuring members of both DEP and Gravity Centre.


This will be a great opportunity to learn more about the building and development process of all of tech tools. Our goal is to collaborate and build our own tool that benefits the city and how we engage with our community.

events.name: M2M Killer App Hackathon June 11-13, 2012
events.about:
Bring your game: Three sessions, two days, one objective: Create the world’s first killer M2M app!

June 11-13, 2012 during the Connected World Conference at the Pheasant Run Resort at 4051 East Main Street in St. Charles, IL 60174
Hackers nationwide are invited to participate in the first ever M2M app Hackathon—with fame and fortune as the reward for your creativity and skills! We provide the energy drinks, snacks, developer kits, and the room to code—all day and all night. The winners will receive not only cash, but a secure place in the history of hacking—guaranteed by a cover story in the nationally distributed Connected World magazine.

Drop your mouse and check out these incentives:
1st place: $3,000 plus be featured on the cover of Connected World magazine and mentioned in the cover story
2nd place: $1,500
3rd place: iPad
4th place: Cellular signal booster

About the Hackathons:
Join us June 11 starting at 4:00 p.m., and grab some free food and drink, as well as your developer kit to get started. You may participate in one or all three Hackathon sessions—either as an individual or as a team. Space is limited so sign up to participate today.

events.name: Ready.Set () {Code} Challenge  - Chevy Chase, MD
events.about:
Ready.Set () {Code} Challenge

Headphones on. Tilt the seat back. Just steady codin’ as the keys get tapped. Get ready, because Nokia Developer is about to turn your town into Dev City with its Ready.Set () {Code} Challenge.

 

We are hitting the road to 13-cities looking for developers who want to build an experience not just another app. To kick off the Ready.Set () {Code} Challenge, Nokia Developer will hold hackathons across the US and Canada beginning in May. You can sign up individually or form your own team to build the coolest, baddest apps for the Windows Phone platform and Nokia Lumia devices.

 

Prizes will be awarded on site at each event for the top 3 created apps, top student created app, and most Nokia-branded developer (use your imagination). App winners will be judged on creativity, usability, technical difficulty and app presentation.

 

1st place:                                                $500 gift card & Nokia Lumia 900

2nd place:                                               $250 gift card & Nokia Lumia 900

3rd place:                                               $100 gift card & Nokia Lumia 900

Student Winner:                                   $150 gift card & Nokia Lumia 900

Most Nokia-Branded Dev:                  $100 gift card & Nokia Lumia 900

 

At Nokia, we don’t have ordinary developers, so these won’t be ordinary hacks. We have some amazing experiences in store – like our Re-Charge Room - for developers to chill out between pounding out code. So come showoff your skills and earn rewards. Space will be limited so register early.

 

The Challenge is on. . . .Ready.Set () {Code}

 

Ready.Set () {Code} Challenge Schedule:

08:30 a.m.             Light breakfast and registration

09:00 a.m.             Welcome and competition overview

09:30 a.m.             Let the hacking begin!

12:30 p.m.             Lunch

07:00 p.m.             Show us your app/Dinner

08:00 p.m.             Winners announced

 

See rules here:

http://www.callingallinnovators.com/readysetchallenge/ChevyChase

events.name: Win8 Hackathon
events.about:
Have you started building your Windows 8 app?  Does this describe you?

 

·         Installed the Windows 8 Consumer Preview or Windows 8 Release preview?

 

·         Installed Visual Studio 11 Express for Windows 8

 

·         Started writing your Windows 8 Metro application

 

If so we are doing a Window 8 app building event on 6/12 in Minneapolis (e.g. hackathon, acceleration lab) with the goal being to help you make progress on, refine or even finish your Windows 9 Metro application.  This is not a training event, but rather an event focused on helping you make progress on your Windows 8 Metro application (please see the prerequisites below). 

So join us for this free, full-day event designed to help you with your Windows 8 coding and application building.  We can help with your apps integration with the Windows shell, including notifications, live tiles, deep links, and contracts with other apps.  Best of all you can build once and support all Windows customers, no matter what type of PC they have – from tablets to laptops to convertibles to desktops.

While you are at this event if your application meets the Windows Store requirements we’ll invite you to have your application reviewed by a Microsoft field engineer in an Excellence Lab.  If you app meets the requirements of the Windows store you’ll receive a token to submit you app to the Windows Store.  Additionally, if you application is selected to be reviewed in an Excellence Lab you’ll be in the running for one of five Samsung Series 7 Slates we are giving out.

 

Prerequisites:

 

·         Your personal identification

 

·         Please bring a notebook computer with

 

o    Windows 8 Consumer Preview or Windows 8 Release Preview installed

 

o    Visual Studio 11 Express for Windows 8

 

o    Your Windows 8 application that you are building.

events.name: SWAF Hackathon
events.about:
Semantic Web and Agri-Food Workshop and Hackathon

 

The workshop will focus on the ways semantic web and related technologies (ontologies, linked data, etc.) can be used across the food and agriculture supply chain to facilitate the exchange of information and enable the creation of additional services for farmers, transporters and processors of food, retailers and final consumers, in effect the whole supply chain. Supply chain integration is a holy grail in many industries but given the specific challenges of the agri-food sector and its importance to society, to the economy, and to the environment, such integration is vital.

Semantic technologies, ontologies and related technologies have grown considerably in maturity in recent years. This workshop seeks papers presenting all aspect of these technologies ranging from position papers to implemented systems and their evaluation. We are particularly interested in examples where semantic technologies are used to cross the boundaries between sub-sectors of the agri-food production and supply chain. Discussions of existing or proposed ontologies are welcome.

 

Part of the SmartAgrimatics International Conference taking place at Hotel Forest Hill – La Villette, 28 ter Avenue Corentin Cariou, 75 019 Paris

  

Full details of the workshop are available here: http://www.agrixchange.org/sam-workshop/semantic-web-and-

Following the workshop a hackathon will take place. For further details about the hackathon please go here.

This ticket allow you access to the workshop and hackathon only and not the conference as a whole.

events.name: AT&T Mobile App Hackathon - Tel Aviv, Israel
events.about:
Have an app idea or need an app built for your business?

Mobile App Hackathon is an event produced by the AT&T Developer Program and Apigee that is designed for attendees (technical & non-technical) to build apps/mobile apps, get fed, compete for prizes across different categories and most importantly: meet new people and scout for teammates to work on new or current projects. Our hackathon will introduce you to the latest cutting edge tools to help deploy your own app with a website backend, fully hosted in the cloud.

Objective C, Android, Java, ASM, Javascript, HTML, C #, Dot Net, XNA and all other languages are welcome. Your only objective is to get a mobile app running regardless of an HTML5, Mobile Web or native implementation. Even if you are rusty with your programming, we will have live developer support from local senior developers as well as from AT&T, Sencha, and Apigee to help you code that much faster.

Event Schedule.  The following is a list of the weekends agenda:

  • 6PM - Friday Evening - Kickoff event with drinks, networking, and developer dating which leads into idea pitches and team formation.
  • 10AM - Saturday Morning - The fun continues with an all day hackathon. Work with the teams that you formed on Friday night to produce the app spec’d out the night before. Senseis will be available throughout the entire event to help you code up your solution. App submissions will be accepted throughout the day with a deadline of 7PM.
  • 7PM - Saturday Evening - Promptly at 7PM, teams will begin pitching their ventures. Pitches are limited to three (3) minutes per team.

Prizes. The following prizes are experiential and geared towards accelerating you towards a successful business as well as expanding your network and industry knowledge:

  • TBA

Judging Criteria. Apps will be judged based on the the criteria below and weighted accordingly.  

  • 33% Weight - Ability to clearly articulate what your app does
  • 33% Weight - Originality of idea
  • 33% Weight -  Technically challenging implementation 

Speakers

Alex Donn, a Developer Evangelist with the AT&T Developer Program, is based out of sunny Seattle! His passion is educating developers young and old about mobile application development best practices through events like hackathons that fuse the collective interests of multiple technology and business leaders.  

 

Jen Mazzon,, a product leader at Apigee, learned marketing and product management fundamentals at Intuit, eventually leaving to join the Upstartle gang as Writely’s VP of Marketing. Post Google acquisition, Jen helped re-launch Writely as Google Docs and product managed dozens of releases on Google Docs and Google Maps teams.
 

Senseis

  • TBA

Sponsors

events.name: Microsoft Windows 8 Developer Day
events.about:
Following on from the sold out Windows 8 Developer Day on May 30th, Microsoft Ireland want to give you some hands on time building Windows 8 apps.

-----


Windows 7 sold 240million copies in its first year, the sequel Windows 8 is coming and we want you to make and sell the apps that make it unique for each user.


 
This one day code camp will be your chance to create apps surrounded by Windows 8 experts who can answer your questions and blast through the bugs you encounter.

 

 By the end of this day you should have a metro designed, stable and functional Windows 8 app.

 To register for any of these workshops, please click on the links below: 

  • Dublin June 15th Sign up at http://dublinwin8.eventbrite.ie/
  • Belfast June 21st Sign up at http://belfastwin8.eventbrite.ie/
  • Cork June 19th Sign up at http://corkwin8.eventbrite.ie/

events.name: OpenIT4Africa Hackathon with Coders4Africa Kenya participation
events.about:
OpenIt4Africa announced the participation of Coders4Africa (hereafter C4A) in its next event scheduled for the 15th, 16th and 17th June in Montreal Canada. Three of C4A’s co-founders: Kwame Andah, Ali Kone and Vincent Muller will be on site for the event to present and discuss the development of new technologies in East and West Africa.
There will also be virtual participation from Amadou Daffe one of the other co-founders who will be joining remotely from the US, but also members of the Coders4Africa community located in Africa during the event.


With a 1000+ member strong network, C4A will be actively participating in the 48 hour hackathon with programmers from Kenya, Senegal, Ghana, United States, Canada and France. Each team will be working in seamless unison thanks to a live-stream and online interaction tools which will allow programmers and project managers to collaborate in real time.

C4A as part of the event, will work on an Open Data project, with the objective of launching websites offering open data for the cities of Dakar (Senegal), Nairobi (Kenya) and Accra (Ghana). A second project will be the development of a directory of IT Professionals in Africa, with users able to create and display his/her profile.

The C4A kenya chapter will be on the spolight. A local Kenyan team has alrady been working on the African Coder Locator project, and can use this hackathon event to get help from experts in the US and Canada . We will also need another team to work concurrently with the US/Canada team on the OpenDataNairobi project.

This event will be a unique opportunity to connect Coders4Africa members, especially those based in Africa, with Montreal hackers who will be able to see real examples of new technology development and local needs, states Vincent Muller, co-founder of Coders4Africa.
OpenIt4Africa is proud to partner with Coders4Africa, in assessing African talents and offering a launchpad for new projects in Africa, highlighted Heri Rakotomalala, co-founder of OpenIt4Africa.
The event scheduled for the 15th, 16th and 17th of June in Montreal, will begin with a series of keynotes and roundtables, with participants discussing opportunities for development of new technologies in Africa. The event will be followed by a hackathon, with the challenge of developing and launching a project for Africa in 48 hours. To learn more visit: http://openit4africa.org

Event Agenda coming soon!

events.name: OpenIT4Africa Hackathon avec la participation de Coders4Africa Senegal
events.about:
Le Hackathon OpenIt4Africa supporté fièrement par Coders4Africa

OpenIt4Africa annonce la participation de Coders4Africa à son prochain événement qui se tiendra à Montréal, Canada, les 15, 16 et 17 juin prochains. L’organisation Coders4Africa sera présente sur place avec trois de ses représentants dAmérique du Nord; et permettra à ses membres de participer, lors de la conférence douverture, à la discussion sur le développement des nouvelles technologies en Afrique de lEst et de lOuest.

Fort d’un réseau de plus de 1000 membres, Coders4Africa sera également actif lors du grand hackathon de 72 heures en mobilisant des participants provenant du Kenya, du Sénégal, du Ghana, des États-Unis, du Canada et de la France.

Nous invitons aussi les autres communautés au Senegal telles que DarkarLUG, Senejug et BantaLabs a participer à cette collaboration internationale.

Toutes ces équipes travailleront au même rythme, grâce au live-streaming et à des outils dinteraction en temps réel qui permettront aux programmeurs et porteurs de projet déchanger et de collaborer afin d’obtenir le plus rapidement possible des résultats très pertinents.

Coders4Africa propose un projet d Open Data quils sont en train de murir pendant presque 1 an, ayant pour objectif de lancer des sites sous format données ouvertes pour les villes de Dakar (Sénégal), Nairobi (Kenya) et Accra (Ghana). Un deuxième projet consistera en la création d’un annuaire de programmeurs en Afrique, avec possibilité pour chaque membre d’y créer et d’y afficher son profil.

Les dévéloppeurs à Dakar seront chargé a priori de travailler sur un projet Open Data specifique au Sénégal. Mais nous encourgeons dautres projets que les participants pourront proposer. 

‘’Cet évènement est une formidable opportunité pour connecter les membres de Coders4Africa, ceux basés en Afrique en particulier, avec les techies montréalais qui, grâce à cela, pourront avoir des exemples concrets sur l’évolution des nouvelles technologies et les besoins sur le terrain’’, note Vincent Muller, co-fondateur de Coders4Africa.

OpenIt4Africa est fière de sassocier avec Coders4Africa, pour pouvoir réunir les talents africains et offrir un tremplin pour le lancement de nouveaux projets pour lAfrique.souligne Heri Rakotomalala , co-fondateur d’OpenIt4Africa.

OpenIt4Africa, programmé les 15, 16 et 17 juin à Montréal, commencera par une série de conférences et de tables rondes lors desquelles les participants discuteront des opportunités dans le secteur des nouvelles technologies en Afrique. L’événement se poursuivra avec un hackathon, dont le défi sera de réaliser un projet en technologies pour lAfrique en seulement 48 heures.

Pour en savoir plus: http://openit4africa.org

 Agenda a venir...

events.name: AT&T Mobile App Hackathon - NXNE (Toronto)

Have an app idea or need an app built for your business?

Our hackathon will introduce you to the latest cutting edge tools to help deploy your own app with a website backend, fully hosted in the cloud.

As far as platforms are concerned, feel free to code in the language you feel most comfortable, whether its Objective C, Java, Javascript, HTML, C #, Dot Net, or XNA. Even if you are rusty with your programming, we will have live developer support from local senior developers as well as from AT&T, Sencha, and Apigee to help you code that much faster.


Event Schedule.  The following is a list of the weekends agenda:

  • 5PM - Friday Evening. AT&T Mobile App Hackathon. Kickoff event with drinks, networking, and developer dating which leads into idea pitches and team formation.
  • 10AM - Saturday Morning - AT&T Mobile App Hackathon. The fun continues with an all day hackathon. Work with the teams that you formed on Friday night to produce the app spec’d out the night before. Senseis will be available throughout the entire event to help you code up your solution. App submissions will be accepted throughout the day with a deadline of 7PM.
  • 7PM - Saturday Evening. Promptly at 7PM, teams will begin pitching their ventures. Pitches are limited to three (3) minutes per team.

Prizes. The following prizes are experiential and geared towards accelerating you towards a successful business as well as expanding your network and industry knowledge:

Judging Criteria. Apps will be judged based on the the criteria below and weighted accordingly.

events.name: ZERO1 App Lab HackFlux
events.about:
ZERO1: The Art & Technology Network is excited to partner with TheGlint for the first in a series of HackFlux at TheGlint. 

ABOUT THE ZERO1 APP LAB:

The objective is to create a seamless visitor experience through mobile technology for the 2012 ZERO1 Biennial. Our goal is to create a collaborative social science experiment exploring how an app can create community, interaction, and navigation in a clear and interesting format. We plan to utilize a variety of techniques and practitioners that will include, but is not limited to: alternate reality, geo location and mapping, mobile technology, storytelling, and augmented reality. Secondly, we plan to develop a ZERO1 API that can be built upon and used by ZERO1 artists, fellows and used for future ZERO1 Marketing, Programming and Garage.

 
AT THE END OF THE WEEKEND:

We will build a community around mobile development and art and to have an app for the 2012 ZERO1 Biennial.

 
AFTER THE WEEKEND:

The winning team will be able to work with ZERO1s core team of mobile devopment interns and our Tech Advisory Committee to develop the app further through the summer. We hope to have a series of testing events around the app.

 
The Jury:

events.name: The Hackatrain: A Hackathon inside the Chicago Brown Line
events.about:
The Hackatrain

The 1st hackathon inside a CTA train in Chicago.

 

Schedule:

 

Teams Meetup at the Hackacave: Wednesday June 13th

Rules of the Hackatrain. Sponsors presentations. Work on your apps.

 

Ride the Hackatrain: Saturday June 16th

9am: Meetup at the Hackacave (TBA Location)

10am-2pm: Ride the Hackatrain and build your apps

3:30-5pm: Finish up the awesomeness of your app.

5pm-7pm: Demo your app to an awesome panel of judges

7pm: Receive Hack prizes

7pm-9pm: Meetup at a local Hackabar.

 

The Hackatrain is supported by:

  • The CTA
  • The City of Chicago
  • Code Academy
  • 1871
  • Technori
  • Code for America Chicago Brigade

 

FAQ

1. What is the Hackatrain?

Web developers and designers will solve a transportation problem building software while riding the Chicago Brown Line. 

On Saturday the teams will meet in the Hackacave, a strategic downtown location and wait turns to ride and hack in the train.

The Hackatrain will ride most of the day and teams are expected to complete their apps while riding the train.

On Saturday evening, teams will demo their apps to a panel of judges. 

2. How does it work?

 The Hackatrain is not your typical hackathon. This is the 1st software development event to take place inside a CTA train, ever!

You will make history!

Upon registration you need to join a team and start developing your application, weeks before the Hackatrain. 

Ride the Hackatrain, speed up your development process and finish a nice, awesome and usable application.

3. How do I apply?

  1. Register and join a team
  2. Pick an idea from a list or propose your own*
  3. Start development and meetup with your team at least once a week.
  4. Prepare in advance for the Hackatrain
  5. Ride the Hackatrain
  6. Demo your app
  7. Make history and win prizes!
* If you propose your own idea, it has to be viable and solve a transportation issue for use by the CTA or the general public. All ideas are reviewed by the Hackatrain board and you will be notified if your idea is accepted for development.

(i.e. ideas related with drinking games in the CTA wont roll)

4. Why the Hackatrain?

It has never been done before. You will be the first ones, and you will make history.

Because it is so freaking cool!

Help yourself. Build a transportation app that makes Chicago an awesome and problem-free city.

5. Who is organizing this historical and awesome event?

  • Tomas Ordonez: Code Academy alumnus and Marketaero.com cofounder.
  • Code Academy
6. What about Wifi?

You will have weeks in advance to start development of your application and you need to come prepared to the Hackatrain in the case you need to transfer data.

I tested my phone hotspot tethering to my MAC in the brownline. There are some spots where 4G drops but it works. We will also have a backup if you really need to watch godzilla movies on netflix online.

7. I dont remember seeing a bathroom in the train. Is there one?

No bathrooms in the train. You are welcome to bring your own...

Just kidding. We are setting up a a Hackacave in the loop, which we will use as our backup hacking space and waiting room for teams to take turns to ride the Hackatrain.

If you really need to go. We might make a stop at Kimball, which has bathrooms.

8. Will there be beer in the Hackatrain?

Negative. The hackatrain will have food and non-alcoholic drinks for you. You are not allowed to bring alcoholic drinks. If you insist we will print a Wanted poster of your face and we will place it all over the CTA brownline. You wont be allowed to ride the Hackatrain.

9. Can I drink beer at the Hackacave?

Dude. Are you for real? The hackacave is not a hackabar. You are free to ingest whatever you want in the hackacave but if you are inebriated. We wont let you in the hackatrain. We will also make you sing Mary had a little lamb 100 times to the crowd at merchandise mart.

10. What are the prizes?

TBA. But there will be categories so everybody goes home happy.

11. Is there an after party?

Dude! I thought you came to make history!

After the Hackatrain rides are over and you are preparing for your demo. At the hackacave, we will have food and drinks for you (yes beer!). After demos and judging we will reconvene at a local bar in the loop.

12. Where is the Hackacave?

Does batman reveal everybody where his cave is?

TBA.

13. Why do I have to pay?

The Hackatrain is supported by sponsors and free for participants. Buy a ticket to save your seat. The ticket fee will be refunded within 5-10 days after the Hackatrain.

14. How will you control the safety of the event if the train is stopping so often?

The Hackatrain will have an exclusive private train for the event. The train will only depart from and arrive at the Hackacave.
 
15. How do I power my laptop?
 
The Hackatrain has limited power connections. You have to fully charge your laptop before riding the Hackatrain. Since you will take turns to ride the train, it is recommended that you recharge your laptop at the Hackacave.
 
16. How do I join a team?
 
After registering we will send you a notification with access to a web application which has a list of all available teams. You are free to join any of them.
 
17. How do I submit an idea?
 
A pool of ideas are available to choose from. You can also submit your own, but it has to comply with the rules. The idea will be reviewed by a panel. Ideas for apps have to be viable and usable by either the CTA or the commuters. Ideas such as drinking games will not roll.

What do you get when you mix Big Brands with Big Brains and Big Prizes?  A one-of-a-kind program to connect developers, brands and mobile technology – The Big Brand Hackathon.

events.name: iOS Dev Scout - Hackathon 2012
events.about:
Missed out to SIgnup?
 
Were restricting the number of participants to 50 due to logistical limitations. If you have just missed this signup and are still passionate about taking part in this Hackathon then you can tweet us @iOSDevScout or contact the organizers. Well do our best to accomodate you.

Contact Details: Subh : 8388 7595 | Michael : 9185 5166 | Mugunth : 9727 4850
  

About iOS Dev Scout - Hackathon 2012

iOS Dev Scout (iDS) - Hackathon 2012 (#idsh), is the first iOS centric Hackathon in Singapore. It is a non-profit developer event for iOS, encouraging development using native iOS SDK. The event format is Unconference or Barcamp-style, featuring content from the participants themselves.

This will be a 24 hours (overnight Hackathon) within which participants will pitch their ideas, form teams to build a working prototype or application in 24 hours. The event will start on Saturday (16th June) 9:00 AM and end on Sunday (17th June) 10:30 AM with final demonstrations. iOS Dev Scout will invite potential investors and mentors for final demonstrations. Participants may speak to them during or after the event to get advice on refining their ideas.   

Date & Time

9 AM on 16th June to 10:30 AM on 17th June


Registration Fee: 

This event is free for participants. (Signup Required, Not open for walk-ins)


Food & Drinks:

Food and Drinks will be served at the event venue.

  • 9 AM - 10 AM - Registration & Key Note

events.name: Free Elections Hackathon
events.about:
An event bringing together all the latest developments in how technology can contribute to free and fair elections around the world.

At the moment we have two major projects:

  • Improvements and upgrades to OneWorlds amazing real-time election monitoring system, which they ran successfully in the recent Senegal Presidential elections. If youve not seen this system before, you should definitely check out the website here:  http://www.senevote2012.com/, and watch this video:http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Fscuy2Tr_mE&feature=relmfu
  • Investigating how technologies such as mobile & cellular communication, crowd-sourced mapping, remote data plotting and covert data transfer can contribute to monitoring of the electoral process in countries where domestic and international observation is restricted. Well be looking particularly at how to address the key issue of corroboration/verification, and running at least a couple of country specific workshops looking at practicalities - Zimbabwe and Iran look likely topics for those at present.
Were currently in dicussions with several other interested organisations about running projects on the day. More details to follow soon.

Any ideas, questions, requests, email me at dan@thesmallaxe.com

events.name: The Opa Hackathon
events.about:
The Opa Hackathon

Well provide free pizzas and drinks for lunch. Awesome partners including AWS, 10gen, Box, VMware, NextSpace. Even if youre new to Opa, the members of the growing community will help you develop real-time web apps easily through the different workshops. Well also launch the Opa Developer Challenge during this event.

Where is it?

The event will be located at SomaCentral on one market street in the Steuart tower. The entrance will be only by Spear Street. The access to SomaCentral is restricted and thus registration is compulsory.

What is Opa?

Opa is a new open source programming language for web application development. It is a tierless language that produces both client and server. Opa is a very efficient language and, for instance, a simple real-time web chat takes less than 20 lines. Thanks to its strong static type, it is safe and secured (against SQL injections or XSS attacks for instance) and built to be scalable.

More information about Opa: http://opalang.org/

events.name: HACK4ASSETS - The ASSETS Hackathon
events.about:
Hack4Assets is a hack day organised by the ASSETS Project and its partners. It provides an exciting environment to explore the potential of ASSETS APIs.

Hack4Assets will take place alongside the Final ASSETS Review from 20 to 21 June in Pisa and will bring together up to 30 developers from across Europe. They will have access to the diverse and rich ASSETS/Europeana collections and ASSETS APIs.

Participants will be encouraged to try out their ideas for creative reuse of the ASSETS APIs and build prototypes, sketches, applications showcasing the social and business value of ASSETS/Europeana cultural data. The suggested (but not obligatory) themes are:

  • Mashing-up: Mash-up ASSETS APIs with other APIs, combine and enrich ASSETS/Europeana content with other free content (e.g. from Wikipedia);
  • User Generated Contents: Applications that let users enrich ASSETS/Europeana content with the results of their work;
  • Search, Browse, Share: Applications that let users search ASSETS/Europeana content, browse and share it (e.g. through social platforms).

The best prototypes, sketches, ideas will be awarded. 

Winners will be asked to deliver a brief presentation about their activities as part of the awards ceremony.


Important: Developers must register in advance to indicate their interest. Depending on the demand for the event, organisers will decide on the final delegate list and send a confirmation e-mail to the selected ones about two weeks prior to the event. Registration closes on 13 June, or earlier if we will reach the maximum number of participants. Please register as soon as you can to be able to receive the final confirmation e-mail in a time which will allow you to arrange your participation.

Follow us on Twitter #hack4assets or #AssetsEu

events.name: Hacktastic Hackathon
events.about:
Join OSUs Technology Commericalization Office for a hackathon like none other- a Hacktastic for Agiculture & Food Science!  

Agriculture is Ohios number one industry. Ohios diverse agricultural, horticultural and forestry industries contribute more than $94 billion to the states economy every year. Were a leader in agriculture, food processing and bio-product innovations, join us for a hackathon celebrating this innovation.

Our mission is to DISRUPT this space, in 1 day well rethink the sector with a focus on innovation that is enabled by an Apple iPhone or iPad and or Google Android mobile devices.   Well have industry and local startup related mentors on hand to enage with.  Bring your laptops, your brians and big ideas- lets hack!

How it works:

First, register! 

Second, submit ideas to our online idea list. 

Third, when we meet for the event well vote collectively on all ideas submitted and then break into groups to hack them into reality! 


Event Rules:
- concept must be “agicuture and or food science” related
- concept must be “iphone, ipad, or android” app

Judging criteria:
- explainable concept in 3 minutes or less
- Problem? 
- Solution?
- Revenue Model?
- Go to Market Strategy?

Building it is always welcome and it moves you closer to reality by doing so- but were hyper critical on the why behind building it. Explain the story of why this idea should be, how it justifies investment, the plan to execute it- basically, prove it. 

Prizes:
- TBD!  (were working on some good ones)

events.name: Gigabit Apps Design Jam
events.about:
Calling all Chattanooga-area web professionals! If you plan, build, design, or craft content for the web, we want you!

Join us this Thursday, June 21st to help envision Chattanoogas connected future.

At this design jam, facilitated by the Mozilla Foundation in preparation for Chattanoogas first Gigabit Apps Hackathon, we will imagine and prototype community-focused apps that use the power of next-gen networks like Chattanoogas gigabit grid.

To kick off the evening, youll learn about some of the challenges facing our community and how future gigabit apps and services could help shape the future of Chattanooga.

Then, well break into groups and imagine these apps from the future. What will they look like? How will they work? Well brainstorm possible solutions, create some paper prototype designs, and begin to identify the challenges well face in development. Each team will then share their ideas back to the group.

This is an evening of creativity and inspiration—an idea generation session. Everyone must roll their sleeves up and participate. You dont need to be an expert, you dont need to know how to code, you dont need your own team, you just need to be passionate about the future. Come prepared with your grand ideas about how Chattanooga can lead innovation in distance education, health IT, clean energy and more.

This is a prelude to a two-day Gigabit Apps Hackathon scheduled for this September 15 & 16, 2012 where your team could walk away with fame and glory, in addition to having a blast building the apps of Chatts future. Plus, compelling prototypes from the Hackathon could evolve into submissions to the Mozilla Ignite challenge, with $500,0000 of seed money and mentorship available to help get them off the ground.

If youre interested in gigabit networks, civic innovation, startup culture and a good challenge, come join us for a thought-provoking and creative evening. Refreshments will be served.

Learn more:

  • http://colab.is
  • http://mozillaignite.org

6:00p-6:00a

 

Hack for Good is a community-focused event for developers. This 12-hour hackathon will provide developers the opportunity to collaborate on a project of choice that will benefit the community.  Several project options will be provided (along with needed information) or developers can work on their personal projects. Event cost is $15 to cover food. 

 

Participants will be presented with two project options that will benefit the community.  After time to meet hear about the overall project goals, developers will form teams, come up with a game plan and start creating!  You can come as a team or come alone and meet new people.  At the end of 12 hours, each team will have 5-10 minutes to present what they have created and potentially have their project become implemented in the community.

events.name: UP Singapore Urban Prototyping Weekend
events.about:
URBAN PROTOTYPING WEEKEND

Friday 22nd – Sunday 24th June 2012

The Urban Prototyping Weekend is where genius ideas become solutions to pressing urban challenges.

It is a three-day hackathon for urban innovation. The first of its kind in Singapore.

Participants

We are inviting up to 250 of Singapore’s best web and app developers, computer programmers, data analysts, hackers, designers, artists, corporate professionals, government employees, tertiary faculty and students, social entrepreneurs, NGO and NPO employees, and other engaged citizens. You’ll have a large, diverse group from which to create your rock star team. Sign up here for your chance to join.

Data Sandbox

You will also have access a huge and first of its kind Big Data Sandbox, which contains big data, real-time data and open data from dozens of Singaporean organizations. We invite you to play in this sandbox–use it to create solutions to urban challenges that may have been impossible to even imagine beforehand.

Goals

Together, we will create new startups, apps, and projects that change Singapore. And the world.

The best prototypes will be invited to pitch for up to S$250,000 in seed funding and support from NC Venture Partners Incubator.

It is expected that a large number of the prototypes will be mobile and web apps. However, there is also room for the creation of new business models, community engagement strategies and other projects that solve urban challenges.

Themes

We encourage you to innovate in our five main domains, and there’s some information and inspiration on these pages. But it’s up to you.

  • Lifestyles of Health & Sustainability (LOHAS)
  • Education
  • Tourism
  • Creative Arts
  • Community Engagement

What to Expect

Before the weekend:

If you want to take part, sign up here. You will automatically be registered with The Do Good Network. You can use the CoLAB platform to post challenges, participate in solutions, and start chatting with potential team members. Spaces for the UP Weekend are limited and active participants will have priority. The week before the event, participants will be invited to post the solutions they would like to work on at the hackathon. The community will then vote on the ideas they like best. The top 30 projects will be selected for the Urban Prototyping Weekend and will be pitched on the Friday night.

Friday night:

The weekend starts in the early evening with a few speakers who will set the context and provide inspiration for the weekend. The winning projects will be pitched, teams will be formed and will break off to scope out a work plan for the rest of the weekend. You are also open to form teams to work on your own projects, participants are not only restricted to those pitched on the night.

Saturday and Sunday:

These days are work days. Teams research, consult with experts, visit target communities, write code, design interfaces, film video and do whatever else it might take to make their ideas come to life.

Sunday evening:

On Sunday afternoon, teams stop working and prepare brief presentations. Each team will have the chance to present their prototype to the audience and judges.

You can find more details on the schedule here.

Resources and a guide to the hackathon are here.

 

Mentors & Judges

We’ll upload our Mentors and Judges list soon.

Prizes

Yes, we’ll have a load of cool prizes for the winners. They will be announced soon.

events.name: Summer Blast-off Hackathon
events.about:
Start the summer with a Blast. Join Startupifier for the Summer Blast-off Hackathon!

Bring your ideas, visions, or skills to the table and team up for a whole day of hacking.

THE GOAL: Build a web, mobile or desktop app in a day. Meet people, work with a team, form connections and build something cool!

If you havent built an app in one day before, come experience what its about! Whatever your area of expertise, whether youre a programmer, designer, or if youre just looking to participate in an interesting time, youre invited.

Friday night: Join us at the Notman house for the start of the event. If you have an idea (or many!) share it, and form a team. Or, come to listen for an idea that grabs you and join a team. Theres no limit on the size or number of teams.

Saturday: Start the day of hacking at the Notman house at 9am. By 7pm, everyone shows what theyve built. It doesnt matter if you have time to finish your app or not -- the goal is to have something interesting to show! But keep in mind that the judges will probably lean towards fully working demos.


SCHEDULE:


Friday

6pm: Introduction, Idea pitching.

7pm: Team formation


Saturday

9am: Start building!

Noon: Lunch

7pm: End of hacking. Start of presentations for the judges.

Presentations are ~2 minutes + ~2 minutes for questions.

 

FREE FOOD: Food and beverages will be provided!


PRIZES: To be announced soon!


JUDGE PANEL: Our panel of judges will evaluate the final presentations and assign the prizes. Were very pleased to invite Daniel Haran, Phil Gauvin, Felix Menard and Jonathan Lavoie-Levesque to be thsi hacks judges. 


Thank you to our kind sponsors!

events.name: Music Data Science HackCamp: Competition & Hackathon
events.about:
This event is onsite only.

You cant participate remotely.

This event has TWO Streams.

You can only register for one stream. You cant register for both streams.

Both streams will start and end at the same time

1. Stream One: Music Data Science Competition:  3 music business problems. Youll be provided with a large music dataset. You will have to apply your data science skills and knowledge to solve the problem. Best analytical/predictive model wins. Prizes awarded at global and local level.

2. Stream Two: Music Data Science Hackathon: You will be provided with access to ECHONET and OPEN EMI APIs. Do your own hack. A panel of music experts will judge your hack. Best hack according to panel wins prizes.

When: Saturday, June 23, 2012 9:30 AM

Where: The Hub Westminster, First floor, New Zealand House, 80 Haymarket, SW1Y 4TE , London  020 7148 6720http://hubwestminster.net/space  

The venue opens at 9.30 am on Saturday Jun 23rdIf you arrive after 11am you will not be able to participate in the competition.The competition starts at 1pm London time Saturday, June 24thUpon arrival to the venue you will have to register at the reception desk.The reception desk should have your name in the list of participants.If you have not registered in evenbrite you will not be in the list. If you are not in the list, you will not be able to participate. Competition ends June, 24th Sunday at 1pm. Prizes to be announced: Event ends: 3pm

  • You will be provided with 3 proper quality meals, unlimited drinks, coffee & snacks.
  • High-speed 100Mbps Internet will be available
  • Shower facilities and resting area available at the venue
  • Please bring your own laptop.
  • Please bring your own sleeping mattress and sleeping bag.

Useful Information regarding Stream One: Music Data Science Competition: You will be provided with access to the competition web platform. Upon selection of the competition title Data Science Hackathon, you will be able to read the challenge, and access and download the dataset.You can download the dataset to your laptop and you can use your own tools.You will be provided with free access to Amazon AWS cloud services should you choose to run computational jobs there or require more storage capacity. You dont have to use AWS if you dont want. You will provided with free access to EMC/Greenplum Hadoop and Database Community editions and other Greenplum analytical tools. You dont have to use these tools if you dont want to.

events.name: Girls Got Geek Hackathon Kickoff
GDG - Game Hackathon
events.about:
What is the GDG Hackathon. 

The GDG Hackathon is a 24 hours game development competition hosted by the Game Developers Guild. It is open to every member of the community. Enter as a team or as a sole developer the choice is yours. 

More details on the rules and judges will be made available here as we get closer to the event.

 

Help support the event. 

The GDG Hackathon is free to attendees. If you are interested in helping make the event better your help would be awesome.

Can you help out? Donate through our PayPal.

In return, you get visibility in front of our tech community. For example, heres what you get for sponsoring:

  • Your logo on printed materials which will be posted and handed out at local universities and other establishments and on GDG Hackathon poster at the event; 
  • Your logo on the event page and GDG Hackathon website;

If you want to contribute an amount that is not $75 or contribute in a non-monetary way (in-kind sponsorship), email us at: GameDevelopersGuild@gmail.com
 


 

Preparation 

  • Register here on EventBrite to give coordinators an idea as to how many people are coming.
  • Follow the Game Developers Guild Twitter for updates: @GameDevGuild  
  • Bring your own equipment. We have some machines in the guild hall which we will make available for the event but their number is limited. 

We thank our sponsors:

events.name: That Conference Milwaukee Hackathon
events.about:
Can you Build a Web, Mobile or Cloud 

App in 24 Hours?

Developers: caffeinate and get ready to dominate! Bring your laptops, phones, gadgets and dev tools to the That Conference MilwaukeeHackathon for the inaugural 24-hour coding challenge. Develop your own web, mobile and/or cloud app, present it and compete for your share of prizes. Winners will walk away with mad props and cool loot.

And to add even more fun, your citys reputation is on the line. That Conference is running hackathons across multiple cities to find the best developers. The top two teams from each city will get to compete to win the audiences vote during That Conference in August. 

What to Expect

Competition

The Milwaukee event kicks off on Saturday, June 9th at the MiKE and runs through the night until Sunday afternoon. Developers are free to use any technology to build any kind of web, mobile and/or cloud applications they choose. There are no limits on team size, but wheres the fun in going it alone?

Any Technology, Any Platform

Participants do NOT have to be here the full 24 hours, though we certainly encourage it (itll be a lot of fun!). We do ask registrants to indicate which times theyll be at the hackathon so we can plan food, etc.

Judges will be on hand on Sunday afternoon to pick the top 2 teams.  Feel free to invite your friends to watch you present.

What to bring

Bring your laptop (and powercord), phones, gadgets and development tools and anything you need to be productive.  And your A-game. Youre going to need that.

Space is limited, so RSVP soon!

Food, beverages and refreshments will be provided.

Hosted By

 

 Sponsors

|

events.name: Peanut Butter & Code Jam #1: Android+NFC
events.about:
Peanut Butter & Code Jams are short, hackathon- style workshops for developers and creatives. We mix two technologies that are great on their own -- but taste better together.

We supply: a quick introductory presentation on the technology being sandwiched, code samples to bootstrap your hacking, food, and cheap drinks.

You bring: your laptop, skills & ideas. Come with a collaborative mindset and/or team up in advance on Twitter or Google+ via the #pbcj hashtag.

 

The focus for Karma Laboratorys first ever PBCJ is: 
Android apps and NFC (near field communications)


Who is PBCJ #1 best suited for?

If you are currently an Android developer but havent dabbled much with NFC or havent set aside the time to play around with it, youll get the most out of PBCJ. There will be NFC tags on hand but bring your own NFC-enabled phone.

If youre a designer or business person, you might want to get a developer friend to come along. Or get up to speed with some of the tutorials on the Android Developer site: http://developer.android.com/resources/index.html.

Things that you should do in advance:

  • Install the latest Android SDK! This can take up to an hour to download and install everything (and the event wifi will not be able to handle this for everyone) so do this in adavnce. http://developer.android.com/sdk/index.html

events.name: Google I/O Vejle 2012
events.about: Semi-private Google IO event. The details are still being fleshed out, but there will be live streams of the event on a big screen, several events and talks (including a Hackathon) and perhaps some schwag.

events.name: I/O Extended San Francisco
events.about:
Google I/O is Googles largest developer conference, drawing thousands of attendees from all over the world. Last year, we introduced I/O Extended, which gives talented developers an opportunity to connect with others and watch the keynote and sessions live, even if they can’t attend Google I/O in person.

I/O Extended San Francisco will take place at Googles San Francisco office, and youre invited! Well be livestreaming the keynote and breakout sessions, along with being the basecamp for I/O Extendeds Develop for Good Hackathon. This hackathon will bring I/O Extended together by connecting developers all over the world- and we want you to be a part of it!

To register, select a ticket for one day (or two, or three) and grab another ticket for the hackathon if youll be participating in that as well. Admission and participation is free.

events.name: Google I/O Extended Utah
events.about:
Missed out on getting a ticket to Google I/O?  If so, dont worry because the Utah Google Developer Group is bringing the experience locally right here to Utah!

Wednesday and Thursday, we will be streaming the keynotes, as well as other technical sessions, live from Google IO.  And for those who need more encouragement to leave the comforts of there plush leather sofa or comfy office chair, we will be mixing in some great presentations and demos from local presenters.  

Wednesday night, in conjunction with Google I/O, we will be streaming the Google I/O After Hours Party as well as hosting our own hackathon that promises to be a blast.

Still not enough? Well, how about we throw in some food and awesome giveaways?  Thats right, we said we want to bring the I/O experience here, and in order to do that I guess we might just have to give something away!

This promises to be a great experience for those who are interested in learning more about whats new at Google or dig deeper into Googles developer tools and APIs. Come hang out, learn, collaborate and network with other professionals and ethusiasts in the area.

More details coming soon, follow us on twitter at @ugtug

events.name: Apps for Security: Amphion DC 2012
events.about:
Welcome to the community!

Apps for Security promotes civic engagement, open innovation, and entrepreneurship while making us all safer and more secure in cyberspace. 
Safer Internet. More Data. Open Innovation. Security Zen.

Were hosting an Apps for Security event in conjunction with the Amphion Forum in Washington DC on Wednesday, June 27th (https://amphionforum.com/washington-dc-meeting/). If youre passionate about Security and the Internet of Things, this is the hackathon for you!  Bring your ideas for creating a safer Internet through open data, collaborative innovation, and a dash of entrepreneurship to Apps For Security: Internet Of Things Edition!


Were looking for- developers, data scientists, designers, policy makers, elected officials, students, and of course-- privacy and security practitioners. Regardless of your skills or interest, were encouraging participation from people and organizations who would like to make a difference in  privacy and security online. 


A day long event comprised of 4 stages:

 

- Welcome, Introductions, & Motivation

 

- Unconference style workshops to flesh out ideas

 

- Coding, Designing, Innovating

 

- App Demonstration & Achievement Recognition

 

 

Stayed tuned to www.appsforsecurity.org for updates over the next few weeks and dont forget to follow @AppsForSecurity :)

events.name: She Shall Lead Idea Hackathon
events.about:
#SheShallLead Idea Hackathon

Without women, there is no social media. Period.

Women are nearly 60 percent of participants on some social networks but are sadly underrepresented in leadership in business, or in panel discussions, or events. This must change.

How? On June 27-28, 2012, Social Media News NY (facebook.com/smnny) will convene a unique “idea hack” combining an in-person conversation and workshop with a virtual real-time live stream and social media community to create action points and take-away strategies for women in social media leadership as well as great networking event to meet one another and cultivate meaningful relationships with women active on social media.

An “idea hack” is part conference, part workshop, part networking with a panel discussion and a virtual and in-person workshop that will form six teams to brainstorm and decide on action plans to enable/empower/promote women as leaders in social media.

The event starts on Wednesday night at Ogilvy HQ on the West Side (636 11th Avenue), and finishes up with a fun no-cover networking #LadiesSocial at Two E Bar/Lounge in The Pierre, A Taj Hotel, from 6:30 pm-9:30 pm on Thursday, June 28.

Wednesdays Details
Presentations and panel discussion with six of New York City’s leading social media professionals:

  • Gemma Craven, Executive Vice President, New York Group Director at Ogilvy 360 Digital Influence (@gemsie)
    Talk:  Taking social back to IRL - in real life
  • Laura Mignott, Co-Founder/President at DigitalFlashNYC (@lmigno)
    Talk: Brands: Real Influencers are your friends
  • Linda Bernstein, Writing, Editing and Social Media Consultant, Adjunct at Columbia Journalism Continuing Ed Advanced Social Media (@wordwhacker)
    Talk:Hashing out the Tags
  • Nora Walsh, Director of Public Relations at The Pierre, A Taj Hotel & Founder of PatchworkCompass.com (@thpierreny, @patchcompass)
    Talk: Whos Listening?
  • Amy Vernon, Digital Consultant, Speaker and Blogger (@amyvernon)
    Talk:The Interdependent Web
  • Marilyn Zayfert, president, illumiNET Digital Marketing (@mzayfert)
    Talk: Chutes and Ladders to the top, Women Leading through Social Media


Each will engage and compel in a fast-paced interactive presentation. After this, the audience (online and in-person) will divide into small groups to interact and brainstorm for a half hour followed by a debriefing session and networking. The panel will then present each group’s key action points.

Thursdays Details

On Thursday night, Social Media News NY and the #SheShallLead panel will host The Pierre’s third annual “social” in honor of Mashable’s #SocialMediaDay.

At 7:00pm, the #SheShallLead panel will recap the top action points developed at the Idea Hackathon, which will be followed by cocktails and networking. The best part is, if you blog, Facebook, tweet, or pin about the “#LadiesSocial” networking event in Two E Bar/Lounge, you can print it out and present it at the door for a complimentary Famous Lady Cocktail. They are also drawing business cards every half hour to give away complimentary items from Two E Bar/Lounge’s delicious summer menu!

Media sponsor for the event is Social Media News NY, which will produce a live stream of the events as well as moderate the social conversation in real time to a global audience. View at Facebook.com/smnny

Twitter Hashtag: #SheShallLead

Contact: Mo Krochmal, editor, Social Media News NY
Phone: 347 735 6860
email: mo.krochmal@gmail.com

events.name: Google I/O Extended
events.about:
Interested in meeting other Google developers, but cant make it to San Francisco this June?

Dont worry!! Google Developer Group, New Delhi is getting you all the live action from Google I/O 2012 (Moscone Center , San Francisco, CA USA) to BoomBox Cafe, Connaught Place, New Delhi.

Timings : 8:30 PM - 5:30 AM 

Learn the tech worlds latest web, mobile and social breakthroughs and meet the developers who are turning them into tomorrows startups. Keep yourself and your team driving innovation at Google I/O, which returns to San Franciscos Moscone Center from June 27th - 29th, 2012. 

Catch live action that covers:

  • Keynote session
  • Google+ platform basics
  • Youtube channels
  • Whats new in Android
  • Google Drive integration
  • Google App script
  • Dart : A modern web language
  • and much more...

Dont miss a chance to catch up with Google evangelist, developers and entusiasts!!


For details contact -
