events.name: Adobe WebUp #6
events.about:
Adobe WebUp 6  se anunta a fi o editie speciala. Continua sa citesti ca sa vezi de ce :).

In primul rand, dupa o pauza de cateva editii vom avea din nou un speaker extern (sesiunea va fi in engleza). Este vorba de colegul meu de echipa Harish care va vorbi despre o unealta pe care a creat-o.

In al doilea rand pentru prima data vom avea ca prezentatori ingineri care lucreaza la codul folosit de browsere ca Chrome sau Safari. Este vorba de colegii mei Raul si Mihnea care fac parte din echipa WebKit Adobe si care va vor vorbi despre CSS Regions si CSS Shaders, doua dintre cele mai hot CSS proposals. Cei doi lucreaza la implementarea de WebKit a acestor propuneri.

Si pentru ca toate lucrurile bune vin cate trei, 99% vom avea si un Hackathon pentru prima oara. Daca esti developer si vrei sa iti incerci puterile atunci fii sigur ca te inscrii la concurs.

Si de aceasta data vom avea partea de socializare/networking. Pentru ca din feedbackul primit a rezultat ca nu toata lumea intelege care este rostul acestei pauze m-am gandit sa va dau cateva motive pentru care ar fi interesanta: discutii mai detaliate cu prezentatorii sau ceilalti participanti despre subiectele serii, discutii intre voi despre orice este cool in web azi, prezentarea de oportunitati/joburi pentru web developeri/designeri.

 

Programul conferintei #6 este:

17:10 – 17:55 Registration   
17:55 – 18:00 Introduction   
18:00 – 18:30

Using CSS Regions to Create Magazine-like Layouts for Any Screen

Afla care sint problemele pe care le intimpina creatorii de continut in incercarea de a prezenta layout-uri de tip revista pe Web si cum pot CSSRegions sa ajute in aceasta directie.

Mihnea este Computer Scientist in echipa WebPlatform din Adobe Romania. A facut parte din echipa care a realizat primul prototip de CSSRegions iar in prezent lucreaza la implementarea suportului CSSRegions in WebKit, rendering engine-ul din browserele Chrome si Safari. Este si comitter la WebKit.

 Mihnea Ovidenie / Adobe
18:30 – 19:00

Building impressionist - Challenges & Lessons Learnt

The session will cover the technology decisions, development process, challenges and lessons learnt while building impressionist - a visual tool to create impress.js presentation. The session will also attempt document my experience building it in the open and also integrating 3rd party open components to build a true - open source - web standards based application.

Harish is a developer evangelist @ Adobe focusing on web and open standards. He is very passionate about UX design, web, open standards and data visualization. He brings more than a decade of experience building large scale applications for the web using open standards & other. Tweets at @hsivaram and blogs at hsivaram.com/tech. Also maintains a bunch of open source projects at github.com/hsivaramx

 Harish Sivaramakrishnan / Adobe
19:00 – 19:30

Bringing Cinematics to the Web with CSS Filters

There are lots of awesome looking websites that are using new CSS features like transitions, animations, transforms and shadows. But these features are not the last thing that CSS can do for you. This talk will look into how CSS Filters can provide rich and easily animated visual effects to any HTML5 content.

For the ones who want more control, it will show how CSS Shaders can provide the flexibility and expressivity needed to create their own special effects. Finally, we will peak into what CSS holds for us into the (not-so distant) future.

Raul is a Computer Scientist for Adobe. For the past 5 years, he has worked on WebKit, the HTML rendering engine for the Safari and Chrome browsers. As part of  Adobe AIR team, he made sure that developers can leverage their existing knowledge in HTML and JavaScript to  write native applications , instead of having to learn new technologies. Recently, his  focus is on moving the web forward, by implementing and contributing to the next generation CSS features, like CSS Regions, CSS Exclusions and CSS Shaders.

 Raul Hudea / Adobe 
19:30 – 20:00

Break / Networking Session

  
20:00 – 20:30

Bleeding Edge HTML5

O prezentare de feature-uri noi si demo-uri ce ofera o viziune asupra viitorului aplicatiilor web. Cat de multe putem face acum? buzzwords: getUserMedia(), FileAPI, IndexDB si Server-Sent Events.

Numele meu este Andrei Oprea, sunt student, pasionat de tehnologii web si open source. Imi place sa lucrez in special in javascript la experimente si demo-uri web.

 Andrei Oprea / Student
20:30 – 22:00

Hackathon

Multi dintre voi ati vrut sa avem si Hackathon la Adobe WebUp. A venit vremea sa vedem daca va si tineti de cuvant si participati. Ce inseamna asta?

Pe scurt, vom forma echipe (de maxim 3 oameni) si vom coda pe o tema data (temele vor fi propuse de participanti si o vom alege pe cea cu cele mai multe voturi). La sfarsit participantii vor selecta echipa care a implementat cel mai bine tema.

Vom avea cu siguranta si premii. Dar nu asta sper sa fie motivatia principala :)

  

 

Pentru amatorii de Twitter, nu uitati ca tagul editiei 6 este #AdobeWebUp6 si contul oficial de Twitter este @AdobeWebUp. Ca sa citez dintr-un clasic Citeste si da mai departe! - vrem sa avem sala plina de oameni pasionati de web ca si tine :)

Ne vedem pe 28 Iunie incepand cu ora 17:10 la etajul 6 al cladiri Anchor Plaza de langa Plaza Romania Mall.
events.address: BD Timisoara, 26Z, Anchor Plaza, 6th floor Array

events.name: Hackathon London
events.about:
Are you a developer, designer, entrepreneur or startup?

If you are, you’ll want to keep the weekend of Friday June 29th – Sunday 1st July free, because we’re offering you the chance to impress potential investors, employers and peers – and nope, we won’t try to charge you, no matter how much you try to make us.

Investor and award-winning entrepreneur Mark Pearson, is inviting you to The Clove Building, Butlers Wharf, in the shadow of London’s Tower Bridge, where you’ll have 48 hours to develop new ideas or work on a current project with your team.

Mark is the founder and CEO of Markco Media, the company behind MyVoucherCodes.co.uk, and has an ever-extending investment portfolio. His investments, the majority of which are residents of The Clove Building, include companies such as games development firm Noisy Duck, citizen journalism website Blottr.com and mobile application company VouChaCha.

The resident start-ups, including Markco Media, are actively recruiting and will be heavily involved in the weekend.

There’ll be guest mentors throughout the weekend from the world of technology and startups who’ll make themselves available to provide advice and guidance. 

So, if you’re looking for a job with some of the UK’s leading online firms, looking for investment for a project of your own or looking to start your own business and simply want to spend time around other like-minded people, you won’t want to miss Hackathon London, on the weekend of Friday June 29th – Sunday 1st July.

We almost forgot – there’s free food and drink, too.

See you there.....

*************************************************************************

Feedback from the first Hackathon

#hackLDN managed to bring together a fantastic mix of developers, designers and entrepreneurs for a weekend of ideas generation and realisation. The quality of results - applications and potential companies - speaks volumes for the talent we are fortunate enough to have in London and beyond, and the organisational skills of Ben, Mark and everybody at Markco Media, who made the event possible. I’m already looking forward to the next hackathon they put together. 

Phil @leggetter, Developer Evangelist at Pusher

I came to Hackathon London looking to see some cool ideas, and build our own. The ideas that people brought were interesting and I have yet to sleep. The staff from marko media are friendly and have some good ideas and suggestions to help us get our ideas up and running.

Chris Ewbank

Even though I am yet to sleep, I am thoroughly enjoying the event. The progress on our team has been awesome and the constant help and banter from the staff just gives us more motivation to carry on with our project!

Rufus Honour - OverHeard

“It’s been fun, if incredibly tiring, to stay up all night working on a startup. Never had an opportunity like it before - I’d definitely do it again.”

Matt House

Considering I haven’t slept yet, I’m really enjoying Hackathon. I’d like it more if our prototype worked, but hey! You can’t get everything in the world!

events.name: TechMeetups Hackathon: HTML5 & Cloud #tmuhack
events.about:
TechMeetups Hackathon: HTML 5 & Cloud #tmuhack


For all developers, designers, ideas people interested in hacking HTML5 apps in the cloud!

 

Why HTML5 & the Cloud?
 

HTML5 is the new standard for web based development. This Hackathon is to introduce the technology to our various communities and encourage mobile app development using the same. As you all know almost all services & functionality is now available on the cloud. Whether it’s a database, server & storage, messages, music & video, latest stock quotes, product listings etc. We’re bringing these two exciting worlds together in our latest Hackathon on HTML5 & the cloud!  

 

Who’s it for?

  • Developers who have their own app idea or want to help someone build a prototype using HTML5 and cloud technologies.
  • Designers who have their own app idea or want to help a team create the best-looking app of the weekend.
  • Anyone else who either has an app idea or wants to join a team – every project needs a marketer or biz dev to create an app to take the market by storm.


What’s happening?

TechMeetups is holding a hackathon competition for those interested in trying out more HTML5 and cloud technologies by building a prototype app in just 48 hours.

  • Friday evening: pitch your idea (or choose your favourite project from the pitches), form a team, hack a prototype and pitch it to our judges on Sunday night for the chance to win some great prizes to help launch your app on the market!
  • Mentors will be on hand to help you with all your dev and business development questions.


For a video about the last mobile app hackathon hosted by TechMeetups in London see: http://crave.cnet.co.uk/mobiles/android-and-ios-app-olympics-held-in-london-in-video-50007159/

** we also allow observers to attend the hackathon during the Friday night pitch session and judging on Sunday night.  To be an observer simply register for the relevant ticket **

 


WHAT STANDS BETWEEN YOU AND THE PRIZE?

Teams must submit working prototypes for judging on Sunday which will be judged by our jury.

Friday
6pm Doors open and networking
7pm Presentations
7:30pm App idea presentations
8pm Teams form & the competition begins

Saturday
The hackathon continues
1pm Lunch
2pm Teams continue hacking!
6pm Video checkpoints

Sunday
The hackathon continues
1pm Lunch
2pm The final stretch!
6pm Presentations
6:30pm Judging
7pm Winners announced

WANT TO JOIN IN BUT HAVE QUESTIONS? READ ON...

What do I need to be an idea generator?
You can be anyone with an app idea who wants to build a team and prototype.  If you’re a developer, come and find the designer and marketer for your project.  If you’re business minded, find developers and designers to bring your idea to life.

Can I work on an existing app idea?
Yes, you can work on an app idea that you and even your business has already researched, but you should not bring along ideas that you’ve already started coding – the weekend is all about building the all-important prototype.

What platforms can I develop for?
Any! Whether it’s an iPhone, iPhone, Android, HTML5 or Windows Phone 7 app, we’re there to support you in building it!

Do I need to have a certain level of experience to get involved?
No, the hackathon is about learning as well as applying your skills so you can get involved no matter how experienced you are.

What’s expected of me over the weekend?
You’ll get most out of the weekend by joining a team and building a working prototype of your app over the weekend.  We’ll have plenty of mentors, both technical and business oriented, who can help you to use new tools and APIs, as well as help you evaluate how attractive and sticky your app is looking.

What should I bring?
Your enthusiasm, your portable computer, the mobile device you’re building for and your camera to immortalize the making of your application!

What is the judging criteria for theapps?
The apps will be judged on their usability, innovation, business potential and execution.

Who owns the apps created?
The apps are owned solely by their creators – we’ll provide you with some terms which you can use so your team knows where they all stand. Do note that we do not get involved legally so it is important that you discuss this with your team before you start on the prototype so everyone is clear on ownership.


SPONSORSHIP OPPORTUNITIES

Through TechMeetups’ growing global network of tech communities, the month of November will be the time when our 4,000+ members around the world are talking about HTML5, cloud technologies and hackathons at www.techmeetups.com and via social media channels. In many of our cities they’ll also be creating their own apps and you can help them by offering your knowledge, experience and tools to try out!

If you’re interested in promoting your company throughout the month, here’s more about what you can expect:

As a Sponsor of the TechMeetups.com Hackathon: HTML5 & Cloud month your brand will have both local and global exposure.  Our event attendees will be developers, designers, entrepreneurs and those interested in innovative technologies and tools for the purpose of growing their business or projects.

TechMeetups.com’s global audience has the same profile and is located across the USA, Europe and Asia where we have active and fast-growing networks.

Through our reach we’ll be marketing the event to the entire TechMeetups global community of over 4,000 members across all these cities.  For more information about our reach and activities, please visit www.techmeetups.com


Email us at sponsor@techmeetups.com for more details.

events.name: The BeMyApp World Cup 2012 - Belgium
events.about:
BeMyApp Belgium
 June 29-July 1st

 A mobile app design & development competition. Find the skills and inspiration to turn your app idea into a reality in just 48 hours, while competing with a global community in Brazil, USA, Morocco, Tunisia and Belgium. 

 

 

The Challenge

Follow mobile app news
& updates by BeMyApp Belgium

  •  Facebook
  •  Twitter
  •  Be.BeMyapp.com

On Friday evening, registered idea generators have one minute to pitch an app concept to a tech audience. Attending designers and engineers as well as our team of glorious mentors vote for the best ideas that will be developed into applications during the weekend.

Teams are formed around the most promising projects and the competition begins. On Sunday evening, the teams will present to a panel of celebrity judges and to the victors will go the spoils - prizes are coming up!

 

The BeMyApp World Cup 2012 - Belgium

This special edition of BeMyApp Weekend is dedicated to all platforms - both native and mobile web apps. It will take place simultaneously in 5 countries around the world - Belgium, Morocco, Tunisia, USA, Brazil.

A panel of judges in each participating country will nominate its best app to compete in the finals. On Monday morning, after the hackathon is over a 48-hour worldwide vote will be launched and the BeMyApp World Cup winner will be selected!!!

 

Technologies and Tools You Might Use

iOS - iPhone, iPad, iPod Touch · HTML5 · Android (Ice Cream Sandwich) · Windows Phone 7 (WP7) · bada

Objective-C (ObjC) · Mono · Javascript · JQuery · Java · C# 

OpenGL ·  Unity 3D  · WebGL · XAML

JSON · XML

Xcode · Sencha · Eclipse · Visual Studio · Photoshop · Illustrator · Keynote

Game · Utility · Social - Twitter, Facebook · API · Location-based · Gamification


All apps built during the WeekEnd belong to the participants only (we take no ownership, promise).

Got questions or interested in sponsoring? Holler at cedric at bemyapp dot com.

 

What to expect?

Expect to find the complimentary skills you’ve been searching for at every other tech event you’ve gone to. Be open, share your ideas and don’t hold back – “Ideas without actions are usually called dreams”

Expect to meet super talented and inspiring people, to work under time pressure, to sleep little, and to dedicate the whole weekend!

Expect to gain valuable feedback and insight not only from your teammates but also from other participants and the all-star panel of Judges.

Apart from seeing your project turning into a shiny prototype, which is a reward on its own, expect to win prizes that will help you get that sexy app out the door and into the app stores.

events.name: Hackathon
events.about:
Notre Vision

Conformément à sa mission d’aider à l’éclosion de technologies de rupture au Benin et en Afrique, EtriLabs a le plaisir d’informer la communauté des développeurs et des codeurs locaux qu’il sera organisé tous les derniers vendredis du mois sur un sujet particulier un Hackathon à EtriLabs doté d’impressionnants prix.

Qu’est-ce qu’un Hackathon ?

Le thème « hackathon » est un mot-valise constitué de « hack » et de « marathon ». C’est un événement où des développeurs/concepteurs/codeurs/Graphistes se réunissent sur une courte période (du vendredi au dimanche dans notre cas) pour faire de la programmation informatique  ou le développement d’applications collaboratives. Les développeurs les plus chevronnés ne cesseront de coder et de fabriquer tout au long de l’événement, sans même dormir et ne prenant que des mini pauses.

Un thème par mois

Un thème sera proposé aux participants qui devront développer une application web ou/et mobile pour résoudre un problème qui afflige la communauté  (le pays en général, certaines localités etc.) ou proposer des solutions à des organisations publiques ou privés incluant les ONG, les entreprises, les secteurs de l’éducation, de l’agriculture, de la santé et autres. Les réalisations et projets de d’applications innovants, seront soutenus et bénéficieront d’une incubation au start-up de EtriLabs pour perfectionner leurs applications.

Durée du Hackathon

Le hackathon commencera le vendredi à 19 heures précises et se terminera le dimanche à 12h.  Il s’en suivra une présentation/démonstration de  10 minutes par réalisation. Le jury se retirera pour délibérer et reviendra donner les résultats au plus grand tard à 17 heures le même jour.

Prix à Gagner

Au moins un 1er prix sera décerné à la meilleure réalisation.  Dans les cas où d’autres réalisations s’illustreront par leur qualité et retiendront l’attention du jury, un 2ème et un 3ème prix  spéciaux du Jury pourront être décernés. Les prix varieront en fonction des lots mis à notre disposition par les sponsors. EtriLabs offrira tous les mois des prix composés de services et d’équipements pour encourager le travail des développeurs.

Jury d’Appréciation

Le jury sera composé d’imminentes personnalités dans les domaines couverts par les compétitions mensuelles. Ainsi, nous pourrions avoir des informaticiens mais également  des professionnels non informaticiens venant des secteurs d’activités sur lesquels portent les réalisations du hackathon

Frais et conditions de participations

La participation est ouverte à tous sans exceptions.

Les frais de participation sont de 5000 F CFA par participant.

Les participants peuvent se constitués ou non en équipe de 2, 3, ou plus.

Informations sur le Hackathon

Pour plus de renseignements, contactez-nous au 21316443, 95025712 et 66847396.

Site web : www.etrilabs.com

Courriel : info@etrilabs.com 

 


HACKATON du mois de Juin 2012

Date et Lieu :  Du vendredi 29 Juin à 19h au dimanche 1er Juillet à 12h à EtriLabs, au 3ème Etage de l’Immeuble BOA Zongo

Date limite des Inscriptions : Jeudi 28 Juin 2012

Consigne : Développez une application mobile opérationnelle sur un Mobile phone ou Tablette

Thème : Le thème sera annoncé à l’ouverture  du Hackathon.

events.name: zNight - Hackathon Google TV
events.about:
La zNight, c’est l’occasion de faire la démonstration de vos talents de développeur. Entrez dans une compétition pendant toute une soirée et montrez que vous êtes le meilleur!
Une nuit de développement, sur un thème d’actualité. Nous vous fournissons de quoi boire, de quoi manger, afin que vous puissiez vous concentrer sur l’essentiel.
Code, fun & beer!

Le thème: Venez découvrir Google TV afin d’anticiper sa prochaine arrivée en France! Cet évènement est l’occasion d’imaginer la création ou le portage de nouvelles applications sur une plateforme encore peu exploitée. Il peut aussi répondre à une simple envie de se tenir informé de l’avancée et des possibilités d’Android!

Le challenge: Vous aurez une nuit pour développer une application Google TV. Aucun thème n’est imposé, et des idées d’applications seront proposées. Le défi sera d’intégrer cette application pour qu’elle soit agréable d’utilisation pour le système. C’est une compétition, il faudra donc être le meilleur! Vous pourrez participer seul, ou en équipe.


La récompense: Un jury que nous révèlerons quelques jours avant la soirée évaluera les applications réalisées à l’issue du concours. Les meilleures applications seront récompensées et les développeurs pourront gagner leur box Google TV. Ainsi, les développeurs auront les moyens de finaliser leurs travaux.

Contact: znight@zenika.com

Déroulement de la soirée

19h30 Accueil
20h00-21h00 Présentation de Google TV
21h30-09h30 Hackathon
10h00-11h00 Présentation
11h30 Délibération du jury

events.name: Montreal Musitk
events.about:
Atelier de création musicale technologique

Musitk est un événement pour musiciens, compositeurs, programmeurs, ingénieurs, et toute personne intéressée par le mariage entre la musique et la technologie. Cet événement est spécialement axé vers des applications créatives technologiques et cherche à stimuler la collaboration entre personnes ayant une variété dexpertises. Pendant ce marathon de 36 heures, des équipes travailleront sur un projet de leur choix relié à la musique et la technologie. À la fin du deuxième jour, les équipes présenteront/ performeront leur projet devant le groupe.

Musitk aura lieu à la Maison Notman du 30 juin au 1er juillet. (N.B. Le festival international de jazz de Montréal [le plus grand festival de jazz au monde!] aura lieu du 28 juin au 7 juillet).

Cet événement est gratuit et ouvert à tous, mais un enregistrement est requis.Pour plus de détails: montrealmusi.tk

Creative music technology workshop

Musitk is an event for musicians, composers, programmers, engineers, and anyone else interested in the intersection of music and technology to meet, brainstorm, and collaborate on a project. On Saturday morning, anyone with an idea will present, teams will form around projects, and work begins. On Sunday afternoon, anyone with a project can perform or present. Any project related to music and technology is within scope and we hope to foster relationships between people of different backgrounds.

Musitk will happen at Notman House the June 30 and July 1. (Note theMontreal International Jazz Festival, the biggest in the world, will be happening June 28 to July 7)

The event is free but registration is required. For full details, seemontrealmusi.tk.

HTML5 DevDay: Davao
events.about:
HTML5 DevDay: Davao is a one-day developer event & hackathon hosted by the Smart Developer Network, the developer community for Smart Communications Incs technology platform (http://smart.com.ph/developer) & the University of Southeastern Philippines (USEP http://www.usep.edu.ph/). Were inviting the existing and aspiring HTML5 enthusiasts to create an HTML5 web or mobile app in the afternoon after a morning of HTML5 talks from HTML5 practitioners.

HTML5 DevDay: Davao is open to all developers most especially those based in Davao and in Mindanao. 

 

How To Join:

1. Form a team of 2-4 members in advance.

2. Register at https://www.facebook.com/groups/smartdevnet/

3. Get ready with your ideas for an HTML5 app. Teams are allowed to have pre-work. You can also start working on your HTML5 app on the day o fthe 

 

Program

0830 - 0930am Registration

0930 - 0945am Welcome, Lets Get this Started Paul Pajo, SMART DevNet

0945 - 1015am HTML5 Basics by Ronald Ramos

1015 - 1045am Great websites with HTML5

1045 - 1115am X-Platform HTML5 Mobile App Dev (Boot toGecko) by Bob Reyes

1115 - 1145am Google Talk by Dan De Lima, Google

1145- 12pm Announcements

1200 - 0130pm LUNCH

0130 - 0145pm SMART DevNet: The Elevator PitchJim Ayson, SMART DevNet

0200 - 0215pm Developer Story: SMART API application by Mobile Tao Maui Millan (SMART)

0215 - 0230pm Hackathon Rules Paul Pajo, SMART DevNet

0230 - 0245pm Break

0245 - 0545pm HACKATHON

0545 - 0645pm Presentations

0645 - 0745pm Judging

0745 - 0815pm Awards


 READ THE FINE PRINT

 

ELIGIBILITY

 

•       The HTML5 DevDay: Davao is open to all developers of all ages.

 

 

PROCESS

 

•       At the end of the hackathon proper, teams will do a live demo of their HTML5 apps.

 

•      The app must use HTML5 and optionally the SMART APIs either as concept and/or prototype

 

•       Teams will undergo final judging by presenting their project to a panel of judges who will identify the winners.

•       All decisions of judges are final. Scores will not be made public.

 

PRIZES

 

•       The following prizes will be awarded to the winning teams for the best use of HTML5 and the SMART APIs

 

PRIZE TO BE ANNOUNCED

 HTML5 APP DEMO

 

•       Teams are expected to bring their own laptops. Internet access will be provided at the venue.

•       The order of presentation will be determined by drawing lots.

•       Each presenter is given three (3) minutes to explain the entry and two (2) minutes to answer questions during the Q&A. 

•       CRITERIA TO BE ANNOUNCED - of course, it MUST use HTML5! 

 

INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY

The team warrants that the entry is their original idea and does not infringe on the intellectual property rights of any third party. Participants are responsible for  securing appropriate protection for any Intellectual Property (IP) contributed by the team members or their parent institutions. In the absence of such protection, participants should restrict themselves to non-enabling disclosures of their IP. Entries that have won major awards (1st, 2nd, 3rd) in any international, national or school competitions cannot be entered. Wireless service applications that are already in commercial production may not be entered. Smart Communications, Inc. (SMART) & USEP shall not be liable to any participant for commercializing ideas that have been independently developed but are similar in concept to submitted entries.

WAIVER

Participants agree to abide by the terms of these Official Mechanics and by the decisions of the organizers and/or the judges, which are final and binding on all matters pertaining to this contest. By joining the contest, the participants agree to waive any right to claim ambiguity or error in these Official Mechanics. Except where prohibited by law, the winners consent to the use of their name and/or likeness by USEP and SMART for advertising and publicity purposes without compensation.

Each participant agrees that USEP and SMART and its parent companies, agents, representatives, affiliates, and employees will have no liability whatsoever for any injuries, losses, or damages of any kind resulting from his participation in the contest, or resulting from the acceptance, possession, or use of these prizes, nor in any way are responsible for any warranty, representation, or guaranty, express or implied, in fact or in law, relative to any prize, including but not limited to the quality, condition, or fitness.

Each participant agrees that USEP and SMART and its parent company, agents, representatives, subsidiaries, affiliates, and employees will have no liability whatsoever for any injury, loss, or damages of any kind resulting from the use of the entry, unless such entry has been formally offered by USEP and SMART to the public as a service or a product. events.name: Yahoo! Intern Open Hack
events.about:
Yahoo! Intern Open Hack is Here!

Yahoo! University Recruiting is very excited to announce the first annual Intern Open Hack!

We hereby issue a call to action for Intern developers and designers from all across the valley to come to Yahoo! and participate in this most awesome of events!

Yahoo! will provide you with everything you need to have fun, be creative and productive, and impress your peers with what you can do with a computer and the wealth of technologies and data available on the Web.

We will be fueling your creativity with a variety of Yahoo! technologies and APIs, including YUI, YQL, Flickr, Updates, Answers, and more. We will introduce you to lots of wonderful data sets that are ripe for mashup and visualization. We will keep you fed, watered and entertained for the duration of the event. All you need to bring is your creativity, your laptop, and your toothbrush.

 

What is Open Hack?

Firstly, what is hacking? For newbies to hacking here is a great introduction on Hacking 101 by Chris Heilmann or check out Ricky Montalvos Hackumentary.

Our FREE event will begin on July 11th with a series of hack-related presentations from some of the Web’s most respected developers. We’ll then dive into 24 hours of hacking on July 13th at 4:30pm, using a great collection of web tools, services and APIs from the Yahoo! Developer Network, and other APIs and data from around the Web. We will end the event on the second day with the hack demos plus bragging rights until the end of eternity or the next Hack Day, whichever comes first.

If you’d like to attend the event, then please register here. Due to the limited size of the venue, we will be reviewing applications for attendance and giving preference to those we believe will best be able to contribute to the design or development of a hack at the event. You could be hacking individually or in groups (max of 4 people) but please sign-up individually.

What do you need to know?

Once you have received confirmation of your place at the event, we will email you everything you need to know.

When?

July 11th, 6:00pm- Intern Hack welcome event, tech talk, demos & networking with other interns who still might need a team

July 13th, 4:30pm- 24 hour Intern Hackathon

RSVP by June 29th!


Other Info

You could hack individually or in groups (max of 4 interns) but please sign-up individually.
Book your place now! RSVP by June 29th!

You know you want to. Due to the limited size of the venue, we will be reviewing applications for attendance and giving preference to those we believe will best be able to contribute to the design and development of a hack at the event. We will send “Open Hack Day Confirmed” emails early July to all lucky hackers.

If you have any questions, please email sethr@yahoo-inc.com  with Open Intern Hack in the subject line.

Thanks and see you in July!

events.name: Code 66 Albuquerque Hackathon
events.about:
Its the Albuquerque areas first 48-hour Hackathon!


THE BASICS:

(From Code for America:) A hackathon is a weekend dedicated to coding, designing, and deploying. Hackathons are generally about developing and publishing application programming interfaces (APIs), apps and open data. Keep in mind that the hackathon is a tactic, not a strategy. The strategy is continuous improvement. Products of a hackathon are often beginnings.. Some products are demonstrations of concepts. Some products are viable but need sustainability plans. Put effort in planning for these outcomes.  Hackathon is about doing.

Orientation and Kickoff - Your event coordinators will welcome you and present an introduction to AbqHack.

Team pitches - Each team will quickly present their demo idea and solicit new team members.
Hacking - Teams will hack on their demos.
Demos - Each team will demo their hacks for the group and judges.
Prizes - The event coordinators and judges will choose the winning team based on the best technical achievement.


HOW TO PARTICIPATE:

Were looking (mostly) for people who do things:

DEVELOPERS - Developers have software development skills and want to create or further develop a project.

DESIGNERS - Design is only important if you want people to discover your project, product or app -- and actually use it. Were looking for people with both mad and relatively calm design skills.

ENTREPRENEURS -  Idea People who can build teams, pitch in and make things happen are often really valuable.  Whether your idea is chosen or not, were glad to include people with skills in finding resources, executing and completing projects. 

Tickets are available on a limited basis. Any minors under 18 must have parental consent and adult supervision.

SPECTATORS - Anybody is welcome at any point of the event. The main public events of the Hackathon are the kickoff/pitch sessions, presentations, and awards.

SPONSORS - There are many ways for companies to partner with the Hackathon. To learn how you can provide support, please contact us.


SCHEDULE:

FRIDAY, JULY 13, 2012

5:30pm - Launch & Connect 

Network with others and begin brainstorming  with your team to network with industry bigs of Albuquerque, brainstorm ideas, or find developers and designers to form a group with you!

6:30pm - Pitch Sessions
Pitch your idea and form your team.  Each presenter(s) has 2 minutes to present.  Time limits are enforced brutally.

8:00pm - Hacking Kickoff

12:00am - Doors close (still tbd) for the evening, time to get some sleep.  Next morning is the start of a big day where the bulk of your project gets done.

SATURDAY, JULY 14, 2012
8:00am - Doors re-open
7:00pm - Team give presentation on the status of their project and get the opportunity to get feedback.

12:00am: Doors close, sleepy time.

SUNDAY, JULY 15, 2012
08:00am - Doors open.  The final sprint to 4:00pm
04:00pm - Pencils down. No more coding, hacks are finished and submitted
05:30pm - Hackathon presentations, each team gets 5 minutes to present.
07:00pm - Awards and closing party

 

Venue: TBD

Participants will sign a release holding any venue harmless and be responsible for their own gear, etc.

events.name: AT&T Mobile App Hackathon - San Francisco
events.about:
Have an app idea or need an app built for your business?

Mobile App Hackathon is an event produced by the AT&T Developer Program that is designed for attendees (technical & non-technical) to build apps/mobile apps, get fed, compete for prizes across different categories and most importantly: meet new people and scout for teammates to work on new or current projects. Our hackathon will introduce you to the latest cutting edge tools to help deploy your own app with a website backend, fully hosted in the cloud.

As far as platforms are concerned, feel free to code in the language you feel most comfortable, whether its Objective C, Java, Javascript, HTML, C #, Dot Net, or XNA. Even if you are rusty with your programming, we will have live developer support from local senior developers as well as from AT&T to help you code that much faster.


Event Schedule.  The following is a list of the weekends agenda:

  • 6PM - Friday Evening - Kickoff event with drinks, networking, and developer dating which leads into idea pitches and team formation.
  • 7PM - Friday Evening - Lightening talks.
  • 8PM - Friday Evening - Idea pitches and team formation. Pitch your ideas and form teams or just start coding with your preformed teams.
  • 12AM - Friday Evening - End of the night. Go home, get some rest and come back the next day refreshed!
  • 10AM - Saturday Morning - The fun continues with an all day hackathon. Work with the teams that you formed the night before to produce the app. Senseis will be available throughout the entire event to help you code up your solution. 
  • 1PM - Saturday Afternoon - Lunch
  • 7PM - Saturday Afternoon - Dinner
  • 12AM - Saturday Evening - End of the night. Go home, get some rest and come back the next day refreshed!
  • 10AM - Sunday Morning - The fun continues with the final six (6) hours of the hackathon. Work with the teams that you formed on Friday to produce the app. Senseis will be available throughout the final hours to help you code up your solution. App submissions will be accepted throughout the day with a deadline of 4PM.
  • 1PM - Sunday Afternoon - Lunch
  • 4PM - Sunday Evening - Promptly at 4PM, teams will begin pitching their ventures. Pitches are limited to three (3) minutes per team.

Prizes. The following prizes are experiential and geared towards accelerating you towards a successful business as well as expanding your network and industry knowledge:

  • Best Hackathon Overall App 
    • 1st Place - $500 in Gift Cards for the team and one (1) year of the Small service from Github for each team member
    • 2nd Place - $300 in Gift Cards for the team and one (1) year of the Micro service from Github for each team member
    • 3rd Place - $200 in Gift Cards for the team and six (6) months of Micro service from Github for each team member

Judging Criteria. Apps will be judged based on the the criteria below and weighted accordingly.  

  • 33% Weight - Ability to clearly articulate what your app does
  • 33% Weight - Originality of idea
  • 33% Weight - Technically challenging implementation

 

Speakers

Alex Donn is a Developer Evangelist with the AT&T Developer Program and is based out of sunny Seattle! His passion is educating developers young and old about mobile application development best practices through events like hackathons that fuse the collective interests of multiple technology and business leaders. Damien Patton, Founder and CEO of Banjo, is a four-time entrepreneur. Damien has built his career on making ideas a reality. Damien has spent the last year building Banjo, a leading social discovery mobile service where users can discover and connect with the people and events around them regardless of where they are, who they know or what social networks they belong to.

 Sidney Maestre, Platform Evangelist for Stackmob, has spent the last two years working with jQuery to build mobile apps and sharing his knowledge with others. These efforts included speaking at Adobe MAX, SenchaCon, HTML5DevConf, Silicon Valley Code Camp, creating a jQuery Mobile course at uDemy.com and organizing the Bay Area Mobile meetup.

Casey Rosenthal a Consultant Engineer at Basho, where he installs and tests Riak clusters. He also provides training to clients so that they can do the same. As Chief Software Engineer for Port Forty Nine, Casey worked for NASA, Caltech, and JPL to engineer systems for storing and disseminating the image archives of space telescopes such as Hubble, Spitzer, Chandra, etc.  

 
   
   

Senseis

  • TBA

Sponsors

events.name: Post-Startup Weekend Hackathon!
events.about:
It’s the Post Startup Weekend Hackathon!
 

You’ve spent 54 hours with your team coming up with your vision. Now it’s time to regroup and dig back in for an all-day hackathon with your fellow Startup Weekenders.
 

We’re getting together at the Fundable offices on Saturday, July 14th from 9 a.m. until 6 p.m. to do a non-stop work session to keep the ball rolling.
 

Drinks and food will be provided – just bring your laptop and go.
 

In addition, a panel of mentors including Fundable’s own Wil Schroter will be on hand to meet with each team individually to provide help on anything including fundraising, customer acquisition, product direction or anything else you need help on.

 

Let’s get to work! ;)

events.about:
Bir gün içinde bir mobil uygulamayı fikir seviyesinden kullanıcılara sunulacak hale getirebilir misin? O zaman Netmera Hackathon senin için! İster tek başına ister takım olarak Hackathona katılabilir ve kendi özgün Android uygulamanı geliştirebilirsin. Dahası diğer geliştiricilerle tanışabilir, deneyimlerinizi paylaşabilir ve hep birlikte müthiş uygulamalar ortaya çıkartabilirsiniz. Gün boyunca ikramlar ve gün sonunda en başarılı uygulamaya verilecek olanSamsung Galaxy S3te seni bekliyor!

Yapman gereken sadece Netmera Platformuna kaydolmak ve gerçekleştirmeyi planladığın uygulama fikrin ile birlikte başvurunu yapmak. Bir gün içinde bir mobil uygulama geliştirmek zor olabilir mi? Netmera platformu aslında tam buna yardımcı olmak için var. Netmera sana internet üzerinden veri alıp gönderen, fotoğraf v.b. görsel öğeleri bolca kullanan veya lokasyon bazlı uygulamaları çok kolay, hızlı geliştirmen için yardımcı oluyor. Netmera platformu hakkında daha fazla bilgiye yandaki videoyu izleyerek ulaşabilirsiniz. Ayrıca menüdeki linkler de sana yardımcı olacaktır.

 

Yarışma sırasında Netmera APIlerini kullanan uygulamanı 11 saat içinde geliştirmen ve jüri üyelerine sunman gerekiyor. Elbette yarışma öncesi ekibinle veya kendin gerek uygulama konun gerekse Netmera APIleri ile ilgili ön çalışma yapabilirsin. Zaten yarışmaya kadar Webinerler ile Netmera API kullanıma ilişkin her türlü sorunuzu yanıtlayacağız. Bununla birlikte uygulamanın ana yapısı Hackathon sırasında geliştirilmeli.

events.name: Startup Dream Team Hackathon #2 with Singly and Firebase
events.about:
Startup Dream Team is glad to be announcing its second public hackathon! 

Were proud to present Singly and Firebase as our API sponsors. 

As with most hackathons, your goal will be to build an enticing product, with or without a team, which users will want to use. 

Come join fellow interns and developers for a day of hacking! 

 

SCHEDULE

9 AM: Arrival and check-in. An overview for the day. 

10 AM: Hackathon begins! 

5 PM: Hackathon ends. 

5:30 PM to 6:30 PM: Presentations of hacks.

7:00 PM: Award ceremony.

7:30 PM: Cleanup and goodbyes.  


There will be prizes for the best overal hack, the best use of Firebase API and the best use of the Singly API.

Get ready!

 

ABOUT

Startup Dream Team is a 8-week summer program for 30 interns and young entrepreneurs from all around the world whose core focus is to create an environment favorable for team creation and teamwork so that young aspiring entrepreneurs dont make the mistake of picking the wrong team when launching their own startup.

You can find more info about the program here: http://startupdreamteam.com/about/

events.name: Creatathon Berlin 2012
events.about:
Am 18. Juli geht es los: G-Texchnology startet den ersten deutschen “Creatathon” und ihr könnt dabei sein. Bewerbt euch hier für euren exklusiven Platz im Kreativteam von iSenseven und G-Technology!

 

Worum geht es?

 

Unser Creatathon ist die kreative Version eines Hackathons: Gemeinsam mit der professionellen Film-Crew von iSenseven und Steffen Willhelm, einem preisgekrönten Amateurfilmer, erstellt ihr am 18. Juli ein anspruchsvolles Multimediaprojekt. An einem Tag. Für einen guten Zweck. 

Die Teilnahme ist beschränkt auf 26 Personen. Mitmachen können Profis und erfahrene Amateure aus den Bereichen Film, Fotografie, Musik und Animation.


Wofür die ganze Action?


Mit dem Output des Creatathon unterstützen wir das alternative Bildungsprogramm der filmArche – Europa’s erster selbstorganisierter Filmschule. Der gemeinnützige Verein aus Berlin verhilft Filminteressierten, die es sich sonst nicht leisten könnten, zu einer hochwertigen Ausbildung im Filmbereich. Über 200 Filmschaffende treffen sich regelmäßig in Berlin-Kreuzberg, um sich gemeinsam fortzubilden, voneinander zu lernen - und natürlich um Filme zu machen. Neben den eigenen Studenten ist die filmArche offen für alle, die sich für die Filmproduktion begeistern und bietet auch Nicht-Mitgliedern Veranstaltungen und Workshops zu einem moderaten Preis.


Ihr führt die Regie!

 

Die filmArche bietet Raum für eine kritische und experimentelle Auseinandersetzung mit dem Thema Film. Sie steht außerdem für Selbstorganisation und Eigenverantwortung. Das offene Prinzip der filmArche bestimmt auch das Thema dieses Projekts: Ziel ist es ein Multimedia-Produkt zu schaffen, das die Grundidee Selbstorganisation vermittelt und den alternativen Ansatz der filmArche widerspiegelt.

Wie genau ihr das Motto umsetzt entscheidet ihr! Das Projekt muss kein Image-Film werden. Es kann ein flippiger Trailer werden, eine emotionale Fotostory, eine seriöse Webreportage oder ein lustiger Film. Oder etwas komplett anderes. Ihr könnt – im Team oder alleine - mit Animationen arbeiten, eine kreative Foto-Strecke entwerfen, das Projekt um ein Musikstück herumbauen oder einfach einen guten Film machen.

 

It’s going to be fun!


Im Mittelpunkt des Creatathons steht der Austausch, das gemeinsame Produzieren  – und ihr sollt Spaß dabei haben. Die erfahrene Crew von iSenseven steht euch während des ganzen Tages zur Seite und teilt mit euch wertvolle Tipps und Tricks. Steffen Wilhelm, der mit seinem Film We miss you unter anderem G-Technology’s „Driven Creativity Award 2011“ gewonnen hat, ist mit von der Partie und wird seine Erfahrungen mit euch teilen. G-Technology kümmert sich um die Rahmenbedingungen: Wir stellen die Location, sorgen für leckeres Essen, ausreichende Getränke und die neueste Technik - damit ihr alles habt, was ihr braucht um ein großartiges Werk zu kreieren!

 

Mit der Teilnahme am Creatathon 2012 tretet ihr die Rechte an den produzierten Werken zugunsten der filmArche ab. Die filmArche wird sie dazu verwenden, ihre  Bekanntheit zu erhöhen und weitere Unterstützer zu finden. Weitere Informationen zu den Teilnahmebedingungen inklusive Bild- und Verwertungsrechten folgen in Kürze.

events.name: iOSDevCamp 2012
events.about:
iOSDevCamp 2012

Friday July 20, 2012 - Sunday July 22, 2012
PayPal (eBay) Offices
2161 N 1st Street
San Jose, California 95131
Get Directions
Who: Developers, designers, entrepreneurs for iOS.

What: 3-day weekend event, in the format of past iPhoneDevCamps and iPadDevCamp.

When: July 20-22, 2012

Where: PayPal (eBay) in San Jose, CA.

Why: We love the developer community!

How: It will cost a small amount to attend, with additional event costs offset by sponsors.


The event is inspired by BarCamp, SuperHappyDevHouse, and MacHack, to develop Cocoa Touch and Web-based applications for Apples iOS. This follows the previous events - iOSDevCamp 2011 at PayPal in San Jose, iPadDevCamp at PayPal in San Jose, and iPhoneDevCamp events held at Adobe Systems in San Francisco, July 2007 and August 2008, Yahoo! in 2009. Out-of-town guests are welcome.

Attendees will include iOS developers, web developers, UI designers, entrepreneurs and testers, all working together over the weekend. Development projects will include both solo and team efforts. While some attendees will wish to work solo during the event, we encourage attendees to team up, based on expertise, to work in ad-hoc project development teams. All attendees should be prepared to work on a development project during the event.

Attendees will be able to:

 

    • Create new applications for iOS.

 

    • Migrate Mac OS X applications to iOS.

 

    • Test and optimize applications for iOS.

 

The event will feature:

 

    • Simultaneous Events Worldwide

 

    • Meetup Time on Friday with Refreshments

 

    • Catered Breakfast, Lunch, and Dinner on Saturday and Sunday

 

    • Saturday Keynote (now accepting nominations)

 

    • Open Mic for Questions

 

    • Ad Hoc Sessions by Participants

 

    • Late Saturday Gaming

 

    • Sunday Keynote (now accepting nominations)

 

    • Hackathon Contest

 

    • Everyone Leaves with Something

 

We are committed to staying not-for-profit; all charges will go toward the production of iOSDevCamp, and the organizers dont make a cent. The organizers are Raven Zachary, Dom Sagolla, Christopher Allen, and Jennifer Holmes. We are currently seeking:

 

    • Sponsors

 

    • Keynote Speakers

 

  • Donations

To get involved with the above, please email Raven, Dom, Christopher and Jennifer: info@iphonedevcamp.org.

events.name: AT&T and Casual Connect Mobile App Hackathon Gaming (Seattle)
events.about:
Have an app idea or need an app built for your business?

This time around we have a special Mobile App Hackathon brought to you by the AT&T Developer Program and Casual Connect Seattle that is designed for attendees (technical & non-technical) to build gaming focused mobile apps! You bring your awesome ideas, we supply the food, prizes across different categories and most importantly: fresh new faces to meet! Our hackathon will introduce you to some of the latest cutting edge tools to help deploy your own app with a website backend, fully hosted in the cloud.

We Supply: Quick presentations and code samples that help to bootstrap your hacking, food to keep you going, and caffeine to keep you awake. The first 150 developers will receive free zeemote devices in order to assist in your development.  In addition we will have NFC devices on site for you to test with.

You Bring: Your laptop, skills & ideas. Come with a collaborative, team focused mindset and/or team up in advance on Twitter/Facebook/Google+ via the #atthack hashtag. Whether you are a backend person and code in Ruby/PHP/.NET or are a designer and only work with Illustrator, you are invited to attend this event. Every group needs a good balance of talent and your development skills are needed!

This event is specifically focused on mobile gaming apps, so bring your creativity cap to crank out something unique. Look to technologies like Weboolu to turn your phone into a controller or maybe pusher.com & pubnub.com to do the opposite. Heck, use multiple smartphones to make a massive keyboard or make a boat that is powered by a Sphero!


Event Schedule. The following is a list of the weekends agenda:

  • 6PM - Friday Evening - Kickoff event with drinks, networking, and developer dating which leads into idea pitches and team formation.
  • 7PM - Friday Evening - Lightning talks.
  • 8PM - Friday Evening - Idea pitches and team formation. Pitch your ideas and form teams or just start coding with your preformed teams.
  • 12AM - Friday Evening - End of the night. Go home, get some rest and come back the next day refreshed!
  • 10AM - Saturday Morning - The fun continues with an all day hackathon. Work with the teams that you formed the night before to produce the app. Senseis will be available throughout the entire event to help you code up your solution.
  • 11AM to 3PM - Saturday Morning - Special module for kids where we will walk through the process of standing up a mobile web page from starting up a cloud-based server to editing the HTML and viewing your handy work on a mobile phone. No prior knowledge required. Please bring your own laptop.
  • 1PM - Saturday Afternoon - Lunch
  • 7PM - Saturday Evening- Dinner
  • 12AM - Saturday Evening - End of the night. Go home, get some rest and come back the next day refreshed!
  • 10AM - Sunday Morning - The fun continues with the final six (6) hours of the hackathon. Work with the teams that you formed on Friday to produce the app. Senseis will be available throughout the final hours to help you code up your solution. App submissions will be accepted throughout the day with a deadline of 4PM.
  • 1PM - Sunday Afternoon - Lunch
  • 4PM - Sunday Evening - Promptly at 4PM, teams will begin pitching their ventures. Pitches are limited to three (3) minutes per team.


Prizes. The following prizes are experiential and geared towards accelerating you towards a successful business as well as expanding your network and industry knowledge:

  • Best Mobile Game - Top three (3) apps will be showcased at the Casual Connect on July 24th and the overall winner selected by the audience.
    • 1st Place
      • $3,000 cash
      • Three (3) mentorship sessions with Wibe Wagemans, Vice President and GM Mobile at Big Fish, specializes in mobile, strategy, and brand management. Previously, he ran global brand advertising and analytics at Rovio and international marketing for Bing for mobile and pc. He served 8.5 years at Nokia as a senior marketing executive, reporting to the Business Group Executive Board with expat assignments in the Netherlands, Belgium, Finland, and the USA.
    • 2nd Place
      • $2,000 cash 
      • Three (3) mentorship sessions with Mike Acuri, VP of Marketing at Zipline Games and the executive producer for Zipline's new casino title, Slots Tycoon. Zipline is known for both it's mobile games and as the creator of the Moai Game Development platform which is being used as the technology platform for hot new games like Double Fine Adventure, Shadowrun Returns, and Strikefleet Omega. Mike is a frequent writer on mobile game technology, analytics, monetization, and user acquisition. Follow his Gamasutra Expert Blog to stay up to date with mobile gaming business strategy.
    • 3rd Place
      • $1,000 cash
  • Best Hackathon Overall App
    • 1st Place - $500 in Gift Cards for the team and one (1) year of the Small service from Github for each team member
    • 2nd Place - $300 in Gift Cards for the team and one (1) year of the Micro service from Github for each team member
    • 3rd Place - $200 in Gift Cards for the team and six (6) months of Micro service from Github for each team member
  • Best Game or App showcasing MHL Technology (Innovative use of RCP encouraged)
    • 1st Place - 46 MHL-enabled HDTV
    • 2nd Place - 27 MHL-enabled monitor
    • 3rd Place - An Unlocked MHL-enabled Android Smartphone compatible with AT&T's network.  Note this is the phone only, and does not include a wireless plan.
  • Best Use of AT&T APIs - Three (3) Sierra Wireless 4G LTE Devices and 1 month of 1GB data.
  • Best Use of AT&T Cloud Services -  $500 VISA Gift Card for each team member (Max 5)
  • Best Use of AWS - $1500 AWS Credit - Spin up Elastic Beanstalk, load balance your app or use a new AWS feature. Show the AWS judges your creative solution to win this prize.
  • Best Use of AllJoyn - $7,000 is up for grabs when you integrate AllJoyn, a proximity-based peer-to-peer framework which enables devices near each other to connect and interact in real-time, into your mobile app. See AllJoyn in these apps: Rollercoaster Rush, PacMan Kart Rally, JamJoyn, Bizzabo. The possibilities are endless, we want to see what you can do! 
    • 1st Prize $5,000
    • 2nd Prize $1,500
    • 3rd Prize  $500
  • Best Use of Sphero SDK - $1000 Cash - Sphero is the first robotic ball gaming device that you control with a tilt, touch, or swing from your smartphone or tablet. You can even use Sphero as a controller for on-screen gameplay. This means big things for you developers. Use the Sphero iOS or Android SDK to create a unique app, hack, or something entirely different.
  • Best Use of Roar Engine - Roar Engine is offering $5,000 worth of game design, back end development and hosting services for the best game or application built using Roar’s game mechanics engine. [read more]
  • Best Use of MapQuest's Maps, Directions, Geocoding, Search, Traffic Or Elevation data from http://developer.mapquest.com/ - $600 Stack'o'Cash

Judging Criteria. Apps will be judged based on the the criteria below and weighted accordingly. Github check-in required.

  • General Judging Criteria:
    • 33% Weight - Ability to clearly articulate what your app does
    • 33% Weight - Originality of idea
    • 33% Weight - Technically challenging implementation
  • AllJoyn Prize Judging Criteria (on a 1 to 10 point scale each):
    • 33% Weight - Innovative use of AllJoyn
    • 33% Weight - Real World Applicability
    • 33% Weight - Simplicity and ease of use
Legal. Please be sure to review the official contest rules below and look for important waivers required for minors to participate:
Hackathon Terms: http://db.tt/kyPS9ojR
AllJoyn Prize Rules:  http://db.tt/w5z0vOLP
Attendees under the age of 18 must provide a signed copy of the form found at the link below in order to participate:
Parental Waiver Form: http://db.tt/UNMqOAMr  Parking Information. Parking can be found at the nearby Central Parking garage, which is located on 721 1st Ave. Parking costs are $3/hr or $18 for 10 hours.
Social Media. 
  • Follow us @hackathonlive for live updates and photos from the event
  • Like us on Facebook! https://www.facebook.com/AttMobileAppHackathon
 

Hackathon Speakers

events.name: AT&T Mobile App Hackathon - Seattle

Have an app idea or need an app built for your business?

Mobile App Hackathon is an event produced by the AT&T Developer Program that is designed for attendees (technical & non-technical) to build apps/mobile apps, get fed, compete for prizes across different categories and most importantly: meet new people and scout for teammates to work on new or current projects.   • Best Mobile Game - Top three (3) apps will be showcased at the Casual Connect Keynote on July 24th and the overall winner selected by the audience.

Alex Donn is a Developer Evangelist with the AT&T Developer Program and is based out of sunny Seattle! His passion is educating developers young and old about mobile application development best practices through events like hackathons that fuse the collective interests of multiple technology and business leaders. Bob Kinney, a Software Engineer for Amazon Web Services, has worked in IT for over 14 years with roles ranging from system administrator to software engineer and spent almost 7 years architecting scalable, highly available infrastructure and user tools for higher education research. Bobs expertise lies in systems integration, data modeling and performance tuning.
Brandon Wu, founder of a creative boutique Studio Pepwuper, and co-founder of 30 Day Books, who loves design, books, and indie games, and spends most of his time creating and enjoying them. He organizes the Unity3D Seattle User Group and blogs about life and creativity at Level Up with Brandon Wu. Brian Sapp, Director of Developer Partnerships at TapJoy, makes mobile apps hum. He specializes in Business Development, Multi-Party Negotiations, Marketing & New Media Strategy, Contract Negotiation, Budget Planning, Client Services, Strategic Partnerships, Music and Intellectual Copyright, Creative Music Placement, & Social Media Marketing.

events.name: Code for Oakland 2012: Building our Civic Web
events.about:
Come out for the 2nd annual Code for Oakland: Building Our Civic Web; a month-long series of focused discussions and events that culminate in a one-day hackathon at the Henry J Kaiser Center!  Join Oaklands community of civically engaged developers, coders, designers, entrepreneurs and innovators as we re-imagine ways in which collaboration and technology can help shape, grow, and sustain the healthy future of our City.
 
The focus of this year’s hackathon is on: building apps, hacking public data and building tools to support economic development in Oakland, improve civic engagement, improve digital education and literacy in our residents and provide tools to attract and sustain local business in the town.
 
Do you have ideas about how technology could help address these issues, but don’t consider yourself a techie? Come to one of these upcoming listening sessions to share your ideas, brainstorm community needs and help shape what is built at the hackathon. We want to hear from small business owners, community activists, teachers, city staff, nonprofit leaders and people from across the city- your ideas may just spark a great new app or tool to make positive change in our city!


Come win prize money for your ideas!

What will happen at the event?

This will be a day of talking, brainstorming, planning and hacking. We will:

Show and share the great apps built last year, and to discuss how we can sustain and scale their use in our city

Build connections between potential collaborators who want to build useful apps for local people and need to fill out their team/skills

Encourage the exchange of experiences, expertise and ideas between those involved in leading open government data initiatives around the East Bay and nearby.

Build & Hack new apps, tools and solutions driven by real needs and problems in our city

Celebrate well end the event with a happy hour at a nearby watering hole to network, share and relax.

Engage On Sunday we will have some team events to get even more involved- stay tuned as we develop some ultra geeky but ultra fun events for everyone! Hint- Max Ogden and Matt Senate are conspiring...

 

Can I propose a new app or need?

Yes, we will be holding city and community listening sessions ahead of the event to solicit ideas and to uncover pain points in local government that we can build solutions for. There will be a pitch session early in the day to get ideas from everyone attending. These sessions are listed on our event website www.codeforoakland.org

 
Get connected early: #CodeforOakland

Who’s behind the event?

Code for Oakland: A one day hackathon was conceived of and is being organized by a committee of Oakland-based business, city staff, developers and community based organizations. Those groups planning the event include

  • The City of Oakland
  • Code for America
  • Lake Merritt / Downtown Business Association
  • Tech Liminal
  • Urban Strategies Council
  • more organizations are joining each month!

For more details and to get involved visit www.codeforoakland.org

events.name: Summer Hackathon

Were hosting our first summer hackathon in our new space!

This time, were inviting developers and designers to come together to share ideas, form teams, and build an app or game. Well start off Saturday morning with idea pitches and then spend the rest of the weekend planning and building. We wrap things up with every team sharing their demos with other participants. Well then pick a couple of the best demos to present to the community at the next DemoCamp in September.

Hackathons are a great way to get to know a new technology, learn to code, flex your mad programming or design skills, and work as part of a team, whether youre a student, rookie or pro. So we hope to see you there!

events.about:
The event is free, but donations are welcome.

Why HTML5 & the Cloud?

HTML5 is the new standard for web based development. This Hackathon is to introduce the technology to our various communities and encourage mobile app development using the same. As you all know almost all services & functionality is now available on the cloud. Whether it’s a database, server & storage, messages, music & video, latest stock quotes, product listings etc. We’re bringing these two exciting worlds together in our latest Hackathon on HTML5 & the cloud!  

Who’s it for?
Developers who have their own app idea or want to help someone build a prototype using HTML5 and cloud technologies.

Designers who have their own app idea or want to help a team create the best-looking app of the weekend.

Anyone else who either has an app idea or wants to join a team – every project needs a marketer or biz dev to create an app to take the market by storm.

What’s happening?
TechMeetups is holding a hackathon competition for those interested in trying out more HTML5 and cloud technologies by building a prototype app in just 2 days.
Saturday morning: pitchyour idea (or choose your favorite project from the pitches), form a team, hack a prototype and pitch it to our judges on Sunday night!

For a video about the last mobile app hackathon hosted by TechMeetups in London see: http://crave.cnet.co.uk/mobiles/android-and-ios-app-olympics-held-in-london-in-video-50007159/

 

AGENDA


Saturday

10:00am Doors open and networking

10:30pm Presentations

11:00pm App or game idea presentations

11:30pm Teams form & the competition begins

10:00pm Close for the night


Sunday

9:00am The hackathon continues

4:00pm The final stretch & teams prepare for presentation time

5:30pm Prototype presentations

6:00pm Judging

7:00pm Winners announced!

 

 

WANT TO JOIN IN BUT HAVE QUESTIONS? READ ON...


What do I need to be an idea generator?
You can be anyone with an app or game idea who wants to build a team and prototype.  If you’re a developer, come and find the designer and marketer for your project.  If you’re business minded, find developers and designers to bring your idea to life.

Can I work on an existing app or game idea?
Yes, you can work on an app or game idea that you and even your business has already researched, but you should not bring along ideas that you’ve already started coding – the weekend is all about building the all-important prototype.

What platforms can I develop for?
Any as long as its done in HTML5!

Tiggzi provided free 2-month Pro plan for our members! Use code TMHackJuly12 (valid until July 23rd).


Do I need to have a certain level of experience to get involved?
No, the hackathon is about learning as well as applying your skills so you can get involved no matter how experienced you are.


What’s expected of me over the weekend?
You’ll get most out of the weekend by joining a team and building a working prototype of your app over the weekend.  

What should I bring?
Your enthusiasm, your portable computer, the mobile device you’re building for and your camera to immortalize the making of your application!
What are the judging criteria for the apps or game? The apps and games will be judged on their usability, innovation, business potential and execution.

We are working on securing food sponsors, but for now plan on bringing your lunch bag!


Who owns the apps created?
The apps and games are owned solely by their creators – we’ll provide you with some terms which you can use so your team knows where they all stand. Do note that we do not get involved legally so it is important that you discuss this with your team before you start on the prototype so everyone is clear on ownership.


SPONSORSHIP OPPORTUNITIES
Through TechMeetups’ growing global network of tech communities, the month of November will be the time when our 4,000+ members around the world are talking about HTML5, cloud technologies and hackathons at www.techmeetups.com and via social media channels. In many of our cities they’ll also be creating their own apps and you can help them by offering your knowledge, experience and tools to try out!


If you’re interested in promoting your company throughout the month, here’s more about what you can expect:
As a Sponsor of the TechMeetups.com Hackathon: HTML5 & Cloud month your brand will have both local and global exposure.  Our event attendees will be developers, designers, entrepreneurs and those interested in innovative technologies and tools for the purpose of growing their business or projects.


TechMeetups.com’s global audience has the same profile and is located across the USA, Europe and Asia where we have active and fast-growing networks.
Through our reach we’ll be marketing the event to the entire TechMeetups global community of over 4,000 members across all these cities.  For more information about our reach and activities, please visit www.techmeetups.com

Email us at sponsor@techmeetups.com for more details.

events.about: Le Company Campus organise son premier Hackathon ! Le Voyage à Nantes, lévènement artistique qui retourne la ville durant lété, en sera le thème. Rendez-vous à lIle Rouge (mais pas que...) le 21-22 juillet pour fêter et coder ensemble cet évènement.
events.address: 17 Rue Lanoue Bras de Fer Array

events.name: Hackathon Open Data
events.about:
HACKATHON OPEN DATA

21 et 22 juillet 2012

 

 

Lassociation Atlantic 2.0 et Libertic organisent le samedi 21 et dimanche 22 juillet, de 10h à 19h à la cantine numérique nantaise un Hackathon Open Data.


 

Un hackathon est un événement sur lequel des développeurs se réunissent pour faire de la programmation informatique collaborative. Le terme est un mot-valise constitué de hack et marathon. Ces évènements fédèrent des développeurs mais également des journalistes, designers, porteurs de projets, amateurs qui développent un projet numérique en équipe, mixant les compétences.


Cet hackathon sur la thématique open data a pour objectif de développer des projets basés sur la réutilisation de données ouvertes (ou ouvrables). Il a également pour objectif de soutenir les participants de lappel à projets open data de Nantes et permettre aux porteurs de développer leurs idées, ajouter des fonctionnalités à leurs services, trouver des compétences exterieures, etc.




Qui participe habituellement ?

Les développeurs, designers, journalistes, chercheurs, agents de la métropole, associations thématiques... Cest ouvert à tous.

Certains viennent développer leurs compétences sur des outils techniques et coder, certains viennent développer leurs projets en cours, certains viennent développer leurs réseaux de connaissances, certains viennent enrichir leurs cv de nouvelles expériences, certaines structures passent recruter des compétences, et tous reviennent pour la bonne ambiance !


Quels projets développer ?

- Certains projets de lappel à projets open data manquent de fonctionnalités ou enrichissement de design. Pourquoi pas compléter ces services

- Des rennais travaillent sur le développement dun projet équivalent à nosdeputes.fr mais au niveau local, pour les conseillers municipaux. Pourquoi pas enrichir ce projet réutilisable dans les villes ouvertes ?

- Certains porteurs didées déposées sur lappel à projets nont pas les compétences techniques pour le développement. Pourquoi pas concrétiser ces idées ?

- Vous avez dautres idées, concepts, venez les proposer !
