events.name: Inbound 2012: Developer Track
events.about:
This track is for developers who want to attend Inbound in order to learn more about the HubSpot APIs and building new marketing products. Inbound provides a unique opportunity of getting nearly instant feedback from thousands of users of any application.

Hack Track Format

There are 2 sections of the track:

Inbound Hackathon (FREE for Developers)

Step 1: Make a team beforehand or be placed on a team.

Step 2: Virtually meet your team before to decide what you want to build.

Step 3: Develop the app during Inbound 2012.

Step 4: Attend some of the sessions at Inbound 2012.

Step 5: Get feedback from over 2,000 marketers at Inbound.

Step 6: Receive feedback from a panel of judges and win cool prizes!

Sound good? Fill out the form here, and we will get back to you ASAP. And did we mention it is FREE for developers?

Hack Track Sessions

These sessions are for developers, IT, and other technical people who may be responsible for customizing HubSpot for their jobs. Track sessions include:

  • Keynote talk with Dharmesh Shah - CTO and Co-Founder of HubSpot
  • CSS an HTML and the CMS (with case studies)
  • Using the APIs and customizing HubSpot (with case studies)
  • “Get started” building a HubSpot app

More to come...

Note: If you are not building an app, then the price to attend this part of the hack track is a $99 add-on to the main ticket as long as you are accompanied by a standard Inbound attendee. You will also get full access to the rest of the event.

Hack Track Project Ideas 

Check out the list of ideas for Hack Track projects! Were also looking for your ideas! If you would like to submit an idea, please do so!  

Sound good? Fill out the form here, and we will get back to you ASAP with a promo code!

events.name: GreenspaceNYC Hackathon
events.about:
Join us on August 29th from 3–9:30 pm
at Wix Lounge 10 West 18th Street, New York, NY 10011
Early Birds (smaller working group) 3-6 pm
6-9 pm (larger working group, come after work)
8:30-9:00 Reception and Wrap Up

This will be an abridged version of a “hackathon”. We will focus on several sustainability use case scenarios rather than present attendees with one use case and an open gov datamine. Attendees will have the opportunity to hack and mash up ideas/solutions to the problem/scenarios that are presented, are encouraged to use open source digital software such as Google Fusion Tables, visualization tools, widgets, etc. Working group  hacks may result in resolved ideas and sketches.
---------------------------------------
MANY THANKS TO OUR SPONSORS
Brooklyn Brewery, Drinks are provided for the reception free of charge.
TekServe, Donating vouchers to attendees.
Wix Lounge, Generously providing a location, WiFi, and coffee.

Wix Lounge is a free coworking and event space in NYC for creative professionals. Brought to you by Wix.com the website builder.
---------------------------------------
TEAM LEADERS
Andrew Haner LEED certified architect (http://www.sun-tect.com)
Ray Manalo web developer for Public Stuff (www.publicstuff.com)
Alessandra Nölting iOS development/ serial entrepreneur (http://outlawapps.co/)
Pablo Schuhmacher Owner, social media company (http://loci.st/)
Sébastien Turban PhD candidate in Economics, Columbia University (http://www.columbia.edu/~st2511/)

---------------------------------------
GREENSPACENYC STEERING COMMITTEE
Jeff Kasper, Laura Scherling, and Courtney Selstad


ATTENDEES
We look forward to seeing you soon! Let us know if you have any questions or concerns. Though it is not required, we recommend you bring your laptop. Please bring a notepad and be prepared to work collaboratively within one of the working groups!

Become a fan of GREENSPACENYC on Facebook or follow GREENSPACENYC on Twitter. For more information, email scherlinglaura@gmail.com

events.name: Windows 8 Unleashed - Seattle
events.about:
Windows 8 Unleashed - Full Day of Hands On Programming, B.Y.O. Laptop! 

Windows 8 is the single biggest opportunity for developers EVER! Come to a “Windows 8 Unleashed” event to kick-start your Windows 8 development. “Windows 8 Unleashed” is a series of FREE  events run by your local community friends and leaders, and are great whether you are an experienced .NET developer, or even if you are just getting started. We’ll spend the morning in lecture and hands on labs. Half way through, you’ll get a chance to take what you learned in the morning and compete in a hackathon with a chance to win some great prizes!

Required Software and Downloads

Please make sure to get the required software and downloads BEFORE coming to the event. You can find everything you need on the “Windows 8 Unleashed Installs” page.

 Agenda

Session I – Overview

  • Metro Style Apps Overview
  • Developing Metro Style Apps
  • Working with Controls
  • Implementing Navigation

Session II – Location and Data

  • Working with Location
  • Data Binding        
  • Roaming
    • App Bar

Session III – Metro Principals

  • Live Tiles & Toast
  • Contracts
  • Full, Fill, Snap and Portrait Views
  • Advertising

Build an App and Win Money and Prizes! 

DAY-OF prizes will be awarded (sponsored by PDSA):

  • 1st Place: $500 Gift Card
  • 2nd Place: $200 Gift Card
  • 3rd Place: $100 Gift Card

“Best Overall App” Prizes will be awarded to the best app from ALL unleashed events:

  • $10,000 from ComponentArt
  • Windows 8 Tablet from PDSA, Inc.

In addition all attendees will receive a FREE eBook from O’Reilly

For more information on other Unleashed events, you can visit www.devunleashed.com.

events.name: BlackBerry Jam Sessions #2 - Rosario, AR
events.about:
Estos hackathons son algo así como los mejores hackathons en el mundo. ¿Por qué pensamos que son los mejores? Debido a que hemos escuchado lo que han pedido los desarrolladores y hemos hecho nuestro mejor esfuerzo para entregarlo.

Vamos a vuestras ciudades, traemos a los expertos, los alimentamos con pizza y Red Bull, los honramos con premios y recompensas, pero sobre todo, trabajamos para crear una relación con ustedes. Estamos ahí para ustedes, porque queremos que tengan éxito. Estos hackathons son más que una sesión de programación de 10 horas de largo. Serán su oportunidad de aprender, practicar y crear sus aplicaciones con el apoyo que nunca antes has experimentado.

Y no sólo eso, tu y tu aplicación serán parte de la competencia más prometedora, la Carrera de Descargas. Si usted participa en cualquiera de nuestros #BB10JamSessions, podrá enviar su solicitud a correr esta carrera para poder ganar increíbles premios, como dinero en efectivo, promociones en AppWorld, fondos de marketing y mucho más!

Más información aquí http://www.blackberryjamsessions.com

events.name: Hack Cyprus 2012
events.about:
What is Hack Cyprus 2012?

The first ever weekend-long hackathon in Cyprus.

What can you expect?

Code = Hack on your ideas for more than 30 hours using any technology you like. Meet other people and form teams. Well provide drinks, food and internet so you can focus on just building cool stuff. Well also try to organise 15-minute talks on various technologies throughout the weekend, so we can all learn while hacking as well.

Sun = If you live abroad, forget rain and clouds. We have 326 days of sunshine every year. When youre done with coding, you can hit the beach in no time. During the event, well make sure that its always cool and nice, and well provide plenty of refreshments, always, free of charge.

Prizes = Prizes for the best ideas kindly provided by our sponsors. Presentations will take place during the last hour of the event, over beers! 

Where can I get more information?

Please visit our official website http://hackcyprus.com

events.name: Drive Hackathon
events.about:
Live notes (Updates during the event)

  • Please use this doc to share your issues/problems/solutions
  • and on IRC: http://webchat.freenode.net/?channels=drive-il&uio=d4

Schedule

  • 4.9 Tuesday 20:00 - 21:00 - Orientation and Kickoff
    • The introduction and explanations about Drive will be also given throughout the GDG meeting.
    • 20:00-20:30: General guidelines for the event: schedule and more info.
    • 20:30-21:00 (Nicolas Garnier) Opening of the Drive hackathon
  • 5.9 Wednesday 8:30 - 9:00 - Teams pitches
    • Each team will quickly present their demo idea and solicit new team members.
    • (Team leads): the hackathon will be team based, but since not everyone will come with a team. This portion of the event allows each team to take 60 seconds to pitch their idea and solicit team members. You can use this doc in order to start setting team!
  • 5.9 Wednesday 9:00 - 12:00 -  Hacking
    • Teams will hack on their demos.
    • It will be an open bar style so people can come and go as they wish during the day.
  • 5.9 Wednesday 12:00 - 12:30 -  Quick demos
    • Team will present the current status of their hacks and their next steps regarding to it.
  • 5.9 Wednesday 13:30 - 19:30 -  Continue Hacking
  • 5.9 Wednesday 20:30 - 21:30 - Demos
    • Each team will demo their hacks for the group and judges.
    • Each team has 5 minutes to show off what they built.
    • The judges may take another 1-3 minutes to ask questions.
  • 5.9 Wednesday 21:30 - Prizes
    • The event coordinators and judges will choose the winning team based on the best technical achievement.

Venue

We will work in Afeka Tel Aviv Academic College of Engineering: 218 Bnei Efraim St. Tel Aviv

Resources

Online


  • Technical documentation: https://developers.google.com/drive/
  • Blog annoucing some partner implementation and features:https://www.google.com/#q=Drive%20site%3Agoogleappsdeveloper.blogspot.com
  • List of Drive UI integrated apps: https://chrome.google.com/webstore/category/collection/drive_apps

Bug and Issue Reports


  • Stack Overflow: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/ask?tags=google-drive-sdk

Misc

  • Registration 

  • Contact

    • IRC

  • http://webchat.freenode.net/?channels=drive-il&uio=d4
  • Equipment: All participants are expected and required to bring their own laptops and power cords. The location/venue will provide WiFi and ‘some’ power outlets.
events.address: Afeka Tel Aviv Academic College of Engineering: 218 Bnei Efraim St.

events.name: [Megathon W8] - Hackathon Windows 8 - Barcelona
events.about:
Megathon Windows 8 es el primer hackathon multiciudad para Windows 8. 

Durante los días 7, 8 y 9 de Septiembre programadores de toda España se reunirán para crear contrarreloj las mejores apps para Windows 8 para conseguir fabulos premios.

En el site http://megathonwindows8.azurewebsites.net tienes las últimas novedades y toda la formación gratuita sobre la creación y diseño de apps metro para que llegues preparado al hackathon.

Inscríbete ya en la edición de Barcelona. 

7 de septiembre

Inicio
17:00 ~ 17:30 – Acreditación de los participantes

17:30 ~ 18:00 – Presentación de proyectos

18:00 ~ 18:30 – Formación de los equipos

Hackathon
18:30 ~ 21:30 – Las 3 primeras horas de programación

Formación
18:30 ~ 19:40 – Formación: Plataforma de desarrollo de Windows 8 para apps Metro

8 de septiembre

Hackathon
10:00 ~ 20:00 – Toda una jornada para programar.

Formación
11:00 ~ 12:00 – Formación: Lo que los desarrolladores Web deberían saber para construir apps Metro  de Windows 8

18:00 ~ 19:00 – Formación: Cómo dar vida a tus apps con las Notificaciones y Life Tiles.

10:00 ~ 17:00 – Últimas 5 horas de programación

Formación
11:00 ~ 12:00 – Formación: Gestión del ciclo de vida de una app Metro de Windows 8

Fin
17:00 ~ 18:00 – Presentación del proyectos

events.name: Los Angeles Hackathon
events.about:
Have an innovative app idea?  Come code your dream app and help develop a solution to put an end to texting while driving.

This is a truly unique AT&T Mobile App Hackathon, an event produced by the AT&T Developer Program, focused on our It Can Wait dont text and drive campaign. Our event is designed for attendees (technical & non-technical) to build apps/mobile apps, get fed, compete for prizes across different categories and most importantly: meet new people and scout for teammates to work on new or current projects. Our hackathon will introduce you to the latest cutting edge tools to help deploy your own app with a website backend, fully hosted in the cloud. Spend the weekend coding and then join us on Tuesday, September 18th where top teams will present their final apps and the big winners will be chosen!

Texting while driving is a common and dangerous habit.  According to a recent AT&T Wireless survey 75% of teenagers consider it common for their friends to text while driving. Over 100,000 automobile accidents a year involve a driver texting and drivers that do text while driving are 23x more likely to be in an accident. Please join us at this hackathon to make the road a safer place and visititcanwait.org to take the pledge.

We Supply: Quick presentations and code samples that help to bootstrap your hacking, food to keep you going, and caffeine to keep you awake. Along with technical senseis to assist you in building faster, smarter, and with new tools.

You Bring: Your laptop, skills & ideas. Come with a collaborative, team focused mindset and/or team up in advance on Twitter/Facebook/Google+ via the #atthack hashtag. Whether you are a backend person and code in Ruby/PHP/.NET or are a designer and only work with Illustrator, you are invited to attend this event. Every group needs a good balance of talent and your development skills are needed!

 

Event Schedule.  The following is a list of the weekends agenda:

  • 6PM - Friday Evening - Kickoff event with drinks, networking, and developer dating which leads into idea pitches and team formation.
  • 10AM - Saturday Morning -  The fun continues with an all day hackathon. Work with the teams that you formed on Friday night to produce the app spec’d out the night before. Senseis will be available throughout the entire event to help you code up your solution. App submissions will be accepted throughout the day with a deadline of 7PM.
  • 7PM - Saturday Evening - Promptly at 7PM, teams will begin pitching their ventures. Pitches are limited to three (3) minutes per team.

Prizes. The following prizes are experiential and geared towards accelerating you towards a successful business as well as expanding your network and industry knowledge:

  • Best Hackathon Dont Text While Driving App (Learn More) - Top five teams will be chosen on site on September 8th and given 10 days to build out and polish their application.  They will then present their final apps during a happy hour event on September 18th where the overall winners will be announced.
    • 1st Place
      • $20,000 in cash for the team to split
    • 2nd Place 
      • $7,000 in cash for the team to split
    • 3rd Place
      • $3,000 in cash for the team to split
  • Best Hackathon General App 
    • 1st Place
      • $1,000 in cash for the team to split
      • One (1) year of the Small service from Github for each team member
    • 2nd Place
      • $500 in cash for the team to split
      • One (1) year of the Micro service from Github for each team member
    • 3rd Place
      • $250 in cash for the team to split
      • Six (6) months of Micro service from Github for each team member
  • Best App using AT&T APIs (Learn More)
    •  
      • $500 in cash
      • A Sierra Wireless 4G LTE Elevate device and 1 Month of 1GB DataConnect Service (Max 3)
  • Best App using Telenav APIs (Learn More)
    • $500 in cash for the team to split

 

Judging Criteria. Apps will be judged based on the criteria below and weighted accordingly.  

  • 33% Weight - Ability to clearly articulate what your app does
  • 33% Weight - Originality of idea
  • 33% Weight - Use of Node.JS, Sencha, cloud9ide.com, Heroku, and other technologies
Social Media. 
  • Follow us @hackathonlive for live updates and photos from the event
  • Like us on Facebook! https://www.facebook.com/AttMobileAppHackathon

 

Speakers

 
Alex Donn is a Senior Marketing Manager with the AT&T Developer Program, is based out of sunny Seattle! His passion is educating developers young and old about mobile application development best practices through events like hackathons that fuse the collective interests of multiple technology and business leaders. Joshua Musselwhite is a fulltime freelance Android developer and software architect who has developed for E!, CBS, Warner Bros., Ebay, Arnold Schwarzenegger and more. Between Android, Flash, Flex, and PHP, he has over 10 years experience developing rich-internet applications, interactive content and games.
John Shiple, the CEO of FreelanceCTO, has secured two Fortune 50 contracts for a startup within a year of operation and has enabled Bigstep.com to sign 50+ co-branded partnerships. He is also responsible for the redesign of the 4th largest site on the Internet, GeoCities, increasing ad inventory by more than 10,000 times and enabling a purchase by Yahoo! for $3.57 billion in stock. Joseph Chiu is a computer and electronics generalist that works on everything from 8 bit processors to distributed systems. He recently helped bring about the current resurgence of 3D movies in the theaters. He has taken multi-spectral images of Dead Sea scroll fragments; and had done various stints in the enterprise field, including helping a financial firm place bets potentially worth billions of dollars..
   
   

Senseis

Karim Varela, an Android developer with Fandango, has over eight years of mobile application development experience. In previous roles, Karim was an Android Engineer for Muve Music and the Android support lead within AT&T Mobilitys technical developer support team. Karim has also held various roles in the mobile games industry ranging from quality assurance and build engineering to porting, and networking engineering. Cas Hoefman, a Solutions Consultant for Oracle during the day, helps to empower brands to deliver the best customer experiences when, where and how customers want it. At night he likes to hack on anything he can get his hands on, has a passion for telco solutions like Tropo and lately has been know to spend way too much time on Bluetooth 4.0 Technology
Hattan Shobokshi is a Senior Software Engineer and is responsible for developing applications on a variety of platforms including weband mobile devices. Hattan is experienced in .NET technologies, in particular ASP.NET MVC. Hattan is also an avid JavaScript developer and is experienced in building rich client side userinterfaces using JavaScript and its supporting technologies. George McKinney is a cross-platform mobile developer & co-founder of Zukini Mobile, Adobe User Group Manager for LA PhoneGap and previously co-Manager of LA Flex. George creates mobile, augmented reality and social game experiences. He loves web programming especially in Actionscript, JavaScript and PHP. Previous work experiences include WebConference.com, Sun Microsystems and EMI Music.
 
Colby Palmer the Co-Founder and CTO of Eventup, a Santa Monica-based startup that is changing the way people book events online. He works primarily with Django, the Python web framework, and can also advise on cloud server scaling and AWS technologies, HTML/CSS front-end development, JavaScript/jQuery and most modern Web technologies.   

Sponsors

events.name: Startup Weekend Tucson - Sept 7-9th, 2012
events.about:
For all event details, visit tucson.startupweekend.org

Thanks!

Startup Weekend Crew

 

Refund Policy:  No refunds will be granted within 7 days of the event if food and drink have already been ordered. Apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

About Startup Weekend: Startup Weekends are 54-hour events designed to provide superior experiential education for technical and non-technical entrepreneurs.  Beginning with Friday night pitches and continuing through brainstorming, business plan development, and basic prototype creation, Startup Weekends culminate in Sunday night demos and presentations.  Participants create working startups during the event and are able to collaborate with like-minded individuals outside of their daily networks. All teams hear talks by industry leaders and receive valuable feedback from local entrepreneurials. The weekend is centered around action, innovation, and education.  Whether you are looking for feedback on a idea, a co-founder, specific skill sets, or a team to help you execute, Startup Weekends are the perfect environment in which to test your idea and take the first steps towards launching your own startup.

events.name: HackAthon Windows 8 - Cordoba
events.about:
Megathon Windows 8. 

El Megathon Windows 8 es el primer hackathon de Windows 8 que se va a llevar a cabo de forma simultánea en varias ciudades de España.

El Parque Científico Tecnológico de Córdoba, Rabanales 21 (www.rabanales21.com) y Number Studios (www.numberstudios.com) organizan en Córdoba el #hackathonw8.

Durante los días 7, 8 y 9 de Septiembre, los participantes acudirán para crear contrarreloj una App Metro  para Windows 8, la cual competirá contra otros equipos tanto a nivel local como contra equipos de otras ciudades.

Durante el #hackathonw8 los asistentes recibirán formación sobre cómo programar apps Metro para Windows 8 usando XAML/C# oHTML5/JavaScript/CSS3 y contarán con mentores que les ayudarán a completar su App.
Las mejores apps recibirán un premio y podrán participar en los Excellence Labs dónde un ingeniero de Microsoft les ayudará a que su aplicación cumpla con los requisitos de UX, rendimiento, seguridad y accesibilidad claves para publicar en la Windows Store.

Para mantenerte informado puedes seguirnos en twitter @JulioC_delaVega, a través del hashtag #hackathonw8 o visitando la web del eventohttp://megathonwindows8.azurewebsites.net

No te pierdas esta gran oportunidad de entrar en el mayor mercado mundial de apps en el que se va a convertir Windows Store!

events.name: Hacking Medicine West
events.about:
Hacking Medicine West  - September 8-9 - San Francisco

Description

Hacking Medicine is an intense, two-day hackathon devoted to disrupting medicine and healthcare, happening September 8-9 in San Francisco.

We cannot ignore the lack of progress in medicine, given advances in tools, technology, and the distribution of information. Taking the Silicon Valley approach to progress, we are challenging engineers, biologists, physicians, designers, and entrepreneurs to band together to: hack medicine.

Agenda

Identify problems in medicine and healthcare
Design solutions within teams
Final presentation and judging / awards

events.name: Windows 8 Unleashed - San Diego
events.about:
Windows 8 Unleashed - Full Day of Hands On Programming, B.Y.O. Laptop! 

Windows 8 is the single biggest opportunity for developers EVER! Come to a “Windows 8 Unleashed” event to kick-start your Windows 8 development. “Windows 8 Unleashed” is a series ofFREE events run by your local community friends and leaders, and are great whether you are an experienced .NET developer, or even if you are just getting started. We’ll spend the morning in lecture and hands on labs. Half way through, you’ll get a chance to take what you learned in the morning and compete in a hackathon with a chance to win some great prizes!

Required Software and Downloads

Please make sure to get the required software and downloads BEFORE coming to the event. You can find everything you need on the “Windows 8 Unleashed Installs” page.

Agenda

Session I – Overview

  • Metro Style Apps Overview
  • Developing Metro Style Apps
  • Working with Controls
  • Implementing Navigation

 Session II – Location and Data

  • Working with Location
  • Data Binding
  • Roaming
  • App Bar

Session III – Metro Principals

  • Live Tiles & Toast
  • Contracts
  • Full, Fill, Snap and Portrait Views
  • Advertising

Build an App and Win Money and Prizes!

Our sponsors have stepped up with some awesome prizes. Not only do you get a ton of information for FREE, but you have an opportunity to win some awesome stuff! You can’t afford to miss this!

DAY-OF prizes will be awarded (sponsored by PDSA):

  • 1st Place: $500 Gift Card
  • 2nd Place: $200 Gift Card
  • 3rd Place: $100 Gift Card

 “Best Overall App” Prizes will be awarded to the best app from ALL unleashed events:

  • $10,000 from ComponentArt
  • Windows 8 Tablet from PDSA, Inc.

In addition all attendees will receive a FREE eBook from O’Reilly

events.name: BlackBerry Jam Sessions #3 - San Luis, AR
events.about:
Estos hackathons son algo así como los mejores hackathons en el mundo. ¿Por qué pensamos que son los mejores? Debido a que hemos escuchado lo que han pedido los desarrolladores y hemos hecho nuestro mejor esfuerzo para entregarlo.

Vamos a vuestras ciudades, traemos a los expertos, los alimentamos con pizza y Red Bull, los honramos con premios y recompensas, pero sobre todo, trabajamos para crear una relación con ustedes. Estamos ahí para ustedes, porque queremos que tengan éxito. Estos hackathons son más que una sesión de programación de 10 horas de largo. Serán su oportunidad de aprender, practicar y crear sus aplicaciones con el apoyo que nunca antes has experimentado.

Y no sólo eso, tu y tu aplicación serán parte de la competencia más prometedora, la Carrera de Descargas. Si usted participa en cualquiera de nuestros #BB10JamSessions, podrá enviar su solicitud a correr esta carrera para poder ganar increíbles premios, como dinero en efectivo, promociones en AppWorld, fondos de marketing y mucho más!

Más información aquí http://www.blackberryjamsessions.com

events.name: Windows 8 Unleashed- COS Edition
events.about:
Windows 8 Unleashed - Full Day of Hands-On Programming, B.Y.O. Laptop!

Windows 8 is the single biggest opportunity for developers EVER! Come to a “Windows 8 Unleashed” event to kick-start your Windows 8 development. “Windows 8 Unleashed” is a series of FREE events run by your local community friends and leaders, and are great whether you are an experienced .NET developer, or even if you are just getting started. We’ll spend the morning in lecture and hands on labs. Half way through, you’ll get a chance to take what you learned in the morning and compete in a hackathon with a chance to win some great prizes!

Required Software and Downloads

Please make sure to get the required software and downloads BEFORE coming to the event. You can find everything you need on the “Windows 8 Unleashed Installs” page.

Agenda 

Session I – Overview

  • ·Metro Style Apps Overview
  • ·Developing Metro Style Apps
  • ·Working with Controls
  • ·Implementing Navigation

Session II – Location and Data

  • ·Working with Location
  • ·Data Binding
  • ·Roaming
  • ·App Bar

Session III – Metro Principals

  • ·Live Tiles & Toast
  • ·Contracts
  • ·Full, Fill Snap and Portrait Views
  • ·Advertising

Build an App and Win Money and Prizes!

Our sponsors have stepped up with some awesome prizes. Not only do you get a ton of information for FREE, but you have an opportunity to win some awesome stuff! You can’t afford to miss this!

DAY-OF prizes will be awarded (sponsored by PDSA):

  • ·1st Place: $500 Gift Card
  • ·2nd Place: $200 Gift Card
  • ·3rd Place: $100 Gift Card

“Best Overall App” Prizes will be awarded to the best app from ALL unleashed events:

  • ·$10,000 from Component Art
  • ·Windows 8 Tablet from PDSA, Inc. 

In addition all attendees will receive a FREE eBook from O’Reillyd

events.name: Hackathon Hack Ta Ville!
events.about:
[English version below]

Dans la lignée des des initiatives de données ouvertes, Hack Ta Ville vise à développer des application s’attaquant aux questions de transport, de planification urbaine mais aussi d’agriculture urbaine, de développement durable ou de l’utilisation du territoire (lieux publics, parcs, développement résidentiel, etc.).

Pour tout le monde

L’objectif est de mettre ensemble des acteurs divers développeurs, designers, acteurs communautaires, leaders et amoureux de la ville pour améliorer la Cité.

Pour plus dinformation: hacktaville.ca

Organisateurs

HackTaVille est organisé par L’association étudiante de l’université de McGill, l’école d’urbanisme de l’Université McGill, l’École Polytechnique de Montréal, Living Lab de Montréal et Nord Ouvert. Lorganisation bénéficie également dun support financier de Yellow Page API.

Jeux de données et ateliers

À loccasion de lévénement, certains organismes partenaires mettre à disposition de nouveaux ensemble de données. Des communications subséquentes auront lieu lorsque les jeux de données en question seront confirmés. Des ateliers et mini-formations auront également lieu en marge du hackathon pour permettre à chacun de progresser dans ses connaissances technique et du fonctionnement de la Ville.

HackTaVille est un prélude au TransportationCamp Montréal qui aura lieu le 21 septembre 2012.

Hack ta ville will build on the successes of the open data movement exploring themes of transportation, urban planning, urban agriculture, sustainable development, urban land use, housing, parks, public spaces – and more.

For everybody

The goal is to bring programmers, designers, community organizers, leaders and members together to improve the city.

For more information, visit hacktaville.ca

Organization

This event is organized by the Student Society of the McGill University, the Urban Planning School of McGill University, theÉcole Polytechnique de Montréal, the Living Lab of Montréal, and Open North. We will also benefits from the financial support of Yellow Page API.

Datasets and workshops

Some of our partners at the event will release new data sets! An announcement will take place before the event and hopefully the datasets will be released in advance. We will have workshops going on throughout the day about programming and designing. So come by, get your hands dirty and learn.

HackTaVille is happening in the lead-up to TransportationCamp Montréal which will take place Sept 21st

events.name: IDEATHON
events.about:
What in tarnation is an Ideathon?

It’s like this. You’ve got an idea, but it’s just that - An idea.  No business model. No brand. No real clue as to how to move forward with it. Ring any bells?! An ideathon is a chance to pitch that idea and, in an afternoon, go from nothing to something. 

What if I don’t have an idea?

If you’re looking to team up with someone with a great concept, this is a fantastic opportunity to hear lots of pitches and get involved at the earliest stage of development.  

 Who should come?

  • If you have an idea– pitch it at one of our events, join forces with people to help develop your idea from nothing to something and maybe even meet your new Co-Founder!

If you don’t- have a current project, you’ll get to hear a load of pitches & you’ll get to work on the one you like – helping to develop it in any way you can – and again, maybe you’ll meet the yin to your yang... the Bonnie to your Clyde... the Adrian to your Rocky. 

How’s it different?

Our events are about rolling up your sleeves and developing a business concept. But! It’s not a hackathon. It’s almost a pre-hackathon. The emphasis is less on building something and more on developing a concept in any way possible, whether it’s a business model, a pitch, a demo, and MVP, UX sketches... You name it.

What’s the catch?

Events are limited to 30 Rockstar-Unicorn-Pirate-Ninjas (Hence the name). We want to keep it small and high quality, so sign up now before it’s too late.

 
And Finally... 
Be sure to join our community on Meetup to meet other like-minded individuals!
 http://bit.ly/SmGmHL

events.name: The App Builder Contest .conf2012
events.about:
On Wednesday, September 12th at  .conf2012 in Las Vegas, NV, Splunk is hosting a hackathon for developers to get together and build applications that make it easier and more effective to gain insights from machine data with Splunk. Brought to you by Splunk>4Good, the hackathon will take place in the Cosmopolitan hotel after the day’s sessions have wrapped up.  Splunkers will be on hand to help with any level of technical question and provide support.  The hackathon is open to developers with any level of familiarity with Splunk, the REST APIs and SDKs.  Whether you’re a Splunk ninja or just want to learn to apply your Python, Java or JavaScript skills to building data apps, attending the hackathon is a great way to grow your skills, meet other Splunk developers and make the most out of .conf2012.

Participants can decide to participate as an individual or join a team. Prizes will be awarded for “Best Application” and “Best Application for Social Impact” by a panel of judges at the conclusion of the hackathon on Wednesday night.  For Official Rules, see here.  Please ensure that your company policies allow you to participate.  

Developers interested in building apps to solve challenging data problems with Splunk are welcome. While the hackathon builds on a ton of great session content at .conf2012, you don’t have to be a registered for the conference to take part.

“NO PURCHASE NECESSARY TO ENTER OR WIN. A PURCHASE WILL NOT INCREASE YOUR CHANCES OF WINNING.  Must be 18 and the age of majority to participate.  Void where prohibited by law.  “Best Application” entries will receive a score of one (1) to ten (10) in the following categories: innovation, technical implementation, presentation, and coolness. “Best Application for Social Impact” entries will receive a score of one (1) to ten (10) in the following categories: innovation, technical implementation, presentation, coolness, and social impact.  Must be present to participate and win.  Sponsor is Splunk Inc. 250 Brannan Street, San Francisco, CA 94107.”

Eventbrite is not a sponsor or administrator of, and is not in any way affiliated with, this hackathon.

events.name: Seattle Startup Weekend + GDG Bootcamp
events.about:
Google Developer Groups and Startup Weekend are joining forces to help developers and entrepreneurs become more successful!

 

We know that during a Startup Weekend event there isn't a lot of time to learn new things. You come in with the tools you have in your belt, and you do the best you can with those. But sometimes those tools aren't enough, which is why we're running this pre-Startup Weekend technical bootcamp

 

We wiil walk newbies, including designers and folks famiar with basics of web programming through a declaritive mobile tablet website driven by Google App Engine. You will install GAE on your machine. Pull the mobile site from Github. And get a hello world mobile tablet development enviornment working. Easiest to work is Apple Macbooks running OSX and Windows 7 machines (odd ball / older / newer machines unlikely we can help with)

 

Note Exchange Building - Enter on 2nd Ave @ Marion. Door Closes 6pm - try arrive a few minutes before hand. We will watch the door till 6:15. Arrive later text 650-453-8 one five seven

 

PS. Google Developer Group regular members who can assist with GAE/ Github are welcome to attend as GDG trainers at no cost. Please let us know you are here to help. THX

events.name: self.dev   |     Monthly Hackathon at Geekdom (Licklider Room)
events.about:
Were doing a monthly hackathon day at Geekdom starting Friday September 14th, 2012 from 10am to 5pm. We will have this hackathon Every Second Friday of the Month. Please review the self.dev hackathon principles before signing up as this event is exclusively for developers.

self.dev 
agenda and schedule

10:00am - 11:30am | Code Katas with Paired Programming 

    - You and a random partner will be given a code kata to work on; its not meant to be solved, but to develop new skills and techniques you may not encounter on a day to day basis.

11:30am - 1:00pm  | Hack & Help

    - Attendees will post up their problems on the whiteboard and 4-5 problems will be selected to work on. Note: That problems can also be fun things youve wanted to learn like for instance how to use a certain API (e.g. - Twilio, Twitter, Facebook Graph, etc). 

1:00pm - 2:00pm    | Working Lunch

    - Lunch will be provided by Jason Seats (kudos to him for pizza). Feel free to continue hacking in groups during this time. 

2:00pm - 5:00pm    | Hack & Help

    - Continue hacking and helping. Feel free to jump to other teams if you feel you can be of more value or youd like to learn something else. We hope everyone has a great day hacking and helping others.

 

self.dev
hackathon principles

This hackathon is for: DEVS ONLY (any skill set or language preference - it doesnt matter, but you must be familiar with standard programming principles). If you are a developer please come and invite others to come as well - web front-end devs (JS/HTML/CSS/etc), back-end programmers (Ruby/Python/Java/ASP.net/etc), desktop application programmers (C#, C++, C/etc), etc.

This hackathon will benefit: Devs who have a current problem or Devs who would love to help other Devs out who need programming help. Also if youve ever wanted to learn a new APi, feel free to form a group surrounding one.

This hackathon is also for: meeting new devs, trying out languages/patterns/skills you wouldnt have normally tried before, and is perfect for the intermediate dev.

This hackathon is not for: business/PR/communications/marketing people, anyone who doesnt work in code on a daily basis. Youre all great people, but this is for devs only. 

Please note in the comments sections of registration if you are here to help or to work on a programming problem.

self.dev Hackathon Goal: Developers at all skill sets face problems each day that may become a road block and its likely other developers have hit similar obstacles and can be a great source of information. Join us for pair programming and group hacking to increase your skill set and knowledge.

events.name: Windows 8 Boot to VHD Event - Los Angeles (September 14, 2012)
events.about:
My team is hosting Windows 8 Boot Camps / Hackathons to help get developers up to speed on Windows 8 Development.  I may not be a developer, but I can still help the developer community get their machines up and running on Windows 8 today without having to wipe out their existing Windows 7 installation.

Since the actual RTM bits are not quite available yet, I will have bootable thumb drives with Windows 8 Release Preview and Windows Server 2012 Release Candidate.  In addition, I will also provide VHD files that have Windows Server 2012 Release Candidate and Windows 8 Release Preview preinstalled so that we can configure your machine with Boot to VHD (no repartitioning required and keeps your existing OS intact).

The only requirement for your computer is that you have Windows 7 or higher installed (required for Boot to VHD) and no drive encryption enabled (e.g. bitlocker, etc.).

If you would like to grab the files prior to arriving at the event, I have put the preinstalled VHDs here: http://aka.ms/hwitcampfiles.  Please download the ISO images here: http://aka.ms/hwws2012 and http://windows.microsoft.com/en-US/windows-8/download.

The event will take place at the Los Angeles Microsoft Office located at 333 Grand Ave., Suite 3300, Los Angeles, CA 90071

Date: Friday, September 14, 2012

Start Time: 4:45PM

End Time: 7:00 PM

events.name: Startup Weekend Toledo 09/14
events.about:
For all event details, visit toledo.startupweekend.org

Thanks!

Startup Weekend Crew

 

Refund Policy:  No refunds will be granted within 7 days of the event if food and drink have already been ordered. Apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

About Startup Weekend: Startup Weekends are 54-hour events designed to provide superior experiential education for technical and non-technical entrepreneurs.  Beginning with Friday night pitches and continuing through brainstorming, business plan development, and basic prototype creation, Startup Weekends culminate in Sunday night demos and presentations.  Participants create working startups during the event and are able to collaborate with like-minded individuals outside of their daily networks. All teams hear talks by industry leaders and receive valuable feedback from local entrepreneurials. The weekend is centered around action, innovation, and education.  Whether you are looking for feedback on a idea, a co-founder, specific skill sets, or a team to help you execute, Startup Weekends are the perfect environment in which to test your idea and take the first steps towards launching your own startup.

events.name: AT&T Mobile App Hackathon Education (Dallas)
events.about:
Have an app idea or need an app built for your business?

This very special AT&T Mobile App Hackathon Education, an event produced by the AT&T Developer Program and AT&T Aspire, is designed for attendees both technical & non-technical to build apps/mobile apps to benefit our education system.  We will have free food compliments of Amazon Web Services, great speakers, and some awesome prizes provided by our sponsors.  Developers, teachers, and students are heavily encouraged to meet new people, scout for teammates, and collaborate to help improve education.

We Supply: Quick presentations and code samples that help to bootstrap your hacking, food to keep you going, and caffeine to keep you awake. Along with technical senseis to assist you in building faster, smarter, and with new tools.

You Bring: Your laptop, skills & ideas. Come with a collaborative, team focused mindset and/or team up in advance on Twitter/Facebook/Google+ via the #atthack hashtag. Whether you are a backend person and code in Ruby/PHP/.NET or are a designer and only work with Illustrator, you are invited to attend this event. Every group needs a good balance of talent and your development skills are needed!

Event Schedule.  The following is a list of the weekends agenda:

  • 6PM - Friday Evening - Kickoff event with dinner, networking, and developer dating which leads into idea pitches and team formation.
  • 10AM - Saturday Morning -  The fun continues with an all day hackathon. Work with the teams that you formed on Friday night to produce the app spec’d out the night before. Senseis will be available throughout the entire event to help you code up your solution. App submissions will be accepted throughout the day with a deadline of 7PM.
  • 7PM - Saturday Evening - Promptly at 7PM, teams will begin pitching their ventures. Pitches are limited to three (3) minutes per team.

Prizes. The following prizes, provided by generous sponsors (Pearson, Github, and Sierra Wireless), are geared towards accelerating you towards successfully completing your app and improving our education system:

  • Best Overall Education App 
    • 1st Place 
      • $500 in Gift Cards for the team
      • $5,000 donated from AT&T to the teams choice of non-profit organizations* 
      • One (1) year of the Small service from Github for each team member
    • 2nd Place 
      • $300 in Gift Cards for the team 
      • $3,000 donated from AT&T to the teams choice of non-profit organizations* 
      • One (1) year of the Micro service from Github for each team member
    • 3rd Place
      • $200 in Gift Cards for the team 
      • $1,000 donated from AT&T to the teams choice of non-profit organizations* 
      • Six (6) months of Micro service from Github for each team member
  • Best App using AT&T APIs (Click for more info)
    • Entire team seeded with 4G Elevate Devices and one (1) month of 1GB DataConnect Service (Max 5) [compliments of Sierra Wireless]
  • Best App using a Pearson API (Click for more info)
    • $250 in Giftcards for team to split
  • Geeks Without Bounds Prize - Help build out The Key. Our goal for this hackathon is a simple one: take a product that is already in existence at the prototype level and move it into a working alpha for teachers to use in their classrooms immediately.(Click for more info)
    •  prize TBA

 

*non-profit organizations must be selected from a provided list

Social Media.
  • Follow us @hackathonlive for live updates and photos from the event
  • Like us on Facebook! https://www.facebook.com/AttMobileAppHackathon
Legal. Please be sure to review the official contest rules below and look for important waivers required for minors to participate:

Hackathon Terms: http://db.tt/kyPS9ojR

Attendees under the age of 18 must provide a signed copy of the form found at the link below in order to participate:

Parental Waiver Form: http://db.tt/zB3pRU1f

 

Speakers

Alex Donn, a Senior Marketing Manager with the AT&T Developer Program, is based out of sunny Seattle! His passion is educating developers young and old about mobile application development best practices through events like hackathons that fuse the collective interests of multiple technology and business leaders.

 Jeff Whitfield, is the lead UI developer at Fossil, a global design, marketing and distribution company, along with being a web developer at Horizon Innovations. He specializes in many languages including PHP, CSS3, HTML5, JavaScript, jQuery, and jQuery Mobile. Since 2005, he has been contributing to an open-source content management framework called MODx.

Matt Baxter, is a UX developer and designer at projekt202. He specializes in mixing design with technology and is particularly sucessful in creating usable digital experiences through code as well as making sure that the experiences are beautiful and easy to use. He previously worked at Left Brain Media as a developer and is a graduate of the University of Texas, Dallas.

 

 Gregg Alpert, West Coast Developer Relations Manager at Pearson, is working to progress technology use in education in an effort to improve learning outcomes. Gregg is passionate about education reform, technology, and business and believes many of the major issues in education can be improved through innovative technologies. He has an MBA with a focus in entrepreneurship and finance.
 
Max Katz, Head of Community and Developer Relations for Tiggzi (http://tiggzi.com), a cloud-based HTML5, jQuery Mobile and PhoneGap mobile app builder. He loves trying out new and cool REST APIs in mobile apps. You can find out what Max is up to on his blog: mkblog.exadel.com and Twitter: @maxkatz. 
  
 

Senseis 

Jeff Linwood, is a mobile app developer with LeanMeanTech in Austin, Texas. Hes been the lead developer on several iPhone and iPad applications in the App Store, and is currently developing for both Android and iOS. Jeffs development background before mobile apps is in enterprise Java and Ruby. Don Archer, an Android mobile application architect at Verizon FiOS has one of the coolest (and most challenging) jobs on the planet. He gets to play with lots of cool toys and write code all day. What could be better? He is also a serial entrepreneur, cyclist, sushi lover, and lingerie industry kingpin. Seriously.
David Hahn, is the President of LevelTen Interactive, a Dallas Drupal web development and Internet Marketing agnecy. He started building database engines and network operating systems at Novell and continued into executive management at venture-backed startups. Kirk Ballou, serves as CEO/Chief Architect at Touch Titans. He leads a team of award winning designers and developers which support every major mobile platform. The worlds largest handset makers, carriers, CNN, Nat Geo, MTV and Red Bull turn to his team for Mobile UX and Design.

Travis Tidwell, is the Lead Developer at AllPlayers.com, an Open-Source-driven online group managment platform. He builds RESTful PHP backends with Drupal CMS and JavaScript web apps that consume them. He is also an Open Source advocate and has worked on some Open Source projects. He has done work with jQuery Mobile, Drupal, and PhoneGap as well. See more of his work on his GitHub. 

 Johnny Diggz Higgins is an entrepreneur, musician, filmmaker and founder of Geeks Without Bounds. In 1999 Diggz co-founded Voxeo and serves as Chief Evangelist for Voxeo Labs’ flagship cloud communications platform, Tropo and its community of over 250,000 developers. Diggz is also a professional dueling piano player and will perform at the slightest arm-twist. 
   
   

 

Sponsors

Media Sponsors

events.name: Ignite Chattanooga Hack Days
events.about:
In a world with universal, ultra high-speed networks, all our assumptions about the web can be reset. What kinds of apps can we build when data can travel as fast as it needs to and processing power is never a bottleneck? The GigCity is going to find out. 

Join Mozilla, US Ignite and a crew of forward-thinking technologists September 14-16th for a weekend of innovation, coding and fun. Leveraging the power of Chattanooga’s Gigabit network, we’ll spend two days prototyping the apps of the future. And well get a glimpse at the new experiences made possible by next-generation networks and our own ingenuity. 

If you plan, build or design for the web, we want you! This is not a spectator sport, so plan to get your hands dirty.

What will happen?

Hackanooga is a participatory event focused on making and doing. We want running code, not just cool concepts. Less yak, more hack. 

Over the course of two days we’ll code, collaborate and kick ass! We’ll eat pancake breakfasts, laugh over midnight marshmallows, and hack furiously into the wee hours. Hackanooga will provide you with meals, snacks, general merriment and even a place to nap over the course of the weekend, so you can focus on your team’s app.

At the end of the event, we’ll revel in the fruits of our collective handiwork and make plans to join forces again. Plus, prototypes created during the event could evolve into submissions to the Mozilla Ignite challenge, with $500,000 of seed money and mentorship available to help get the apps off the ground.

Up for the challenge?

Hack yes! What do I need to do?

Everyone is welcome, but space is limited, so sign-up early. If you’re interested in participating, please register by Tuesday, August 28, 2012.  (We’re also offering a limited number of travel scholarships for out-of-town hackers. If you’re seeking travel support, please complete the appropriate application fields when you register.)

Don’t worry if you don’t have a team or an app idea; we’ll pair you up with a team based on your interests. We’ve partnered with organizations around Chattanooga to uncover potential projects in the areas of strategic growth, distance education, library technology, clean energy, government transparency, healthcare and public safety. We have an abundance of ideas and expert resources, now we just need you.

Hackanooga Event Schedule

Friday, September 14th

6:00 - 7:00   Hackanooga Kick-off Dinner & Drinks
7:00 - 9:00   Project introductions & team formation

Saturday, September 15th

9:00 am - Pancake Breakfast @ Firehouse
10:00 am - Welcome to Hackanooga: Check-in, set-up team stations & hacking begins
12:30 pm - Lunch
3:30 pm - Afternoon update & tea time
6:30 pm - Evening update
7:00–9:00 - Dinner & Team Trivia
9:30 pm - Hacking continues (optional overnight)
12:00 am - Midnight Marshmallows
1:00 am - Hacking continues (snacks available all night)

Sunday, September 16th 

9:00 am - Breakfast
10:00 am - Morning update & hacking resumes
12:30 pm - Lunch
1:30 pm - Afternoon update
3:30 pm - Hacking concludes & tea time
4:00–6:00 - App Demos
6:30–9:00 - Dinner & After Party!

Questions, comments or concerns about Hackanooga? Please email kelly [at] easy-designs [dot] net.
For more, check out mozillaignite.org, thegigcity.com, and us-ignite.org. If you have questions about the scholarship, the Mozilla Ignite or US Ignite challenges, please email ignite [at] mozillafoundation [dot] org.

events.name: Digital Sizzle 6 - Hackathon
events.about:
Digital Sizzle 6 – Part 1

The ‘Art Meets Tech’ Hackathon


 

Digital Sizzle 6 will bring together around 100 hackers, digital artists and digital musicians to create something amazing over the space of 48 hours.

Using various data sources, APIs and anything else you feel like using, the hackers and artists will be tasked with ‘creating’ using data. The exciting part of this project is that there is no way of knowing what will come out of it!

Weve got some super high level dudes and dudesses who will be mentoring and advising over the weekend, and maybe even lending a helping hand on the projects.

So get your creative juices flowing and get involved in a weekend that could potentially give birth to some truly amazing works...

 

The Prize

The works that are generated over the weekend will be displayed at Digital Sizzle 6 – Part II, which will be held at the Whitechapel Gallery on the 26th September.  If this isn’t enough of a prize we have gone the extra mile and the overall winner of the Hackathon will have the opportunity to be selected for exhibition as part of the innovation and ideas showcase, mounted alongside the annual WIRED magazine conference on October 25th and 26th.


 

Logistics

You need to be available and able to get to central London on:

Friday 14th September from 7pm until 11pm

Saturday 15th September from 9am (ish) until Sunday 16th September 7pm.

Overnight stays can be accommodated on Saturday night only.  Please bring your own sleeping bag and towel (shower available).

The gallery show will be on the 26th September from 7pm - 11pm. 

 

For the hackers: 

Well, if youre the hackers and coders, we know that you need to be looked after in a certain way.  So, all food & drink will be taken care of, and we mean everything: coffee, beer, pizzas, snacks, soft drinks, cereal, et cetera. The mother-effing works!

Alongside that, were bringing in the best of the visualization & data music community. Twilio will be bringing their famously powerful but simple API, a friendly face to help developers get started and enough food and drink to fuel an army! BrandWatch will be giving you all the social media data APIs and mentors you can throw a stick at and Reactify - the experts when it comes to cool generative/reactive/interactive sound that can take influence from all sorts of interesting data - will be on hand to help the frustrated musicians amongst you turn any data streams into music! The choice is yours, all you have to do is show up and get creative! 

So bring your laptop, your favourite development stack, and well pair you up with some artistic talent who are skilled in this arena, to help guide, educate and in some cases, pair-program with you.  You can also bring any hardware that you might want to incorporate - Raspberry Pi, Arduino, second screens etc

We think that language such at MAX/MSP, Processing.js, python, ruby, would be great for the ease of use, but hell, if you wanna go PHP, C#, Fortran, R, on our asses, were not going to complain!

For the artists:

You’ll get all the same lovely food & drink, connectivity and support as your hacker team members, but where they bring the coding skills, you bring the creativity! Come along with your wildest dreams of visualisations, push the boundaries of what you know possible and use the expertise of the hackers to scratch your artistic itch in any way you like.

Provided data goes in and something comes out, anything is fair game: the medium is not set, use whatever you have to create something awesome:

Interactive installation? Fine.

Visual projection? No problem.

Aural interpretation of footfall data at the Olympics? Go for it. 

There will be mentors on hand to consult with and help guide the projects through the weekend, just in case anyone ventures too far into their own imagination (or anyone else’s) and can’t find the way back!

We dont know whats going to come out of the hackathon, all we know is that were super excited to be putting this event on and cannot wait to see what you all come up with - its going to be a real adventure!

events.name: m2Work Hackathon - EAST ASIA
events.about:
In order to bring mobile microwork ideas to life and help mobile entrepreneurs launch sustainable businesses, we’ll be hosting a global m2Work Hackathon in five countries on September 15-16, 2012. At the event, talented ideators will have the chance to connect with fellow developers and build prototypes with market appeal.

Visit the m2Work Hackathon’s official website here.

Earlier this year, infoDev and Nokia launched the m2Work Challenge, which yielded almost 1000 ideas on how to create jobs that people could do from many of the five billion active mobile phones in developing countries.

The next phase is to bring those ideas to life. Several challenge winners are deep in talks with national governments, angel investors, and fellow developers on how to improve and distribute their apps. To help the larger m2Work community turn their ideas into mobile microwork businesses, infoDev and its global partners are organizing the m2Work Hackathon in five sites across the world.

The m2Work Hackathon aims to:

  1. Shape promising idea submissions into mobile application prototypes;  

  2. Bolster other prototype mobile microwork applications that qualify for pre-incubation support at infoDev’s Mobile Application Labs (mLabs), and  

  3. Increase awareness for the job-creating potential of mobile microwork in developing countries.

The local chapters of the event will be hosted by mLab East Africa (Kenya), mLab Southern Africa (South Africa), mLab ECA (Armenia), mLab East Asia (Vietnam), and mHub Nepal.

To learn more about mobile microwork or get involved in the Hackathon, contact us at info@m2workhackathon.org and follow us on Twitter and Facebook.

events.name: Hackons la corruption
events.about:
Les états financiers de l’évènement seront dévoilés après l’évènement en format ouvert. Tout surplus d’argent sera remis à des projets importants qui aideront à lutter contre la corruption au Québec.

Le succès de cet événement repose grandement sur les revenus qui seront tirés de la vente de billets. En vous procurant un billet à 50, 100 ou 200 dollars, vous contribuerez véritablement à la lutte contre la corruption au Québec.

Hackons la corruption ensemble

Chaque année au Québec nous dépensons plus de 1 milliard de dollars dans des projets d’infrastructure pour améliorer la qualité de vie de tous les Québécois et Québécoises. Ces projets, qu’il s’agisse de rénovation ou de construction, d’infrastructures physiques ou encore d’infrastructures technologiques font malheureusement encore l’objet d’abus qui mènent à des dépenses excessives et des débordement budgétaires évitables.

Avec un gouvernement ouvert et transparent, qui met à la disposition de ses citoyens les appels d’offres passés ainsi que les contrats alloués aux entreprises, il devient possible d’aller plus loin et de prêter main forte à l’industrie et aux gouvernements pour aider notre société à limiter les abus et la corruption dont nous sommes parfois collectivement victimes.

Les 15 et 16 septembre 2012, des centaines de citoyens se rassembleront pour créer des
outils qui aideront à prévenir la collusion et la corruption au Québec. Dans une ambiance collaborative et non-partisane nous travaillerons à tirer parti des technologies de l’information et des données gouvernementales disponibles pour aider nos gouvernements et concitoyens à veiller à la meilleure utilisation des fonds publics en prévenant les pertes résultant d’abus. C’est en utilisant des données provinciales, municipales et fédérales que les citoyens pourront développer des solutions qui contribueront à prévenir la corruption. 

Les ensembles de données seront mises à disposition des participants en juillet 2012.

Nous espérons que les projets réalisés lors du Hackathon aideront le Québec à prévenir la corruption et améliorer notre societé québécoise. 

Pour commanditer lévènement, sil vous plait nous contacter au info@quebecouver.org

Nos commanditaires

events.name: AT&T Mobile App Hackathon - It Can Wait Finals! w/30k+ in prizes
events.about:
Interested in seeing innovative solutions to a real problem?  Come watch the finalist from our It Can Wait hackathon present their final applications!

This is the conclusion of a truly unique AT&T Mobile App Hackathon, an event produced by the AT&T Developer Program, focused on our It Can Wait dont text and drive campaign. On September 8th we selected five (5) finalist who were given an extra ten (10) days to build out their applications. On September 18th, those five (5) teams will be given a chance to present their final products to a panel of judges with the winner walking away $20,000 richer! Come enjoy a night of networking, drinks, and innovative tech solutions!

Texting while driving is a common and dangerous habit.  According to a recent AT&T Wireless survey 75% of teenagers consider it common for their friends to text while driving. Over 100,000 automobile accidents a year involve a driver texting and drivers that do text while driving are 23x more likely to be in an accident. Please join us at this hackathon to make the road a safer place and visit itcanwait.org to take the pledge.

Event Schedule.  The following is a list of the weekends agenda:

  • 6PM - Kickoff event with drinks, networking, and developer dating which leads into idea pitches and team formation.
  • 7PM - The fun continues as the five (5) finalist present their polished applications to our judging panel.
  • 8PM - Winners are announced!

Prizes. The following prizes are experiential and geared towards accelerating you towards a successful business as well as expanding your network and industry knowledge:

  • Best Hackathon Dont Text While Driving App (Learn More) - Top five teams  chosen on site on September 8th were given 10 days to build out and polish their application.  They will be presenting their final apps where the overall winners will be announced.
    • 1st Place
      • $20,000 in cash for the team to split
    • 2nd Place 
      • $7,000 in cash for the team to split
    • 3rd Place
      • $3,000 in cash for the team to split

 

Judging Criteria. Apps will be judged based on the criteria below and weighted accordingly.  

  • Ability of application to address the current problem of texting while driving
  • Ability to clearly articulate what your app does
  • Originality of idea
  • Difficulty of technical implementation (e.g. languages, tools, and APIs used)
Social Media. 
  • Follow us @hackathonlive for live updates and photos from the event
  • Like us on Facebook! https://www.facebook.com/AttMobileAppHackathon
Legal. Please be sure to review the official contest rules below and look for important waivers required for minors to participate:

events.name: The Opa Hackathon in San Francisco
events.about:
Hi everyone,

I'm very happy to tell you that the third Opa Hackathon will be in San Francisco, on September, 18th (Tuesday).

You are all very welcome to this event. Come after work to have fun and share dinner and drinks with other Opa Developers. It'll be a great opportunity to share thoughts about Opa and learn about this new ultimate framework for JavaScript. If you have any suggestion to improve Opa or if you have found any bug or error, it will also be a way to report them. And of course, if you just want to discover Opa, we'll be happy to show you! 


You can also visit our meetup group: http://www.meetup.com/The-Opa-Hackathons-in-the-Bay-Area/ 
If you haven't Opa on your computer yet, please download it here before coming:
http://opalang.org/get.xmlt. 


By the way, for all of you who are interested in Opa, you can take part in the Opa Developer Challenge with great prizes (worth more than $15,000):
http://opalang.org/challenge/home.xmlt and http://www.cloudspokes.com/challenges/1562


What is Opa?

JavaScript is becoming the universal language, with technologies such as Node.js and MongoDB. Entire, modern applications can now run JavaScript from end-to-end. JavaScript and Node.js are outstanding but there is still a major problem to solve: Node.js hangs and faces bugs + safety issues.
The solution is Opa, the ultimate enterprise framework for JavaScript. Thanks to its code verification and its code automation, create a web app is simpler, safer, more secure and it considerably reduces the risks of XSS attacks or SQL injections for instance. Your code is much shorter, much better and much safer.

More information about Opa: http://opalang.org/

events.name: European WebKit Hackathon Bucharest 2012
events.about:
About
Adobe is organizing an European WebKit Hackathon in Bucharest during autumn 2012. We welcome WebKit contributors to join us in September for a 3-day WebKit hacking event in Bucharest.

Goals
Our intention is to gather WebKit contributors from Europe, know each other better, share WebKit expertise and help WebKit move forward by fixing bugs, writing tests and develop HTML5 prototypes based on WebKit.
Adobe will participate with its WebKit team, which includes, among others, Dirk Schulze(krit, WebKit reviewer), Alexandru Chiculita (achicu, WebKit committer) and Mihnea Ovidenie (mihnea, WebKit committer).

Cost
Participation is free of charge. Adobe will host the event in its Bucharest office. Adobe will not pay for the transport or for the hotel of the WebKit contributors attending the event. Lunch will be provided during the hackathon.

Suggested Hotels
West Plaza Hotel (***),  near the Adobe office
Intercontinental Hotel (****), downtown Bucharest
Novotel (****), downtown Bucharest

Contact: mihnea@adobe.com

Possible items for hackathon:

  • SVG: make supporting code more integrated/shared with generic CSS/HTML code
  • Fix WebKit bugs in several areas of interest: background and borders, css images, css flex box, css regions
  • Fix WebInspector bugs
  • Fix IE Test center tests that are failing in WebKit
  • Improve testing infrastructure

events.name: TranspoCamp Montréal 2012
events.about:
Le TranspoCamp Montréal 2012 est un forum ouvert (unconference) dune journée qui rassemble des professionnels des transports, des urbanistes, des développeurs, des citoyens et toute personne intéressée par les nouvelles technologies appliquées au domaine du transport urbain.

Plusieurs sessions organisées par vous, les participants, se dérouleront en parallèle durant toute la journée. Consultez la liste des participants pour connaître leurs intérêts et faire connaître les vôtres.

Linscription est entièrement gratuite.

Le lieu exact du TranspoCamp sera dévoilé par lAgence métropolitaine de transport (AMT) le 6 septembre prochain au cours dune conférence de presse pour lancer la journée En ville sans ma voiture.

Cette année, le TranspoCamp est jumelé avec le Hackathon Hack ta ville qui se tiendra à lU. McGill le samedi 8 septembre. Les développeurs du Hackathon viendront ensuite présenter leurs réalisations au TranspoCamp Montréal 2012. 

Le Living Lab de Montréal, qui organise lévénement dans le cadre de la journée En ville sans ma voiture, est un organisme à but non lucratif dont la mission est de faciliter les regroupements entre citoyens, chercheurs, administrateurs et entrepreneurs pour mieux comprendre et utiliser les technologies dans la ville daujourdhui.

De quoi allons-nous discuter ensemble ?

Le domaine des transports est devenu le sujet de lheure à Montréal. Mais au-delà des problèmes, il y a sûrement des solutions durables que vous êtes capable dimaginer. Vous vous demandez seulement sil y a des gens comme vous prêts à collaborer pour commencer à les mettre en application. Le TranspoCamp Montréal 2012 est lendroit où vous pouvez apporter votre contribution et faire connaître votre point de vue.

Le TranspoCampMTL abordera plusieurs des sujets suivants :

  • Cocktail Transport
  • Multimodalité
  • Bilan de CO2 personnel
  • Modes de repérage dans la ville
  • Tramway - Bixi
  • Optimiser ses déplacements
  • Nouvelle citoyenneté
  • Télétravail, lieux de communication
  • Responsabilité et implication
  • Économie sociale
  • Proximité des services

Et dautres encore que vous pouvez proposer vous-même en participant à cette journée !

Quelques jours avant le TranspoCamp Montréal 2012, consultez la liste des participants inscrits (ici en bas de la page) et les sujets dateliers qui pourraient vous intéresser.

Les technologies mobiles ont sans aucun doute le pouvoir de transformer notre manière dhabiter lespace urbain, mais elles peuvent aussi créer des silos dinformation si elles ne sont pas intégrées à la vie publique des citoyens de manière transparente, responsable et socialement équitable.

Nous savons que vous êtes nombreux à vouloir partager de linformation pour offrir des services de transport mieux adaptés aux besoins des citoyens, réduire les coûts dexploitation des systèmes, répondre aux exigences du développement durable et ouvrir le chemin aux inititiatives qui vont dans le même sens.

Alors, on vous attend !

Comment ça fonctionne, un Forum Ouvert ?

Pour ceux qui ne connaissent pas, ce nest pas une conférence traditionnelle avec panélistes et invités. Cest vous qui allez déterminer les sujets au programme !

Tout le monde est bienvenu et vous pouvez proposer de tenir une session au cours de la première heure de lévénement. Les sujets de session sont affichés sur un grand tableau qui sert à allouer lespace dans la grille horaire de la journée. Les participants qui le veulent ajoutent ensuite leur nom sur le tableau et quand tout le monde est prêt, les sessions peuvent commencer.

Si vous trouvez que vous ne participez pas beaucoup à une session ou que ce nétait pas ce que vous pensiez, vous pouvez allez voir une autre session à nimporte quel moment. Levez-vous discrètement et votez avec vos pieds ! Cest votre conférence, après tout !

 

P.S. : Grâce à vous, le TranspoCamp Montréal 2011 sest mérité le Prix Coup de coeur du jury dhonneur lors de la 5e édition des Grands prix d’excellence en transport de lAssociation québécoise du transport et des routes (AQTR).

Merci de tout coeur <3

events.name: Opscode Chef Hack Day - Austin (hosted by Gazzang)
events.about:
Join us in the offices of Gazzang, for a day of hacking Chef, eating good food and connecting with folks from the Austin DevOps community. The goal of this event is to bring together people in the area working on Chef projects into direct contact with the local Chef community for help in real time. There will be spontaneous mini-tutorials and brain-storming sessions on how to solve common Chef problems as they come up. There will also be opportunities to get hands-on guidance from Gazzang and Opscode for working with Chef, zNcrypt and zTrustee. Having a group of people + some real world tasks/problem + the Opscode team in the room will allow for some intensive learning.

Hope to see you there!

events.name: World Robotic Sailing Championships 2012
events.about:
The World Robotic Sailing Championships are a series of races and challenges designed for autonomous sailing robots. These are sailing boats up to 4 metres long, which can sail themselves using an onboard computer.

One day these boats might be used for:

  • Sail across oceans on their own.
  • Measure water quality, such as water temperature, salinitiy or look for pollution. This data is useful for climate change and oceanography researchers.
  • Listen for the noises from marine life such as wales or dolphins.
  • Cleanup oil spills or other pollution from the water.
  • Use sonar to make images of the seabed. This lets us measure the water depth, look for wrecks or see how sand banks are moving.
  • Monitoring the coastline for suspicious boats, such as smugglers, pirates or illegal immigrants.

The Championships are designed to get more people building these boats and to show what they can do. The Championships last one week and have a series of races, a test of the boats remote sensing and their collision avoidance capabilities.

Some teams are also going to try and build new boats from spare parts during the championships in a Hack-a-thon style event.

We are inviting members of the public to the last day of the championships, when well have the collision avoidance event, a short race for all boats and another race for the boats built during the week. Event organisers will be on hand to answer any questions you might have.

More information about the event can be found on our webpage.

Note that many Satnavs and google maps do not put the venue in the right place using the postcode. Instead use the co-ordinates 51.4480 degrees North, 3.1751 degrees West or see our map.

events.name: PayPal Hackathon
events.about:
Prizes
First place receives $5,000!
Second Place receives $2,500!
Third place receives $1,000!

Additionally, participants nominated by their fellow participants in the following categories will recieve an iPad for:

Most Helpful
Most Entertaining
Most Ambitious

The Schedule
September 21, 4:00pm. The doors open for the 2012 Hackathon.
September 21, 5:00pm. Keynote, rules, kickoff.
September 21, 5:30pm. The event officially begins.
September 21, 7:00pm. Dinner is available for all participants.
September 22, 12:00am. Late-night food available for the participants.
September 22, 8:00am. Breakfast becomes available.
September 22, 12:00pm. Lunch becomes available.
September 22, 5:00pm. The event officially closes, judging begins, and dinner is available.
September 22, 7:00pm. Prizes are awarded for the top three teams, and top 3 participants.
September 22, 7:30pm. The Social begins.
September 22, 11:00pm. Doors close.

Judging Criteria
Each entry will be given three minutes to demo their finished entry. The following criteria are the basis of what the judges will be using to determine the winner. No powerpoint slides, please; we just want to see your awesome creation.

Integration: how well does the submission use PayPals unique capabilities?
Utility: how useful is the submission to the end user?
User Experience: how easy is the submission to use?
Innovation: how unique and innovative is the submission? 

Rules

  • The development tools, frameworks and application focus are entirely up to the participants but they must use PayPal in some way.
  • Submission cannot be under development prior to the start of the hackathon at 5:30pm on September 21.
  • Participants are expected to bring all tools and software necessary to build their entry. Organizers will provide food, caffeine, Internet access, and power strips, but you might want to bring your own as well.
  • Employees, contractors, and partners of PayPal are welcome to participate in the hackathon, but are not eligible to receive prizes.
  • To participate, submissions must be received by 5:00pm on September 22. Participants are strongly encouraged to pre-register to assure enough food and seating, but participants may join on the contest at any time prior to the submission deadline.
  • Participants may work by themselves or in a team.
  • Rules are subject to change at the discretion of PayPal.

If you have questions, please reach out to us here or at our LinkedIn discussion group or email us at hackathon@paypal.com.
