events.name: Election Hackathon - Organized by The Washington Post
events.about:
What is the Election Hackathon?

The Election Hackathon is a chance for developers to show off their skills and shed light on the upcoming Presidential Elections. The hackathon will take place from Saturday, October 6th to Sunday October 7th. We are looking for innovative, useful and relevant apps that leverage data from The Washington Post, NPR, and Sunlight Labs APIs, as well as any other additional sources you think may be relevant. At the end of the hackathon, the developers who create the best, most inspiring apps will receive prizes in various categories.

Who

Developers who are interested in the 2012 Presidential Elections and who will be in the Washington D.C. area on October 6th and 7th. Register now, space is limited.

When & Where

October 6th and 7th, 2012, The Washington Post, 1150 15th St. NW, Washington D.C.

Why

To shed new light on the Presidential Election in the form of innovative and creative apps. Also to have fun. Also there will be prizes for the best apps.

Schedule

Saturday, October 6th, 2012

  • 8:00 AM Registration opens, coffee, bagels, get crazy
  • 11:00 AM Hackathon begins, and API demos, workshops and office hours throughout the day
  • 1:00 PM - 2:00 PM Lunch
  • 6:00 PM Dinner
  • 7:00 PM – TBA More Building

Sunday, October 7th, 2012

  • 9:00 AM Breakfast
  • 12:00 PM Submission Deadline
  • 1:00 PM Lunch - Judges select finalists to show demos
  • 3:00 PM Demos begin
  • 4:30 PM Winners announced
  • 5:00 PM Hackathon Ends

APIs

You can get access to these APIs right now and start learning, exploring and coming up with ideas! Make sure you sign up prior to the hackathon.

  • The Washington Post

  • NPR

  • Sunlight Labs

Other Resources

  • Govtrack
  • Data.Gov
  • U.S. Census
  • USASpending.gov
  • Recovery.gov

 

Find out more here.

events.name: TAPPED NFC Hackathon
events.about:
TAPPED: The NFC Accelerator

Make your idea into a Near Field Communications reality! How about the chance to connect with some of the most influential people in mobile and NFC? How about the chance to win some major cash? Tap into that!

Visit our website at tappednfc.com for additional details, developer guide and NFC resources.

What it is

TAPPED: The NFC Accelerator is a collection of three free events, with one goal: drive innovation of novel NFC mobile app prototypes built on solid business plans.

Apps will need to focus on:

  • Social – Enhance, alter, and establish social interactions.
  • Gaming – Enrich games and possibly take them beyond the digital world and into the physical realm.
  • Internet of things – build bridges between the Android device and real-world objects. Leverage tools ranging from NFC tags, NFC-enabled appliances, or dedicated NFC-enabled devices built on Arduino and the Raspberry Pi minimal computing platforms.

Your app will need to run on Android, the leading smartphone platform for NFC development. Loaner devices will be available.,

Visual designers will be on hand to help with app user experience and graphics. You will also get a presentation template so you don’t need to worry about making your presentation to the judges look cool (you can still roll your own).

What you need

Naturally, bring your own computer. Save some time by installing the Android development tools in advance. We will give you a set of NFC gear (courtesy of Cellotape) – tags, wristbands, stickers, cards. We will also lend you one (or two) NFC phones if you don’t have one. It’s a Samsung Galaxy Nexus running Android 4.x. We’ll take care of food and drinks, too.

While we encourage you to take a very good look at our development guide, sample project and app code, expert Android and NFC developers will be on hand. We will also have a back-end developer on hand to assist with server-side matters (as well as folks from Kinvey, a nifty back-end as a service cloud offering we love).

Schedule

TAPPED tour events take place over the weekend and run from 10:30 am on Saturday through 6:30 pm Sunday. Coding will run from 11:30am Saturday through 3:00pm Sunday.

  • Saturday
    • 9:30 am – 10:30 am Registration
    • 10:30 am – 11:00 am Opening remarks
    • 11:00 am – 12:30 pm
      • Development begins
      • Breakout sessions about Android NFC development
      • Q&A with some of our API provider partners
    • 10:00 pm - You can continue coding but we have to leave the space
  • Sunday
    • 8:00 am - Back at General Assembly (breakfast)
    • 1:30 pm – 3:00 pm Judging presentation prep
    • 3:00 pm Coding ends
    • 3:00 pm – 4:30 pm Presentations to the judges
    • 4:30 pm – 5:00 pm Judges finalize decisions
    • 5:00 pm – 6:30 pm Award ceremony, drinks, finger foods

Very Important Note

Before we go any further we want to assure you: your code, ideas, thoughts remain YOUR OWN or property (or your team’s). You keep your code wherever you want and we will take it away from you.

Prizes and Rules

Winner Selection and Prizes

  • One winner will be selected for each one of the themes – Gaming, Social, Internet of things
  • Each of the three winners will then be ranked with each other to produce an overall winner, second place and a third place winner.
  • Prizes
    • First Place: $3000 plus $1000 for 3 months of hosting on Rackspace
    • Second Place: $2000 plus $500 for 3 months of hosting on Rackspace
    • Third Place: $1000 plus $250 for 3 months of hosting on Rackspace
  • Prizes will be distributed as American Express gift cards.

Event winners from all three events will be invited to submit their work to Verizon’s NFC challenge, part of Verizon’s participation in this year’s premier NFC industry event, WIMA. The Verizon NFC Challenge winners will be invited to join Verizon in San Francisco, CA, November 26-27, 2012 to present their apps.

Gift Cards

Gift cards will be sent to users following the event. That way if you have a team of three you won’t need to find a way to split a $3,000 gift card.

TAPPED Rules

  1. All coding and development must take place during the event and on event premises.
  2. Competition entries can be from single developers or from teams of 2-4 developers.
  3. Competition entries will be presented and must run on a device provided at the event.
  4. Event participants must be willing to show their code to event staff and able to demonstrate it compiles in an Android development environment.
  5. All code developed during the event will remain the sole property of its developers.
    Competition entries must be related to one of the three themes of the events
    • Gaming
    • Social
    • Internet of Things
  6. Apps must run on an Android device and use NFC in their operation.
  7. Apps developed during the event will not be secret or confidential. We will use the apps in our publicity materials.
  8. Winners will provide the Event organizers with a working Android app apk file for demonstration purposes in publicity functions. We will not distribute the app but want to have the ability to remember what you created.

Judging Guidelines

  1. Working App – the app must be working and demonstrated on the device during the presentation (25%)
  2. NFC Use – The app must use NFC as a key element in its functionality. (25%)
  3. Relevance to the the application theme – The app must relate to one of the following: social, gaming or Internet of things. An app can cross boundaries but cannot be disconnected from the themes. (15%)
  4. Originality – the app bringing something novel to life? (15%)
  5. Business prospects – Is the app built with a business model in mind? (10%)
  6. Look and feel – How well does the app look and work? (10%)

Our Sponsors

events.name: Transparency Works #2: Hacks for Transparency
events.about:
WHAT IT IS ALL ABOUT?

„Transparency Works“ is back with the Hacks for Transparency hackathon! Have you ever heard of „Ushahidi“, „OpenCongress“ or „FixMyStreet“? Do you think you can create something of a kind and would like to win a 1000 EUR prize to help you implement your idea? Then register at http://transparencyworks.lt/register/ and read further.

WHEN/WHERE?

Transparency International together with the Random Hacks of Kindness is organizing a global hackathon ‚Hacks for Transparency‘ which will take place in six countries around the globe on 6 – 7 October. If you are ready to spend 48 hours developing new e-transparency ideas and tools, join us in Vilnius!
Location: Contemporary Arts Centre, Vokiečių str. 2.

WHY?

The aim of this event is to promote, develop and integrate innovative and sustainable ICT solutions to curb on bureaucracy, achieve greater accountability and make the fight against corruption more effective! Therefore we invite anti-corruption activists and technology experts to gather in Vilnius for 48 hours and work together in creating innovative solutions that can change the world!

HOW CAN YOU MAKE THIS HAPPEN?

There are two ways:
• Propose an idea – submit a short problem statement explaining how your idea can contribute to the fight against corruption and promote greater transparency. You can submit your ideas to karolis@transparency.lt;
• Or get your team together, spend 48 hours creating innovative solutions to promote transparency and win 1000 EUR!

events.about:
A community meeting followed by 2 day hack event. The BRISSkit community meeting will showcase and demo the Brisskit open source biomedical research data management cloud hosted applications alongside presentations from national stakeholders and pilot groups working with BRISSkit applications. The Health Research hackday provides the opportunity for the UK community of medical researchers, informatics professionals and developers to develop solutions to health research data management challenges.

Do please join https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/healthresearchhack in the lead up to the event to help decide hackday challenge themes. The aim is to deliver proofs of concept to solve clinical research data management challenges using open source software, but not limited to the Brisskit research data management applications: CiviCRM - a patient recruitment and contact management application Onyx - a clinical data capture application i2b2 - a clinical data warehousing query and cohort generation tool catissue - a tissue asset management application openesb - an web service framework and integration platform All running in VMware and made avaiable over WIFI internet. Registration for the event is free and arrangements will be made for accommodation in nearby hotels, subject to availability

Proposed agenda :

  • Day 1 : 9:00-14:00 Brisskit Community Programme - content provided by Brisskit Community partners
  • Day 1: 19:30 – Dinner
  • Day 2 : 9.00 to 12:30 Short Presentations from project proposing to use or integrate with Brisskit toolset
  • Day 2 : 12:30 – Lunch
  • Day 2 : 13:00 – 13:30 Organisaiton into Hackday projects
  • Day 2 : 13:30 – 19:00 Project planning and delivery
  • Day 2: 19:30 – Dinner
  • Day 3 : 8:00 to 15:00 – Hacking Continued
  • Day 3 : 12:30 – Lunch
  • Day 3: 14:00 – submission of short project presentations
  • Day 3: 15:00- 16:30 – Presentation of Project Progress and Outcomes
  • Day 3: 17:00 – Announcement of Winners and Award of Prizes

We are looking to attract both clinical researchers and as many clinical research geeks as it is possible to accommodate, so this invitation is also extended to the Brisskit open source developer community.

We will organise a GoogleGroup and a Twitter feed so that clinical research challenges can be shared and discussed online well before the event itself. All hackday project ideas will be logged onto the Brisskit wiki before the event.
Accomodation arrangements and options for overnight stays to be annouced.

See http://www.brisskit.le.ac.uk/events/forthcoming for further details.

events.name: Behance Open House - Brooklyn Beta

Come visit the Behance office for breakfast & a chance to tour our space and chat with our team. 

Part of the Brooklyn Beta Conferences Beyond Beta

We want you to come to Brooklyn this October, even if you didn’t get a ticket to Brooklyn Beta. To help persuade you, we’re putting together a week (including the weekend) full of events you can pick and choose from, including talks, hackathons, open houses,meetups, eating, drinking, knitting, and more.

With your help, this could be the first year of a new kind of Brooklyn Beta. We’re calling it Beyond Beta, and we really hope you’ll join us.

About Behance

Behance is a rapidly-growing technology company based in New York City. Our talented team of developers and designers work to leverage the latest technologies to creative revolutionary products that empower creative professionals.   Millions of visitors, enthusiasts, and creative professionals from across industries - and around the world - use Behance to connect and showcase their creations.

events.name: SMART DevNet Presents UNITY GAME JAM: Benilde
events.about:
UNITY GAME JAM: Benilde

The First SMART DevNet 48H Unity Game Jam

SMART DevNet proudly presents Unity Game Jam: Benilde – the first live Game Jam in Metro Manila in partnership with DLS-CSB and UNITY.  The event will be a 48-hour game development hackathon and participants can spend the night at DLS-CSB beginning at 7PM on Thursday, October 11th and finishing at 7PM on Saturday, October 13th. 

Unity will be providing all participants with access to an extended trial of Unity Pro with iOS Pro and Android Pro add-ons and the team license for the Game Jam.

The themes and rules will be announced at the beginning of the jam itself. However, the event will be focusing on learning.   Hence, participants will be provided with elements they can use and there will be several mentors present from CSB, Unity, and local game companies to guide and assist. 

With experienced game developers and Unity experts as mentors, this will be a truly amazing opportunity to try your hand at game development for the first time, explore and try Unity, or experiment with a new feature or a new game!

You may join as individuals working on your own or join together as a team with a maximum of four participants each team.  Amazing prizes await the winners of the Game Jam!

This is on a first come first served basis, so please make sure to register now!

events.about:
For all event details, visit bocaraton.startupweekend.org

Thanks!

Startup Weekend Crew

 

Refund Policy:  No refunds will be granted within 7 days of the event if food and drink have already been ordered. Apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

About Startup Weekend: Startup Weekends are 54-hour events designed to provide superior experiential education for technical and non-technical entrepreneurs.  Beginning with Friday night pitches and continuing through brainstorming, business plan development, and basic prototype creation, Startup Weekends culminate in Sunday night demos and presentations.  Participants create working startups during the event and are able to collaborate with like-minded individuals outside of their daily networks. All teams hear talks by industry leaders and receive valuable feedback from local entrepreneurials. The weekend is centered around action, innovation, and education.  Whether you are looking for feedback on a idea, a co-founder, specific skill sets, or a team to help you execute, Startup Weekends are the perfect environment in which to test your idea and take the first steps towards launching your own startup.

events.name: Eugene Startup Weekend 10/12
events.about:
Ever wondered what it takes to be an entrepreneur?

The professional and personal challenges, the high and lows, the failures and the success?

Startup Weekend is a global grassroots movement of active and empowered entrepreneurs who are learning the basics of founding startups and launching successful ventures. It is the largest community of passionate entrepreneurs with over 400 past events in 100 countries around the world in 2011.

The non-profit organization is headquartered in Seattle, Washington but Startup Weekend organizers and facilitators can be found in over 200 cities around the world. From Mongolia to South Africa to London to Brazil, people around the globe are coming together for weekend long workshops to pitch ideas, form teams, and start companies.

All Startup Weekend events follow the same basic model: anyone is welcome to pitch their startup idea and receive feedback from their peers. Teams organically form around the top ideas (as determined by popular vote) and then it’s a 54 hour frenzy of business model creation, coding, designing, and market validation. The weekends culminate with presentations in front of local entrepreneurial leaders with another opportunity for critical feedback.

Whether entrepreneurs found companies, find a cofounder, meet someone new, or learn a skill far outside their usual 9-to-5, everyone is guaranteed to leave the event better prepared to navigate the chaotic but fun world of startups. If you want to put yourself in the shoes of an entrepreneur, register now for the best weekend of your life!

events.name: Kalamazoo EDU Startup Weekend 10/12
events.about:
Ready to make amazing solutions for Education? Startup Weekend EDU is a 54-hour incubator where teachers, admins, IT professionals, and entrepreneurs take an idea to make Education better, and rapidly improve upon it throughout the weekend, in order to present a minimally viable product to a panel of judges by Sunday late afternoon. The goal is to make an application that improves or helps Education at any level (K-12 or higher ed).

Early bird registration is $75 until Sept 12, or when tickets are gone! Students get an even better discount with tickets for $49 anytime! If you are looking to hone your education or entrepreneurship skills, be mentored by amazing people, and have a blast doing it, Startup Weekend Kalamazoo EDU is for you!

About Startup Weekend: Startup Weekends are 54-hour events designed to provide superior experiential education for technical and non-technical entrepreneurs.  Beginning with Friday night pitches and continuing through brainstorming, business plan development, and basic prototype creation, Startup Weekends culminate in Sunday night demos and presentations.  Participants create working startups during the event and are able to collaborate with like-minded individuals outside of their daily networks. events.name: Tijuana Startup Weekend II
events.about:
Desarrolla Una Idea De Negocios!

Startup Weekend es un evento de 54 horas en un fin de semana entero donde se espera que 10 ideas se conviertan en empresas.

Click here for English

Los participantes se presentan el viernes para presentar sus ideas. Las mejores 10 se escogen, y forman equipos para trabajar en esos proyectos durante el fin de semana con la ayuda de mentores y facilitadores. Para el final del domingo, todos los equipos presentan su proyecto de negocios antes un jurado.

Y lo más importante, no necesitas traer una idea. Puedes unirte al equipo que encuentres más atractivo para trabajar en ese proyecto.

Startup Weekeend Tijuana se llevará a cabo esta vez en las instalaciones del BIT Center 

¿Quiénes pueden participar?

Desarrolladores y programadores de cualquier lenguaje, diseñadores gráficos, especialistas en UX,  mercadólogos, administradores de negocios, y emprendedores.

Debido a la alta demanda del evento te sugerimos que reserves tu lugar. Regístrate Ahora

Elige el tipo de boleto más adecuado para tu perfil ya sea desarrollo, diseño o negocios.
No necesitas equipo para inscribirte. Si tienes una idea el viernes la podrás exponer en caso contrario te podrás unir a alguien más quien su idea te haya parecido interesante.

¿Porqué participar en Startup Weekend?

  • Resuelve un problema práctico
  • Aprende cómo iniciar la creación de una empresa de tecnología
  • Construye tu red de contactos
  • Posibilidad de encontrar un co-fundador para tu idea de negocio
  • Conoce líderes y emprendedores experimentados

$300 MNX Pre-venta hasta el 1 de Octubre

$500 MNX después del 1 de Octubre

events.name: AT&T Aspire Mobile App Hackathon
events.about:
Have an idea for an app to improve attendance rates in New York City’s public schools?

This special edition of AT&T Mobile App Hackathon, an event produced by the AT&T Developer Program and AT&T Aspire in coordination with the Mayor’s Interagency Task Force on Truancy, Chronic Absenteeism & School Engagement, is focused on building the next great app to help combat truancy. Attendees are encouraged to come regardless of whether they already have a team to work with or nothing other than a great idea. Our hackathon will introduce you to the latest cutting edge tools to help deploy your own app with a website backend, fully hosted in the cloud.

The hackathon, October 12-13th, unites a unique community of civic leaders in order to power innovative ideas and the development of technology to help solve one of the city’s greatest challenges: chronic absenteeism. One in five New York City school students—over 200,000--missed a month or more of school last year. Research shows that students who are chronically absent are significantly less likely to graduate from high school. In fact, 3 out of 4 students who are chronically absent in the sixth grade never graduate from high school, while ninth grade attendance is a better predictor of graduation than eighth grade test scores. This is why Mayor Bloomberg established the Truancy Task Force in 2010, bringing together the Department of Education and multiple other city agencies in a coordinated and systematic effort to help these students succeed in school and beyond. Last year, students in the Task Force’s pilot schools gained nearly 12,000 days of school as compared to similar students.

The event will be a forum for some of the city’s great minds and innovators to unlock the potential of new media and technology to help our city’s nearly one million students get to school on time, every day.

Learn more at: http://www.nyc.gov/html/truancy/html/home/home.shtml

 

We Supply: Quick presentations and code samples that help to bootstrap your hacking, food to keep you going, and caffeine to keep you awake. Along with technical senseis to assist you in building faster, smarter, and with new tools.

You Bring: Your laptop, skills & ideas. Come with a collaborative, team focused mindset and/or team up in advance on Twitter/Facebook/Google+ via the #atthack hashtag. Whether you are a backend person and code in Ruby/PHP/.NET or are a designer and only work with Illustrator, you are invited to attend this event. Every group needs a good balance of talent and your development skills are needed!


Event Schedule. The following is a list of the weekends agenda:

  • 6PM - Friday Evening - Kickoff event with drinks, networking, and developer dating, which leads into idea pitches and team formation.
  • 7PM - Friday Evening - Inspiring and Technical Talks to get you ready to go.
  • 8PM - Friday Evening - Idea pitches and team formation
  • 12AM - Friday Night - End of the night, get some sleep and prepare for a full day of coding.
  • 10AM - Saturday Morning - The fun continues with an all day hackathon. Work with the teams that you formed on Friday night to produce the app spec’d out the night before. Senseis will be available throughout the entire event to help you code up your solution. App submissions will be accepted throughout the day with a deadline of 7PM.
  • 1PM - Saturday Afternoon - Lunch is served.
  • 7PM - Saturday Evening - Promptly at 7PM, teams will begin pitching their ventures. Pitches are limited to three (3) minutes per team.
  • 9PM - Saturday Night - Winners are announced!

Prizes. The following prizes are experiential and geared towards accelerating you towards a successful business as well as expanding your network and industry knowledge:

  • Best Overall Education App 
    • 1st Place 
      • $500 in Gift Cards for the team
      • $5,000 donated from AT&T to the teams choice of non-profit organizations* 
      • One (1) year of the Small service from Github for each team member
    • 2nd Place 
      • $300 in Gift Cards for the team 
      • $3,000 donated from AT&T to the teams choice of non-profit organizations* 
      • One (1) year of the Micro service from Github for each team member
    • 3rd Place
      • $200 in Gift Cards for the team 
      • $1,000 donated from AT&T to the teams choice of non-profit organizations* 
      • Six (6) months of Micro service from Github for each team member
  • Best App using AT&T APIs (Click for more info)
    • Entire team seeded with 4G Elevate Devices and one (1) month of 1GB DataConnect Service (Max 5) [compliments of Sierra Wireless]

 

 

Judging Criteria. Apps will be judged based on the criteria below and weighted accordingly.

  • 33% Weight - Ability to clearly articulate what your app does
  • 33% Weight - Originality of idea
  • 33% Weight - Use of Node.JS, Sencha, cloud9ide.com, Heroku, and other technologies
Social Media.
  • Follow us @hackathonlive for live updates and photos from the event
  • Like us on Facebook! https://www.facebook.com/AttMobileAppHackathon

 

Speakers

 
Alex Donn, a Senior Marketing Manager with the AT&T Developer Program, is based out of sunny Seattle! His passion is educating developers young and old about mobile application development best practices through events like hackathons that fuse the collective interests of multiple technology and business leaders.

Rachit Shukla, is the CEO of Two Toasters, an acclaimed mobile product development firm which designs and develops iOS andAndroid applications for established tech giants (Airbnb) to nationalbrands (Dick’s Sporting Goods, Lexus and Acura) to early stage,venture-backed startups (Yipit, Go Try It On, GateGuru. Previously, he led IdeaBahn, and graduated from the Wharton School of Business in University of Pennsylvania.
Tian He, the Co-Founder and VP of Technology of Gojee, is responsible for managing the development and execution of Gojees technology strategy. Under the New England Patriots as the Chief Chinese Correspondent, he helped develop the first Chinese Website for an NFL team. Tians interests are exploring and applying the power of data mining and social networks to consumers and businesses.  Max Katz, Head of Community and Developer Relations for Tiggzi (http://tiggzi.com), a cloud-based HTML5, jQuery Mobile and PhoneGap mobile app builder. He loves trying out new and cool REST APIs in mobile apps. You can find out what Max is up to on his blog: mkblog.exadel.com and Twitter: @maxkatz. 
   
   

Senseis

 

Vanessa is a data-focused technologist, avid coder for humanity, and founder of Developers for Good, techies who use their skills for social good. She co-founded Girl Develop It, which teaches software development at low cost. Vanessa advises for Ohours, which helps people build relationships through face-to-face conversations. She has also led Data & Analytics, from operations to business intelligence, for Paperless Post. Chrys Wu is both a hack (journalist) and a hacker (coder). When she’s not meeting, greeting and connecting journalists and technologists as a co-organizer of Hacks/Hackers, she is a user engagement strategist and a trustee of the Awesome Foundation NYC. She is also founder of NYC Ruby Women, a community of women who develop in Ruby. Talk with her on Twitter @MacDiva.
Domenic Demicola develops software and servers for the NOOK at Barnes and Nobles.com, all in JavaScript and HTML5. He enjoys taking part in Node.js open-source ecosystem and the New York tech scene, and runs the NYC HTML5 App Developers meetup. Find him on GitHub as domenic or Twitter as @domenic. David Ambrose serves as Senior Director, Mobile and Social at Travelzoo (NASDAQ: TZOO), the most trusted publisher of travel, entertainment and local deals. He leads the overall mobile and social product and commercialization strategy, helping subscribers discover high quality content at their fingertips as well as through their friends. 
   

Sponsors

events.name: friday night swap/meet: ArtHackMeetery
events.about:
In the Bay Area, we are bombarded with info about hackathons, unhackathons, meetups, and more for coders, entrepreneurs, designers, and more to collaborate and solve problems ... but where are the artists?

With ArtHackMeetery, we want to bring together civically minded artists to brainstorm and prototype ways to improve their urban landscape using their unique perspectives as artists.

 With so many artists working in this space, it seems prime time to get together, make stuff, and drink some beers. Teams of artists will work together to (quickly, like really quickly) brainstorm and prototype solutions to various civic issues specific to the Central Market neighborhood. After the teams present their concepts, there will be time for more drinks and conversation.

We hope you will join us!

Note that the program begins at 7:00pm. 

---

About swap/meet:

Chris Treggiari’s artistic practice strives to investigate how art can penetrate the public realm in a way that connects wide ranges of people and neighborhoods in a variety of communities. Chris’s public installations aim to turn the passive viewer into an active art maker. Some of his most recent projects, like the Mobile Arts Platform and War Gastronomy, have been shown at the 2012 Venice Architecture Biennale, the Berkeley Art Museum, the Torrance Art Museum, SOMArts and the Yerba Buena Center for the Arts.

Jessica Watson is a recent graduate of the MBA in Design Strategy program at CCA. Since she can remember, she has been interested in how the intersection of creativity and the city can help to solve urban issues. She has worked with the Mayor’s Office for Civic Innovation, fuseproject and Hot Studio. Additionally, she is a frequent contributor and/or collaborator to Chris Treggiari’s projects, including All Aboard as part of Southern Exposure’s Public Art/Urban Intervention Day.

events.name: Startup Weekend Neuchâtel - Octobre 2012
events.about:
La langue principal de lévènement sera Français mais vous pouvez également utiliser lAnglais pour présenter votre projet et travailler avec votre groupe. 

Le ticket comprend les boissons et la nourriture (7 repas) pendant le weekend. 

Des questions ? switzerland@startupweekend.org

Refund Policy:  No refunds will be granted within 7 days of the event if food and drink have already been ordered. Apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

About Startup Weekend: Startup Weekends are 54-hour events designed to provide superior experiential education for technical and non-technical entrepreneurs.  Beginning with Friday night pitches and continuing through brainstorming, business plan development, and basic prototype creation, Startup Weekends culminate in Sunday night demos and presentations.  Participants create working startups during the event and are able to collaborate with like-minded individuals outside of their daily networks. All teams hear talks by industry leaders and receive valuable feedback from local entrepreneurials. The weekend is centered around action, innovation, and education.  Whether you are looking for feedback on a idea, a co-founder, specific skill sets, or a team to help you execute, Startup Weekends are the perfect environment in which to test your idea and take the first steps towards launching your own startup.

events.name: Code Green Hackathon
events.about:
Seattle’s first cleantech hackathon will be the first hackathon to grace the Hub’s new space in Pioneer Square, aka the Center for Impact and Innovation. We’re applying technology to sustainability and building real products in the course of a weekend. We’re recruiting developers, designers, entrepreneurs, and cleantech thinkers to Code Green.

Kickoff on Friday, Oct. 12 with final pitches and awards on Sunday, Oct. 14.  

www.codegreenhackathon.com
@codegreenhack

events.name: HTML5 Hackathon presented by Onswipe
events.about:
Onswipe is holding an HTML5 hackathon in conjunction with the Empire.js conference in order to let developers create and show off what is possible on the web.  We’ll be hosting it at Onswipe HQ, providing food, beer, and a ton of different prizes.  We’ll also have a speaker and guest judges.

Best overall project
Ticket to Empire.js and an iPad 3
Best designed project
Ticket to Empire.js and an iPad 3
Best game focused project
iPad 3
Best data focused project
iPad 3

events.name: 48rails
events.about:
http://www.48rails.it

http://twitter.com/48rails

Vogliamo riunire i migliori dev Rails italiani per condividere la sfida del RailsRumble 2012, la coding competition internazionale più estrema (e divertente!) cui uno sviluppatore Rails possa ambire.  Per 48h sarai immerso in un ambiente senza distrazioni libero di ideare, sviluppare e pubblicare una webapp che la giuria internazionale del Rumble valuterà per design, completezza, originalità e utilità. Vieni e mostra a tutti il tuo valore!

Pensi si tratti di una semplice hackathon? Non sarebbe abbastanza geek. Il nostro timer sarà quello ufficiale del RailsRumble: 48 ore esatte durante le quali oltre che col tempo ti misurerai con team provenienti da tutto il mondo.  Scegli fino a 3 compagni, portate la vostra idea vincente. E preparatevi a fare tardi, molto tardi.  Il tempo ti sembra troppo poco? Niente di più sbagliato, dai unocchiata ai risultati delle scorse edizioni.

Due giorni da dedicare esclusivamente alla tua furia creativa. A *tutto* il resto pensiamo noi. All Inclusive.  Abbiamo riservato un edificio intero per il weekend, nel centro di Padova.  Ci saranno postazioni per lavorare, connettività, cibo, taniche di caffeina e… camere da letto per quando non potrete più rinviare un sonnellino. Per i più romantici virtuosi anche un giardino privato in cui passeggiare per riordinare le idee.

events.name: BlackBerry Jam Sessions #8 - Caracas, VZ
events.about:
Estos hackathons son algo así como los mejores hackathons en el mundo. ¿Por qué pensamos que son los mejores? Debido a que hemos escuchado lo que han pedido los desarrolladores y hemos hecho nuestro mejor esfuerzo para entregarlo.

Vamos a vuestras ciudades, traemos a los expertos, los alimentamos con pizza y Red Bull, los honramos con premios y recompensas, pero sobre todo, trabajamos para crear una relación con ustedes. Estamos ahí para ustedes, porque queremos que tengan éxito. Estos hackathons son más que una sesión de programación de 10 horas de largo. Serán su oportunidad de aprender, practicar y crear sus aplicaciones con el apoyo que nunca antes has experimentado.

Y no sólo eso, tu y tu aplicación serán parte de la competencia más prometedora, la Carrera de Descargas. Si usted participa en cualquiera de nuestros #BB10JamSessions, podrá enviar su solicitud a correr esta carrera para poder ganar increíbles premios, como dinero en efectivo, promociones en AppWorld, fondos de marketing y mucho más!

Más información aquí http://www.blackberryjamsessions.com
events.address: Avenida Libertador, Bello Campo, Chacao Piso 6

events.name: SoCraMOB Open Space 2012.4
events.about:
Do you care? Dieser Community-Day richtet sich an alle Software-Entwickler, die an ihre Arbeit einen gewissen Anspruch haben; an alle, die mehr als „nur“ ein lauffähiges Programm wollen.

We want to share! Wir möchten mit Euch diskutieren, was vernünftige Software-Entwicklung im 21. Jahrhundert bedeutet.

Software Craftsmanship ist eine von Programmiersprachen unabhängige Bewegung: ob Java, .NET, PHP oder Ruby, jeder ist herzlich willkommen. Wir würden uns freuen, viele Entwickler aus dem Großraum Münster, Osnabrück und Bielefeld an diesem Tag zu versammeln.

Was dich erwartet: Das Programm besteht aus Vorträgen, Diskussionen und natürlich: Live Hacking! Den Tag gestalten wir dynamisch nach dem Open Space Prinzip. Du kannst Dir einen Eindruck vom Open Space verschaffen, indem Du die Fotos vom Open Space am 14. April in Osnabrück anschaust.

Teil des Programms werden einführende Workshops zu Scrum, Kanban, Test-Driven Development und Domain-Driven Design sein.

Um neue Dinge gleich selbst auszuprobieren, solltest Du ein Notebook mit einsatzbereiter/-en Entwicklungsumgebung(en) Deiner Wahl mitbringen.


Programm

09:00    Kaffeestart
09:30    Einführung: OpenSpace
10:00    erste Session
11:00    zweite Session
12:00    dritte Session
13:00    Mittagspause (Pizzabuffet)
14:00    vierte Session
15:00    fünfte Session
16:00    Retrospektive des Tages
16:30    Ende

Im Anschluss besteht die Möglichkeit, den Tag gemeinsam bei einem kühlen Getränk am Hafen ausklingen zu lassen.

events.name: Hack Omaha
events.about:
Hack Omaha is a daylong sprint on October 13 where coders, designers and data junkies turn government information into something useful, revealing and beautiful.

The cost is low. The payoff huge. Come play with our data and make something incredible.

It will be held at the Presidents residence at Metropolitan Community College. You might want to refer to the map to track down the building.

events.name: Life is a Game: A Weekend Long Game Jame hosted by Class Dojo
events.about:
Life is a Game San Francisco – Oct 13th and 14th
Join us for a weekend long Game Jam hosted by Class Dojo. Youll meet awesome new people, test your production skills and hear from some of the most creative people in the game industry. 

How does this work?
Teams of 4-6 people will make games around a central theme announced Saturday morning. You can bring a team with you or form a team during pitches. Just bring your ideas and your own technology, well provide prizes, meals, snacks and drinks. There will be office space available if you want to crash onsite  or you can go home for the night, its up to you.
 
Judging
Submissions will be reviewed by panelists from Artillery Games, Red Hot Labs and Phoenix Guild. Prizes will be awarded for:

Best Overall
Best Use of Theme
The Oddball
 
Schedule
Saturday
9:00am - 9:30am: Check in
9:30am - 10:00am: Tech Talks and theme announced
10:00am - 11:30am: Pitches and team forming
11:00pm Doors are locked for the night

Rest of Saturday: Make games

Sunday
1:00pm - 2:00pm: Wrap up and prepare presentations
3:00pm - 3:45pm: Team presenations
4:15pm - 5:00pm: Winners announced!

events.name: Film Experience Hackathon
events.about:
ABOUT THE HACKATHON

Coders, hackers, filmmakers and visual artists will join forces to create new and innovative ideas demonstrating how technology can enrich the end-to-end movie experience. 

Over the course of the weekend, teams will self-assemble and create a proof-of-concept, prototype and/or fully working application that is focused on one or more of the following film experience areas:

  • Discover: Improve the experience of discovering, learning about, locating, and ticket-buying/streaming/downloading a movie.
  •  Watch: Enrich the movie-viewing experience itself through multimedia and interactive elements.
  •  Engage: Rethink the ways that viewers can share opinions, reviews, and have conversations—online and/or offline—about movies. 
Judges will select a 1st, 2nd, and 3rd place winner based on effectiveness, innovation, team pitch, and overall impression. Prizes will be awarded as follows: 
  • 1st Place: SXSW Film & Bond Strategy Prize Package
    The winning team will receive three (3) SXSW 2013 Film Badges ($650 value each) and be featured as a highlighted participant in the inaugural Film Startup Alley at the 2013 SXSW Film Conference & Festival. This new programming track brings together the startup, entrepreneur and investor communities under one umbrella at a prime location. Featuring various events, panels, and networking opportunities, the Film Startup Alley will be the hub of the entrepreneur and filmmaking communities at SXSW Film. The team will also receive $2500 Finishing Fund to refine and complete your Film Experience hack for SXSW and 12 Hours of marketing/pitch consulting from Bond Strategy & Influence.
  • 2nd Place: TBD
  • 3rd Place: TBD

The event will be held on October 13 & 14 at Meet at the Apartment, 101 Crosby Street, in Soho NYC. Registration details and additional information can be found at http://hackingfilm.com.

CONFIRMED JUDGES

  • Christina Warren (Mashable)
  • Marc Schiller (BOND Strategy and Influence)
  • Craig Hatkoff (Tribeca Enterprises)
  • Lance Weiler (Filmmaker)
  • Julia Kaganskiy (Creators Project) 
  • Jessica Brillhart (Google Creative Labs)

THANK YOU TO OUR SPONSORS

 EVENT DETAILS

Prizing - TBD 

Food & Beverage - Each participant will receive Seamless credits to use throughout the weekend for  lunch, and dinner. We will also provide breakfast, snacks, soft drinks, water, and coffee.

APIs - TBD

      Twitter - Follow @bondinfluence and #filmhacks for news, running commentary, and other chatter  related to the hackathon.

SCHEDULE

DAY 1 - OCT. 13, 2012

 9:00     Registration & Breakfast

10:00    Welcoming Remarks & Introductions

10:30    Guest Speaker

11:00    API Workshops

12:30    HACKING

 TBD      Office Hours with technical & design subject matter experts

6:30      Happy Hour  

DAY 2 - OCT. 14, 2012

9:00       HACKING begins

TBD       Office Hours with technical & design subject matter experts

4:30       END HACKING - All projects must be submitted to the hackathon wiki.

              Meet Open to Public 

5:00       Demo Presentations

6:30       Judges Decide Winners

6:45       Winners Announced 

7:00       Closing Remarks & Event End 

ABOUT OUR SPONSORS

Bond Strategy and Influence

Bond is a digital strategy and marketing agency, serving clients in the media and entertainment, financial services, hospitality and fashion industries. BOND blends the best of big agency creative effectiveness and combines it with the business results focus of top tier consulting firms all in a nimble, client focused package. Starting with the assumption that digital is at the core of every successful business strategy today, we are able to craft marketing, communications and business growth strategies that connect with customers. Our expertise is in optimizing the digital footprint of our clients by delivering strategies and results that drive our client’s business value and best of breed status.

Mashable

Mashable is a leading source for news, information & resources for the Connected Generation. Mashable reports on the importance of digital innovation and how it empowers and inspires people around the world. Mashables 20 million monthly unique visitors and 6 million social media followers have become one of the most engaged online news communities. Founded in 2005, Mashable is headquartered in New York City with an office in San Francisco.

Seamless 

Seamless is simply the easiest way to order food for delivery or takeout. Whatever you’re in the mood for, wherever you’re in the mood for it, you’ve got it. No menus, no phone calls, no repeating yourself. Were delivering food happiness to over 1.5 million users from over 10,500+ restaurants in 40 cities. We guarantee you the best food possible in the best way possible. Delivery or takeout, individual or corporation, were serious when we say, “your food is here.”

SXSW

The South by Southwest® (SXSW®) Conferences & Festivals (March 8-17, 2013) offer the unique convergence of original music, independent films, and emerging technologies. Fostering creative and professional growth alike, SXSW® is the premier destination for discovery.

events.name: Off the Rails hack day
events.about:
Loco2 and Bethnal Green Ventures have teamed up to host Off the Rails, a hack day for doing cool stuff with train data and APIs.

The hack day will be held at Campus London (near Old Street/Moorgate, London) on Saturday October 13th.

The day

Well follow a loose format, starting with an introduction to the datasets, code/APIs, and a selection of noteworthy existing applications (please bring your own to show off!).

Developers, designers and ideas people will then break into groups to get hacking. The results will be presented in the evening, all accompanied by free food and drinks

The data

2012 is an exciting year for rail data, with lots of datasets and APIs becoming available that could solve a lot of headaches for train travellers. The UK is leading the way, with Network Rail recently making realtime data available along with existing timetable datasets.

Elsewhere in Europe, the Dutch national rail company, NS, has released an easy-to-use, versatile API, and the Frenchand Germans are beginning to follow suit. And then there’s carbon-footprinting data to help to determine exactly how smug we can all feel for taking the train. There are plenty of ingredients for some exciting apps...

About YOU

We’re looking for enthusiastic train and software geeks, as well as designers and others interested in the worlds of trains, travel and/or sustainability. Everyone is welcome, and all expertise is greatly appreciated so that we can get a good mix of technical and creative minds.

events.name: Random Hacks of Kindness at ICCM : presented by AT&T Developer Program
events.about:
Welcome to the first ever ICCM RHOK event!

The International Conference of Crisis Mappers unites mappers, humanitarians, technologists and more. Random Hacks of Kindness is an event and community that brings together similar minds for quick sprint-like “hacks” aimed at solving real world problems. The event will be held on October 13 -14, 2012 at George Washington University. The goal is to unite the hacking (technical communities) with the humanitarian communities.

How to ICCM RHOK
This hackathon follows the Random Hacks of Kindness model. We will curate the challenge definitions as per the criteria below. RHOK participants will collaborate with the challenge owners during the event to build a prototype or address an issue. Items that are deemed sustainable may be continued by the teams with the support of the greater digital humanitarian communities. 

AT&T, our gold sponsor, is presenting ICCM RHOK as part of their AT&T Developer Program.  We also seek further sponsorship to support the technology, logistics and food needs.If you know of any (or are such a group!), please let us know.

About Registration
Registration for ICCM RHOK is free and separate from the other ICCM events. While it will be hosted in the same location, this simultaneous event is focused on making and doing Hacks + maps and more. We’ve set up a number of free tickets for you to grab. Please pick one ticket based on your best-fit skills. This will help us in team formation and recruitment.


About the Challenge Submissions
ICCM RHOK Challenge Submissions will be accepted from August 29 - September 27, 2012 18:00 UTC. Our problem curation team will review and announce the full list by October 3, 2012.  Each challenge submission requires project owners to be available in person or virtually for the duration of the event. The final ICCM RHOK Challenge Submissions will be published on the Crisismappers site.

The criteria for acceptance of hacks includes:

  • relevant to the ICCM community
  • Topics focused on either maps or humanitarian-focused hacks
  • Clear problem statement and set of tasks
  • Plausible for a weekend hackathon

How to submit a Challenge Submission:
We are using Hackpad to track challenge submission and notes.  

  • Review the ICCM RHOK Challenge Submission homepage.
  • The hackpad should be linked to the main “Challenge Submission” page. See more details on how to use this tool.

ICCM RHOK Event Schedule
Saturday, October 13, 2012: 10:00 - 17:00 pm EDT 
Sunday, October 14, 2012: 10:00 - 18:00 pm EDT

(Final pitches are at 16:00 pm Sunday. All can attend)

What to Bring:

laptop, coffee mug, smile

What we Supply:

Food, beverages, wifi, power

More Details soon!

Contacts: Willow Brugh (willow.bl00 AT gwob.org)  and Heather Leson (hleson AT ushahidi.com)

Sponsors

events.name: GeekGirlMeetup Hackathon with The Giving Lab
events.about:
GeekGirlMeetup Hackathon with The Giving Lab

Saturday, October 13th and Sunday, October 14th

Lady-hackers--ever considered using your coding skills for a charitable cause? Join us at General Assembly for a hackathon in collaboration with GeekGirlMeetup and The Giving Lab. For two days we will bring together talented women to develop new methods of charitable giving, whether it be fundraising tools, games, or social media apps. The team with the most promising concept will be awarded a cash prize, classes at General Assembly, access to mentors, and a years free membership to MyNewsDesk. 

GeekGirlMeetup is an un-conference for women about web, code & startups, creating new female role models, networks and active knowledge exchange.

The Giving Lab is an initiative by See the Difference which aims to develop new methods of giving to charity. They are supported by NESTA, Comic Relief, The Baring Foundation, Cabinet Ofice, Nominent Trust, Garfield Weston Foundation, Pears Foundation and Seene.

 

Cant make it? Sign up at http://galondon.com to stay in the loop on future events and classes.

events.about:
Hackathon

  • Hackathon Location: Landmark Convention Hall, Jalan Braga No 129 Bandung 40111. Google map link: http://goo.gl/maps/kGLp
  • Date & Time: Starts at 1pm, Saturday, 13th October 2012 and ends on 6pm, Sunday, 14th October 2012.

events.name: UNITY GAME JAM: Game Developers Conference
events.about:
SMART DevNet Presents UNITY GAME JAM: BENILDE

Game Development Seminar

For those who are not able to participate in the Game Jam, we will be having a seminar on game development where you and others who want to know what game development is about, can come and find out more about game development, the business, the community and support in the Philippines and hear from successful game developers. 

The event will be held on Saturday, October 13th, the final day of the Game Jam at DLS-CSB from 1:00 to 5:00 pm at the Greenway.

The agenda is as follows:

  • 1:00 to 2:00: Overview of game development; Tools, technologies & skills; How to make money from games - Business Opportunity (Unity)
  • 2:00 to 3:00: Learning game development – education and training; SMART programs for game development (CSB and SMART)
  • 3:00 to 5:00: Philippines game development community and success stories (IGDA, GDAP and local companies)

You are invited to remain at the venue for the presentation of the Game Jam games and awards, all taking place at DLS-CSB.

events.name: hackRU: A Scarlet Night of Hacking
events.about:
The Undergraduate Student Alliance of Computer Scientists at Rutgers will be hosting its annual hackathon “hackRU: A Scarlet Night of Hacking” for the third year in a row!

The event is a 24-hour hackathon. It will begin on October 13th at 2:00pm and conclude on October 14th at 3:00pm EST. We will have several companies presenting their technologies so that students can create original applications in unique and interesting ways. Last year, we had over 150 students in attendance, and we are aiming to double the turnout this year.

This event is open to anyone willing to spend the weekend hacking for honor and glory. There is no limit to the size of a team but remember that the bigger the team, the harder it is to manage a project. We are looking forward to seeing some awesome hacks and some awesome hackers.

events.name: The Hacker Games: Brown University Qualification Round and Mixer
events.about:
The Hacker Games is an annual competition between hackers from the best universities in the country. Five winners from each university will be flown to San Francisco to compete in the The Hacker Games hackathon. 

The Hacker Games Brown Qualification Round and Mixer is on October 13, 2012.  Youll hear from some of the best startups in the area, meet amazing people, and have a chance to win awesome prizes.  Five winners from Brown University will be flown to San Francisco to participate in the The Hacker Games Hackathon Final. 

You must register with a Brown University .edu address to be eligible to attend this event.

The Hacker Games is an annual competition between hackers from the best universities in the country. Five winners from each university will be flown to San Francisco to compete in the The Hacker Games hackathon.

The Hacker Games Berkeley Qualification Round and Mixer is on October 13, 2012.  Youll hear from some of the best startups in the area, meet amazing people, and have a chance to win awesome prizes.  Five winners from Berkeley will be flown to San Francisco to participate in the The Hacker Games Hackathon Final.

You must register with a CalTech .edu address to be eligible to attend this event.

events.name: Hackerspace Mumbai October 2012
events.about:
Hackerspace Mumbai

Hackerspace Mumbai is an initiative of Headstart Network Foundation. It’s a place where hackers meet, create and learn with each other. It’s a place where cred is based only on what you have built and what you share with other hackers (and aspiring hackers) rather than where you studied, where you work etc.

The underlying aim of Hackerspace Mumbai is to massively upgrade the city’s rep for coding skills. We want to herald some kickass coders and projects from this city.  

Hackers are people who

  • Can create an entire application by themselves. This can be mobile, web (not wordpress pls!), desktop
  • Love pushing the boundaries of what they can do
  • Learn by doing
  • Share with hackers and aspiring hackers

Why come to Hackerspaces

  • Meet other Hackers
  • Create new things
  • Learn new tech
  • Learn new methods and alternate approaches
  • Take on challenges

Ground Rules for Hackathons

  • Everyone codes (even the organizers). No spectators.
  • Must form a team. We learn from each other.
  • Anyone can post a challenge
  • The challenge/project can be either open source/proprietary.Both are welcome; and the latter’s IP will be respected
  • You can work through the night at the venue

Event Flow

  • Saturday
    • 4:30 PM – Registrations

events.name: Design-Centric Hackathon
events.about:
About M-RGE

M-RGE is a new, FREE work space and community for designers & hackers.Membership is still open for the month of September, apply here!

The M-RGE Hackathon

User Experience and Visual Design are becoming increasingly important in todays technology startups. Yet hackathons dont attract designers because design isnt valued enough.

At the M-RGE Hackathon, we will flip the traditional hackathon model on its head by having designers pitch developers. In addition, design will be as important in winning as technology.

The M-RGE Hackathon will be one of the best events youve ever attended, with amazing food, shwag, and prizes.

6pm-Onward: Coding all night!


Sunday

6pm: Event Ends

 


Our Partners (Thank You!)

events.name: Indy Hack Day
events.about:
WHY A HACK DAY?

Indiana has a talented community of developers and designers. But we dont have an event we can all attend. We thought it would be great to get together to work on our projects, see what others are doing and learn from each other.

Its a way to bring developers and designers together. The event has an open schedule. What you do while youre here is up to you. This is our version of an unconference. Well end the day with a mixer so you can unwind and network.

Check out the site for more info http://indyhackday.com

WHOS IT FOR?

Indy Hack Day is exclusively for developers and designers. Were serious about it. Thats why we ask for your LinkedIn profile and Twitter handle.

We want to provide an environment free of the business guys, salesmen and recruiters. If you write code, do graphic design, work with typography or design user experiences this is for you.

REASONS TO COME

Spend a day working on your project
Meet other talented devs & designers
Take a workshop
Lunch and dinner is provided

WHERES THIS SHINDIG?

The Speak Easy

5255 North Winthrop Avenue Indianapolis, Indiana 46220 USA

The Speak Easy is a new place for Indianapolis-based entrepreneurs, startups to work, play, and collaborate. We thought it was the perfect spot for our hack day.

events.name: Palm Mobile Development - Hackathon
events.about:
Open webOS Hackathon With Roy Sutton, Engineer at Palm 

Open webOS is the first open-source version of webOS released on September 28, 2012 from Palm. In the two days that Open webOS has been released, it’s already been ported to an HP TouchSmart all in one PC, a Galaxy Nexus, an Asus Transformer Prime and a Raspberry Pi computer. We will try to make history at Semaphore Lab by inviting the Toronto hacking community to hack Open webOS on an Android device to be determined!

events.name: Open Data Day
events.about:
Open Data Day is a program that highlights the problems behind a lack of easily accessed government data, and how solutions can help your community in multiple ways.  Lunch will be provided.

What to expect...

events.about:
This hackathon is the best place to work, network and perhaps even meet your future co-founding software engineer, designer, product guy, business geek, customer, employee or angel investor.

In the hacakthon you can either work on an existing or new project.

For startups it is  the best place to see people working on apps and APIs for your products.

We will build interdisciplinary teams at the hackathon on the Saturday morning. Each team will consists of software engineers, product guys, designers and business geeks. The software engineers will be coding, while the product guys  work on the product details,the designers take over the design and the business geeks the business side of the project.

 On Sunday evening each team will have 5 minutes to demo and pitch their work + 5 minutes Q&A. The best 3 teams will win prizes.

events.name: State of the Mobile Nation
events.about:
This event is supported by Hotwire and Mozilla.

What better time for a review of where were at than the Autumn. Its that back to school feeling and also the start of the build up to the annual mobile industry festival in Barcelona at the end of February. 

We all know mobile is bigger than a very big thing and that the speed of change is faster than anything weve seen in history. But what is actually happening? With so much going on, its easy to miss the real innovations and game-changers in front of our eyes. Wheres the smart money going and why? Whos doing interesting things and how? Will augmented reality take over the world or is it a flash in the pan? Will the machines take over in 2040? And what are we likely to see in the next 12 months that could or should directly affect our strategic thinking? Can Nokia make a come-back? Will HTML5 win the OS war? Does it matter? Will more sectors face collapse or massive change due to the not-so-humble mobile phone?

Join mobile man-about-town and Godfather of Mobile, Russell Buckley and a panel of guests who will debate and discuss all of this and more. There will be time for Q&A.

This session will be live-webcast (subject to, you know, the tech working properly). Registration details will be shared with the sponsors.

Timing:

9.30am Doors open

10am Prompt start

10.45am Session finishes. Time for networking.

Further sessions on mobile advertising and mobile payments will start at 11.15 and 13:00 respectively. Separate RSVP required for each session.

All sessions are free to attend.

Tea, coffee and light refreshments will be provided. 

Although the format is a panel discussion, this is a live recording, so we are limiting spaces to create a more intimate atmosphere and to allow for more discussion and comment from the audience. Therefore, space really is limited so please RSVP to reserve your spot.

Swedish Beers is also happening on 17 October at The Nordic Bar from 6.30pm.

This event forms part of London Mobile Week.

 

About our sponsors

About Hotwire  

 Hotwire is an integrated PR and communications agency. Founded in 2000, the agency spans a number of industries including telecoms, media, marketing, consumer, technology, financial services and cleantech. Quickly becoming a global offering, Hotwire has offices in the UK, across Europe, Australia and the US. Suffice to say, the team are passionate about all things mobile and will be on hand to chew the fat with you.

Mozilla Spaces

 Mozilla Spaces are open working environments where Mozillians can hack,code, design, research, create, engage and contribute to building a brighter future for the web and they are hosting this session. You may be familiar with Mozillas brilliant Firefox browser for desktop and mobile and more recently, they announced their Firefox OS for mobile.

events.name: Nooku Jam 12.3 - Leuven, BE
events.about:
Start the last quarter of 2012 with a spark of creativity, a sprinkle of magic and a lot of Nooku. Learn everything about the latest Nooku 12.3 release and how we are leaving our Joomla legacy behind ! 

Expect two days of intense presentations, discussions, brainstorms, workshops, and hackathons around specific areas of the Nooku project, release. Our friends from FlandersDC will again be hosting the Nooku Jam in their uber awesome Creativity Lab. 

What is a Nooku Jam?

Nooku Jam is an unconference community event focussed mostly on developing with the Nooku. Jams are born from the desire for people to share and learn in an open environment. It is an intense event with discussions, hacking and interaction from developers who are the main actors of the event.

This Jam is a great opportunity for Nookuers to meet in person, to put a face on a lot of quirky mailing list and IM nicknames, and to spend some quality time together!

Anyone with something to contribute or with the desire to learn is welcome and invited to join. When you come, be prepared to share with other attendees. When you leave, be prepared to share it with the world.

Programme 

It is strongly recommended that attendees give a demo, facilitate session, or help with one. This is called sharing and we like it. Dont be intimidated by this, just think about what youre passionate about and come give a talk on it. It could be anything like code you have written, a project you are working on, or an idea that you have.

We have four speaking rooms in the lab, and a projector or screen will be available at all but one of them if youd like to make some slides. If youd like to just lead a discussion, you can sign up to do that without a projector as well. 

You wont need to decide what you want to talk about until you get there. We wont be scheduling talks until the day of the event (thats part of the fun). Well build a schedule with speakers together on a whiteboard starting at 9:30 AM on October 18th, 2012, the day of the event. 

Schedule

9:00  am  - Doors open, people can register and small introduction

9:30  am  - People can sign up for talks on the big whiteboard

10:00 am - Talks start. There are four rooms for presentations, and each presentation will have 25 minutes and they will be spaced out. We recommend that you limit your talks to about 20 minutes to allow 5 minutes for discussion (and incase you run long).

12:00 am - Lunch is served, we take 2 hours break

14:00 pm - Talks resume

16:00 pm - Nooku Hackathon, Ligthning talks and other fun activities! Opportunity for developers to hack on Nooku together, talk, show, listen, ...

18::00 pm - Jam ends. We are going out for dinner and diving into the Leuven nightscene.

Location

Nowadays Leuven is a real student city, as during the academic year most citizens in its centre are students. Leuven sports one of the liveliest bar scenes in Belgium. Besides boasting the longest bar in Europe, the Old Market, tens of bars and cafes crammed into a central square in Leuven. The Catholic University Leuven is the oldest Catholic university still in existence.

The event venue is very well connected, the train station is only 100m walk away and trains are going from Brussels Airport twice every hour. 

Hotels

There are a number of hotels at walking distance from the venue. We recommend Novotel which is only 100m walk from the event venue.

  • Parkinn Hotel (Timble team will be stationed here*)
  • Novotel
  • eTap Hotel

* Since we like to try new things, the Timble team will shift to the Parkinn Hotel instead of Novotel for this edition.

events.name: Mansoura Startup Weekend
events.about:
About Startup Weekend: Startup Weekends are 54-hour events designed to provide superior experiential education for technical and non-technical entrepreneurs.  Beginning with Friday night pitches and continuing through brainstorming, business plan development, and basic prototype creation, Startup Weekends culminate in Sunday night demos and presentations.  Participants create working startups during the event and are able to collaborate with like-minded individuals outside of their daily networks. All teams hear talks by industry leaders and receive valuable feedback from local entrepreneurials. The weekend is centered around action, innovation, and education.  Whether you are looking for feedback on a idea, a co-founder, specific skill sets, or a team to help you execute, Startup Weekends are the perfect environment in which to test your idea and take the first steps towards launching your own startup.

events.name: Big Data and Bigger Data Science
events.about:
Thursday, October 18th from 7:00 - 8:00 pm

Team of founders & early employees, Keen.io

This class is in preparation for the ReRoute/SF hackathon happening at the Hattery on Oct. 19-21st. 

From browsers to mobile applications and from cars to printers, we live in an age of an internet of things. Every access point presents an opportunity to learn a great deal about what users want. Successful companies will require flexible and extensible technology as well as resident data scientists to make the most of this connected world. This class is both a primer on big data data science and the technology that will support it. 

Student Takeaways:

Folks will leave the class with an appreciation for how developers and business stakeholders can leverage user analytics in building and optimizing mobile applications. Students will also get early access to Keens analytics platform, as well as a tutorial on the service. 

Level & Prerequisites:

Beginner. The class is an introduction to data science and how a wise integration can drive dollars and customer experience. The July 2011 New Yorker article, “Looking for Someone”, is a fun primer on data science. It’ll help set the mood. 

Required class materials / software:

A laptop and curiosity. We’ll be using Keen’s cloud-based platform to run through some exercises on a provided data set. Well also talk quickly about feeding new data into the system, in case we have any experienced developers. 

Instructor bio:

Keen is all about the team. A handful of the founders and early employees will be onsite to teach and support. Professional backgrounds include Google, Salesforce.com, iFixIt, Accenture, and Amazon. Apparel choices will range from pressed shirts to skinny jeans.


Offered in partnership with the  . 

___

Cant make it? Sign up at http://generalassemb.ly/sf to stay in the loop on future events and classes in San Francisco. Follow us on Twitter @GA_SF.

events.name: Cloud Foundry Dev Day DC
events.about:
THE NEW DATE HAS BEEN SET! and we'll have a whole team on site to guide you through the very hands-on day!

#CFDevDayDC

This hands-on Developer Day will ramp you up from hello world to building sample apps on Cloud Foundry's hosted and Private PaaS options. Meet our experts, Patrick Chanezon, Chris Richardson, Josh Long and many others, who will guide you through our Cloud Foundry vision, getting started, Cloud Foundry internals and architecture, setting up your own private PaaS using Cloud Foundry Bosh, and additional hackathon.

This is a follow-up from our successful date on the Cloud Foundry Open Tour in DC. For newcomers, we will walk you through the basics and ramp you up for the rest of the day. For previous attendees, you can review the bootcamp or join us after the bootcamp for a great day of hand-on work.

events.name: Data Camp Fall 2012
events.about:
Data is everywhere. Learn how to use it. 

Today the social sector is surrounded by mountains of useful data, but for many individuals and organizations uncovering the insights buried in that data can seem either too difficult or too expensive.

It doesn’t have to be that way.

Free, flexible, and easy-to-use data tools, along with helpful community resources, are making it possible for anyone to turn messy and meaningless data into beautiful and meaningful insights, without the big bucks or the PhD. All that’s needed is a little spark to help get the data fire started.

Thats why we created Data Camp. 

Data Camp is a day-and-a-half crash course in online and open source data tools for beginners. With the help of Chicago-area data professionals and enthusiasts, Data Campers are led through a project that introduces them to a core set of data tools to clean, manage, store, explore, analyze, and visualize almost any dataset.

 

Schedule

Thursday, October 18th (optional)

  • 6:00 pm - 8:00 pm
  • Help Session: Getting set up with R, RStudio, & Google Refine

Friday, October 19th 

  • 8:30 am - 5:00 pm
  • Programming Basics, Data Storage, Cleaning, & Exploration

Saturday, October 20th

  • 8:30 am - 12:00 pm
  • Analysis and Visualization

 

What You can Expect to Learn

  • Cleaning data with Google Refine
  • Storing & accessing data in the cloud using Fusion Tables
  • Exploring and analyzing data using RStudio
  • Visualizing data using ggplot2, Google Visualization API, & Tableau Public
  • Publishing data visualizations to the web
  • Talking with a computer through a command line interface, writing scripts and functions 

Data Camp is Co-sponsored by:

The Harris School of Public Policy, The Center for Impact Measurement, Data Potluck, Emphanos, Data Analysis for the Public Good, Open Government Hack Night, and the Chicago Data Visualization Group

 

FAQs

Do I need prior programming experience for Data Camp?

No. Data Camp is indented to be an indtroductory course and will assume no prior programming knowledge. Hoever, some familiarity with data (e.g. excel spreadsheets) and a basic understanding of statistics (means, variances, correlations) will be helpful.

 

What should I bring to the event?

Your laptop. This is going to be a hands-on workshop with every participant should bring a laptop in order to get the most out of it. 

Will food be provided?

Coffee on Friday morning and lunch on Friday at noon will both be provided. 

What is the refund policy?

You can cancel up to 48 before the event and still recieve a full refund.

3:00 PM Results presented, Prizes given, hackathon OVER

Organized by Hacker Lounge (www.hackUT.com) and TES (http://studentorgs.engr.utexas.edu/tes/)

events.name: Adobe Game Jam- San Francisco
events.about:
Adobe Game Jam
San Francisco – Oct 19th and 20th

Are you into building Games? Do you want to show your gaming coding skills, have fun, and win some cool prizes? The come join us October 19th & 20th for the first Adobe Game Jam.  You’ll meet likeminded people and learn more about Flash game design and development.

Rules:  http://gaming.adobe.com/events/gamejams/

Prizes

12-month subscription to Adobe Creative Cloud®

Participants will vote for winners in each of the following categories:

  • Game concept and design
  • Technology
  • Graphics

Requirements

  • You will need to bring your own equipment (laptop and/or devices ) to build and demo the game. (There will be limited set of devices available on-site for testing and presenting your game)
  • You should be somewhat familiar with programming in ActionScript 3.
  • To save time, either Flash Builder 4.7 beta (free download) or Flash Professional CS6 (free 30-day trial available) are recommended to already be installed on your laptop before the Game Jame begins.
  • Wi-Fi will be provided

Schedule


Friday, October 19th

4:00PM       
 Registration/Meet & Greet
4:30PM Introduction: Demo of Stage 3D apps for iOS/Android + Desktop and a basic walkthough of available engines and tooling.
 5-7:00PM Brainstorm & Teams: You can work solo or form a team of up to 5 members.  Experts will be on hand to help you implement a plan for Saturday’s coding.







*Snacks and beverages will be provided

Saturday, October 20th

9:00AM        Check -in (Coffee & breakfast will be provided)
9:30AM Start coding! Experts will be on hand to answer questions and help troubleshoot.
12:30PM

Break for Lunch (Pizza from Amici’s)
 6:00PM All Games Finalized
 6-7:00PM Game Showcase
  Teams present games (5 min each)
  Attendees vote on games
  Winners & Prizes announced

 

 



 

 

  

Location:

Adobe Systems Inc.

601 Townsend St.

San Francisco, CA

Train:

The Caltrain is a 10 minute walk from our facilities: http://www.caltrain.com/

San Francisco Station - 700 4th St., San Francisco 94107

Buses:

SF Muni Bus #10 passes by the Adobe Office en route to the Caltrain Depot, the Transbay Terminal, and Market St. Muni Bus #19 crosses Townsend at 8th Street traveling south. 

Parking:

There will be validated parking provided. Please pull a ticket upon entry into the garage. Lobby Reception and/or Security will validate your parking ticket. If you arrive after 7PM, you may need to buzz security to open the garage gate.

Adobe Garage
650 King St.
San Francisco, CA 94107
Map:  http://g.co/maps/fm3yu

Bicycles:

Secure bicycle storage is available but only on a first come first basis.

events.name: Oslo Startup Weekend
events.about:
Startup Weekend is an intense weekend event which focuses on taking ideas to a business concept that could form the basis of a credible business. The weekend brings together people with different skillsets – software developers, graphics designers, business people, marketers musicians, creatives and various others – to build products and services and develop a commercial case around them. The event is as always open to any ideas and to everyone who want to experience a high-energy weekend of starting a new project.

We have been lucky to have access to some additional mentors and participants from the music industry this time, which means that if you want to work on a cultural or music related idea it’s a good opportunity to do so. Norway is strong on music-technology and we will give you some insight into the industry the week before the event during Oslo Innovation Week. At Startup Weekend Oslo in January 2011 Soundrop started it’s journey – recently raised $3m in funding june 2012 and they will tell their story at Mobile Monday 15th of October. Read the story. As we said, you don´t have to work on anything music related, but you may be inspired to do so

events.name: Banja Luka Startup Weekend
events.about:
Ever wondered what it takes to be an entrepreneur?

The professional and personal challenges, the high and lows, the failures and the success?

Startup Weekend is a global grassroots movement of active and empowered entrepreneurs who are learning the basics of founding startups and launching successful ventures. It is the largest community of passionate entrepreneurs with over 400 past events in 100 countries around the world in 2011.

The non-profit organization is headquartered in Seattle, Washington but Startup Weekend organizers and facilitators can be found in over 200 cities around the world. From Mongolia to South Africa to London to Brazil, people around the globe are coming together for weekend long workshops to pitch ideas, form teams, and start companies.

All Startup Weekend events follow the same basic model: anyone is welcome to pitch their startup idea and receive feedback from their peers. Teams organically form around the top ideas (as determined by popular vote) and then it’s a 54 hour frenzy of business model creation, coding, designing, and market validation. The weekends culminate with presentations in front of local entrepreneurial leaders with another opportunity for critical feedback.

Whether entrepreneurs found companies, find a cofounder, meet someone new, or learn a skill far outside their usual 9-to-5, everyone is guaranteed to leave the event better prepared to navigate the chaotic but fun world of startups. If you want to put yourself in the shoes of an entrepreneur, register now for the best weekend of your life!

events.name: Braga Startup Weekend
events.about:
About Startup Weekend: Startup Weekends are 54-hour events designed to provide superior experiential education for technical and non-technical entrepreneurs.  Beginning with Friday night pitches and continuing through brainstorming, business plan development, and basic prototype creation, Startup Weekends culminate in Sunday night demos and presentations.  Participants create working startups during the event and are able to collaborate with like-minded individuals outside of their daily networks. All teams hear talks by industry leaders and receive valuable feedback from local entrepreneurials. The weekend is centered around action, innovation, and education.  Whether you are looking for feedback on a idea, a co-founder, specific skill sets, or a team to help you execute, Startup Weekends are the perfect environment in which to test your idea and take the first steps towards launching your own startup.

About Braga: Braga is a city in northwestern Portuguese district of Braga, considered the oldest Christian archdiocesein the country and one of the oldest in the world. Under the Roman Empire, known as Bracara Augusta, the settlement was centre of the province of Gallaecia. With a total urban population of 175,063 inhabitants, Braga is the third-largest city in Portugal (after Lisbon and Porto). Braga is also the seat of the Greater Metropolitan Area of Minho, which includes a population of 826,833 (2007 statistics), considered one of the fastest growing urban areas in the European Union. In 2012, the city was awarded with the title European Youth Capital 2012.

For all event details, including mentors, coaches, speakers and facilitators visit braga.startupweekend.org

Food and drinks for the three days are included.

Thanks!

Startup Weekend Crew

Refund Policy:  No refunds will be granted within 7 days of the event if food and drink have already been ordered. Apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

events.name: Apps4VA HAC4EDU Arlington
events.about:
Apps4VA is sponsoring 5 simultaneous 24-hour hackathons to develop software applications using education data.  Cash and other prizes will be awarded to winners.  Well supply food, snacks, and data.  You supply energy, excitement and ingenuity! 

Apps4VA is an collaborative effort between the Center for Innovative Technology and the Virginia Department of Education to encourage the development of new and innovative ways to use and analyze education data.  For more information on the program, visit http://www.apps4va.org/index.html
