Developers interested in building apps to solve challenging data problems with Splunk are welcome, you don’t have to be a registered for the conference to take part.

“NO PURCHASE NECESSARY TO ENTER OR WIN. A PURCHASE WILL NOT INCREASE YOUR CHANCES OF WINNING.  Must be 18 and the age of majority to participate.  Void where prohibited by law.  “Best Application” entries will receive a score of one (1) to ten (10) in the following categories: innovation, technical implementation, presentation, and coolness. “Best Application for Social Impact” entries will receive a score of one (1) to ten (10) in the following categories: innovation, technical implementation, presentation, coolness, and social impact.  Must be present to participate and win.  Sponsor is Splunk Inc. 250 Brannan Street, San Francisco, CA 94107.”

events.name: Ogden Startup Weekend
events.about:
Ever wondered what it takes to be an entrepreneur?

The professional and personal challenges, the high and lows, the failures and the success?

Startup Weekend is a global grassroots movement of active and empowered entrepreneurs who are learning the basics of founding startups and launching successful ventures. It is the largest community of passionate entrepreneurs with over 400 past events in 100 countries around the world in 2011.

The non-profit organization is headquartered in Seattle, Washington but Startup Weekend organizers and facilitators can be found in over 200 cities around the world. From Mongolia to South Africa to London to Brazil, people around the globe are coming together for weekend long workshops to pitch ideas, form teams, and start companies.

All Startup Weekend events follow the same basic model: anyone is welcome to pitch their startup idea and receive feedback from their peers. Teams organically form around the top ideas (as determined by popular vote) and then it’s a 54 hour frenzy of business model creation, coding, designing, and market validation. The weekends culminate with presentations in front of local entrepreneurial leaders with another opportunity for critical feedback.

Whether entrepreneurs found companies, find a cofounder, meet someone new, or learn a skill far outside their usual 9-to-5, everyone is guaranteed to leave the event better prepared to navigate the chaotic but fun world of startups. If you want to put yourself in the shoes of an entrepreneur, register now for the best weekend of your life!

Come to a “Windows 8 Unleashed” event to kick-start your Windows 8 development. “Windows 8 Unleashed” is a series of FREE events run by your local community friends and leaders, and are great whether you are an experienced .NET developer, or even if you are just getting started. We’ll spend the morning in lecture and hands on labs. Half way through, you’ll get a chance to take what you learned in the morning and compete in a hackathon with a chance to win some great prizes!

events.name: Boundless Physics Textbook Hackathon
events.about:
Developers and coders aren’t the only hackers out there. Join Boundless on November 2 - 4 for a textbook hackathon to create a free, open physics book.

What’s a Textbook Hackathon?

An event in which specialists of a certain subject area get together to create learning content for the community. Hackers will sort through the best openly licensed and free educational materials available online to create an open textbook. 

Why Hack with Us?

Boundless is making the worlds open educational content more useful for students by connecting them with the wealth of high quality, openly licensed, and free educational content that has been created by leading educators and institutions over the last 20 years. 

By hacking with us, youll be contributing the vast world of open educational resources and making this content relevant and useful for physics students everywhere. Its a unique way to meet local physicists, a cool resume booster, and a way to give back to the educational community. 

Plus, youll feel right at home in our kickass office space (photo evidence below). 

Who Should Attend?

Physics professors, teachers, researchers, graduate students, or teaching assistants. Not sure if you fit the bill but still want to attend? Email us: hackathon@boundless.com

Event Details

Expect lots of free food, mingling with fellow physists, ping pong matches, an epic Super Smash Bros brawl, and prizes throughout the hackathon weekend. 

November 2 (6pm - 10pm) 

Let your inner-physics socialite shine at the Hackathon Orientation. We’re not talking about that boring orientation experience from freshmen year; we’re talking orientation Boundless style—food, fun, and games!

We’ll lay out some of the key components and guidelines for the textbook hackathon and sign you up for the weekend-long Super Smash Bros brawl, so don’t miss it! 

Don’t forget to bring your friends. Whoever brings the most friends with them wins a $100 cash prize Friday night.

If you can’t make this orientation and networking night but still want to attend, we’ll host some light guideline refreshers on Saturday and Sunday mornings.

November 3 (9am - 9pm) and November 4 (9am - 6pm)

The brunt of the textbook hack will take place Saturday and Sunday. We’ll have the office open all day, so stop by when you can to start hacking!

Boundless has lots of different office settings open for you to use. Whether you work better in a quiet room, on a comfy couch, or at your desk: we have it all. Find the spot where you’ll work best and bang out some physics hacks!

Sunday night well have some special Hackathon Closing Ceremonies. Prizes and awards will be bestowed then.

Prizes

  • Come all three days and be entered in a raffle to win an Xbox 360 with Kinect Star Wars bundle ($400 value)
  • $150 cash prize for winning the Super Smash Bros brawl
  • $100 cash prize for bringing the most friends
  • More to be announced soon!

Time Commitment

We hope you can commit 10 hours to hacking. Come and go as you please!

What to Bring

Just a laptop, charger, and an itch to hack. We’ll supply the rest.

Questions?

Email us at hackathon@boundless.com

events.name: Bath Startup Weekend #2: 2nd to 4th Nov 2012
events.about:
What is Bath Startup Weekend?

Bath Startup Weekend is a weekend-long, hands-on experience where entrepreneurs and aspiring entrepreneurs can find out if startup ideas are viable. On average, half of Startup Weekend’s attendees have technical backgrounds, the other half have business backgrounds.

On Friday evening, participants that wish to have 60 seconds to make a pitch, the pitches are whittled down to the top ideas, and then teams form around the ideas. Over Saturday and Sunday teams focus on customer development, validating their ideas, practicing LEAN Startup Methodologies and building a Minimal Viable Product. Finally, the weekend culminates with demonstrations in front of an audience of judges and potential investors.

The ticket includes all meals, snacks, as much tea and coffee as you can drink.

Oh, and there will be some free beer, too.

The venue will be open for the entire duration of the event. Teams and individuals that want to can work on their ideas day and night.

Who should come along?

Existing entrepreneurs, aspiring entrepreneurs and anyone who has thought they would like to be a part owner in a new business venture. People of all backgrounds including software developers, marketers, designers, ux/ui experts, online business enthusiasts, and students.

Bath is less than 90 minutes from London, by train. The venue, Bath Innovation Centre, is 5 minutes walk from the railway station.

events.name: Lehigh Valley Startup Weekend
events.about:
Ever wondered what it takes to be an entrepreneur? The professional and personal challenges, the high and lows, the failures and the success? Startup Weekend is a global grassroots movement of active and empowered entrepreneurs who are learning the basics of founding startups and launching successful ventures. It is the largest community of passionate entrepreneurs with over 400 past events in 100 countries around the world in 2011.

The non-profit organization is headquartered in Seattle, Washington but Startup Weekend organizers and facilitators can be found in over 200 cities around the world. From Mongolia to South Africa to London to Brazil, people around the globe are coming together for weekend long workshops to pitch ideas, form teams, and start companies.

All Startup Weekend events follow the same basic model: anyone is welcome to pitch their startup idea and receive feedback from their peers. Teams organically form around the top ideas (as determined by popular vote) and then it’s a 54 hour frenzy of business model creation, coding, designing, and market validation. The weekends culminate with presentations in front of local entrepreneurial leaders with another opportunity for critical feedback.

Whether entrepreneurs found companies, find a cofounder, meet someone new, or learn a skill far outside their usual 9-to-5, everyone is guaranteed to leave the event better prepared to navigate the chaotic but fun world of startups.

events.name: Santa Barbara Startup Weekend #2
events.about:
Startup Weekend Santa Barbara is back!

Startup Weekend returns to the Santa Barbara area November 2, 3 & 4.

What is Startup Weekend?

Startup Weekend is a global network of passionate leaders and entrepreneurs on a mission to inspire, educate, and empower individuals, teams and communities. Share ideas, form teams, and launch startups.
The November event will no doubt bring out incredible ideas and create amazing new businesses. We’ll also learn a lot working together all weekend in beautiful Santa Barbara.

Launch a Startup in 54 Hours!

Actually at this weekend you’ll get 55 hours! We set the clocks back early Sunday morning giving us some extra time to get things done…

The first Santa Barbara Startup Weekend saw some amazing ideas come together and some great businesses created. From Chirp to Artful, the winners of the June event amazed the crowd and the judges.

We’ve landed a great partner for the second Santa Barbara event! Citrix Online will be hosting the event at its headquarters in Goleta. The Citrix location is a great facility with some amazing amenities, including my favorite team meeting area…a bocce court. In addition to the global sponsor tools available, Citrix employees will be participating and mentoring and the company will provide access to GoToMeeting and their new collaboration tool Podio, for weekend the participants.

The November event will feature some amazing speakers and mentors including John Greathouse, Jim Semick, Ali Bauerlein, Colin Kelley, and Lex Sisney. We’ve also got some surprises up our sleeve… so stay tuned.

In addition, we are adding a few new twists…

During lunch on Saturday, an amazing team of brand experts, designers, UX and UI professionals, and product designers, will join us to discuss the impact of effective design on startups. The roundtable will be lead by Citrix’s Senior Director of Global Creative, Andreas Forsland. More information coming soon!

Sunday we’ll also be adding a mentoring team, let by Alissa Sears of Christie Communication, to help give feedback on your final presentations before you present to a panel of judges.

In addition…the Independent, an incredible supporter and sponsor of the event, will also be embedding a reporter in the weekend to participate in the weekend, and write about the experience.

We’ll mix in some music… great food… beer and wine… A LOT of coffee.… and you’ll even get an extra hour to work on your idea. Yeah, that’s right… on Sunday morning November 4th we’ll be setting the clocks back 1 hour. That means more time to code, design, build business models, and validate your product.

More information about the awards, judges, some potential surprises and location details will be posted in the coming weeks.

In the meantime, tickets are available now!

For those that just want to see what the weekend is all about, tickets are also available for the opening idea pitches and the closing team presentations. Get yours now and save a few bucks… ($15 now… $20 at the door)

For those new to Startup Weekend check out some of the media from Santa Barbara’s past Startup Weekend(June).

Hope you can join us on November 2 at Startup Weekend!

About Startup Weekend: Startup Weekends are 54-hour events designed to provide superior experiential education for technical and non-technical entrepreneurs.  Beginning with Friday night pitches and continuing through brainstorming, business plan development, and basic prototype creation, Startup Weekends culminate in Sunday night demos and presentations.  Participants create working startups during the event and are able to collaborate with like-minded individuals outside of their daily networks. All teams hear talks by industry leaders and receive valuable feedback from local entrepreneurials. The weekend is centered around action, innovation, and education.  Whether you are looking for feedback on a idea, a co-founder, specific skill sets, or a team to help you execute, Startup Weekends are the perfect environment in which to test your idea and take the first steps towards launching your own startup.

events.name: Data DeathMatch!
events.about:
Data DeathMatch! Nov. 2rd/3rd, Fight Political Corruption and Help Schools Work Smarter!

Are you a hacker who wants to fight political corruption or thinks that our schools should work smarter? Choose your focus, work with our government allies, and join Code for America for a hackathon to improve the cities we live in.

 We’ve opened critical datasets (now available through well-documented APIs) and have lined up a blockbuster group of open-data advocates standing ready to help you build apps that will revolutionize the way citizens interact with government.

Want to get a head start? Here are the links for the education API and transparency data well be working with.


 

Friday, well break into hacker teams who want to work on government transparency data and those who want to hack education. Saturday, well go into full development mode and compete for use of our apps in government/schools and magical prizes! Along the way, the people whove developed the APIs (Captricity and LearnSprout) and our community partners who have shared their data (like the Fair Political Practices Commission (FPPC) and local school representatives) will have your back - providing you free coaching on how the data sets well be showcasing work.

Bonus: Prizes TBD. Beer, breakfast, lunch, and dinner! Ping pong and air hockey when you’re not hacking to save government or hearing from awesome speakers. 

Space is limited, so RSVP early.

Schedule
November 2nd: 

  • 6:30PM Mixer
  • 7PM Introduction of CfA, Community Stakeholder, APIs
  • 7:30PM Idea Development/Team Building
  • 8PM Wrap-up

November 3rd:

  • 9AM  Breakfast
  • 9:30AM Hackathon Overview
  • 10AM Work Sprint
  • 12PM Working Lunch
  • 1PM Work Sprint
  • 6PM  Dinner, Demos, Prizes
  • 7:30PM  Mixer

If you have questions, ping atran@codeforamerica.org. Sumo suits and wrestling attire strongly encouraged.

events.name: medX hosted by Enventure
events.about:
What?

Houstons first Med Hack Day -- a 24-hour marathon for developers, designers, scientists, educators, and the community to come together to collaboratively create ideas to change world, one step at a time.

Hack Days were originally created by Yahoo! in 2005 and soon after became a worldwide trend. By collaborating on focused tasks during a short period of time, participants are capable of producing remarkable results. Med Hack Houston specifically aims to facilitate the collaboration of individuals of all backgrounds to help make the life sciences more accessible, educational, and enjoyable at the largest medical center in the world.

Who?

Med Hack Houston calls upon medical scientists, physicians, engineers, software developers, designers, web enthusiasts, educators, and anyone else with a passion for innovating new ideas related to the medical field.

Event Schedule 

Friday evening, participants will arrive and the event to form and meet with their teams. Individuals can pitch their ideas and/or their skill sets and join teams of their interest. Team members will get the chance to get to know one another and begin brainstorms.  After a few hours of sleep, groups will reconvene Saturday morning to work on their hacks.  During the day, there will be short chalk talks, and other opportunities to learn about new medical innovations. At the end of the the day, teams will pitch their ideas, and the event will conclude with a keynote address and announcement of top hacks.

The Hacks 

Do you have a cool project in mind, and all you need is a designer and a web developer to make it happen? Or, do you have a unique skill set and drive to make something happen, but need that great idea to get started? Med Hack Houston provides a space where you can team up with eager Houstonians representing a variety of skills and backgrounds to bring your ideas to life. You will encounter unique networking opportunities and the exhilaration of sharing a room with a diverse group of passionate individuals.

Your Host:

Enventure is a networking group especially targeting and nurturing young medical entrepreneurs in Houston, TX. They meet regularly for morning coffee or happy hour and share ideas related to medical start-ups with the ultimate aim to build a home for the worlds top medical & life science innovators.
enventure.tumblr.com

events.about:
The Foursquare hackathon is back! And this year, we’re inviting you to hack foursquare itself. Our all-new Connected Apps platform enables you to hack new functionality directly into the core Foursquare experience and make it discoverable to the over 25 million people already on foursquare.

On November 3rd, we’re opening up our NYC & SF offices for a connected apps hackathon of epic proportions. And just like last year, we’re inviting developers all around the world to band together and hack some awesome connected apps.

OMG Prizes

Oh yeah, and were giving out some mindblowingly awesome prizes for the best connected apps built by anyone anywhere during the hackathon. Build something amazing and you might just find yourself ringing the NASDAQ closing bell, rockingtickets to SXSW, partying with an action figure version of yourself, or wearing the infamous foursquare hackathon TITLE BELT.

  2. If youre in NYC or SF, tell us a little bit about yourself for a reserved spot at an official site.
  3. Read the Schedule and Rules
  4. Mark your calendar and start thinking of ideas! Weve got some suggestions to get your mental juices flowing.

events.name: Altmetrics Hackathon
events.about:
Uncover how science research is shared, used, and measured with altmetrics at the Altmetrics Hackathon on Nov 3, 2012 in San Francisco.  Altmetrics are online metrics that capture the many ways in which research articles are shared, commented, reviewed, and put to use.  As a set, they collectively tell the larger story of science.

Build new tools and improve existing ones with real time datasets and API services.  Create new mashups.  Brainstorm the future of tracking science.  Fun prizes awarded at the end of the session.  View ideas and share your own here.

Co-hosted by PLOS and ImpactStory

events.name: DCWEEK Hackathon Presented by AT&T
events.about:
In its second year, the DCWEEK Hackathon is the biggest event of its kind in the region. Hundreds of hackers, hustlers and designers gather to build new apps and companies -- whether for fun, for the prizes or for the opportunity to launch a new startup.

More details, including the prize pool will be announced in the early Fall.

============AGENDA============

Saturday (11/3)

[10:00 AM] Coffee, Registration

[11:00 AM] Intro to the DCWEEK Hackathon

[11:30 AM] API & Data Lightening Talks (TBD talks by specific API/Data providers)

[12:30 AM] Hacker, Hustler, Designer Matching (only if you need additional team members)

[01:00 PM] Hacker cave land grab (go find a breakout room for the weekend) and get started

The venue will be open through the night. 


Sunday (11/4)

[09:00 AM] Coffee and Bagels delivered

[2:00 PM] Organizers check in on team progress to see whos going to submit to win prizes

[4:00 PM] Prototypes are due for submission to Organizers

[5:00 PM] Live Demos & Judging by Entrepreneur/Investor/Sponsor panel

[6:00 PM] Exit

============JUDGES============

TBD

============PRIZES============

 $5,000+ (more details TBD)

 ============PRESENTING SPONSOR============

 

Full DCWEEK 2012 Overview:

events.name: BlackBerry Jam Sessions Andalucía 2012
events.about:
Estos hackathons son algo así como los mejores hackathons en el mundo. ¿Por qué pensamos que son los mejores? Debido a que hemos escuchado lo que han pedido los desarrolladores y hemos hecho nuestro mejor esfuerzo para entregarlo.

Vamos a vuestras ciudades, traemos a los expertos, os alimentamos, os damos de beber, os honramos con premios y recompensas, pero sobre todo, trabajamos para crear una relación con vosotros. Estamos ahí para vosotros, porque queremos que tengan éxito. Estos hackathons son más que una sesión de programación de 10 horas de duración. Serán tu oportunidad para aprender, practicar y crear tus aplicaciones con el apoyo que nunca antes has experimentado.

Desarrollar en BlackBerry es más fácil que nunca. Ya seas desarrollador de C, C++, Qt, Javascript, HTML5 y/o Flash, tienes tu hueco en estas sesiones. Si quieres saber más sobre las plataformas de desarrollo échale un ojo a http://developer.blackberry.com/

Más información http://spain.blackberryjamsessions.com/
events.address: Malaga España  Sábado 3 de noviembre de 2012 desde las

events.name: Making Javascript Beautiful
events.about:
Το Flash πέθανε! Ζήτω το Flash! Αυτό είναι το ένα καλό που έκανε η Apple στον κόσμο.
Και τώρα τι; Πώς φτιάχνουμε τα ωραία γραφικά που γνωρίζουμε κι αγαπάμε;

Η VisionMobile και η Rulemotion σας προσκαλούν στο “Making Javascript Beautiful”, ένα Hackathon με θέμα τη δημιουργία εντυπωσιακών interactive γραφικών με τεχνολογίες HTML5 / Canvas / Javascript. Δώδεκα (12) ώρες με κώδικα, pizza και energy drink, με έπαθλο τη πτήση της ζωής σας.

Πως λειτουργεί το Hackathon;

Οι συμμετέχοντες χωρίζονται σε ολιγομελείς, κατά το δυνατόν ομοιογενείς, ομάδες. Εντός 12 ωρών καλούνται να δημιουργήσουν μια εφαρμογή γραφικών σε HTML5 / Canvas / Javascript χρησιμοποιώντας προεπιλεγμένα dataset δεδομένων.

Στο τέλος της ημέρας βραβεύεται η ομάδα που δημιούργησε την καλύτερη εφαρμογή, με βάση τα παρακάτω κριτήρια:

  1. Form, i.e. beautiful
  2. Function, i.e. conveys the information
  3. Comprehensible, i.e. does not need a manual

Σε ποιούς απευθύνεται;

Web developers, Javascript ninjas, Graphic Designers.

Τι χρειάζεται να φέρω μαζί μου;

Laptop, ιδέες, φαντασία και ενθουσιασμό για να δημιουργήσουμε όλοι μαζί.

Κόστος

Δωρεάν.

Έπαθλο

Τα μέλη της νικήτριας ομάδας θα πετάξουν με αλεξίπτωτο πλαγιάς (παραπέντε).

events.name: Ladies Learning Code Hack Day
events.about:
Hey you! Have you joined the Ladies Learning Code email list? If not, click here.

What is Ladies Learning Code?

Were a not-for-profit startup in Toronto who provide women (and men*) the opportunity to learn beginner-friendly computer programming and other technical skills in a social and collaborative way. Were all about showing people that learning to hack can be fun!

*Men are welcome to attend workshops (and they do!), but we request that you bring with you an additional female learner where possible.

Why a Hack Day?

Sometimes, you want a structured learning experience, like a Ladies Learning Code workshop. But sometimes, you just want to work on a project! Whether you want to take something you learned at a Ladies Learning Code workshop to the next level, need help installing a Wordpress theme, or want to add some JavaScript to your personal website, the Ladies Learning Code Hack Day is for you!

Essentially, Ladies Learning Code Hack Day is a day dedicated to taking your web skills to the next level – no matter what stage you’re at. Beginners are welcome, but even our more experienced community members will find value in the day. There’s no specific content and we can’t tell you what you’ll learn in advance – because it depends on the personal project you bring along with you. As usual, this event will be supported by some of Toronto’s most talented developers – we call them “Mentors” – who will be there to help you throughout the day! Were aiming for a 4:1 ratio or better of participants to Mentors, so if youd like to help out as a technical volunteer, please join our tech help mailing list here.

Note that this Hack Day is dedicated to website projects – anything related to creating websites is fair game! That includes HTML & CSS, Wordpress, JavaScript, jQuery, web design, and more!

Here are some examples of projects you could work on at the Ladies Learning Code Hack Day:

  • Get help purchasing a domain name and hosting – or finally make use of a domain name you purchased ages ago!
  • Learn to build a simple webpage using  HTML & CSS
  • Learn to install and tweak a Wordpress theme (such as one from Themify.me!)
  • Add some JavaScript to a website you’ve created on your own
  • Install a widget, tweak some code on your website, add a contact form – feel free to get creative!
 

Is this workshop for you?

This workshop has been designed for beginners who have never been exposed to JavaScript before, but already have basic knowledge of HTML and CSS. Not sure if you have the basic HTML and CSS youll need to get the most out of this workshop? If youve been to either of our Intro to HTML & CSS workshops (and paid attention), you should be good to go! Missed those workshops? See this quiz. If you can answer the 3 questions, you are probably a good fit for the October 13th workshop!

Requirements:

  1. No experience necessary, but it may help to have a project in mind when you arrive. Email us at info [at] ladieslearningcode.com if you have any questions or need ideas! Remember, beginners are welcome!
  2. You must own or have access to a laptop with wi-fi for which you have administrative permissions. Please be sure to bring your powercord.

Also, if you can bring a travel mug to the workshop, that would be great! Were trying to make our workshops more eco-friendly.

*Are you quaified to help out this workshop? Great - our workshops absolutely wouldnt be possible without the incredible developers who help us out! Please join our tech help email list here.

Whats Included?

  • A small ratio (usually 4:1!) of participants to instructors - get the help you need!
  • A fun and inclusive learning envionment
  • A great venue (The Ladies Learning Code space at The Centre for Social Innovation)
  • Delicious snacks
  • A free Wordpress theme from Themify.me (Thanks, @Themify!)

Questions?

Email us at info [at] ladieslearningcode.com. You can also find us here:

Twitter: @llcodedotcom (dont forget to use the hashtag: #ladieslearningcode)
Facebook: facebook.com/ladieslearningcode
Mailing List & Developer/Designer Mailing List: http://ladieslearningcode.com

What participants say about our workshops:

Honestly, the set up of one instructor - four students is brilliant.

Im super impressed with the organizers and participants, and I think its a really valuable initiative.

[The best part of the workshop was] the positivity, helpfulness and eagerness to learn/teach of every person in the room.

After years of teaching myself how to code, I wasnt sure how Id find the collaborative experience of an LLC workshop - but it completely exceeded my expectations. The lead instructor was clear and thorough, and the volunteer instructors were always ready to throw new challenges at us the moment they saw wed completed the current task. Solving a coding problem has always been exciting for me, but having a group of people equally excited about it was amazing!

[My favourite part was] the casual nature of things, and the fact that all the instructors walked around and helped out learners everywhere around the room - so I got to meet and talk to a bunch of people who were experienced and gain some perspectives. The food was great too. ;)

events.name: Science Hack Day San Francisco 2012
events.about:
More details about Science Hack Day SF 2012 are at http://sf.sciencehackday.com

Press: If you are wanting to cover Science Hack Day SF, please email ariel@sciencehackday.org.

Attendees: Please only sign up if you intend to hack at Science Hack Day for BOTH days.

Science Hack Day is a 48-hour-all-night event that brings together designers, developers, scientists and other enthusiastic geeks in the same physical space for a brief but intense period of collaboration, hacking, and building cool stuff. A hack is a unique modification, an interesting mashup or a quick solution to a problem - maybe not the most elegant solution, but often the cleverest. The mission of Science Hack Day is to get excited and make things with science! Heres what came out of last years event: http://sf.sciencehackday.com/2011/11/22/summing-up-science-hack-day-sf-2011/

events.name: New York Legal Hacker Meetup at Projective Space: Hacking the Patent System
events.about:
Each month, the New York Legal Hacker Meetup tackles one area where law has failed to keep up with technology. With a distinguished panel that will lay out the issue, we throw it open to our audience to ask questions and present their own solutions that will help law and policy adapt to a constantly changing world.

This month, were meeting at Projective Space in the Lower East Side to look at the patent system and the issue of non-practicing entities (or patent trolls). Well dig into the architecture of the current patent system, and how it encourages this behavior. Then well look at how we define trolling, explore the problems they may create, and discuss what kinds of patents they’re using. Finally, we’ll look at practical solutions that tackle the problem and protect innovation.

As usual, our first hour will be a panel discussion with a host of amazing experts in the field. Our second hour will be a mini-hackathon followed by quick demos and networking.

Finally, we’ll look at practical solutions that tackle the problems weve raised, and determine for ourselves whether our current system and the solutions we propose promote the Progress of Science and useful Arts. 

Moderated by

Jorge Torres, Silas Capital

Panelists

Josh Becker, Lex Machina

Nilay Patel, The Verge

Serge Krimnus, The Farrell Law Firm

events.name: SAP CodeJam Bratislava
events.about:
Remember Hacker Night? Well, SAP is bringing it back under a new format calledCodeJam. This new concept offers an opportunity for you as a developer to not only get your hands on SAP’s latest technologies but also to put yourself to the test and to code, hack and create with your peers.

SAP CodeJam Bratislava will focus on Cloud technologies. As a participant, you’ll get access to the SAP NetWeaver Cloud including tools, sandboxes, experts, and more! In the days prior to the event, youll receive an email with a checklist and a couple of links that will help you get prepared. 

So, put yourself to the test and sign up for CodeJam Bratislava now! The event is free, but space is limited.

events.name: Constantine Startup Weekend 11/2012
events.about:
Ever wondered what it takes to be an entrepreneur?

The professional and personal challenges, the high and lows, the failures and the success?

Startup Weekend is a global grassroots movement of active and empowered entrepreneurs who are learning the basics of founding startups and launching successful ventures. It is the largest community of passionate entrepreneurs with over 400 past events in 100 countries around the world in 2011.

The non-profit organization is headquartered in Seattle, Washington but Startup Weekend organizers and facilitators can be found in over 200 cities around the world. From Mongolia to South Africa to London to Brazil, people around the globe are coming together for weekend long workshops to pitch ideas, form teams, and start companies.

All Startup Weekend events follow the same basic model: anyone is welcome to pitch their startup idea and receive feedback from their peers. Teams organically form around the top ideas (as determined by popular vote) and then it’s a 54 hour frenzy of business model creation, coding, designing, and market validation. The weekends culminate with presentations in front of local entrepreneurial leaders with another opportunity for critical feedback.

Whether entrepreneurs found companies, find a cofounder, meet someone new, or learn a skill far outside their usual 9-to-5, everyone is guaranteed to leave the event better prepared to navigate the chaotic but fun world of startups. If you want to put yourself in the shoes of an entrepreneur, register now for the best weekend of your life!

events.name: hack/reduce launch party!
events.about:
Boston’s Big Data Hackspace is opening its doors on November 8th and we’re inviting the whole community over to celebrate with us!  Join us at our amazing space in the old Kendall Boiler & Tank Building (yes, THAT building) for drinks, eats, music, and awesome peeps. 

Join Governor Deval Patrick, Christopher Lynch, Frederic Lalonde and Abby Fichtner at this grand opening. Be amongst the first to walk through our doors and see how hack/reduce will help Boston create the talent and technologies to lead us into a big data-driven future.

Brought to us by our fabulous friends at Silicon Valley Bank - they love big data!

Code Big or Go Home.  And… if you want to get your Big Data geek on, the festivities will continue through the weekend with a big data hackathon.  Stay tuned for more on that!

about hack/reduce
hack/reduce is ground zero for Bostons Big Data community; a big data clubhouse that connects developers, data scientists and domain experts across disciplines.

Well provide a large-scale compute cluster, data sets, hands-on workshops, hackathons and a shared workspace for developing Big Data projects and helping Boston to create the talent and technologies to lead us into a big data-driven future.

hack/reduce is a non-profit 501 c3 established in partnership with the State of Massachusetts and our amazing Founding Sponsors:

Microsoft
IBM
EMC
Massachusetts Technology Collaborative
Atlas Venture
Bain Capital Ventures
Bessemer Venture Partners
Charles River Ventures
Matrix Partners
North Bridge Venture Partners
Goodwin Proctor
Foley & Lardner

With thanks to our wonderful in-kind sponsors: Brown Rudnick LLP and Turnstone.

 

Getting Here

Attire is casual. Come as you are.

Were a 5 minute walk from the Kendall T stop. Just take 3rd street down 3 blocks to our building on the left in the Kendall Boiler & Tank Building.

There is limited street parking around the building and a garage at 350 Kendall Street, Cambridge, MA.

events.name: Silicon Valley comes to Southampton
events.about:
Southampton Startup Weekend is sponsored by Leto - technology innovation company, which was co-founded by Southampton University graduate Alex Berezovsky, and employs several Southampton alumni. Leto is based in London and provides technology innovation consultancy and software (web and mobile application) development; initially focusing on startups, and now also helping bigger companies in re-engineering their systems and processes. Leto was also invited to mentor teams throughout the Southampton Startup Weekend, and give a welcoming speech to inspire young entrepreneurs to develop some exciting startups.

Event will be judged by Don Spalinger, the Director of Research and Innovation, Simon Cox, an Associate Dean for Enterprise, both from the Southampton University; and Penny Smout, CEO of Hawk Conservancy, who has an extensive experience working in startups. Moreover, it is confirmed that on Sunday night, when the winners are announced, prizes will be awarded by David Cameron!

events.name: Windows 8 Unleashed - Seattle
events.about:
Windows 8 Unleashed - Full Day of Hands-On Programming, B.Y.O. Laptop!

Windows 8 is the single biggest opportunity for developers EVER! Come to a “Windows 8 Unleashed” event to kick-start your Windows 8 development. “Windows 8 Unleashed” is a series of FREE events run by your local community friends and leaders, and are great whether you are an experienced .NET developer, or even if you are just getting started. We’ll spend the morning in lecture and hands on labs. Half way through, you’ll get a chance to take what you learned in the morning and compete in a hackathon with a chance to win some great prizes! 

Required Software and Downloads

Please make sure to get the required software and downloads BEFORE coming to the event. You can find everything you need on the “Windows 8 Unleashed Installs” page.

Agenda

Session I – Overview

  • ·Metro Style Apps Overview
  • ·Developing Metro Style Apps
  • ·Working with Controls
  • ·Implementing Navigation

Session II – Location and Data

  • ·Working with Location
  • ·Data Binding
  • ·Roaming
  • ·App Bar

 

Session III – Metro Principals

  • ·Live Tiles & Toast
  • ·Contracts
  • ·Full, Fill Snap and Portrait Views
  • ·Advertising

Build an App and Win Money and Prizes!

Our sponsors have stepped up with some awesome prizes. Not only do you get a ton of information for FREE, but you have an opportunity to win some awesome stuff! You can’t afford to miss this!

DAY-OF prizes will be awarded (sponsored by PDSA):

  • ·1st Place: $500 Gift Card
  • ·2nd Place: $200 Gift Card
  • ·3rd Place: $100 Gift Card

“Best Overall App” Prizes will be awarded to the best app from ALL unleashed events:

  • ·$10,000 from Component Art
  • ·Windows 8 Tablet from PDSA, Inc.

In addition all attendees will receive a FREE eBook from O’Reilly

events.name: AngelHack Fall 2012 Tel Aviv
events.about:
Get excited Tel Aviv! The largest hackathon competition in the world is coming to town! Join us for AngelHack Tel Avivs inagural 24hr event, where youll find:
  • 100s of amazing developers & designers to work with
  • Gourmet food, shwag, nerf guns, helicopters, and at select locations- AR drones and free massages
  • Over $650,000 in prizes, including acceptance into AngelHacks Hackcelerator program and trips to Silicon Valley (more details below and on our FAQ)
  • Media coverage and immediate attention for your hackathon project to get taken to the next level
  • An awesome community of mentors, influencers, and expert judges to help you along the way
  • Free tickets compliments of the Azure Accelerator program! Thanks guys!!

What should I build?
Create a prototype (hack) of something that you believe solves a big problem. You dont need a business plan or anything crazy like that, but you should be able to show the big idea potential of your hack. AngelHack is a launchpad for you to flush out and validate projects youve always wanted to build. Previous winners include: Appetas, GiveGo, TapFame, SnapStore, ShareBrowse, Kloutron, & Blue Dragon Security.

What are the rules?
All code must be FRESH. Prior to the hackathon you can create your design, wireframes, logo, and user flows. You can even build hardware. But to make things completely fair you can not write any code whatsoever until the hackathon starts. All code must be built at AngelHack.

For more info visit our Rules and FAQ pages.

Good Luck,
Gregory Gopman
AngelHack Founder / CEO

As seen in

events.name: Appsterdam phpBB Hackathon
events.about:
From Nov 9th to Nov 12th 2012 phpBB contributors will come together in Amsterdam to work on cool new features, squash bugs, write documentation and to improve infrastructure. Youre invited to come and help out! All tickets are free, but we ask that you signup so we can make sure there is enough space available and so there will be lunch and beverages for everyone.

Each day starts at 9am with breakfast (and coffee!). After a brief discussion we split into groups to work on the various projects. Before lunch we will come together to show each other the progress weve made and after lunch we split into groups again. Around 6pm well have a last meeting to discuss each projects progress. Afterwards well head out for dinner and drinks and meet again the next morning.

Appsterdam was kind enough to offer to host us. Check out their website to see what else they do and which other events they organize!

events.name: WOWZAPP 2012: Worldwide Hackathon for Windows -- Bern, Switzerland
events.about:
Hands-on Lab in Bern, in Collaboration with .NET User Group Bern and .NET User Group Zentralschweiz

Be part of the worldwide Microsoft WOWZAPP Hackathon for Windows, and win a Samsung ATIV Tab!

 

Agenda:

08:45 – 09:15     Registration

09:15 – 10:30     Introduction and registration to the WOWZAPP Hackathon and
Windows 8 Apps Overview

10:30 – 10:45     Break

10:45 – 14:45     Hands-on Lab “The Contoso Cookbook App”

12:15 – 13:15     Lunch

14:45 – 15:00     Draw of Samsung ATIV Tab

 

Part 1: MSDN TechTalk –Windows 8 Apps Overview
If you want to get up to speed with this important release, this overview session is for you. We will introduce you to Windows 8, explaining the peculiarities of the new development platform for applications and the coexistence with the current development technologies. At the same time you will learn how you can benefit from the biggest opportunity presented by the Windows Store. This session will be held in German.

Part 2: MSDN Hands-On-Lab – Learn all About Developing Windows 8 Apps
Then, after the break, if you want to learn more about developing Windows 8 apps, you will have the chance to build your first app on your own with the support of Microsoft employees, using the language and technology you prefer. You can choose between two versions of the same lab (manual only available in English): one based on HTML and JavaScript, the other one based on XAML and C#. The goal of the lab is to make you acquire the skills needed to write compelling and store-ready apps. 

Please bring your own laptop/tablet with the following software pre-installed: 

Windows 8 RTM
If you’re an MSDN subscriber, you can get Windows 8 RTM from MSDN Subscriber Downloads. 
If you’re not an MSDN subscriber, you can download an evaluation version of Windows 8 RTM from Evaluation Center. Note this version will expire and you cannot upgrade.

Visual Studio 2012 RTM
Microsoft Visual Studio Express 2012 for Windows 8 is your tool to build Windows 8 apps. It includes the Windows 8 SDK, Blend for Visual Studio, and project templates. You must first install Windows 8 RTM.
Get details and additional languages
Download now

events.name: WOWZAPP 2012: Worldwide Hackathon for Windows -- Seoul, Korea
events.about:
Be part of the app revolution!

여러분들의 도전을 응원합니다!

By registering, you’ll be joining thousands of developers worldwide as we build apps for the next generation of Windows.

전세계 학생 개발자들의 축제! 월드와이드 윈도우 8 해커톤에 참여하시는 여러분들을 환영합니다! 88명의 대한민국 국가대표 학생 개발자들과 함께 합니다!

대한민국의 대표 학생 개발자는 바로 나! 지금 바로 신청하세요!

Expert Help, Free Resources

여러분들의 도전을 함께 하겠습니다.

Microsoft app experts, developers and trainers will be available on-site to assist your learning and coding. Learn about building Windows Store apps today – download the info, tools and resources you need now. 

마이크로소프트의 무료 소프트웨어 지원 프로그램 드림스파크를 통해 개발자 계정 무료 등록 및 많은 교육 자료를 사전에 접하실 수 있습니다! 이 곳 링크를 통해서 영문자료와 (info, tools and resources) 한국에서 직접 에반젤리스트가 제공하는 Hands-on-Lab 실습 동영상이 준비되어 있습니다. (http://aka.ms/contosokr)  

Windows Azure Mobile Services

Does your Store app idea include cloud services or storage? Check out Get started withMobile Services –registered student WOWZAPP 2012 participants are eligible for a FREE student Windows Azure six-month subscription!– supplies are limited so be sure to register now!

Korea WOWZAPP Agenda Details

Day 1 (11/9) APP STAR Awards Special Judges

오후 12시 입장 / 오후 1시부터 3시까지 APP STar Awards 심사 진행

88명의 월드와이드 해커톤 참여자들은 첫날, 앱스타어워즈의 특별 심사위원으로 초대됩니다. 특별 심사위원으로 초대되는 88명의 월드와이드 대한민국 국가대표들에게는 그날의 특별한 선물이 기다리고 있습니다! 여러분들이 직접! 한국의 새로운 앱스타를 선발해주세요! 그리고, Next Time is YOURS!

Day 2~3 (11/10~11) WOWZAPP Real Hackathon

오후 10시부터 다음날 아침 10시까지! 24시간을 불태우자!

88명의 월드와이드 해커톤 참여자들은 토요일 아침 10시부터 다음날 일요일 아침 10시까지 24시간내에 앱을 완성해야 합니다.

앱의 참여주제는 자유입니다. 반드시 제출시간내에 앱을 완성, 패키징하여 스토어에 제출이 완료되어야 합니다.

자세한 한국의 이벤트들은 등록되신 분들을 대상으로 별도 이메일을 11월 1일경 발송할 예정입니다. 자세한 사항 및 궁금하신 사항은 studentappkr@live.com 으로 메일주시기 바랍니다.

NOTE: This event is being held in a different location on Day 2 and Day 3. Please see your event confirmation once you have registered for full location details

events.name: WOWZAPP 2012: Worldwide Hackathon for Windows -- Ljubljana, Slovenia
events.about:
Postani del revolucije v gradnji aplikacij!

Z udeležbo na dogodku, se boš pridružil tisočem razvijalcem in oblikovalcem po vsem svetu in skupaj bomo zgradili aplikacije za novo generacijo operacijskega sistema Windows 8.

Prijavite se na ITIME+ in ImagineCup

Dogodek WOWZAPP 2012 hackaton je del pospeševalnika idej ITIME+ in izbora ImagineCup, zato je udeležba odlična priložnost, da oblikujete ekipo, izdelate rešitev in se pripravite na prijavo na omenjena programa.

Sodelovanje v skupinah

Na dogodku bomo vzpodbujali tudi delo v skupinah. Vsi obiskovalci WOWZAPP 2012 hackatona, boste imeli priložnost, da predstavite svojo idejo pred vsemi udeleženci in se formirate v skupine (primer: udeleženec z dobro idejo želi za pomoč dodatnega programerja ali oblikovalca).   

Pomoč strokovnjakov in brezplačni viri

Na voljo vam bodo odlični strokovnjaki za gradnjo Windows 8 aplikacij. kljub temu pa se že danes začnite pripravljati – prenesite si vse potrebno za gradnjo in razvoj. 

Windows Azure Mobile Services

Ali vaša aplikacija potrebuje tudi prostor za shranjevanje? Preverite kako zgraditi zaledni sistem s pomočjo Windows Azure Mobile Services. Vsak  letošnji WOWZAPP 2012 udeleženec je upravičen do 6-mesečnega dostopa do Windows Azure storitve. 

Vsebina srečanja:

Petek - 9.11.2012

15:00 - 18:00 - Uvodna delavnica za razvoj Windows 8 aplikacij

18:00 - 18:10 - Uradna otvoritev WOWZAPP 2012 Hackatona

18:10 - 18:30 - Predavanje Kaj je sploh dobra Windows 8 aplikacija?

18:30 - 19:30 - Predstavitev idej za sestavo novih skupin

19:30 - 21:00 - Večerja in sestavljanje skupin

21:00 - 21:00 (10.11.2012) - WOWZAPP 2012 - 24urni Hackaton

Sobota - 10.11.2012

  8:00 - 10:00 - Zajtrk

13:00 - 14:30 - Kosilo

21:00 - 00:00 - Kostanjev piknik

Nedelja - 11.11.2012

  8:00 - 10:00 - Zajtrk

10:00 - 12:00 - Javna predstavitev aplikacij in snemanje

12:00 - 12:10 - Uradni zaključni nagovor in zaključek WOWZAPP 2012

Windows Azure Mobile Services

Ali vaša aplikacija potrebuje tudi prostor za shranjevanje? Preverite kako zgraditi zaledni sistem s pomočjo Windows Azure Mobile Services. Vsak  letošnji WOWZAPP 2012 udeleženec je upravičen do 6-mesečnega dostopa do Windows Azure storitve.

WOWZAPP Windows 8 Hackathon in Berlin

Melde dich jetzt an und werde Teil des weltweiten Windows 8 Hackathons! Vom 9. bis 11. November finden weltweit in über 40 Ländern Windows 8 Hackathons statt. Der deutsche Hackathon findet im Loft aka Dark Side Bakery in Berlin Mitte statt. Wir schalten live auf die anderen Kontinente und sind mit Microsoft Experten, Entwicklern und Trainern die gesamte Zeit vor Ort, um dir bei der Umsetzung deiner Ideen zu helfen. Der Hackathon startet am Freitag um 16h und Samstag und Sonntag jeweils um 10h. Nachtschichten sind nicht geplant aber auch nicht ausgeschlossen :)

events.name: WOWZAPP 2012: Worldwide Hackathon for Windows -- Wallisellen/Zurich, Switzerland
events.about:
WOWZAPP – The Worldwide Microsoft Hackathon for Windows

Be part of the worldwide Microsoft WOWZAPP Hackathon for Windows! Join us for a coding night with pizza and drinks. And win a Samsung ATIV Tab!

Agenda:

16:00 – 16:15     Registration

16:15 – 17:30     Introduction and registration to the WOWZAPP Hackathon and Windows 8 Apps Overview

17:30 – 17:45     Break

17:45 – 21:45     Coding Lab “The Contoso Cookbook App” and Expert Lounge

21:45 – 22:00     Draw of Samsung ATIV Tab

Pizza, soft drinks, Red Bull, coffee, beer as well as candy bars and fruit will be available all night.

Part 1: MSDN TechTalk –Windows 8 Apps Overview
If you want to get up to speed with this important release, this overview session is for you. We will introduce you to Windows 8, explaining the peculiarities of the new development platform for applications and the coexistence with the current development technologies. At the same time you will learn how you can benefit from the biggest opportunity presented by the Windows Store. This session will be held in English.

Part 2: MSDN Hands-On-Lab – Learn all About Developing Windows 8 Apps
Then, after the break, if you want to learn more about developing Windows 8 apps, you will have the chance to build your first app on your own with the support of Microsoft employees, using the language and technology you prefer. You can choose between two versions of the same lab (manual only available in English): one based on HTML and JavaScript, the other one based on XAML and C#. The goal of the lab is to make you acquire the skills needed to write compelling and store-ready apps.

Expert Lounge

Are you already working on an app? Do you have an idea and want to discuss its feasibility and options? Or are you almost done and need some ideas on how to market your app? Come to our Expert Lounge and meet with peers to discuss your ideas and questions!

Please bring your own laptop/tablet with the following software pre-installed:

Windows 8 RTM
If you’re an MSDN subscriber, you can get Windows 8 RTM from MSDN Subscriber Downloads.
If you’re not an MSDN subscriber, you can download an evaluation version of Windows 8 RTM from Evaluation Center. Note this version will expire and you cannot upgrade.

Visual Studio 2012 RTM
Microsoft Visual Studio Express 2012 for Windows 8 is your tool to build Windows 8 apps. It includes the Windows 8 SDK, Blend for Visual Studio, and project templates. You must first install Windows 8 RTM.
Get details and additional languages
Download Now

events.name: HackPrinceton Fall 2012
events.about:
Do you want to make cool apps for the iPhone? Have a crazy hardware design that just needs to be built? Want to win awesome swag and cash prizes? Network with fellow entrepreneurs and mentors from various businesses and tech companies? Come to HackPrinceton!

Our 2012 fall hackathon will be held the weekend after fall break, and is open to students of all levels. Developers, designers, and startup enthusiasts are all welcome to come together and share ideas, form teams, and build products.

This year, we have both software and hardware tracks, with grants available for a select number of hardware projects. We also have a variety of prizes available for technical, business, design, and more categories.

events.name: Trondheim Startup Weekend
events.about:
Now you have the chance to create a business during one weekend. StartupWeekend is repeating it’s success in Trondheim at 9-11th November.

You will get the opportunity to try out a business idea, join a team of enthusiastic people, and get connections that can transform your life. And the best part is that you actually get to be part of building stuff for real. It is a fast paced weekend where you will be thrown into tasks you might never have done before — an excellent opportunity to learn new skills. StartupWeekend is coming to Trondheim for the second time.

I bet you wonder how it all works. We start the weekend with an open microphone session where project ideas are pitched. If your brilliant idea is not ready yet, don’t worry — pitching is optional. The most popular projects are found by voting. You are free to join any team/project you like. Throughout the weekend we have mentors, facilitating the teams, and there will be small workshops about entrepreneurship. StartupWeekend has a focus on lean startup methodology. You will learn to do market validation, customer development, and your team will build a minimum viable product. At the end of the weekend you have the chance to win amazing prices from our sponsors.

Participants are a mix of all kinds of professions and students. Anybody with an interest in entrepreneurship are welcome to join. Typical backgrounds are engineers, designers, economists, students, doctors, humanist. The more cross-disciplinary the teams are, the better.

events.about:
¿Qué es WOWZAPP?

WOWZAPP es el primer hackathon de Windows 8 que se va a llevar a cabo de forma simultánea en todo el mundo.

Durante los días 9, 10 y 11 de noviembre, los participantes acudirán para crear a contrarreloj una app para Windows 8, la cual competirá contra otros equipos a nivel local.

Previo al hackathon los alumnos de la universidad recibirán formación sobre cómo programar apps para Windows 8 usando C#/XAML y contarán con mentores que les ayudarán durante el fin de semana.

events.name: WOWZAPP 2012: Worldwide Hackathon for Windows -- Vienna, Austria
events.about:
Be part of the App revolution!

An diesem 3-tätigem Appathon können Euch Windows 8 Experten, Developer und Trainer rund um die Uhr und vor Ort mit Tipps und Tricks beim App Development unterstützen.

Schon heute könnt Ihr alle relevanten Infos, Tools und Ressourcen downloaden und uns beimWindows 8 Camp, z.B. am 8. November 2012, besuchen, wo wir Euch mit Windows 8 und Modern UI Trainings/Vorträgen zeigen, was es beim Entwickeln für Windows 8 Apps zu Beachten gibt.

Neben den weltweiten Streaming Sessions zeigen wir Euch in lokalen 30 Minuten Sessions diesen Content:

Windows 8 - folgt demnächst

Windows 8 - folgt demnächst

Windoes 8 - NFC (Andreas Jakl)

Windows Phone 8 - Neues für Entwickler (Robert John)

Windows Phone 8 - Multitasking und location based Services (Robert John)

Windows 8 und die Cloud: better together (Jürgen Mayrbäuerl)

Für alle, deren App Idee mit Cloud Services und Storage verwirklicht werden kann, gibt es dieses Angebot für registrierte WOWZAPP 2012 Teilnehmer: eine kostenlose 6-Monats Azure Subsciption!

events.name: espnW Hack Day 2012
events.about:
This fall, ESPN will host its first public Hack event under the espnW brand in partnership with Stanford University. The espnW Hack Day event will bring women in technology — who also love sports -- together to collaborate on mobile, digital and social products for sports fans and athletes.

There will be prizes for the best applications for serving sports fans, as well as for best usage of partner APIs.

Free admission: Coffee, Lunch, Dinner + hack snacks included.

All Experience Levels Welcome.

Brought to you by ESPN, Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, Twilio & Mashery

Tweet about it using #hackespnW

 

Schedule Details

Friday November 9, 2012

  • 5:00PM Registration / Appetizers & Beverages
  • 6:00pm Welcome Address
  • 6:15pm API Demos from ESPN, Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, Twilio, Mashery
  • 7:00pm Idea Pitches
  • 7:45pm Team Formation + Networking
  • 9:00pm Doors Close

Saturday November 10, 2012

  • 8:00 - 9:00am Registration / Breakfast
  • 9:00 - 10:00am Intro / API Demos
  • 10:00am – 6:00pm Hacking! Coding! Designing!
  • 12:30 - 1:30pm Lunch
  • 1:30 - 5:30pm Mad Afternoon Rush to finish hack
  • 1:30 - 5:30pm Mad rush to finish hack
  • 6:00pm Submission Deadline
  • 6:00 - 6:30pm Dinner
  • 6:30 - 7:45pm Presentations
  • 7:45 - 8:15pm Judging
  • 8:15 - 8:45pm Awards
  • 9:00pm Doors Close 

Prizes 

  • Best Use of Twilio API: Nike Fuel Bands and $50 Twilio credit for each member winning team (Maximum: 4 team members)
  • Best Use of Facebook API $750 in Facebook Ads credits and a Facebook sweatshirt for each team member
  • Best Use of Twitter API Twitter Schwag Bags (Maximum: 4 team members)
  • Best Use of YouTube API Nexus 7 Tablet
  • Best Demo of Mashery API Network: BIG JAMBOX by Jawbone
  • More prizes coming soon!
 

Judges

Confirmed judges include:

  • Rob King (SVP Editorial, ESPN Digital and Print Media)
  • Danielle Tiedt (Chief Marketing Officer, YouTube)
  • Sara Haider (Sr. Software Engineer, Twitter for Android)
  • Sophia Chung (Software Engineer, Facebook)
  • Jessica Kahn (VP, Product, Engineering, and Operations, Disney Mobile)

Additional judges and speakers will be announced soon.

 

Directions and Parking

From Highway 101 North & South or El Camino Real

Take the Embarcadero Road exit west toward Stanford. At El Camino Real, Embarcadero becomes Galvez Street as it enters the university. Stay in the left lane on Galvez and at the stop sign turn left onto Campus Drive. Continue on Campus Drive until you reach Mayfield Ave (about 1 mile). Turn right onto Mayfield Ave. After a forced left turn there is a large parking lot off of Mayfield on the right side. (Parking is $1.50 per hour from 8 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. and credit cards, bills and coins are accepted.) If you park as far from Mayfield Ave. as you can, you will be in closer proximity to our building. Once parked, walk north towards Tresidder Union which can be recognized by its outdoor tables. Walk with the Tresidder Union on your left side and you will see the Old Union directly in front of you. Take a left to walk between Tresidder Union and Old Union, and then a right onto Duena Street, keeping Old Union on your right. At the next intersection with Panama Mall, make a left onto Panama. The d.school is two buildings down. On several doors, you’ll see “Thomas F. Peterson Engineering Laboratory.” You’ve arrived!

From Highway 280 North & South

Exit at Alpine Road. Take Alpine Road east toward Palo Alto. Turn right at the first light onto Junipero Serra Blvd. Turn left at the first light onto Campus Drive West. Take the second right onto Santa Teresa St. After two blocks, take a right onto Lomita Rd. Drive one block and turn left onto Mayfield Ave. There is a large parking lot off of Mayfield on the left side. (Parking is $1.50 per hour from 8 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. and credit cards, bills and coins are accepted.) If you park as far from Mayfield Ave. as you can, you will be in closer proximity to our building. Once parked, walk north towards Tresidder Union which can be recognized by its outdoor tables. Walk with the Tresidder Union on your left side and you will see the Old Union directly in front of you. Take a left to walk between Tresidder Union and Old Union, and then a right onto Duena Street, keeping Old Union on your right. At the next intersection, Panama Mall, make a left onto Panama. The d.school is two buildings down. On several doors, you’ll see “Thomas F. Peterson Engineering Laboratory.”

Additional parking and directions information can be found on the Stanford d.school site.

 

Brought to you by

events.name: imo Hackathon@Northwestern
events.about:
imo Hackathon@Northwestern is an event hosted by Hack Northwestern and sponsored by imo.im, a quickly growing Silicon Valley start-up co-founded by one of the first 10 employees at Google. The hackathon is designed for students in the Chicago-land area to build collaborative apps that can be discoverable by imo’s millions of users.

We want this hackathon to be fun while allowing students to show off their skills - and get rewarded for their talents.

Coders will have 22 hours to build an app for the chance to win big prizes and get a leg up in imo’s recruiting process. And of course, it wouldnt be an event without free food and swag.

If you are attending the event and would like to send your resume in before or after the event, please email jobs@imo.im with the subject line JOB ID: 012.

This event is open to all university students, not just Northwestern students. Just remember your university email address!

Please visit http://hacknorthwestern.com/imo-hackathon.html to find out more.

Prizes:

  • First Place: $1,000 Amazon gift card for the team
  • Second Place: $600 Amazon gift card for the team
  • Third Place: $200 Amazon gift card for the team

Social Media:

  • Follow us @imoim for live updates and photos from the event; #imoHackathon
  • Like Hack NU on Facebook! https://www.facebook.com/HackNorthwestern?fref=ts
  • “Like” imo on Facebook! https://www.facebook.com/imo.im?fref=ts

events.name: WOWZAPP 2012 Worldwide Hackathon for Windows -- Madrid
events.about:
¿Qué es WOWZAPP?

WOWZAPP es el primer hackathon de Windows 8 que se va a llevar a cabo de forma simultánea en todo el mundo.

Durante los días 9, 10 y 11 de noviembre, los participantes acudirán para crear a contrarreloj una app para Windows 8, la cual competirá contra otros equipos a nivel local.

Previo al hackathon los alumnos de la universidad recibirán formación sobre cómo programar apps para Windows 8 usando C#/XAML y contarán con mentores que les ayudarán durante el fin de semana.

Las mejores apps recibirán un premio y una vez cumpla con los requisitos de UX, rendimiento, seguridad y accesibilidad claves para publicar en la Windows Store, podrá ser publicada.

Horarios:

Viernes 9 de 17:00 a 19:00

Sábado 10 de 10:00 a 19:00

Domingo de 10:00 a 14:00

Sala 3301 de la Escuela Universitaria de Informática de la Universidad Politécnica de Madrid

events.name: WOWZAPP 2012: Worldwide Hackathon for Windows -- Mexico City, Mexico
events.about:
Los fresas se van al antro el viernes; los geeks nos reunimos a programar Apps!

Como parte del lanzamiento de Windows 8, te invitamos a participar en este Hackathon de 24 horas, en donde tu y un grupo de 100 personas entre desarrolladores, diseñadores, emprendedores y expertos en tecnología nos reuniremos para programar, divertirnos, compartir conocimiento y publicar Apps para Windows 8, teniendo la oportunidad de ganar alguna de las increibles tabletas con Windows 8 entre otros premios.

Esta es la agenda

Viernes 9

05:00 pm - Bienvenida al evento y a los equipos participantes
05:30 pm - Presentación de Windows 8, mécanica del evento y premios
06:30 pm - PitchFire (cada equipo presentará en 1 minuto la idea de su App)
07:30 pm - Hacking time...
09:30 pm - Cena (tacos al pastor) y DJ con música de los 80´s
10:30 pm y toda la noche - Hacking time acompañado de bebidas energéticas, refrescos, cervezas, papas, dulces, café y mucho ambiente de colaboración para terminar Apps sorprendentes!.

Sabado 10

09:00 am - Desayuno (waffles) y presentación de avances
10:00 am - Presentación El ecosistema de Apps en México y Windows 8
11:00 am - Hacking time
02:00 pm - Inicio de presentación de las Apps terminadas (yeah!)
04:00 pm - Anuncio de los ganadores, premiación y cierre del evento (todos a dormir)

 

 

Estas son las reglas

1.- Equipos de máximo 3 personas pudiendo combinar programadores, diseñádores, expertos de negocio, etc. cada uno de los integrantes necesita registrarse y enviar una breve descripción de su App para que la idea sea aceptada y su lugar asegurado el día del evento a este correo fcuevas@microsoft.com antes del viernes 2 de Noviembre a las 12:00 pm .

Nota: La lista de los asistentes con lugar asegurado será publicada aquí ;Si tu nombre no aparece publicado no será posible tu participación. 

2.- Se  pueden llevar al Hackathon avances de su app (código fuente, diseño gráfico, u otros recursos) con la finalidad de garantizar que será terminada al menos en su versión inicial; Es responsabilidad de los integrantes de cada equipo llevar sus computadoras o hardware y software necesario para el Hackathon.

Algunas ideas de Apps para que te animes

  • App que ayuda a los niños de primaria a conocer los estados de la republica mexicana, rios, montañas etc. haciendo uso de la experiencia touch y audio.
  • App que utilice Bing Maps para geolocalizar las estaciones de Ecobici en la ciudad de México.
  • Videojuego de la clásica lotería mexicana, de serpientes y escaleras o el famoso turista.
  • App que utilice Windows Azure mobile services para levantar encuestas utilizando la experiencia de uso que ofrece una tableta.
  • Videojuego estilo Adivina Quien que te permita multiples jugadores online y que las fotos puedan ser tomadas de tu red social.
  • App que muestra el calendario maya y la descripción de los simbolos utilizando Semantic Zoom.

events.name: Startup Weekend Presents: The Battle for the Charles
events.about:
Startup Weekend Presents:

The Battle For The Charles

For all event details, visit boston.startupweekend.org

Join the battle to create and innovate!

Startup Weekend is a global grassroots movement of active and empowered entrepreneurs who are learning the basics of founding startups and launching successful ventures. It is the largest community of passionate entrepreneurs with over 400 past events in 100 countries around the world in 2011.

This year, Boston presents The Battle For The Charles, a staged event where teams from Boston go head-to-head with their best new ideas and concepts, followed by a 54-hour frenzy of business model creation, coding, designing, and market validation, culminating in a showdown on Sunday, November 11th, when one team will reign supreme!


FRIDAY Band together at NERD with other passionate collaborators, form a squad, find your Home Base, and start your Battle plans!
SATURDAY Report to your Home Base (NERD or Bocoup Loft), meet with mentors, collaborate and innovate, and get ready for Battle!
SUNDAY Invade NERD, finish preparations for Battle, take down the competition, claim your spoils, and celebrate at the after party! 


Victory at home is only the first step toward Global Startup Battle domination! Bostons top teams will have the opportunity to compete against winners from around the world until just one startup is left standing. Prizes include launch packages, VIP trips to Rio De Janiero and San Francisco, design services, legal support, and more!


The non-profit organization is headquartered in Seattle, Washington but Startup Weekend organizers and facilitators can be found in over 200 cities around the world. From Mongolia to South Africa to London to Brazil, people around the globe are coming together for weekend long workshops to pitch ideas, form teams, and start companies.

Whether entrepreneurs found companies, find a cofounder, meet someone new, or learn a skill far outside their usual 9-to-5, everyone is guaranteed to leave the event better prepared to navigate the chaotic but fun world of startups. If you want to put yourself in the shoes of an entrepreneur, register now for the best weekend of your life!


Refund Policy:  No refunds will be granted within 7 days of the event if food and drink have already been ordered. Apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

events.name: Startup Weekend Trojmiasto
events.about:
Ever wondered what it takes to be an entrepreneur? The professional and personal challenges, the high and lows, the failures and the success? Startup Weekend is a global grassroots movement of active and empowered entrepreneurs who are learning the basics of founding startups and launching successful ventures. It is the largest community of passionate entrepreneurs with over 400 past events in 100 countries around the world in 2011.

All Startup Weekend events follow the same basic model: anyone is welcome to pitch their startup idea and receive feedback from their peers. Teams organically form around the top ideas (as determined by popular vote) and then it’s a 54 hour frenzy of business model creation, coding, designing, and market validation. The weekends culminate with presentations in front of local entrepreneurial leaders with another opportunity for critical feedback.

Startup Weekend Trojmiasto Nov 2012 will be a part of Global Entrepreneurship Week. Thanks to that winners will be eligible to compete in Global Startup Battle not only for fame and glory but also for very cool prizes – trip to Global Entrepreneurship Congress in Rio De Janeiro, trip to Silicon Valey, $50,000 in services and more!

Whether entrepreneurs found companies, find a cofounder, meet someone new, or learn a skill far outside their usual 9-to-5, everyone is guaranteed to leave the event better prepared to navigate the chaotic but fun world of startups.

Startup Weekend is an intense 54-hour event which focuses on building a web or mobile application that could form the basis of a credible business over the course of a weekend. The weekend brings together people with different skillsets – primarily software developers, graphics designers and business people – to build applications and develop a commercial case around them.

events.name: Bangkok Startup Weekend
events.about:
Event Details

Participants : 60 People

Tickets Open on Sale

Early Bird 2,000 Baht


Normal 3,000 Baht

Rules

1. Participants must remain at the event for 54 hours until after pitching & announcing the winner 

2. Participants can leave in case of emergency only

3. Anyone who is not a participants, facilitators, mentors, presss or judges are not allow in the event

3. Please , prepare sleeping bag or sleeping equipment and shower equipment for yourself.

Contact me :

Email : bangkok@startupweekend.org

Follow us : www.facebook.com/startupweekendbangkok

My Page : http://bangkok.startupweekend.org 

For all event details, visit bangkok.startupweekend.org

Thanks!

Startup Weekend Crew

Refund Policy:  No refunds will be granted within 7 days of the event if food and drink have already been ordered. Apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

About Startup Weekend: Startup Weekends are 54-hour events designed to provide superior experiential education for technical and non-technical entrepreneurs.  Beginning with Friday night pitches and continuing through brainstorming, business plan development, and basic prototype creation, Startup Weekends culminate in Sunday night demos and presentations.  Participants create working startups during the event and are able to collaborate with like-minded individuals outside of their daily networks. All teams hear talks by industry leaders and receive valuable feedback from local entrepreneurials. The weekend is centered around action, innovation, and education.  Whether you are looking for feedback on a idea, a co-founder, specific skill sets, or a team to help you execute, Startup Weekends are the perfect environment in which to test your idea and take the first steps towards launching your own startup.

events.name: Bern Startup Weekend
events.about:
Von der Idee bis zur Unternehmensgründung in 48 Stunden
  • Du hast eine Idee und suchst talentierte Teammitglieder?
  • Du hast Talent und willst es einbringen, um eine neue Idee umzusetzen?
  • Du willst lernen, wie aus einer Idee ein Geschäftsmodell wird?

Am Startup Weekend Bern triffst du qualifizierte Teilnehmer aus allen Disziplinen, vom Programmierer über den Marketingexperten bis zum Agrartechniker. Zusammen entwickelt ihr in 54 Stunden aus euren Ideen Geschäftsmodelle und vielleicht schon den ersten Prototypen. Dabei werdet ihr von inspirierenden Coaches und hochkarätigen StartUp-Experten unterstützt und erhaltet die Chance, eure Ideen vor potenziellen Investoren zu präsentieren.

Per sofort kannst Du Dich für einen der 99 freien Plätze bewerben.

Im Preis inbegriffen sind neben den Referaten und dem Coaching auch die gesamte Verpflegung inkl. Getränke (ja, wirklich). Ausserdem erhalten alle Teilnehmer ein attraktives Paket aus Gutscheinen und Dienstleistungen die jedes StartUp Tag für Tag gebrauchen kann.

events.name: Bretagne Startup Weekend
events.about:
Ce que cela représente comme défi professionnel et personnel ? Les hauts et les bas, les échecs ou les succès ? 
  
  Startup Weekend, c’est la plus grande communauté d’entrepreneurs du monde avec plus de 400 événements organisés à travers le monde en 2011. 
  
  Berceau de la première édition bretonne en 2011, Lannion accueille un an après la troisième édition du Startup Weekend Bretagne le weekend du 9 au 11 novembre 2012, en ouverture de la semaine internationale de lentrepreunariat ! 
  
    Startup Weekend cest en premier lieu l’apprentissage de la création dentreprise par l’action. 
  
  Autour de votre idée ou celle d’un autre participant, vous disposez d’une équipe et de 54 heures pour construire ce projet, et le transformer en entreprise ! A la fin du temps imparti vous présenterez l’aboutissement de votre travail devant un jury d’experts, qui aura la lourde tâche de vous départager parmi l’ensemble des projets et récompenser ceux qu’ils ont préférés. Vous aurez alors toutes les cartes en main pour poursuivre l’aventure plus loin… 
  
  Cest ce quont fait Zéro-Gâchis, notre premier lauréat, Jelouemoncampingcar.com ou encore BeeWatch suite à lédition de lannée dernière !  
  
  Startup Weekend, c’est également l’occasion pour tout entrepreneur ou créateur d’entreprise de trouver un co-fondateur, rencontrer de nouvelles personnes, ou apprendre de nouvelles compétences en dehors de son métier habituel.  
  
  C’est aussi l’occasion de venir tester une idée, d’en discuter avec un public expérimenté et passionné, et ainsi approfondir sa réflexion, afin que chacun soit garanti de quitter l’événement, mieux préparé à naviguer dans le monde chaotique mais amusant de la startup !  
  
  Pendant ces 54 heures, vous allez travailler dans une ambiance surchauffée, faire des rencontres exceptionnelles, vous amuser et vous récompense avec cocktail, buffet et goodies tout au long du weekend!!! Et bien entendu on vous réserve quelques surprises…  
  
  Le rendez-vous est donc pris pour le vendredi 9 novembre 2012 pour écrire une nouvelle page de lentrepreneuriat breton tous ensemble !

events.name: Buenos Aires Startup Weekend
events.about:
The professional and personal challenges, the high and lows, the failures and the success?

Startup Weekend is a global grassroots movement of active and empowered entrepreneurs who are learning the basics of founding startups and launching successful ventures. It is the largest community of passionate entrepreneurs with over 400 past events in 100 countries around the world in 2011.

The non-profit organization is headquartered in Seattle, Washington but Startup Weekend organizers and facilitators can be found in over 200 cities around the world. From Mongolia to South Africa to London to Brazil, people around the globe are coming together for weekend long workshops to pitch ideas, form teams, and start companies.

All Startup Weekend events follow the same basic model: anyone is welcome to pitch their startup idea and receive feedback from their peers. Teams organically form around the top ideas (as determined by popular vote) and then it’s a 54 hour frenzy of business model creation, coding, designing, and market validation. The weekends culminate with presentations in front of local entrepreneurial leaders with another opportunity for critical feedback.

Whether entrepreneurs found companies, find a cofounder, meet someone new, or learn a skill far outside their usual 9-to-5, everyone is guaranteed to leave the event better prepared to navigate the chaotic but fun world of startups. If you want to put yourself in the shoes of an entrepreneur, register now for the best weekend of your life!

events.name: Cambridge Startup Weekend-SVC2UK
events.about:
Startup Weekend and Silicon Valley comes to the UK are teaming up to bring the craziness of the 54-hour long events simultaneously in London, Manchester, Sheffield, Southampton and Cambridge this coming November. Those events will bring developers, designers, marketers, product managers and startup enthusiasts to come together to share ideas, form teams, build products, and launch startups!

What is specific about the Startup Weekend-SVC2UK events?

Teams will be free to work on any startup they want but they will have access to UK government data sets from data.gov.uk to build startups. Participants will use this data to produce high impact applications/websites to unlock the power of public data to help “rewrite the rules of the new economy”

After the weekend, the top startups will be invited to attend an exclusive awards ceremony in central London in November and will also get the chance to fight in the Global Startup Battle taking place between the 130 Startup Weekend events during GEW.

Thanks!

Startup Weekend Crew

events.name: Startup (Military) Veterans Day Weekend/Hackathon + Basic Training!!
events.about:
JOIN US!!!!

Calling all returning military veterans of Iraq & Afghanistan service AND the tech community in the SF Bay Area!

The Startup Veteran’s Day Weekend/Hackathon –

Join VetsinTech,  and Co-Chair Craig Newmark

Keynote Speaker - TBD VIP

NOTE: All meals are provided!!

For more info, schedule, speakers, sponsors and more (TBD)...

visit http://vetsintech.co/veterans-day-weekend-hackathon/

Our Objective: to support our returning bay area veterans - thru education, re-integration, and by connecting to the tech ecosystem in SF Bay Area!

In this two-day event the tech community in SF will come together to support our returning Iraq/Afghan veterans.  Teams of approximately 5-10 people will be formed with a variety of skills -the vets can have the idea, help with business plan, marketing or just sit in to audit/participate for educational purposes – vet coding skills are NOT required - however developers from the tech community are encouraged to attend!

Additional information can be found at www.vetsintech.co
