events.name: TechMeetups Hackathon: Mobile Apps #tmuhack
events.about:
TechMeetups Hackathon: Mobile Apps #tmuhack

9-11 November

venue tbc

For all developers, designers, ideas people interested in hacking Mobile apps for any platform!
 
Who’s it for?

  • Developers who have their own app idea or want to help someone build a prototype for any mobile platform.

  • Designers who have their own app idea or want to help a team create the best-looking app of the weekend.
  • Anyone else who either has an app idea or wants to join a team – every project needs a marketer or biz dev to create an app to take the market by storm.

What’s happening?
TechMeetups is holding a hackathon competition for those who want to get together and hack a prototype app in just 48 hours!

  • Friday evening: pitch your idea (or choose your favourite project from the pitches), form a team, hack a prototype and pitch it to our judges on Sunday night for the chance to win some great prizes to help launch your app on the market!
  • entors will be on hand to help you with all your dev and business development questions.

 

For a video about the last hackathon hosted by TechMeetups in London see: http://crave.cnet.co.uk/mobiles/android-and-ios-app-olympics-held-in-london-in-video-50007159/

** we also allow observers to attend the hackathon during the Friday night pitch session and judging on Sunday night.  To be an observer simply register for the relevant ticket **

WHAT STANDS BETWEEN YOU AND THE PRIZE?

Teams must submit working prototypes for judging on Sunday which will be judged by our jury.

Friday
6pm Doors open and networking
7pm Presentations
7:30pm App idea presentations
8pm Teams form & the competition begins

Saturday
The hackathon continues
1pm Lunch
2pm Teams continue hacking!
6pm Video checkpoints

Sunday
The hackathon continues
1pm Lunch
2pm The final stretch!
6pm Presentations
6:30pm Judging
7pm Winners announced

WANT TO JOIN IN BUT HAVE QUESTIONS? READ ON...

What do I need to be an idea generator?
You can be anyone with an app idea who wants to build a team and prototype.  If you’re a developer, come and find the designer and marketer for your project.  If you’re business minded, find developers and designers to bring your idea to life.

Can I work on an existing app idea?
Yes, you can work on an app idea that you and even your business has already researched, but you should not bring along ideas that you’ve already started coding – the weekend is all about building the all-important prototype.

What platforms can I develop for?
Whatever purpose you wish to build your app prototype for, TechMeetups and our mentors there to support you in building it!

Do I need to have a certain level of experience to get involved?
No, the hackathon is about learning as well as applying your skills so you can get involved no matter how experienced you are.

What’s expected of me over the weekend?
You’ll get most out of the weekend by joining a team and building a working prototype of your app over the weekend.  We’ll have plenty of mentors, both technical and business oriented, who can help you to use new tools and APIs, as well as help you evaluate how attractive and sticky your app is looking.

What should I bring?
Your enthusiasm, your portable computer, the mobile device you’re building for and your camera to immortalize the making of your application!

What is the judging criteria for theapps?
The apps will be judged on their usability, innovation, business potential and execution.

Who owns the apps created?
The apps are owned solely by their creators – we’ll provide you with some terms which you can use so your team knows where they all stand. Do note that we do not get involved legally so it is important that you discuss this with your team before you start on the prototype so everyone is clear on ownership.

SPONSORSHIP OPPORTUNITIES

Through TechMeetups’ growing global network of tech communities, the month of November will be the time when our 4,000+ members around the world are talking about mobile apps and hackathons at www.techmeetups.com and via social media channels.

If you’re interested in promoting your company throughout the month, here’s more about what you can expect:

As a Sponsor of the TechMeetups.com Hackathon: Mobile Apps month your brand will have both local and global exposure.  Our event attendees will be developers, designers, entrepreneurs and those interested in innovative technologies and tools for the purpose of growing their business or projects.

TechMeetups.com’s global audience has the same profile and is located across the USA, Europe and Asia where we have active and fast-growing networks.

Through our reach we’ll be marketing the event to the entire TechMeetups global community of over 4,000 members across all these cities.  For more information about our reach and activities, please visit www.techmeetups.com

Email us at sponsor@techmeetups.com for more details.

events.name: Startup Weekend for the Planet / Mexico City
events.about:
Startup Weekend es una red global de lideres y emprendedores que se unen en un evento de 54 horas para compartir sus ideas, formar equipos y validar el potencial de negocio de sus ideas, construir productos y lanzar startups. 
 
Durante el fin de semana tendrás la oportunidad de trabajar con personas de distintos perfiles como programadores, diseñadorespara para probar ideas de negocio y llevarlas hasta su máximo potencial. No te pierdas esta experiencia inolvidable.
 
Hoy en día tan solo individuo empoderado con una buena idea, determinación y la ayuda de algunas buenas herramientas puede retar a industrias completas. Esto nos ha llevado a crecer una nueva raza de emprendedores que están dispuestos a resolver los retos mas grandes a los que se enfrenta el planeta y la humanidad a través de la innovación. Ellos idean, generan prototipos y crean soluciones que generan valor para el planeta, la sociedad y la economía.

Porque SW edicion Planeta? Estamos viviendo en tiempos muy interesantes; caracterizados por movimientos masivos de poder, en donde ya no se requiere de estructuras gigantescas y complejas para transformar las ideas de una persona hacia una solución tangible.

Somos comunidad: Partimos de un origen común, y junto a nuestro planeta tierra compartimos un futuro común como especie. Un Futuro, que si miramos atrás depende de nosotros.

Participa diseñado el cambio hacia un mundo mejor. El fin de semana esta centrado en accion, innovacion y educacion para el emprendimiento. 

Refund Policy:  No refunds will be granted within 7 days of the event if food and drink have already been ordered. Apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

About Startup Weekend: Startup Weekends are 54-hour events designed to provide superior experiential education for technical and non-technical entrepreneurs.  Beginning with Friday night pitches and continuing through brainstorming, business plan development, and basic prototype creation, Startup Weekends culminate in Sunday night demos and presentations.  Participants create working startups during the event and are able to collaborate with like-minded individuals outside of their daily networks. All teams hear talks by industry leaders and receive valuable feedback from local entrepreneurials. The weekend is centered around action, innovation, and education.  Whether you are looking for feedback on a idea, a co-founder, specific skill sets, or a team to help you execute, Startup Weekends are the perfect environment in which to test your idea and take the first steps towards launching your own startup.

events.name: Evernote Hackathon Brazil
events.about:
Depois do grande sucesso da primeira edição, Evernote chega ao Brasil para mais um hackathon que irá movimentar a comunidade de desenvolvedores local.  Na última edição, dois times garantiram o seu lugar entre os seis finalistas da Evernote DEVCUP no Silicon Valley. Nessa ediçāo, além da viagem para o Silicon Valley para o grande ganhador, os  participantes poderão voltar para casa com tablets e diversos outros prêmios exclusivos ... e um super produto desenvolvido com todo o apoio do nosso time! E todos os participantes que submeterem suas soluçōes garantem uma conta premium do Evernote!

Em parceria com a Samsung, essa edição será novamente recepcionada pela Academia Wayra Brasil.

EVERNOTE

Nosso objetivo é oferecer a todos a possibilidade de capturar cada momento, ideia, inspiração ou experiência, sempre que se quiser e utilizando qualquer plataforma ou dispositivo . E, então, fazer com que seja sempre muito fácil encontrar essas informações.

Para conhecer melhor a nossa plataforma e nossos produtos, visite o nosso site no Brasil. E se você quiser conhecer as últimas novidades e conhecer melhor como as pessoas têm usado o Evernote, dê uma olhada o nosso blog. Para se inspirar e conhecer soluções desenvolvidas por nossos parceiros, confira o nosso baú. 

SAMSUNG

Presente no pais desde 1986, a Samsung é uma das principais fabricantes de produtos eletroeletrônicos do mercado nacional. Atua nas áreas de telefonia celular, smartphones, tablets, áudio e vídeo, linha branca, monitores, notebooks e soluções de impressão.

No Brasil, é pioneira na fabricação local de tablets, TVs com tecnologia LED, #D e Smart TVs. Sede para a América Latina, o país é o mais representativo para a Samsung na região.

REGRAS

  1. Todas as soluções desenvolvidas deverão obrigatoriamente utilizar a Evernote API.
  2. Todas soluções desenvolvidas devem funcionar perfeitamente na plataforma Android.
Não tem um dispositivo Android? A Samsung disponibilizará 12 tablets Galaxy Note 10.1 para que vocês possam desenvolver a sua ideia!

EVERNOTE API

Você já pode ir entendendo como funciona na nossa API, visitando a nossa página dedicada aos desenvolvedores, Evernote Developers. Em breve publicaremos um guia exclusivo para esse evento.

PREMIAÇÃO
 
TODOS OS PARTICIPANTES:
  • 1 tablet Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1, a ser sorteado entre as equipes participantes.
  • 3 meses de Evernote Premium (US$15).
  • Camiseta exclusiva do nosso hackathon. Se você nāo participou na edição anterior, comece a sua coleção agora!
  • Super high tech AdWipes & adesivos.
  • Mentoria completa da nossa equipe durante todo o hackathon, non-stop!
  • Outros presentes exclusivos. Aguarde!
VENCEDOR:
  • Viagem para o HQ do Evernote no Silicon Valley para até dois membros do time vencedor: uma semana de mentoria para a sua solução, no nosso HQ, com todas as despesas por nossa conta.
  • 1 tablet Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1
  • 1 ano de Evernote Premium
  • Uma camiseta oficial do Evernote
  • Outros presentes exclusivos. Aguarde!
RUNNER-UP:
  • 1 semana de mentoria da equipe Evernote para melhorar a sua solução
  • 1 tablet Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1
  • 1 ano de Evernote Premium
  • Uma camiseta oficial do Evernote
  • Outros presentes exclusivos. Aguarde!
 
NOSSO TIME DE ROCKSTARS
 
Para garantir que vocês terão todo o apoio necessário para construir as melhores soluções do mercado estamos trazendo  um time mais que estrelado do Silicon Valley e do Brasil. É uma oportunidade única para conhecer essa galera, aprender tudo sobre a Evernote API e aprender rapidamente todos os atalhos para construir as suas soluções rapidamente! 

EVERNOTE TEAM

Seth Hitchings 

VP of Platform Strategy

Seth Hitchings é responsável pelos times de Plataforma e Relacionamento com Desenvolvedores no Evernote. A equipe de Plataforma é responsável pela manutenção da API pública do Evernote e pela sua documentação, pelo formento a sua utlizaçāo, pelo suporte aos desenvolvedores que a utilizam e pela a manutenção do Evernote Trunk (baú).

Julien Boedec 

Developer Advocate 

Julien Boedec é responsável pelo suporte a desenvolvedores e pelo fórum de desenvolvedores do Evernote, além do relacionamento com nossos parceiros integradores. É a pessoa certa para responder todas as questōes que você possa ter em relação a nossa API. Fluente em inglês e francês. 

Ty Smith

Android Senior Software Engineer

Ty Smith é um dos engenheiros responsáveis pela versão Android do Evernote e pelo suporte ao SDK para Android do time de Plataforma e Relacionamento com os Desenvolvedores. Ele é a pessoa certa para as dúvidas relacionadas à plataforma, arquitetura e programação para a plataforma Android, principalmente se envolver a Evernote API.


Lindsey Smith

Product Designer

Com experiência em design para Android, iOS, Windows Phone e Windows 8, Lindsey Smith é responsável pelo design de diversos produtos móveis do Evernote, incluindo as versão móvel do próprio Evernote e do Evernote Hello. 

 

Luis Samra

General Manager LATAM

 

SAMSUNG TEAM

Bruno de André Mazzoco

Global Services Technical Manager

Com experiência em desenvolvimento de software e hardware, antes dessa posição, trabalhou na Samsung como desenvolvedor e líder técnico, com expertise em bada, widgets e aplicações Android. É a pessoa certa para te ensinar os atalhos para desenvolvimento nos dispositivos Android da Samsung.

 

BRAZIL LOCAL SUPPORT

Ana Carolina Merighe

Local Advisor

 

PROGRAMAÇÃO

9 de Novembro de 2012

18:30 - 21:30: Um happy hour para desenvolvedores, designers, players da comunidade mobile local e nosso time se divertirem, se conhecerem e discutirem suas ideias!

21:30 - 9:30: Tempo livre antes da maratona, mas se não resistir e já quiser começar a trabalhar na sua grande ideia, fique à vontade ;)

10 e 11 de Novembro de 2012 

Começa a maratona!

08:00 - 09:30: Credenciamento e café da manhã

09:30 - 09:45: Boas vindas do Evernote, Samsung e Wayra

09:45 - 10:00: Roberto Civille Rodrigues, ganhador a primeira edição e um dos ganhadores do Evernote DEVCUP compartilhará a sua experiência com a nossa API, a competição e sua passagem pelo nosso HQ

10:00 - 10:20: Apresentação Evernote API *

 10:20 - 10:40: Apresentação Samsung 

10:40 - 11:00: Monte o seu time (se sexta-feira não foi suficiente)!

11:00 - 12:00: Começa a maratona: design e código!

12:00 - 13:00: Almoço

13:00 - 19:00: Mais código e design!

19:00 - 20:00: Pausa para o jantar e dar uma descontraída :)

20:00 - 00:30: Mais código e design!

00:30 - 01:00: Café ou energético: você escolhe!

01:00 - 08:00: Mais código e design!

08:00 - 09:00: Café da manhã

09:00 - 11:00: Mais código e design!

11:00           : Prazo final para submeter seus aplicativos!

11:00 - 13:00: Almoço + Apresentaçōes

13:00 - 14:00: Hora de comemorar e registrar o seu sucesso!

14:00           : Missão cumprida!

 

* Ainda não conhece a nossa plataforma e achou pouco tempo? Nāo se preocupe, o nosso time estará por lá o tempo todo para te ajudar. Enquanto isso, você já pode ir vendo como fácil desenvolver soluções utilizando a nossa API, dando uma olhada na nossa área exclusiva para desenvolvedores. 

 
Garanta já a sua vaga!
 
 
OBSERVAÇÕES GERAIS 

Alguns lembretes sobre a viagem, prêmio do primeiro colocado:
 
  • O grupo deve indicar quais participantes (2) irão usufruir da viagem objeto da premiação do primeiro classificado do hackathon. 
  • A viagem deve acontecer no prazo máximo de 12 (doze) meses, contados da data de entrega deste prêmio. Para garantirmos a melhor mentoria possível, a data será acordada entre o participante e a equipe do Evernote.
  • Evernote e Samsung não se responsabilizam pela emissão dos documentos necessários para a realização da viagem prêmio, assim como passaportes, vistos, taxas, certidões, etc. e nem garante o acesso dos participantes em território internacional.
  • O prêmio “viagem”  é pessoal e intransferível, não podendo ser convertido em dinheiro.
 
Algumas observações adicionais sobre o evento:
  • O concurso hackathon é um concurso exclusivamente cultural e recreativo. Os prêmios serão distribuídos em razão do resultado do concurso, levando em consideração os predicados e resultados demonstrados pelos participantes.
  • Qualquer pessoa pode participar do concurso hackathon em igualdade de condições.
  • Para participar do concurso hackathon, você não é obrigado a adquirir ou vincular-se ao uso de qualquer produto ou serviço da Evernote, da Samsung ou da Academia Wayra Brasil.
  • Somente os participantes que desenvolverem soluções de acordo com as regras do concurso poderão receber prêmios.
  • A compra do ticket é necessária para o ingresso no recinto do evento. Nenhum pagamento à parte é necessário para participar do concurso hackathon.

Os organizadores têm total liberdade para alterar as regras acima sem prévio aviso.

Caso você tenha qualquer dúvida ou dificuldade em processar o pagamento de sua inscrição, por favor, entre em contato com enbrasil@evernote.com

Caso você represente qualquer veículo de imprensa e tenha interesse em participar do evento e/ou obter mais informações sobre o hackathon, por favor, entre em contato com evernote@nr-7comunicacao.com.br

events.name: Compute Midwest: The Convergence Of Tech
events.about:
UPDATE: HACKATHON-ONLY TICKETS ARE SOLD OUT!!! We cannot open up any additional tickets at this point



We’re extremely excited to announce our latest creation:Compute Midwest, slated for Nov 9th – 11th, 2012!

What Is Compute Midwest?

Compute Midwest (CMW) Compute Midwest is a 2 day convergence of tech: new people, new ideas and innovation in Kansas City.

With 1 conference, 8 amazing spakers, a hackathon and 2 parties, Compute Midwest provides a fantastic opportunity to connect you with 400+ forward thinking tech minds.

Engage in conversation about the future, exchange/build new ideas and gather several takeaways that can move your career or company forward!


Imagine The Future: Nov 9th

Join us on November 9th at the beautiful Kauffman Center For Performing Arts.

Get inspired & learn about what’s next in technology – straight from tech leaders, startup founders & visionaries.

Hear the stories of innovators who are building companies that change our life, our work & our business.

Gain insight into their vision for the future, learn where technology is going and discover how Kansas City can capitalize on Google Fiber. 

Create The Future: Nov 10th

Over 100 developers & designers will come together on Nov 10th at the Google Fiber Space for a 24-hour code-fest focused on building awesome apps with APIs!

You’ll share ideas, collaborate and possibly start new ventures! You’ll also discover tools & new APIs to experiment with.

Build your app solo or with a team of up to 5 people. Teams can be pre-organized or find fellow coders to collaborate with at the event! Present it and compete for thousands of dollars in great prizes as well as community recognition! 

Prizes: So far we have these items up for grabs :

  • iPhone 5
  • iPad3 16GB WiFi
  • Parrot AR Drone 2.0
  • iPad3
  • Go Pro Hero camera
  • $500 in amazon gift cards
  • $500 “mystery prize”
  • Sphero Robots/Kindle Fires

…and more….. with more prizes coming soon.
[What is a hackathon?] 

For more info about a previous hackathon we did back in June, seeHack The Midwest

Who’s Speaking?

Here are a few people that will be speaking on November 9th…. look for more speakers soon!

Brad Abrams – Product Manager for the Cloud Platform Team, Google

Brad Abrams is a Product Manager for the Cloud Platform team at Google, where he is responsible for the developer and admin experience for the platform. He is author of several books from Addison Wesley, including Framework Design Guidelines. Previously, Brad was the Product Unit Manager of the Application Framework team at Microsoft Corporation. He graduated from North Carolina State University in 1997 with a BS in Computer Science.

Scott Chacon – CIO of Github

Scott Chacon is CIO ofGithub, the largest code host in the world. Github recently closed $100m Series A investment, primarily from Andreessen Horowitz – one of the top VC firms in Silicon Valley.

Scott is a Git evangelist and Ruby developer, the author of the Pro Git book by Apress, the Git Internals Peepcode PDF as well as the maintainer of the Git homepage and the Git Community Book.

Zach Kaplan, CEO of Inventables

Zach Kaplan is the founder and CEO of Inventables, the hardware store for designers.

Zach has spoken on product development and innovation to audiences at conferences across the country, including: a talk at TED, entitled “Toys From The Future”

His work has been covered by Business Week, Fortune, Forbes,CNN, NPR and other leading media outlets. In 2006 he was honored by Chicago’s Museum of Science and Industry as a Modern Leonardo da Vinci and currently sits on the advisory committee for the Fast Forward exhibit.

Prior to Inventables he created Lever Works, a custom web application and hosting company that sold to Leo Media, a multimedia firm, in 2001. 

He holds a bachelors degree in Mechanical Engineering from the University of Illinois. 

 

 

 

Dan Levin, Chief Operating Officer, Box


Prior to his engagement with Box, Dan served as interim CEO of Picateers. Before that, he spent 6+ years at Intuitin a variety of roles including Senior Vice President & General Manager of the Small Business Group, Vice President & General Manager of the Quicken Health Group, and Vice President of Product Management.

Previously, Dan spent thirteen years in venture-backed startups, including senior executive roles at ReplayTV which was acquired by Sonic Blue (SVP and CTO), GuestConnect which was acquired by 4th Network (founder and CEO) and Books That Work which was acquired by Sierra On-Line (co-founder and President).

Dan received a bachelor’s degree in applications of computer graphics to statistical data analysis from Princeton University.


 

 

Jason Hoffman – Founder and CTO of Joyent

Jason the founder and CTO at Joyent, where he is responsible for overseeing the development and implementation of Joyent’s cloud computing technology.

His specialties include bioinformatics, grid computing, cloud computing, distributed systems, collaborative applications and deploying and scaling web applications. Jason earned a BS and MS in Chemistry and Biochemistry at UCLA, and a PhD in Molecular Pathology at The Burnham Institute and UCSD School of Medicine.

Joyent is a key contributor to Node.js code development. Node.js is a platform built on Chrome’s JavaScript runtime for easily building fast, scalable network applications. Node.js uses an event-driven, non-blocking I/O model that makes it lightweight and efficient, perfect for data-intensive real-time applications that run across distributed devices.

Naithan Jones, CEO and Founder, AgLocal

Naithan “Nait” Jones foundedAgLocal in late 2011 to be a web and mobile platform that will match the supply of independent and family farms that produce meat to the demand of wholesale and retail buyers that seek a direct buying connection to these farms. 

Nait hails from a family of chefs and farmers, and this background served as the chief influence and inspiration for AgLocal. His professional career is in enterprise technology and technology start-ups, with successful career stops at Sprint Corporate, Gartner Research and the Kauffman Foundation.

 

 

 

 

Ben Milne, CEO & Founder, Dwolla

Ben is the founder of Dwolla a revolutionary mobile payments company that removes the need to use a credit card.

Charging only .25 cents per transaction, you can use your mobile phone or computer, your social networks (Facebook, Twitter, Linkedin) as well as physical locations to send and receive cash.

Ben started his first company, Elemental Designs, at the age of 18. Ben began leveraging the internet to drop ship custom made speakers. His adventures lead him all over the world, establishing operations in Southern Asia and California. An original $1,200 investment would turn into a multi-million dollar company by the age of 22. 

After heavy research in 2008, Ben and partner, Shane Neuerburg, approached a Midwestern bank with an idea to establish a new payment network that would upend the financial services industries. They called it Dwolla, and Ben sold Elemental Designs to focus on the new payments venture. 

In 2009, the privately funded Dwolla launched in Iowa and California, boasting the nation’s cheapest payment platform of only 25 cents per transaction.


Michelle Munson, CEO & co-founder, Aspera

Michelle is the CEO and co-founder of Aspera, a company named to GigaOM’s “Top 50 Cloud Innovators” list.

Michelle is co-inventor of Aspera’s fasp™ transport technology and is responsible for overseeing the company’s direction in collaboration with co-founder Serban Simu.

Michelle was a software engineer in research and start-up companies including the IBM Almaden Research center before founding Aspera in 2004. 

She has dual B.Sc. degrees in Electrical Engineering and in Physics from Kansas State University and was a Goldwater Scholar for achievement in Science and Mathematics, and later a Fulbright Scholar at Cambridge University where she received a postgraduate Diploma in Computer Science.

Michelle was the 2006 KSU College of Engineering Alumni Fellow(the youngest recipient ever), and has received national achievement awards from Glamour Magazine and USA Today.

 

Ticket Packages

We offer 3 ticket passes (w/ special discounts for students/entrepreneurs/startups) :

  • Conference only – this gives you an all day pass for November 9th to hear our awesome speaker lineup. Includes breakfast and lunch.
  • Conference + Hackathon – this gives developers and designers an all day pass to the conference on November 9th and the Hackathon on November 10th-11th. Includes breakfast and lunch November 9th & meals provided during 24h hackathon.
  • Hackathon only – this gives developers and designers a pass to the hackathon on November 10th-11th. Includes meals provided during 24h hackathon.

events.name: Dream It, Build It, Do It! Hackathon
events.about:
Dream it, Build it, Do it! Hackathon

9th Nov 7:00 pm 2012 - 10th Nov 7:00 pm 2012

Change the way tasks are done. Forever.

 

Introduction - 

Easilydo fundamentally reimagines how people get things done. We are building the world’s first proactive assistant for people who want to feel accomplished and in control of their daily tasks. Easilydo is a mobile application that shows all your important to-do items and lets you respond right on the spot.  Prioritize and respond to emails, view and schedule reminders, post on Facebook, add Contacts and much more - all with a simple tap of the Do It button.

You are warmly invited to our Dream it, Hack it, Do it! Hackathon and contribute your ideas to our awesome repertoire of Do-its. The hackathon entry should follow the paradigm of:

If (event happens), offer to (do action).

Examples: 

  • When I am not at home, offer to show me map directions to go home.
  • When I receive an event invitation on Facebook, offer to add it to my Google Calendar.

Get your creative juices flowing and hack the next coolest Do-It the world has ever seen! 

Judging Criteria

Each entry has to be deployed to our server and will be given time to present their finished product. Judges will base their decisions on:

  • Time Saved: How much time does it save the end-user?
  • Innovation: How innovative is the idea? 
  • Delight Factor:  How delightful does the user feel after having it done? 

 

We look forward to your awesome creation!

Prizes

First place receives $1,000
Second place receives $750
Third place receives $500
Peoples Choice Award receives $250

Additionally, there will be raffles every 2 hours and all participants stand to win Apple Store gift cards! 

Schedule

Friday (9th Nov 2012)

19:00 Doors open
19:30 Welcome & overview by Easilydo CEO and judges
19:45 Easilydo architecture and infrastructure presentations by Directors of Engineering
20:00 Dinner and networking
21:00 Team forming and ideas pitching
22:00 Hacking begins!
 
Saturday (10th Nov 2012)

02:00 Supper surprise
08:00 Breakfast is served
08:30 Continue coding
13:00 Lunch is served
17:00 Submission of projects
17:30 Presentation, demonstration and judging
18:30

Winners announced and awards presentation

What you’ll need:

  • Laptop

What we’ll provide:

  • Food. Lots of it!
  • All the drinks you can drink
  • Easilydo server integration assistance

Rules:

  • The development tools, frameworks and application focus are entirely up to the participants but they must be able to integrate into Easilydos server.
  • Participants are expected to bring all tools and software necessary to build their entry. 
  • Participants may work by themselves or in a team of up to three.
  • Rules are subject to change.

If you have questions, please reach out to us here or email us at ande@easilydo.com

events.name: WOWZAPP 2012: Worldwide Hackathon for Windows -- Singapore
events.about:
Be part of the app revolution!

By registering, you’ll be joining thousands of developers worldwide as we build apps for the next generation of Windows.

Event Agenda and Schedule 

Weve got an exciting 3 days for WOWZAPP 2012!

Look out for lightning talks by our Developer Evangelists, our guest speakers who will be speaking about Game development and using the Parse SDK for Windows 8.

Please take note that the overnight hackathon only begins on the 10th of November at 9am. 

Friday Evening / 9 Nov  (Level 21 Auditorium)
 
6pm – Registration and dinner
 
7pm – WOWZAPP Introduction by Eugene Fabian, Program Manager, Microsoft Bizspark - The Windows 8 Opportunity / Hackathon and  Lightning talks format  / Resources for WOWZAPP
 
730pm – Pitching begins (90 secs each person – were giving away adorable  Fruit Ninja plushies for people who pitch their app ideas! So show us what youve got!
8pm – Team up and form your groups. Its lonely to go through a long hack night by yourself. How about making a couple of friends through this event? Designers and developers, you guys are better together!
830pm – Closing and explanation for WOWZAPP Day 2
9pm – Leave for supper at Lau Par Sat (Optional) 
 
 
Saturday / 10 Nov (Level 21 Auditorium)
 
9am – Breakfast and Hackathon begins! 
 
1030am – 1st Lightning talk by Chris Ismael in  Room 22CF12 - Using Parse SDK to build server-free Windows 8 applications (20mins) 
 
12noon – Lunch
 
2pm – 2nd Lightning talk by Bruce Wang, Senior Developer Evangelist, Microsoft Singaporein Room 22CF12 - The Windows 8 Design Language (20mins)
 
4pm – 3rd Lightning talk by Ty Tianyang, CTO, Tyler Projects in Room 22CF12 - Game Development on Windows 8 (20mins)
 
6pm – Dinner
 
7pm – 4th Lightning talk by Chun Siong Tan, Developer Evangelist, Microsoft Singapore in Room 22CF-12 - Windows Phone 8: Whats new and opportunities for developers (20mins)
 
12 midnight – 4am: Horror movies screening (Resident Evil / The Ring) *Subject to change* 22CF12 / 22BR-01
 
Well be serving some light supper -  instant noodles / milo / biscuits and of course - chips!
 
Sunday / 11 Nov (Level 21 Auditorium)
 
7am - Breakfast
 
830am – Time to Demo apps! (3mins for each team) 
 
10am – Closing session

What to pack for WOWZAPP 2012

WOWZAPP 2012 is designed to be hands on so bring your own machine with Windows 8 installed and the developer tools required to build Windows 8 Applications. Check out theresources on the Windows 8 site to get started on your app now.

Your machine but also remember that it’s the small things that make it work. Power cables, mice, your favorite pair of headphones and if you really need it perhaps an additional monitor. We have touch devices where you can test out your apps!

Oh, did we mention that were giving away an awesome WOWZAPP t-shirt for attendees? But bring along your own towel and some extra underwear if you want to shower!

What to prepare for the pitch

Be clear about what you want to hack, the clearer you are the easier it is for people to join your team and move on to make amazing things. Consider framing your “pitch” to the following format :

1. What is the problem I seek to solve

2. My idea on how to solve it

3. What existing talents/ assets I have that would help me do it

Each person is given precisely 90 seconds to pitch an idea at the beginning of Hack weekend; no slides are required.

If you already have a team – you get to start working on your app without having to pitch! Come speak to the organizers if you need to run through your pitch and get comfortable with it.

Expert Help, Free Resources

Microsoft app experts, developers and trainers will be available on-site to assist your learning and coding. Learn about building Windows Store apps today – download the info, tools and resources you need now. 

Windows Azure Mobile Services

Does your Store app idea include cloud services or storage? Check out Get started withMobile Services –registered student WOWZAPP 2012 participants are eligible for a FREE temporary student Windows Azure subscription!– supplies are limited so be sure to register now!

events.name: WOWZAPP 2012: Worldwide Hackathon for Windows - Hanoi, Vietnam
events.about:
Hackathon là một sự kiện mà tại đó các lập trình viên, sinh viên gặp gỡ và thành lập các nhóm để phát triển một ứng dụng trong vòng tối đa 48 tiếng đồng hồ. Để làm được điều này, cuộc thi đòi hỏi ở các đội thi một nghị lực phi thường và sẵn sàng đạp lên mọi rào cản để đi đến đích cuối cùng của cuộc thi. Với hình thức đặc biệt, Hackathon không chỉ là nơi để các bạn thu thập thêm nhiều kiến thức mà còn có thể khám phá, thử thách các giới hạn của bản thân khi tạo ra một sản phẩm đột phá trong thời gian giới hạn, là bước đệm chuẩn bị cho các bạn kĩ năng quan trọng để sẵn sàng thành công trong môi trường CNTT hội nhập quốc tế ở nước ta giai đoạn hiện nay.

Giới thiệu về Wowzapp 2012: Worldwide Hackathon for Windows - Vietnam

WOWZAPP 2012 là cuộc thi lập trình nhanh trên Windows 8.  Cuộc thi này được Microsoft tổ chức đồng loạt trên khắp thế giới trong khoảng thời gian từ ngày 9/11/2012 đến 11/11/2012  trong đó có Việt Nam.

Việt Nam Hackathon được tổ chức từ 10/11/2012 đến 11/11/2012 tại hai thành phố  Hà Nội và Hồ Chí Minh với quy mô dự kiến là 1.000 thí sinh.

Về giải thưởng: Tổng trị giá giải thưởng lên tới 20.000USD,  mỗi thành phố 10 giải.

Chuẩn bị cho giải WOWZAPP 2012, Microsoft Việt Nam đã tổ chức 2 cuộc thi  nhỏ mang tên “Pre-Appathon” với những giải thưởng rất hấp dẫn. Chi tiết vui lòng tham khảo tại: https://www.facebook.com/events/385852721485619/

Tham dự WOWZAPP 2012 – Việt Nam lần này, ngoài những giải thưởng giá trị, thí sinh có cơ hội giao lưu, học hỏi nâng cao kĩ năng chuyên môn cũng như kĩ năng giao tiếp, làm việc nhóm. Đặc biệt, cuộc thi còn mang đến các cơ hội tư vấn, làm việc với các chuyên gia hàng đầu trong lĩnh vực phần mềm ở Việt Nam. 

Đối tượng tham gia cuộc thi

·         Tất cả lập trình viên, sinh viên yêu thích lập trình.

 

Quy trình đăng kí dự thi:

-          Đăng kí dự thi tại:

§  Hà Nôi: http://wowzapp2012hanoivietnam.eventbrite.co.uk

§  Hồ Chí Minh: http://wowzapp2012hochiminhvietnam.eventbrite.co.uk/

-          Sau khi đăng kí, tiến hành gửi lệ phí thi vào 1 trong các tài khoản dưới đây: 

1. Triệu Lan Ánh

    Số tài khoản: 0011000487133

    Ngân hàng: Vietcombank - Chi nhánh Hà Nội

2. Đào Phương Linh

    Số tài khoản: 03001011920791

    Ngân hàng: Maritime Bank – Chi nhánh Hà Nội

§  Nội dung chuyển tiền: Số đt người gửi tiền - Email người gửi - Tên nhóm dự thi nộp tiền dự thi WOWZAPP 2012

3. Hoặc nộp tiền trực tiếp tại văn phòng công ty Alpha Media (công ty tổ chức sự kiện WOWZAPP 2012)

- Hà Nội: số 20/127 Văn Cao, Ba Đình, Hà Nội

               Ms Đào Phương Linh/Ms Trương Quỳnh Anh

               ĐT: 0915891138

-          Danh sách những người đăng kí và đóng phí sẽ được cập nhật trên facebook của cuộc thi: https://www.facebook.com/wowzapp2012

Lưu ý:

-          Lệ phí dự thi là 100.000 VND/người.

 

Quy chế đội thi

·         Các thí sinh có thể tham gia đăng ký dự thi theo hình thức nhóm.

·         Một nhóm sẽ có từ 2 đến 4 thành viên

·         BTC khuyến khích các thí sinh đăng ký nhóm khi đăng kí online

·         Các trường hợp tới thời điểm khai mạc vẫn chưa có nhóm, BTC sẽ sắp xếp nhóm ngẫu nhiên cho các bạn.

·         Các thí sinh sẽ không thể thay đổi đội thi kết thúc thời gian đăng ký cho phép.

 

Thể lệ cuộc thi Hackathon

1.      Các đội thi chỉ được phép sử dụng nền tảng Windows 8 của Microsoft để phát triển các ứng dụng của mình.

2.      Các đội thi có khoảng 30 giờ để hoàn thành sản phẩm của mình và nộp về BTC.

3.      Các thí sinh cần trang bị laptop đã cài đầy đủ các công cụ để thực hiện bài thi của mình.

4.      BTC sẽ trang bị 1 đường truyền wifi cho các thí sinh. Tuy nhiên, để tránh các trường hợp đáng tiếc, các thí sinh cần chủ động trang bị các thiết bị kết nối internet cá nhân (như USB 3G).

5.      Trong suốt quá trình cuộc thi diễn ra, các thi sinh không được phép rời khỏi khu vực dự thi. Các trường hợp còn lại đều phải có ý kiến của BTC.

6.      Việc các đội thi sử dụng các framework, thư viện hỗ trợ bên ngoài cần tuân thủ theo đúng các giấy phép và được ghi chú đầy đủ cho BTC.

7.      Đội thi có hành động sao chép hoặc gian lận sẽ lập tức bị loại khỏi cuộc thi.

8.      Quyết định của BTC là quyết định cuối cùng.

 

Thời gian và địa điểm diễn ra cuộc thi

·         Thời gian: Bắt đầu từ 08:00 sáng ngày 10/11/2012 đến 6:00 chiều ngày 11/11/2012

·         Địa điểm:

-      Hà Nội: Microsoft Innovation Center, 18 Hoàng Quốc Việt - Cầu Giấy - Hà Nội

-      Hồ Chí Minh: SHTP Training Center, Lô E1 – Khu công nghệ cao – Xa lộ Hà Nội – Quận 9 - TPHCM

 

Các thông tin khác

·         BTC sẽ chuẩn bị các buổi ăn và nước uống cho các thí sinh trong suốt thời gian diễn ra cuộc thi.

·         Tất cả mọi quy chế, thể lệ và các mốc thời gian quan trọng sẽ được BTC phổ biến lại cho tất cả các thí sinh trước khi cuộc thi bắt đầu.

events.about:
Hackathon là một sự kiện mà tại đó các lập trình viên, sinh viên gặp gỡ và thành lập các nhóm để phát triển một ứng dụng trong vòng tối đa 48 tiếng đồng hồ. Để làm được điều này, cuộc thi đòi hỏi ở các đội thi một nghị lực phi thường và sẵn sàng đạp lên mọi rào cản để đi đến đích cuối cùng của cuộc thi. Với hình thức đặc biệt, Hackathon không chỉ là nơi để các bạn thu thập thêm nhiều kiến thức mà còn có thể khám phá, thử thách các giới hạn của bản thân khi tạo ra một sản phẩm đột phá trong thời gian giới hạn, là bước đệm chuẩn bị cho các bạn kĩ năng quan trọng để sẵn sàng thành công trong môi trường CNTT hội nhập quốc tế ở nước ta giai đoạn hiện nay.

Giới thiệu về Wowzapp 2012: Worldwide Hackathon for Windows - Vietnam

WOWZAPP 2012 là cuộc thi lập trình nhanh trên Windows 8.  Cuộc thi này được Microsoft tổ chức đồng loạt trên khắp thế giới trong khoảng thời gian từ ngày 9/11/2012 đến 11/11/2012  trong đó có Việt Nam.

Việt Nam Hackathon được tổ chức từ 10/11/2012 đến 11/11/2012 tại hai thành phố  Hà Nội và Hồ Chí Minh với quy mô dự kiến là 1.000 thí sinh.

Về giải thưởng: Tổng trị giá giải thưởng lên tới 20.000USD,  mỗi thành phố 10 giải.

Chuẩn bị cho giải WOWZAPP 2012, Microsoft Việt Nam đã tổ chức 2 cuộc thi  nhỏ mang tên “Pre-Appathon” với những giải thưởng rất hấp dẫn. Chi tiết vui lòng tham khảo tại: https://www.facebook.com/events/385852721485619/

Tham dự WOWZAPP 2012 – Việt Nam lần này, ngoài những giải thưởng giá trị, thí sinh có cơ hội giao lưu, học hỏi nâng cao kĩ năng chuyên môn cũng như kĩ năng giao tiếp, làm việc nhóm. Đặc biệt, cuộc thi còn mang đến các cơ hội tư vấn, làm việc với các chuyên gia hàng đầu trong lĩnh vực phần mềm ở Việt Nam. 

Đối tượng tham gia cuộc thi

·         Tất cả lập trình viên, sinh viên yêu thích lập trình.

 

Quy trình đăng kí dự thi:

-          Đăng kí dự thi tại:

§  Hà Nôi: http://wowzapp2012hanoivietnam.eventbrite.co.uk

§  Hồ Chí Minh: http://wowzapp2012hochiminhvietnam.eventbrite.co.uk/

-          Sau khi đăng kí, tiến hành gửi lệ phí thi bằng một trong 2 cách sau:

 1. Triệu Lan Ánh

    Số tài khoản: 0011000487133

    Ngân hàng: Vietcombank - Chi nhánh Hà Nội

2. Đào Phương Linh

    Số tài khoản: 03001011920791

    Ngân hàng: Maritime Bank – Chi nhánh Hà Nội

§  Nội dung chuyển tiền: Số đt người gửi tiền - Email người gửi - Tên nhóm dự thi nộp tiền dự thi WOWZAPP 2012

3. Hoặc nộp tiền trực tiếp tại văn phòng công ty Alpha Media (công ty tổ chức sự kiện WOWZAPP 2012)

- Hồ Chí Minh: 

               Mr Võ Ngọc Trường Giang

               Điện thoại: 0923335556

               Địa chỉ: số 5-7-9-11 đường Nội Khu Hưng Gia 4, Phú Mỹ Hưng, Q.7

§  Nội dung chuyển tiền: Số đt người gửi tiền - Email người gửi - Tên nhóm dự thi nộp tiền dự thi WOWZAPP 2012

-          Danh sách những người đăng kí và đóng phí sẽ được cập nhật trên facebook của cuộc thi: https://www.facebook.com/wowzapp2012

Lưu ý:

-          Lệ phí dự thi là 100.000 VND.

 

Quy chế đội thi

·         Các thí sinh có thể tham gia đăng ký dự thi theo hình thức nhóm.

·         Một nhóm sẽ có từ 2 đến 4 thành viên

·         BTC khuyến khích các thí sinh đăng ký nhóm khi đăng kí online

·         Các trường hợp tới thời điểm khai mạc vẫn chưa có nhóm, BTC sẽ sắp xếp nhóm ngẫu nhiên cho các bạn.

·         Các thí sinh sẽ không thể thay đổi đội thi kết thúc thời gian đăng ký cho phép.

 

Thể lệ cuộc thi Hackathon

1.      Các đội thi chỉ được phép sử dụng nền tảng Windows 8 của Microsoft để phát triển các ứng dụng của mình.

2.      Các đội thi có khoảng 30 giờ để hoàn thành sản phẩm của mình và nộp về BTC.

3.      Các thí sinh cần trang bị laptop đã cài đầy đủ các công cụ để thực hiện bài thi của mình.

4.      BTC sẽ trang bị 1 đường truyền wifi cho các thí sinh. Tuy nhiên, để tránh các trường hợp đáng tiếc, các thí sinh cần chủ động trang bị các thiết bị kết nối internet cá nhân (như USB 3G).

5.      Trong suốt quá trình cuộc thi diễn ra, các thi sinh không được phép rời khỏi khu vực dự thi. Các trường hợp còn lại đều phải có ý kiến của BTC.

6.      Việc các đội thi sử dụng các framework, thư viện hỗ trợ bên ngoài cần tuân thủ theo đúng các giấy phép và được ghi chú đầy đủ cho BTC.

7.      Đội thi có hành động sao chép hoặc gian lận sẽ lập tức bị loại khỏi cuộc thi.

8.      Quyết định của BTC là quyết định cuối cùng.

 

Thời gian và địa điểm diễn ra cuộc thi

·         Thời gian: Bắt đầu từ 08:00 sáng ngày 10/11/2012 đến 6:00 chiều ngày 11/11/2012

·         Địa điểm:

-      Hà Nội: Microsoft Innovation Center, 18 Hoàng Quốc Việt - Cầu Giấy - Hà Nội

-      Hồ Chí Minh: SHTP Training Center, Lô E1 – Khu công nghệ cao – Xa lộ Hà Nội – Quận 9 - TPHCM

 

Các thông tin khác

·         BTC sẽ chuẩn bị các buổi ăn và nước uống cho các thí sinh trong suốt thời gian diễn ra cuộc thi.

·         Tất cả mọi quy chế, thể lệ và các mốc thời gian quan trọng sẽ được BTC phổ biến lại cho tất cả các thí sinh trước khi cuộc thi bắt đầu.

events.name: Cereal Hack 2
events.about:
Cereal Hack Is Back!

Calling all coders, designers, biz devs, and hardware hackers!
Join us for a weekend of competitive creative collaboration!

Cereal Hack 2 will be more awesome than the first one. We didnt even know that was possible!

For one it will be hosted at the new Hacker Lab HQ in the heart of Midtown in 10,480 SQ SF of awesomeness!

Two, Intel is the MEGA SPONSOR! So we have a sweet $2000.00 Grand Prize for Best Project for Social Good!

We have also included a competition for hardware and maker hacking! 

Come join us, have fun, meet incredible people, and see Hacker Lab!

Cereal Hack 2 is going to be epic! All proceeds will go to support Hacker Lab and its mission of providing you cool tech stuff to do!

Visit cerealhack.com!

Get your tickets today!

Tickets available at the door!

 

 Presented By

 

Mega Sponsor

What is a hackathon?

A hackathon is where people code in a marathon type fashion to build mobile, hardware, and web applications in a competitive environment. There are different types of Hackathons but this is how we are going to roll! See Wikipedia to read more.What happens at a hackathon?

People will either come alone or with a team to get together and build out an idea. If you are looking for people to join your team you can give a 60 second pitch to attract team members. Networking will also be done to meet, mingle, and build teams. Once teams are established, they will begin planning and  building out their project. At the end of the hackathon, the projects and teams will be presented and judged in a competition-like setting for prizes.What can we build at the hackathon?

This is a mobile, hardware, and web development hackathon including game development, so you can build anything that falls into that space.What if I dont have a team?

Thats ok! We will have team building activities and networking time to find a team to join or give you time to build one there!Will this be judged?

There will be a panel of startup founders and VCs judging projects and presentations based on the value of the idea, execution, teamwork, design, and ability to demonstrate the product and vision.  Are you making something useful?  What could this look like after 3 months?Can my project already be built before coming out to the hackathon?

No, all projects must be built in their entirety at the hackathon. All coding will be submitted to Git Hub for validation and any cheaters will be disqualified.What if my idea is a top secret?

If you are afraid of letting your secret out, we recommend you not participate in hackathons. Frankly, most of people in the startup world rarely come across something that has not been done yet. Someone can take your idea, but they can’t take your vision, and that is what makes your idea unique.What if I am not a Designer or Coder?

That is okay. Every team needs a Biz Dev, Entrepreneurs, Idea Guys and  Hustlers!What skills are on a winning team?

Typically, winning teams have 3-5 people including one biz dev, one designer and a coder or two.May I bring a desktop?

No because of space issues, we ask that you bring a laptop or mobile devices only.

events.name: AngelHack Fall 2012 London
events.about:
Ready to take your big idea to the next level? Then join us for Londons next AngelHack, where winning teams will receive 6-8 weeks of mentorship and be flown into Silicon Valley for a weekend of events including a Global Demo Day to A-list investors and media, Site visits to, Google, Facebook, Google Ventures, VIP dinners, and ragging parties with the Valley startup community. This is not your typical weekend hackathon! This is the big leagues! This is AngelHack and you cant afford to miss it.

AngelHack Fall 2012 Fast Facts
  • 2500 amazing developers & designers in 11 cities for you to work with
  • Great food, shwag, nerf guns, helicopters, and awesomness all around
  • Over $650,000 in prizes, including trips to Silicon Valley for the top 25 teams
  • Media coverage and all star investor judges to help validate those whacky hack ideas of yours
WANT 50 FREE CARDS FROM MOO FOR YOUR ANGELHACK LONDON PROJECT?

What should I build?
Create a prototype (hack) of something that you believe solves a big problem. You dont need a business plan or anything crazy like that, but you should be able to show the big idea potential of your hack. AngelHack is a launchpad for you to flush out and validate projects youve always wanted to build. Previous winners include: Appetas, GiveGo, TapFame, SnapStore, ShareBrowse, Kloutron, & Blue Dragon Security.

What are the rules?
All code must be FRESH. Prior to the hackathon you can create your design, wireframes, logo, and user flows. You can even build hardware. But to make things completely fair you can not write any code whatsoever until the hackathon starts. All code must be built at AngelHack.

For more info visit our Rules and FAQ pages.

Good Luck,
Gregory Gopman
AngelHack Founder / CEO

As seen in

events.about:
Please join us at the DoSomething.org and Warby Parker Hackathon! 

The DoSomething.org and Warby Parker Hackathon will take place on Saturday, November 10, 2012 from 10am-8pm. This wont be just any regular hackathon and believe us, you wont want to miss it. 

Hackawhat? 

BE A SHOW OFF. We want developers who arent afraid to try something crazy, and in turn start the base for DoSomething.orgs next awesome product. 

ACCESS TO OUR API. DoSomething.org operates on multiple platforms. You can build from our site, on SMS, on Facebook, Spotify, Mobile Commons, Four Square... take your pick. 

MEET BADASS NERDS. Expect some industry innovators to be in attandance. Were also putting together a kick ass juding panel. 

Sign up to get your free ticket today!

events.name: Sharefest Hackathon
events.about:
The new HTML5 P2P API called WebRTC DataChannels opens the door for many cool projects.

One of them is Sharefest. A sharing webapp that will allow users to share files instantly without any servers. It will be dead simple - something like http://sharefest.jit.su/

Users also wont need to install any software (such as Bittorrent client), they just need a modern browser. 

We are inviting anyone who is interested in WebRTC to join us and hack together Sharefest.
The event is part of our startup accelerator event, so more people will be there, food and drinks! 

FAQs 

What skills are needed?

 Any WebRTC background is awesome, but all javascripters are welcome.
HTML5/CSS3 enthusiasts to make sharefest look awesome!

What are my transport/parking options getting to the event?

Theres a free parking lot on the back-side.
Drive East to California from El Camino Real and take a left.
Youll see the food trucks and Upwest party...  

What can/cant I bring to the event?

Bring your laptop... Beer and food are on the house!

Where can I contact the organizer with any questions?

hadar at peer5 dot com

events.name: Capitol Camp 2012
events.about:
Capitol Camp 2012 spans two days, and includes a Hackathon targeted toward computer programmers on Thursday, November 15th from 10am - 5pm; and an Unconference targeting a wider audience of both technical and non-technical participants on Friday, November 16th from 10am - 5pm. 

The Hackathon gives participants the opportunity to build an application that benefits government. Applications built at government hackathons generally consume government data, and are a popular way to rapidly build prototypes that demonstrate what is possible when government data is made freely available. This Hackathon will convene at 10am, 11/15/12, in Hearing Room A of the Legislative Office Building and run until 5pm.

The Unconference consists of less technical, interactive sessions that examine the intersection of government and technology. The Unconference will convene at 10am, 11/16/12, in Hearing Room A of the Legislative Office Building and run until 5pm. Attendees propose session topics to present and engage in active dialog within the context of the following three thematic tracks:  Open Data, Transparency and Open Source.

  • Open Data - A look at how government can best expose their data to citizens. Topics of exploration include: 1) What data should be made available, 2) What are the optimal data formats for open data, 3) What are different platforms available for delivering open data, 4) How can open data initiatives be done in a cost effective way, and 5) What is value of open data.
  • Transparency - Discussions about how technology can serve to enhance openness. Topics of exploration include: 1) Benefits and challenges of government transparency, 2) Specific examples of government transparency initiatives, and 3) Transparency-enabling technologies.
  • Open Source - Find how government organizations can (and do) leverage open source technology.  Topics of exploration include: 1) Open source philosophy and development model, 2) Popular open source development tools and platforms, and 3) Barriers to adoption of open source technologies  

More information is available at www.capitolcampny.org

events.name: SMARTDevNet & DevCon presents Eden Hackathon Benilde
events.about:
Eden Hackathon Benilde is a one-day hackathon presented by SMARTDevNet (SMART Developer Network), SMART Communications Inc.s developer community for its technology platform, DevCon (Developer Connect) and De La Salle-College of Saint Benilde in cooperation with its Information Systems Department, Project Management (PRJ-MGT) Section TO0B and the Association of Information Management (AIM). Eden Hackathon Benilde focuses on the Eden PHP library created by OpenOvate ( http://eden.openovate.com) which allows developers to do rapid prototyping in PHP for Internet Platforms and APIs for popular services like Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Google Drive, Google g+, PayPal and Amazon. Were inviting PHP developers to experience the power of the Eden PHP Library and show off the what they can do!

   Eden Hacakthon Benilde is open to all developers: students, teachers and professionals. This is a FREE event, no charge for admission, but registration is required.

HOW TO JOIN THE HACKATHON

1. Form a team of 2-4 members in advance. If you dont have a team going to the hackathon, you are encouraged to find other hackathoners who dont have any teams yet. If you still dont have a team just before the hackathon begins, the organizers wil try to find you a team. A team must have a minimum of two members.

2. Join our Facebook Group at https://facebook.com/groups/smartdevnet/ - we will be announcing a Hackathon Signup page here where you will need to provide details of a) your app name and description, b) the team name, and c) your team members.

3. Get ready with your ideas on how to work with the Eden PHP Library ( http://eden.openovate.com ). Teams are allowed to have pre-work. You can also start working with the Eden PHP library on the day of the hackathon itself.

4. At the end of the hackathon, all the groups registered for the hackathon will need to present their app via a live demo. The order of the presentations will be drawn by lots. Teams who are not registered cannot do a live demo and will not be eligible for any of the prizes.

5. We encourage everyone to join a team - even if you registered just to observe, you are strongly encouraged to be a participant-observer. 

6. Skill Requirements: Participants must know PHP proficiently - you dont need to be an expert but you need to way your way around.

7. Amazon API demo: We will demonstrate the Amazon API. You would need a verified AWS account to be able to use the Amazon API.

8. Prerequisites: Laptop with PHP and MySQL installed. Ideas on what application to develop for Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Google g+, Google Grive, SMTP, MySQL, Amazon and/or Paypal. Two or more platforms can also be mashed together to create a hybrid app.  This will be for the hackathon session.

PROGRAM:

0730-0830am  Registration 
0830-0845am  Welcome Remarks by Organizers 
0845-0900am  Introduction and General Overview of the Eden PHP Library by Christian Blanquera
0900-0930am  Twitter and PayPal integration through Eden by Clark Galgo
0930-1000 am  Database and Emails: MySQL and SMTP integration by Christian Blanquera
1000-1030am  Facebook and Tumblr Integration by Dan Molina
1100-1130am  Google Drive, Google g+ & AWS Integration by Symon Buenavista
1130-1200pm  Mashup Workshops & Hackathon Orientation 
1200-0100pm  LUNCH
0100-0115pm  Hackathon Rules by Paul Pajo, SMARTDevNet
0115-0345pm  HACKATHON PROPER
0345-0445pm   Presentations
0445-0500pm  Judging and Awarding
   
   

 

Eden Hackathon Benilde is open to all developers of all ages.


PROCESS

• At the end of the hackathon proper, teams will do a live demo of their Eden PHP Library apps.

• The app must use the Eden PHP Library and optionally the SMART APIs either as concept and/or prototype

• Teams will undergo final judging by presenting their project to a panel of judges who will identify the winners.

• All decisions of judges are final. Scores will not be made public.

 

PRIZES

• A prize will be awarded to the winning teams for the best use of the Eden PHP Library

 

HTML5 APP DEMO

• Teams are expected to bring their own laptops. Internet access will be provided at the venue.

• The order of presentation will be determined by drawing lots.

• Each presenter is given three (3) minutes to explain the entry and two (2) minutes to answer questions during the Q&A.

 

CRITERIA


•The app must be in HTML5 & functionality is preferred

•An App that people want - 15% (convince us market NEED for your app)

•An App whose time has come - 15% (convince us of the apps TIMING)

•An App thats clever (really!) - 15% (convince us of the apps INGENUITY)

•An App thats properly mashed-up - 65% (convince us of your apps API INTEGRATION - the more the merrier!)

 

 INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY

 The team warrants that the entry is their original idea and does not infringe on the intellectual property rights of any third party. Participants are responsible for securing appropriate protection for any Intellectual Property (IP) contributed by the team members or their parent institutions. In the absence of such protection, participants should restrict themselves to non-enabling disclosures of their IP. Entries that have won major awards (1st, 2nd, 3rd) in any international, national or school competitions cannot be entered. Wireless service applications that are already in commercial production may not be entered. Smart Communications, Inc. (SMART), DevCon & De La Salle-College of Saint Benilde (DLS-CSB) shall not be liable to any participant for commercializing ideas that have been independently developed but are similar in concept to submitted entries.

By joining the contest, the participants agree to waive any right to claim ambiguity or error in these Official Mechanics. Except where prohibited by law, the winners consent to the use of their name and/or likeness by SMART, DevCon & DLS-CSB for advertising and publicity purposes without compensation.

Each participant agrees that SMART, DevCon & DLS-CSB and its parent companies, agents, representatives, affiliates, and employees will have no liability whatsoever for any injuries, losses, or damages of any kind resulting from his participation in the contest, or resulting from the acceptance, possession, or use of these prizes, nor in any way are responsible for any warranty, representation, or guaranty, express or implied, in fact or in law, relative to any prize, including but not limited to the quality, condition, or fitness.

events.name: Windows 8 Unleashed - Bellevue
events.about:
Windows 8 Unleashed - Full Day of Hands-On Programming, B.Y.O. Laptop!

Windows 8 is the single biggest opportunity for developers EVER! Come to a “Windows 8 Unleashed” event to kick-start your Windows 8 development. “Windows 8 Unleashed” is a series of FREE events run by your local community friends and leaders, and are great whether you are an experienced .NET developer, or even if you are just getting started. We’ll spend the morning in lecture and hands on labs. Half way through, you’ll get a chance to take what you learned in the morning and compete in a hackathon with a chance to win some great prizes!

Required Software and Downloads

Please make sure to get the required software and downloads BEFORE coming to the event. You can find everything you need on the “Windows 8 Unleashed Installs” page.

Agenda

Session I – Overview

  • ·Metro Style Apps Overview
  • ·Developing Metro Style Apps
  • Working with Controls
  • Implementing Navigation

Session II – Location and Data

  • ·Working with Location
  • ·Data Binding
  • ·Roaming
  • ·App Bar

 

Session III – Metro Principals

  • ·Live Tiles & Toast
  • ·Contracts
  • ·Full, Fill Snap and Portrait Views
  • ·Advertising 

Build an App and Win Money and Prizes!

Our sponsors have stepped up with some awesome prizes. Not only do you get a ton of information for FREE, but you have an opportunity to win some awesome stuff! You can’t afford to miss this!

DAY-OF prizes will be awarded (sponsored by PDSA):

  • ·1st Place: $500 Gift Card
  • ·2nd Place: $200 Gift Card
  • ·3rd Place: $100 Gift Card

“Best Overall App” Prizes will be awarded to the best app from ALL unleashed events:

  • ·$10,000 from Component Art
  • ·Windows 8 Tablet from PDSA, Inc.

In addition all attendees will receive a FREE eBook from O’Reilly

events.name: Los Angeles CleanWeb Hackathon
events.about:
The Cleanweb Hackathon will demonstrate the impact of applying information technology to resource constraints. Join us November 16-18 in Los Angeles as we bring together developers, designers, students and business professionals dedicated to optimizing resource use and accelerating cleantech development. Participants are tasked with building applications that tackle energy, waste, water, and other sustainability issues by leveraging web and mobile technologies. We challenge attendees on what they can do over the course of the weekend that might just change the world (and LA) for the better.

Saturday and Sunday’s Events will be held at at the beautiful University of Southern California Tutor Campus Center Forum. Friday night kick-off location TBA.

events.name: AT&T Mobile App Hackathon - Las Vegas
events.about:
Have an app idea or need an app built for your business?

Mobile App Hackathon is an event produced by the AT&T Developer Program  that is designed for attendees (technical & non-technical) to build apps/mobile apps, get fed, compete for prizes across different categories and most importantly: meet new people and scout for teammates to work on new or current projects. Our hackathon will introduce you to the latest cutting edge tools to help deploy your own app with a website backend, fully hosted in the cloud.

We Supply: Quick presentations and code samples that help to bootstrap your hacking, food to keep you going, and caffeine to keep you awake. Along with technical senseis to assist you in building faster, smarter, and with new tools.

You Bring: Your laptop, skills & ideas. Come with a collaborative, team focused mindset and/or team up in advance on Twitter/Facebook/Google+ via the #atthack hashtag. Whether you are a backend person and code in Ruby/PHP/.NET or are a designer and only work with Illustrator, you are invited to attend this event. Every group needs a good balance of talent and your development skills are needed!

Event Schedule.  The following is a list of the weekends agenda:

  • 6PM - Friday Evening - Kickoff event with drinks, networking, and developer dating which leads into idea pitches and team formation.
  • 10AM - Saturday Morning -  The fun continues with an all day hackathon. Work with the teams that you formed on Friday night to produce the app spec’d out the night before. Senseis will be available throughout the entire event to help you code up your solution. App submissions will be accepted throughout the day with a deadline of 7PM.
  • 7PM - Saturday Evening - Promptly at 7PM, teams will begin pitching their ventures. Pitches are limited to three (3) minutes per team.

Prizes. The following prizes are experiential and geared towards accelerating you towards a successful business as well as expanding your network and industry knowledge:

  • Best Hackathon Overall App 
    • 1st Place - $500 in Gift Cards for the team and one (1) year of the Small service from Github for each team member
    • 2nd Place - $300 in Gift Cards for the team and one (1) year of the Micro service from Github for each team member
    • 3rd Place - $200 in Gift Cards for the team and six (6) months of Micro service from Github for each team member
  • Best App using AT&T APIs (Click for more info)
    • $500 in gift cards for the team to split and entire team seeded with 4G Elevate Devices and one (1) month of 1GB DataConnect Service (Max 3) [compliments of Sierra Wireless]
  • Best Native Objective-C App
    • One (1) CarBots Micro RC Car for each team member

Judging Criteria. Apps will be judged based on the criteria below and weighted accordingly.  

  • 33% Weight - Ability to clearly articulate what your app does
  • 33% Weight - Originality of idea
  • 33% Weight - Use of Node.JS, Sencha, cloud9ide.com, Heroku, and other technologies
Social Media. 
  • Follow us @hackathonlive for live updates and photos from the event
  • Like us on Facebook! https://www.facebook.com/AttMobileAppHackathon

Speakers

 
Alex Donn is a Senior Marketing Manager with the AT&T Developer Program, is based out of sunny Seattle! His passion is educating developers young and old about mobile application development best practices through events like hackathons that fuse the collective interests of multiple technology and business leaders. Andy White is an entreprenuer, angel investor, and active in the #VegasTech ecosystem, working with @vegastechfund as part of @downtownprojlv. He is also a Board Trustee at Launchup where he established new expansion cities for the program. Andy founded Milennial Technology in January of 2010.
Ray Morgan, CTO of Rumgr, is a full stack developer who can be found crafting new iOS features, hacking on the API servers or working with the databases. He really enjoys finding ways to help other developers, and learn from them. Outside of Rumgr you can find Ray participating in VegasTech or the 500 Startups network as a mentor.  Fred Guest has 8 years of capital markets experience at a number of Wall Street firms, most recently Barclays Capital, where he worked on the equity syndicate desk which handles the pricing and distribution of IPOs. Currently he is working on startups in Las Vegas and learning programming.
 
Alex Gaber, is an API Evangelist for Layer 7 Technologies a company that manages over 200 APIs spanning business and government.  Starting as a web developer 15 years ago, Alex grew up in Silicon Valley and is an active member in the hackathon and developer community.  He has a passion for building web and mobile applications that integrate numerous APIs and ideas to create innovative and unique solutions. 
  

Senseis

   
Ardie Yorgans is a front-end developer and part of the #VegasTech community since founding Yeres Messenger, a winning startup at Startup Weekend Las Vegas. He now focuses on effective communications, presentations, and direction for Yeres and new startups alike. Dave Stevens has been developing for the mobile web since the days of WAP. He is currently works at Zappos (though is attending as an individual) and previously worked on the Mobile Web team on ESPN. A strong proponent of node.js, redis and tiny file sizes - dont mind the funny accent (hes a Brit).
   
   
   
   

Sponsors

events.name: The Campus2.0 Hackathon
events.about:
WANTED: GOOD IDEAS. KEEN SKILLS.

The Opportunity: Create the app youve always wanted with a team of programmers, designers, business strategists, and idea people. Whether you have the million-dollar idea, or the skills, we need you!

The Event: Over 26 hours, this hackathon will mix together students, faculty, and leaders from the DFW tech and business innovation space. Interdisciplinary teams will work through Friday night and Saturday to compete and build the best, most innovative web or mobile app to transform life on campus.

The Mechanics: All registered attendees may pitch ideas for teams. Teams will then self-organize around ideas.  Teams must consist of 2-6 people, at least half of which must be students.

The Awards: Creations will be judged Saturday night in the following categories: 
Best Use of Proxomo, Highest Impact to Students, and Highest Impact to UNT.

The Lead Sponsor, : Thanks to Proxomo, participants can use software tools to simplify app development through backend APIs. On Nov. 6th at 7pm CST, developers can learn more by listening in to a TECHTALK through an AT&T Bootstrap lecture with Proxomos founder and CEO, Daniel Knoodle. Proxomo is a single backend as a service supporting all app platforms and devices - iPhone, Android, Windows Phone and web apps. At the Hackathon, youll be able to get your backend up and running in five minutes or less and win prizes for doing so!

FAQ

Q: Can I pitch an idea from a class project, or an idea that I used in another competition? 
A: Absolutely.

Q: Can non-students pitch ideas?  
A: Absolutely; however, remember that students must make up at least half of each team. After the pitches, each attendee will find (or recruit) a team around their favorite idea.

Q: Will there be food and drink to keep me going? 
A: For registered participants, well have ample (free) coffee/soda to fuel teams throughout the event, plus free dinners and breakfast on-site (to save you time). Youll have to stretch and buy your own lunch on Saturday, but well bring the food trucks to you. 

 Q: Can any professional register and join, or do you have to be an alum? 
A: The more the merrier! Any professional can either register to join a team with students, (as each team has to be at least half students), or register as a mentor to float among all teams for a portion of the event.   

Q: Do I need to assemble a team before hand, or are the organizers creating teams for us? 
A: On Friday night, registrants will self-organize into teams around their favorite idea pitches. If you have friends, mentors, or colleagues you want to team up with, just have them register and join your team after the pitches.  

Q: How long will I have to pitch my idea? 
A: Each registrant with an idea will get 60 seconds to pitch their vision and needs in order to recruit potential team members. 

Q: Can students from any university register? Can high school students register? 
A: Any student can register for one of the student tickets. Note: students under 18 will have to sign a media waiver upon arriving.

events.name: #hackLynbrook - Lynbrook High School\'s first hackathon.
events.about:
#hackLynbrook

WHAT?

#hackLynbrook is more than just your traditional hackathon. #hackLynbrook is a hackathon with a misison; to build technologies to help improve the education expierence. Designers, developers, students and teachers will form teams in order to create the best hack to help students or teachers in 30 hours.
