events.name: Manchester Hackathon
events.about:
Calling all hackers, coders and creative collaborators - Manchester needs you to shape the future of the digital city.

For the first time ever, the City of Manchester invites you to dig underneath its digital skin. FutureEverything, Open Data Manchester and Manchester City Council are looking for experts and innovators to hack, code, programme and experiment with the citys sets of open data to build new applications and develop future services.

Utilising the open data sets from DataGM made available by Manchester City Council and public sector partners, participants are welcome to produce anything they wish - develop applications to help people find their way around, stay safe, discover new experiences and everything and anything in between. All data is released under the Open Government Licence.

Taking place at MadLab in the heart of Manchesters Northern Quarter on Saturday 17th November, the Manchester Hackathon is set to be an intense, productive and exciting collaboration between the brightest minds in software development and data processing. Entries from both teams and individuals are welcome, and there are cash prizes to be won for the best product at the end of the session, including;

  • Grand Prize - £4,600*
  • Best Under 21s Creation - £600
  • Best Visualisation - £600
  • Best Locative Application - £600
  • Developers Prize - £600
  • Best Solution for an Identified Problem - £600
* £1000 prize & £3,600 development funding 

The prizes will be selected by a panel of independent industry experts, including Dave Carter (MDDA), Lou Cordwell (magneticNorth) and Andrew MacKenzie (Open Mercia).

The Hackathon takes place on Saturday 17th November 9am - 7pm at MadLab (36 - 40 Edge St, Northern Qtr, Manchester M4 1HN), with a warmup and networking session beforehand at MDDA (Lower Ground Floor, 117-119 Portland St, Manchester, M1 6ED) on Friday 16th November 6.30 - 8.30pm.

The event is completely free to enter and open to all.

www.futureeverything.org | www.opendatamanchester.org.uk | @FuturEverything | #futr |

FutureEverything was founded in 1995, it is Manchesters award winning internationally respected festival of ideas and digital invention. It is hailed by The Guardian as one of top ten ideas festivals in the world (February 2012).

FutureEverything brings the future to Manchester with inspiring live experiences and industry events, engaging a wide audience and affiliating its partners with the very best in digital innovation. For almost twenty years FutureEverything has been at the heart of the digital debate, inspiring thinkers, city makers, developers, coders, artists and musicians to experiment and collaborate. 

The next FutureEverything festival will be Thursday 21 - Sunday 24 March 2013.

 

 

The Manchester Hackathon is partially funded under the ICT Policy Support Programme (ICT PSP) as part of the Competitiveness and Innovation Framework Programme by the European Community.

events.name: New York TechMeetups Hackathon: Mobile Apps #tmuhack
events.about:
** The ticket you can buy here is for those wishing to participate in the whole weekend of the hackathon.  For other ticket options and more info about the event see our main event page **


Who’s it for?

  • Developers who have their own app idea or want to help someone build a prototype for any mobile platform.

  • Designers who have their own app idea or want to help a team create the best-looking app of the weekend.
  • Anyone else who either has an app idea or wants to join a team – every project needs a marketer or biz dev to create an app to take the market by storm.

What’s happening?

TechMeetups is holding a hackathon competition for those who want to get together and hack a prototype app in just 48 hours!

  • Friday evening: pitch your idea (or choose your favourite project from the pitches), form a team, hack a prototype and pitch it to our judges on Sunday night for the chance to win some great prizes to help launch your app on the market!
  • Mentors will be on hand to help you with all your dev and business development questions. 

WHAT STANDS BETWEEN YOU AND THE PRIZE?

Teams must submit working prototypes for judging on Sunday. The most promising prototypes will be presented with prizes by our jury panel.

 

Friday

6pm Doors open and networking
7pm Presentations from the organisers and our API & SDK Partners
7:30pm App idea presentations
8pm Teams form & the competition begins
11pm Close for the evening

 

Saturday

10am The hackathon continues - Mentors will be present throughout the day
1pm Lunch
2pm Teams continue hacking!
6pm Video checkpoints
11pm Close for the evening

 

Sunday

10am The hackathon continues - Mentors will be present throughout the day
1pm Lunch
2pm The final stretch!
6pm Presentations
7pm Jury deliberates (while hackers relax with some drinks)
7:30pm Winners announced
9pm Close for the evening


WANT TO JOIN IN BUT HAVE QUESTIONS? READ ON...

What do I need to be an idea generator?
You can be anyone with an app idea who wants to build a team and prototype.  If you’re a developer, come and find the designer and marketer for your project.  If you’re business minded, find developers and designers to bring your idea to life... and so on.

Can I work on an existing app idea?
Yes, you can work on an app idea that you and even your business has already researched, but you should not bring along ideas that you’ve already started coding – the weekend is all about building the all-important prototype from scratch and trying out new APIs & SDKs with the support of our Partners.

What platforms can I develop for?
Whatever purpose you wish to build your app prototype for, TechMeetups and our mentors there to support you in building it and taking it to market.

Do I need to have a certain level of experience to get involved?
No, the hackathon is about learning as well as applying your skills so you can get involved no matter how experienced you are.

What’s expected of me over the weekend?
You’ll get most out of the weekend by forming or joining a team and building a working prototype of your app over the weekend.  We’ll have plenty of Mentors, both technical and business minded, who can help you to use new tools and APIs, as well as help you evaluate how attractive and sticky your app is looking.

What should I bring?
Your enthusiasm, your portable computer, the mobile device you’re building for and your camera to immortalize the making of your app!

What is the judging criteria for theapps?
The apps will be judged on the following criteria:
1. Creative use of technology
2. User Experience and potential for long term user engagement
3. The quality of the prototype you have built
4. The market potential of the app
5. The viability of your business model


Who owns the apps created?
The apps are owned solely by you, the creators. Do note that we do not get involved legally so it is important that you discuss this with your team before you start on the prototype so everyone is clear on ownership.


SPONSORSHIP OPPORTUNITIES

Through TechMeetups’ growing global network of tech communities, the month of November will be the time when our 5,000+ members around the world are talking about mobile apps and hackathons at www.techmeetups.com and via social media channels.

If you’re interested in promoting your company throughout the month, here’s more about what you can expect:

As a Sponsor of the TechMeetups.com Hackathon: Mobile Apps month your brand will have both local and global exposure.  Our event attendees will be developers, designers, entrepreneurs and those interested in innovative technologies and tools for the purpose of growing their business or projects.

TechMeetups.com’s global audience has the same profile and is located across the USA, Europe and Asia where we have active and fast-growing networks.

Through our reach we’ll be marketing the event to the entire TechMeetups global community of over 5,000 members across all these cities.  For more information about our reach and activities, please visit www.techmeetups.com

Email us at sponsor@techmeetups.com for more details.

events.name: Sustainability Hackathon - hosted by BMW i Born Electric Tour, NYC
events.about:
SUSTAINABILITY HACKATHON.
Hosted by BMW i. BORN ELECTRIC TOUR. New York.

Our hearts go out to the city of New York along both the NYC and NJ Tech Communities following the ravages of Hurricane Sandy. Both BMW and AT&T have donated over $1 million each to relief efforts in order to help those that have been impacted.

AT&T has additionally been working with the City of New York to quickly deploy generator-driving stations and has invited people affected by the storm to visit any of its approximately 400 retail stores in the Northeast to charge their devices.

We encourage those who have been fortunate enough not to be impacted to donate to $10 by texting to the following non-profit organizations:

  • REDCROSS to 90999 to support the American Red Cross
  • STORM to 80888 to help the Salvation Army
  • HUMANE to 80888 to give to the American Humane Society

Come and join us in New York on 11/16 to 11/18, and help us create a more sustainable future. Tweet about this hack: #sustainhack, and form teams at HackerLeague.

We are looking for technical as well as non-technical people to build apps, mobile apps and hacks to address some of the most pressing problems in sustainability facing our future as a greener planet. Hack, get fed, compete for prizes across different categories, and most importantly: network with likeminded people to work on new or current projects.

Our sponsors will give you inspiration for your ideas and help you to realize them.

  • BMW Group Technology Office USA - our research & development wing in Mountain View, CA, in the heart of Silicon Valley, is on hand to inspire and challenge you with todays most pressing problems in Sustainable Mobility.
  • AT&T - with tons of experience running successful hackathons and building mobile apps, we have representatives from AT&T to help you out. Also, check out the other Mobile App Hackathon events and#atthack
  • Tendril - sustainability doesnt just mean transportation. Tendril specializes in cloud services for managing your smart home and controlling your home appliances according to your energy needs.
  • BMW i Ventures - ever wondered who funds new ideas in the area of mobility? BMWs VC company, based directly in Manhattan, wants to meet bright people with new ideas.

We supply: quick presentations and code samples, which help to bootstrap your hacking, food to keep you going, and caffeine to keep you awake. That, and a group of technical senseis to assist you in building faster, smarter, and with new tools.

You bring: your laptop, skills and ideas. Come with a collaborative team and a focused mindset, and/or team up in advance on Twitter/Facebook/Google+ via #sustainhack. Whether you are a backend developer and code in JEE/Ruby/PHP/.NET, a front-end wizard, or are a designer and work with Illustrator, you are invited to attend this event. Every group needs a good balance of talent, and your development skills are needed!

EVENT SCHEDULE.

The weekends events are planned out as follows:

  • 7pm Friday Night: Kickoff event with drinks, networking, and developer dating. which leads into idea pitches and team formation.
  • 9am Saturday Morning: Breakfast followed by idea pitches and team formation. The fun continues with an all day hackathon. Work with the teams that you formed over the course of Friday and Saturday to produce your hack. Senseis will be available throughout the entire day to help you code up your solution.
  • 8am Sunday Morning: More coding with breakfast served. App submissions will be accepted throughout the day with a deadline of 2pm.
  • 2pm Sunday Afternoon: Promptly at 2pm, teams will begin pitching their ventures. Pitches are limited to three (3) minutes per team.

PRIZES.

The following prizes are experiential and geared towards accelerating you towards a successful business as well as expanding your network and industry knowledge:

  • All - Best overall app
  •  
    • 1st prize - $500 gift cards for the team and one (1) year of the Small service from Github for each team member
    • 2nd prize - $300 gift cards (per team) and one (1) year of the Micro service from Github for each team member
    • 3rd prize - $200 gift cards (per team) and six (6) months of Micro service from Github for each team member
  • AT&T - Best hack using AT&T APIs - http://developer.att.com/API
    • 1 prize - Sierra Wireless 4G LTE Momentum device, 1 month 1GB DataConnect Service (max 3)
  • Tendril - Best smarthome hack
    • 1 prize - $1500 Apple Mac Store vouchers
  • BMW - Best Sustainable Mobility hack
    • Prizes to be confirmed
  • BMW Judge’s Choice
    • The CEO of BMW i Ventures will be on the judging panel and will consider hacks for a possible offer of 3 months incubation space at BMW i Ventures in New York. This prize may not be awarded directly on the day of the prizegiving

JUDGING CRITERIA.

 Apps will be judged based on the criteria below and weighted accordingly.  

  • 33% Weight - Ability to clearly articulate what your app does
  • 33% Weight - Originality of idea
  • 33% Weight - iOS, WP7/8, RIM, & Android native apps are a big +++
SOCIAL MEDIA.
  • Tweet about your idea and participation with #sustainhack
  • Like BMW i on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/BMWi
  • Like AT&T Mobile App Hackathon on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/AttMobileAppHackathon

 

SPEAKERS. 

   
Alex Donn - Senior Marketing Manager at AT&T, is based out of sunny Seattle! His passion is educating developers young and old about mobile application development best practices through events like hackathons that fuse the collective interests of multiple technology and business leaders. He loves bacon and is allergic to all types of gluten. Adam Wilson - the founder and chief software architect at Orbotix (makers of Sphero), attended the University of Northern Colorado and graduated with a degree in Mathematics and Physics. He has years of experience building custom software and worked in penetration testing for RMSTek – a true hacker at heart. He was involved in a NASA project with internet controlled robotics when he left to get rolling with TechStars and Orbotix.
 

Mark Platshon - Partner with Birchmere Ventures and Senior Investment Advisor for BMW i Ventures. Previously Mark was a partner in the Cleantech group at VantagePoint and a Silicon Valley CEO for 20+ years. Before joining the venture capital world, Mark was a serial Silicon Valley CEO for over 20 years, including ELO, Idetek, Zing and was co-founder of Amprius, an advanced Lithium-ion battery company spun out of Stanford University.

He was an early investor in Tesla. He has served on the Boards of numerous companies, including Synxis, acquired by Sabre; Everdream, acquired by Dell; Coulomb, Embark, Solexant, Amprius, GLO, Idetek, ELO, Ancore, Zing and Capnia. Mark earned a BSE in Naval Architecture and Marine Engineering at the University of Michigan, studied Nuclear Engineering at the Westinghouse Naval Reactor School and obtained his MBA from Stanford University. As a Lieutenant in the Navy, Mark had a joint Navy and Department of Energy appointment to Admiral Rickover’s nuclear submarine engineering staff.

  


SENSEIS.

Rónán Ó Braonáin - is a Senior Advanced Technology Engineer in the Sustainable Mobility group at the BMW Group Technology Office USA in Mountain View, CA. Hailing originally from Ireland, Rónán has over 6 years experience working as a software engineer, originally at IBM, before moving to BMWs Munich headquarters. There he gained a lot of experience with automotive software development, and later led software development on government-sponsored projects in the smarter and greener charging of electric vehicles. Rónán has a BSc (Hons) in Computer Applications from Dublin City University and speaks fluent German. Dennis Kyle - serves as the Vice President of Strategic and New Markets for Tendril Networks where he oversees the development of Tendril’s non-Utility business relationships. Dennis has over 20 years of leadership experience in Technology and Communications related industries. As one of the early employees at McCaw Communications (which later became AT&T Wireless) he has been involved in the very beginnings of the Communications and Internet revolution. Over the years he and has held numerous senior leadership positions at companies such as Nextlink Interactive and XO Communications as well as Level 3 Communications and Zayo Managed Services where he served as Senior Vice President and President respectively. Dennis has a BS in Industrial Engineering from Northwestern University as well as MBA and MA in “Development Economics” from Stanford University.


SPONSORS.
Thank you to all who helped to make this possible.

events.name: Georgetown Hackathon 2012
events.about:
Georgetown Hackathon 2012
Striving for the Magis (the more)

What: 100 students & alumni | 30 faculty & staff | 20 teams | 36 hours | $2,000

Hacking: Taking something apart and rebuilding it to make it better or give it a new function

The Challenge: Design an app, product, or service that will transform the University and enhance the way students live, learn, work, and play at Georgetown. 

The Mission: To turn data into information and create a more social and mobile Georgetown.

Collaborate: Georgetown staff, faculty, and designers and engineers from innovative companies will participate as mentors for these 20 teams during the Georgetown Hackathon.

Incubate: Teams will present 3 minute pitches on Sunday to a panel of Georgetown senior administrators as well as other leading industry thinkers. The winning teams will get to incubate their ideas directly at the University.

Hosts: The CIOs Office & University Information Services (UIS)
 

Collaborators: The Presidents Office | The Provosts Office | The COOs Office

events.name: AngelHack Hackathon Fall 2012 Boston
events.about:
AngelHack’s 24-hour Hackathon is back and this time we’re bigger than ever! Join us for Bostons Fall 2012 edition, where you can find:

  • 100s of amazing developers & designers to work with
  • Gourmet food, shwag, nerf guns, helicopters, and at select locations- AR drones and free massages
  • Over $650,000 in prizes, including acceptance into AngelHacks Hackcelerator program and trips to Silicon Valley (more details below and on our FAQ)
  • Media coverage and immediate attention for your hackathon project to get taken to the next level
  • An awesome community of mentors, influencers, and expert judges to help you along the way

What should I build?
Create a prototype (hack) of something that you believe solves a big problem. You dont need a business plan or anything crazy like that, but you should be able to show the big idea potential of your hack. AngelHack is a launchpad for you to flush out and validate projects youve always wanted to build. Previous winners include: Appetas, GiveGo, TapFame, SnapStore, ShareBrowse, Kloutron, & Blue Dragon Security.

What are the rules?

All code must be FRESH. Prior to the hackathon you can create your design, wireframes, logo, and user flows. You can even build hardware. But to make things completely fair you can not write any code whatsoever until the hackathon starts. All code must be built at AngelHack.

For more info visit our Rules and FAQ pages.

Good Luck,
Gregory Gopman
AngelHack Founder / CEO

As seen in

events.name: #blackhack at the Hype
events.about:
#blackhack at the Hype is a hackathon for the black tech community in Metro ATL and beyond. Were bringing together the hacker/designer/founder community to design mobile and web applications for corporations, local nonprofits and tech startups with black founders. 

Join us on November 16-17th for a chance to:

  • network with the local #blacktech community, 
  • create gorgeous new apps, 
  • support our startups and, of course, 
  • eat amazing food all day. 

Thats not all, well also be:

  • sharing your resumes with our startups and corporations who are always on the lookout for amazing talent, 
  • giving out great prizes, including:
We have some amazing prices and the list keeps growing!

Interview on FuseBox Radio

2nd place:
Special Edition EA Sports Packs

1 year supply of Limitless Sure Shots

$50 Amazon Gift Card

Best of all? All proceeds go to Black Girls Code, so pay what you can so we can teach our girls to code!

events.name: BSC Open Hackathon 1: Saturday, Nov 17  - Sunday, Nov 18 (weekend)
events.about:
The hackathon will take place fromSaturday, Nov 17 at 9am - Sunday, Nov 18 8pm. 

This hackathon is the best place to work, network and perhaps even meet your future co-founding software engineer, designer, product guy, business geek, customer, employee or angel investor.

In the hacakthon you can either work on an existing or new project.

For startups it is  the best place to see people working on apps and APIs for your products.

Dont be afraid or shy. The hackathon is meant to be fun. We will build interdisciplinary teams. You do not need to be a software engineer to participate.

There will be enterprise/consumer angel investors and VCs at the hackathon. So it would a great environment to chitchat with investors in a relaxed atmosphere about your product/project; WesttechVentures +  Wellington + Hasso Plattner Ventures + Rocket Internet + Catagonia + Tarent AG

There will be free food and drinks on both days. Please write us an e-mail if you are vegetarian after buying a ticket in order  to order vegetarian food  also.

You can win an iPad/Kindle for hacks on Paymill.

 

We will build interdisciplinary teams at the hackathon on the Saturday morning. Each team will consists of software engineers, product guys, designers and business geeks. The software engineers will be coding, while the product guys  work on the product details,the designers take over the design and the business geeks the business side of the project.

On Sunday evening each team will have 5 minutes to demo and pitch their work + 5 minutes Q&A. The best 3 teams will win prizes.



Below are the list of topics:

Consumer

  1. Social
  2. Photo
  3. Couponing/daily deal services
  4. Payments (web, mobile)
  5. Mobile Advertising
  6. Games
  7. Real Estate
  8. Education
  9. Finance
  10. Music & Sound
  11. Travel

Enterprise

  1. Big data analytics
  2. Platform as a Service: PaaS

 

Schedule

Saturday

09:00:00 AM Reception + Registration

09:30:00 AM Introduction + Hackathon Agenda + Sponsor Pitches

10:00:00 AM Idea Pitches + Prices Annoucement

10:30:00 AM Team Building

11:00:00 AM Begin Hacking

02:00:00 PM Continue Work

07:00:00 PM Dinner  (Free Food + Drinks)

08:00:00 PM Continue working overnight

Sunday

08:00:00 AM Breakfast (Free Food + Drinks)

09:00:00 AM Progress Updates From Groups

09:00:00 AM Continue Work

01:00:00 PM Lunch (Free Food + Drinks)

02:00:00 PM Continue Work

05:00:00 PM Pitch + Pitch Training

06:00:00 PM Hack Presentations 08:00:00 PM Closing

Please note that the deadline for purchasing a ticket  is Nov 14 as we will need time to prepare the event. No ticket can be purchased on the day of the hackathon. People without a ticket will not be allowed to enter the premise.

We are looking for further supporters for the hackathon. If you want to support organizing the hackathon, shoot us an e-mail.

Buy your ticket for the hackathon today on this page  or  on Eventbrite: http://goo.gl/FeGl3

events.name: hack/reduce kickoff hackathon
events.about:
Boston’s Big Data Hackspace is kicking off November 17th with its first hackathon and we’re inviting the whole community to participate!  Join us at our amazing space in the old Kendall Boiler & Tank Building (yes, THAT building) for a full day of hacking with 115 coders, 45 pizzas, and beer.

The hackathon is an all-day event where hackers build cool Big Data analytics applications that run on a Hadoop cluster. Hack/reduce provides the space, the food, the cluster and some hand-holding.

We’re pre-loading the datasets found on here: https://github.com/hackreduce/Hackathon/wiki/Datasets. If there are other data sets you’d like to work on, let us know as soon as possible so that you don’t waste half the day Saturday waiting for your data to be uploaded to the cluster.

For more details, visit: https://github.com/hackreduce/Hackathon/wiki

Brought to us by our fabulous friends at Hopper!

  

about hack/reduce
hack/reduce is ground zero for Bostons Big Data community; a big data clubhouse that connects developers, data scientists and domain experts across disciplines.

Well provide a large-scale compute cluster, data sets, hands-on workshops, hackathons and a shared workspace for developing Big Data projects and helping Boston to create the talent and technologies to lead us into a big data-driven future.

hack/reduce is a non-profit 501 c3 established in partnership with the State of Massachusetts and our amazing Founding Sponsors:

  • Microsoft
  • IBM
  • EMC
  • DELL
  • Massachusetts Technology Collaborative
  • Atlas Venture
  • Bain Capital Ventures
  • Bessemer Venture Partners
  • Charles River Ventures
  • Matrix Partners
  • North Bridge Venture Partners
  • Goodwin Proctor
  • Foley & Lardner

With thanks to our wonderful in-kind sponsors: Brown Rudnick LLP and Turnstone.

Getting Here

Were a 5 minute walk from the Kendall T stop. Just take 3rd street down 3 blocks to our building on the left in the Kendall Boiler & Tank Building.

There is limited street parking around the building and a garage at 350 Kendall Street, Cambridge, MA.

events.name: Midata Hackathon 2012
events.about:
More and more data is being generated which contains information about the choices that we make. Businesses use this data to develop new products and services, but so far consumers have not been able to access it or use it easily. By giving consumers the ability to request their data electronically, the UK governments midata strategy helps give power back to consumers. Accessing data about their previous consumption/transactions, and thus their purchasing and consumption behaviour, can help them make better decisions in the future.

The Midata Hackathon 2012 is all about exploring whats possible when consumers have access to their data. Come along and join developers, designers, and domain experts to build new apps that empower consumers in radical new ways.

Visit the website at http://theodi.org/events/midata-hackathon-2012 for full details and schedule.

events.about:

events.name: Accessibility Hackathon 2
events.about:
Accessibility Hackathon 2 will bring together people with disabilities, and software and other developers to produce accessibility solutions, and to provide mentorship.

The event will take place from 9:30AM to 5:30PM, on Saturday November 10th, in room 215 Adaptive Services at the Martin Luther King Jr. Memorial Library at 901 G Street NW, Washington DC, 20001.

SimpleEmotion.coms president, Gabriel Forsythe y Korzeniewicz will be present to introduce participants to their software that recognizes emotions in spoken audio content.  SimpleEmotion is opening their API so that developers can build accessibility solutions.  The Adaptive Services Division community has suggested a number of solutions listed at this page: http://www.wikimediadc.org/wiki/Accessibility_hackathon2

Please also see our list of suggested solutions from last year: http://www.wikimediadc.org/wiki/Accessibility_hackathon

This event is related to DC Week, a city-wide tech festival that brings together developers, goverment and nonprofits.  DC Week developers are invited to come to the event.

Another project will be to create a list of open source and easy to use adaptive technologies that can go on refurbished computers.  

Antoher project will be to create an accessible snap circuits kit using Braille, LargePrint and editing a manual for cognitive accessibility.

Please feel free to suggest other solutions at: http://www.wikimediadc.org/wiki/Accessibility_hackathon2
events.address: Room 215, Adaptive Services Division 901 G Street NW

events.about:
ReCode Project

http://recodeproject.com/

Come hang out with us and translate computer art from the 1970s into Processing! Were starting an active archive called the ReCode Project that will archive retro artworks and host modern code so you can play with it. But we need translators to make this happen and this here hackathon is going to launch it all.

events.name: Wikilife Hackathon
events.about:
Sat, Nov 17 - WikiLife Hackathon: Cambridge

Please join us on Saturday, November 17 for a WikiLife hackathon in Cambridge at {location}. 
  • Learn about WikiLife
    • The event will include a description of on the major features of WikiLife, including our API.  Enthusiasts will be on hand to help and to answer questions throughout the day. 
  • Build with Us or Build Your Own 
    • Throughout the day, you will be building complete mobile Quantified Self tracking application. Bring your great idea with you to the hackathon plus anything you can prepare ahead of time (sketches, designs, webpage mockups, etc.) and use the time and information provided to develop your idea into a working application, then share it with the world.  You are encouraged to code with a team [do we want to encourage people to code in teams? ]
    • At the end of the day, well invite you to share your WL application with the group. 
  • What Do I Need? 
    • We will provide facilities, power, food, refreshments, caffeine and experts to help you learn to use WikiLife and write your application. Just bring your laptop, ideas, and enthusiasm to complete the mix. 
  • When and Where? 
    • The WikiLife Cambridge hackathon will take place Saturday, November 17th from 
      10 am to 6 pm. It will be held in {name and address of venue with link to map}. 
  • Questions?
  • Contact Amy Robinson at 256.457.6677 or arobinson@wikilife.org

events.name: Hackathon - Gestione emergenze
events.about:
L’hackathon è passione, impegno, voglia di divertirsi e di creare qualcosa di nuovo. Ma può essere anche qualcosa si più. Con questo hackathon vogliamo dare un aiuto concreto alle popolazioni colpite da catastrofi che si abbattono sul territorio (come sismi e alluvioni).

Programmatori, designer, esperti di tecnologie e makers ma anche studenti, creativi e appassionati tutti possono partecipare all’hackathon mettendo in condivisione le proprie conoscenze e professionalità per dare un aiuto concreto a chi è stato colpito da catastrofi. 

LHackathon si svolgerà allinterno di Codemotion Venezia, ospitato da H-Farm ed è organizzato da WhyMCA con il supporto diFrankenstein Garage.

Per tutte le altre informazioni sull’evento Codemotion, da come arrivare al programma, consultate il sito: www.codemotion.it

events.name: Ideate with Unilever in Health and Wellness
events.about:
Are you looking for potential cofounders to work on ideas on the wellbeing space? Are you passionate about industries such as health, sport, beauty and food, and are you looking to identify an opportunity to work in?

Do you want to know what is Unilever looking for in areas such as Health and Wellness?

Founders Fit is running a full day Ideation day with Unilever in the areas of Health and Wellness. The event will bring together talented designers, technologists and business people to explore the opportunities to exploit Univers IPA related to health and wellbeing.

In this Ideate event, Unilever will show and open their HeartAge API to the entrepreneurs attending the event. During the day, cross disciplinary teams of 4-6 entrepreneurs and experts will generate ideas or products, applications and services that can be implement with the help of the HeartAge Tool. At the end of the day, the teams will present the ideas in front of a panel of experts, including some Unilever representatives. The best 10 ideas will be selected to be developed in a hackathon the first weekend in December.

What is the event format?

Participants will have the opportunity to meet innovators from Unilever and from other companies and startups related to health and wellness industry. They will also have the change to get new ideas for potential new businesses.

Who should attend:
- Entrepreneurs starting companies in the well-being space (i.e. food, health, sport/fitness, beauty,...)
- Entrepreneurs looking to join startups in the any of these industries
- Professionals passionate for the well-being space, looking to create solutions to help people improve their health and quality of life
 
Agenda of the day:
12pm - 12.30 - registration and lunch
12.30pm - 1pm - rules of the game
1pm - 2pm - speed meetings with industry experts and pitches from industry experts (including Health 2.0 guys and Unilever guys)
2pm - 5pm - ideation (based on halfway milestones)
5pm - 6pm - final presentation of ideas in front of experts panel
6pm - selection of the ideas to be developed in the  hackathon

events.name: Hackathon Cloud Life
events.about:
Welcome to a mobile HACK! where teams will compete for prizes to develop the most innovative cloud connected mobile phone application.

Draft agenda:

    14:30 Inroduction and welcome
    15:00 HACK! begins
    18:00 Pizza & Drinks arrive
    20:30 Demos and voting
    21:15 Prize giving
    21:30 End

HACK venue:

     Restuarant Gustav in Greenland building

HACK! format:

     Teams of three putting together a cloud connected mobile application in 5 hours.

HACK! preparation:

     You are free to develop on any platform, but we will support you on Google app engine and Android, so prepare your laptop with Google’s development environment (GAE SDK,Android SDK & Eclipse). There are loads of useful resources on the web and a good starting point is programmable web.

The event is open to all employees and on-site consultants at Sony Mobile: please register with your corporate email address.

events.name: KWBBDev BB10 Mini-Hackathon
events.about:
Hello KW BB Dev team! Want to jump start your BB10 dev? polish your BB10 apps with fellow BB devs? Join the BB10 mini-hackathon right here at Kitchener-Waterloo.

The Matrix and Atlas rooms are reserved from 12 pm - 4 pm. You can join us for the first half (12 - 2 pm) or preferably stay with us until 4 pm. There are some cool prizes to be awarded to the best BB10 app presentation.

Bring your own laptop with the latest BB10 WebWorks and/or BB10 NDK already installed. If you have a BB10 Dev Alpha device, bring it with you as well.

RIM application development consultants will give mini-presentations at the start and at the middle of the event. After coding, presentation of BB10 apps follows. We end with judging and awarding of BB10 app/ presentation. Detailed agenda will be available before the start of the event.

events.name: Shipper des API, du Web avec Scala et de l'Android en mode Hackathon.
events.about:
Un hands on pour voir ce que lon peut faire avec Scala et Java pour créer et livrer un produit rapidement en mode hackathon. La soirée sera animée par Rand Hindi, Pierre-Yves Ricau et Jonathan Winandy. 

Le hands on se déroulera en binôme avec la partie Scala et Android en même temps.

Pour participer à la soirée, vous aurrez besoin absolument de votre propre machine.

Pour informations :

  • On ne fait pas de Scala sur Android, ce nest pas sérieux en mode hackathon !
  • Pour la partie sur Scala, il est mieux de connaître un peu Scala/sbt (avoir suivit le cours sur Coursera par exemple).
  • Pour la partie sur Android, il est préférable davoir un téléphone qui tourne sur Android, et de connaître un petit peu/de loin Android.

events.name: Real Time Web Hackaton
events.about:
Real-time web : the next frontier.

Real time applications (like audio, video or data) are now possible using HTML5. In this Hackaton you will learn and be able to do all kind of applications that uses this facilities. Even if you don’t know about you will be able to do an application along the day. The leaders of the community will teach you how things work and how to use on your new applications.

You will be able to attend different tutorial session with the best experts and you will be able to demonstrate your best abilities in the HACKATON with some nice prices.

We are waiting for you in order to see what may build together.

Schedule : 

10h00  Opening WebGL and Q4S Workshop

10h10  Introduction to HTML5 and to Chrome browser architecture 

10h40  Introduction to WebRTC Arquitecture

11h10  Q4S: A quality of service approach for HTML5 and WebRTC

12h00 Lynckia: An Example of a WebRTC MC

12h30 WebRTC application example 

13h00 ViSH: HTML5 Real Time Mashups

13h30  Presentation of WebRTC and Q4S Hackathon and networking session

20h00 Presentation of Hackathon Results

 20h30 Awards and Closure

events.name: Mile High
events.about:
A tempting cocktail of programming, design and creativity. This competition will stretch even the industrys best talent. Whether youre competing from the flight control tower or spectating from the viewing platform, the experience will be nothing short of... explosive. 

Heres why...

Mile High is not just for hackers and designers. Spectators are also highly valued. Picture a live competition, in a bar, DJs and audience involvement with creative competitions. Fight for prizes, free drinks, and your team on the night.

Note! Audience participation is encouraged.

You’ll receive a pre-flight beverage drink on arrival at the lounge and we’ll provide light snacks from Verona that will top any airline food you’ve ever experienced.

Last time we had 6 computer screens, this time we’re ramping up the visuals. That means you’ll be able to see exactly what the teams are working on throughout the night.

Our flight crew will answer any questions, so no hacking knowledge is required to fly Mile High Airlines

The flight control deck will be fun to watch and easy to follow along with on the big.

What to expect of your journey.

 For starters, a planeload of fun.

As you walk in the door we will assign you to a team with a unique coloured wristband. Your wristband colour will match the colour of the team youve been assigned to. Want to switch teams? Bartering and bribery is encouraged! Find somebody to trade with, meet new people, break the ice. We will be running mini competitions and giving out drink cards and prizes throughout the night.

6 teams overcome various distractions, working together on a project to solve a myriad of computer programming problems in an entertaining environment featuring:

  • 20 hackers, 4 designers
  • Spectator competitons
  • Giveaways
  • And much more... (we like surprises)

Inflight Entertainment.

No reruns of Forrest Gump, we promise.

Our lineup of inflight entertainment will keep you going throughout your journey.

Head over to our website for more details: Hacktivate.me

events.name: Mobile Technology Hackathon: Apps for Empowerment
events.about:
The theme of the 5th ICAT is:

Appropriate Technology for the 21st Century: Linking Education, Research and Practice to Inform Policy

  1. Promote the identification, assessment, archiving and tracking of appropriate technology education, research and practice
  2. Focus on how to impact technology policy to safeguard the planet and empower the people, particularly historically oppressed and disadvantaged populations
  3. Provide a forum for networking on appropriate technology solutions to sustainable development in Africa and across the Global South

In this spirit, we will be holding a hackathon in conjunction with the conference.  A hackathon is an event where software developers, designers, and subject-matter experts come together for a short amount of time, develop an idea for a project, and make strides toward a first implementation of the project idea.

How you can help

ICAT brings together some of the world’s foremost thinkers on Appropriate Technology, including YOU.  If you have an idea for an application that can help empower people, share it with us, and participate in the hackathon.  If you dont have an idea yet, come brainstorm with us, or lend your expertiese.

During the hackathon youll contribute to an empowering project (or projects) related to 

  • urban and community planning,
  • political awareness and participation,
  • economics and markets,
  • personal and environmental health,
  • ...

Schedule

We will be kicking off the hackathon during the ICAT tech fair on Friday, November 23, and continuing through the day on Saturday, November 24.  Additionally, we encourage participants to continue work on their projects, as there will be a second round of judging on December 17th.

  • Friday, November 23 - Technology fair and project brainstorming
  • Saturday, November 24 -
    • Introductions and project pitches
    • Project work
    • Presentations/demonstrations
    • First-round judging and awards
  • Monday, December 17 -
    • Second-round judging and awards

We hope you join us!

events.name: Student Upstarts Business Hackathon
events.about:
Why? Because we believe that students will create the best companies for the future - be your own boss and do it right now.

What? A Student Upstarts business hackathon - pitch ideas, form teams and build a business - all in one weekend.

Where? The offices of Entepreneur First, 111 Canon Street, London, EC4N 5AR. Map URL.

The format:

- Join fellow entrepreneurial students who are interested in starting their own company to discuss ideas, form teams then create a business over the weekend.

- The aim is to build the best MVP and pitch this on Sunday afternoon to a judging panel.

- Christian and Matthew, the co-founders of Student Upstarts, will be there all weekend to mentor teams on how and why to build an MVP and to answer queries on what makes an investable business as well as the Student Upstarts plans for the rest of 2012.

- Students from the teams weve backed so far will also be there to answer any questions too.

- Whats included: Red Bull, Pizza and a few of beers to celebrate on Sunday.

-- Hosted by Christian Jakenfelds & Matthew Stafford --

-- Student Upstarts - up to £15,000 investment into student teams to create and grow businesses --

events.name: AngelHack Fall 2012 Santiago
events.about:
Ready to take your big idea to the next level? Then join us for Santiagos first AngelHack, where winning teams will receive 6-8 weeks of mentorship and be flown into Silicon Valley for a weekend of events including a Global Demo Day to A-list investors and media, Site visits to, Google, Facebook, Google Ventures, VIP dinners, and ragging parties with the Valley startup community. This is not your typical weekend hackathon! This is the big leagues! This is AngelHack and you cant afford to miss it.

AngelHack Fall 2012 Fast Facts
  • 2500 amazing developers & designers in 11 cities for you to work with
  • Great food, shwag, nerf guns, helicopters, and awesomness all around
  • Over $650,000 in prizes, including trips to Silicon Valley for the top 25 teams
  • Media coverage and all star investor judges to help validate those whacky hack ideas of yours

What should I build?

Create a prototype (hack) of something that you believe solves a big problem. You dont need a business plan or anything crazy like that, but you should be able to show the big idea potential of your hack. AngelHack is a launchpad for you to flush out and validate projects youve always wanted to build. Previous winners include: Appetas, GiveGo, TapFame, SnapStore, ShareBrowse, Kloutron, & Blue Dragon Security.

What are the rules?
All code must be FRESH. Prior to the hackathon you can create your design, wireframes, logo, and user flows. You can even build hardware. But to make things completely fair you can not write any code whatsoever until the hackathon starts. All code must be built at AngelHack.

For more info visit our Rules and FAQ pages.

Good Luck,
Gregory Gopman
AngelHack Founder / CEO

As seen in

*Tickets are Non-Refundable

events.name: Clean and Green Hackathon
events.about:
Clean and Green Hackathon

The hackathon will consist of developers coming together and through key environmental datasets, collaboratively co-create solutions using mobile/web applications that will empower the public to play a more active role in safeguarding, nurturing and cherishing Singapores environment. The hackathon will follow two topics: Safeguard our clean and green environment and Conserve our precious resources, aligned with the Clean and Green campaign in 2013.

It will be held from 24-25 November 2012, at the Plug-In@Blk71, an innovative space amanged by NUS Enterprise. All meals will be provided from start till end and winners of the hackathon stand to win attractive prizes.

This event is geared to forming a lasting relationship with the creative community in Singapore and encouraging innovation and citizen collaboration for a more environmentally conscious and technologically enabled Singapore citizenry.

Registration

Registration is free and open

Transportation

MRT Station: One-North, Kent Ridge

Bus: 14, 33, 91, 92, 95, 166, 198, 200

Sponsors

Adobe

National University of Singapore

More Information

Please see www.cgs.sg/hackathon

events.about:
Full day Hackathon from 9.00 am to 6.30 pm. 

9.00 am - Keynote by Google Student Ambassador representative

events.address: 3, IPS Building University of Malaya, Universiti Malaya

events.name: Product Hack Camp #sapihack
events.about:
Calling all product managers, designers, developers, and marketers!

How creative can you be in just 33 hours? Youd be surprised at whats possible.
Join us and find out how much innovation you can unlock in a weekend.

This is your chance to hack together new product concepts and explore amazing feature ideas, play with a bunch of fun tools and mash some great brands together.

With inspirational talks by successful product management veterans, product demos, giveaways and a series of invaluable product management mini workshops hosted by Brainmates.

It doesnt matter who you are - designer, developer, marketing guru, student, analyst, or something else entirely - youve got worthwhile skills to contribute. Come with a team, or find some kindred spirits to partner with on the day.

PRIZES

Create something brand new and compete for the $5000 prize for the best product concept that mashes SAPI up with other partners.

Or bring your existing products and teams to the party, and compete for a$5000 prize for best SAPI integration with an existing product.


And more!

  • $500 prize to the runners up in each category.
  • $500 prize from Jeppesen for best use of thier Journey Planner API mashed up with SAPI
  • Adobe will award a prize for best use of Phonegap Build using SAPI
  • Free tickets to workshop your app with app guru Mike Lee, mayor of Appsetrdam (value of $275 each)
  • Place in the next Brainmates Essentials of Product Management course (value of $2799)
  • 3 free PRO licenses for the Wikitude SDK
  • Gadgets!! Amazon Kindles - BlackBerry PlayBooks - a Jambox from Mashery - an iPad Mini from Twilio.
  • Free Twilio credits for participants.
  • More prizes to be announced closer to the date.

AGENDA

SATURDAY

  • 9:00 am - arrive at York Butter Factory
  • 9:30 am - kick off, introduction to mentors
  • 10:00 am – tools overview (5 minute overview for each mashup partner)
  • 10:30 am – team formation activities
  • 11:00 am – work begins, optional sessions held throughout the weekend
  • 12:00 pm – lunch is served
  • 7:00 pm – dinner is served with drinks

SUNDAY

  • 10:30 am – brunch is served
  • 3:00 pm – tools down, and final presentations to the judges and peers!
  • 5:00 pm – awards and celebration drinks/snacks

OPTIONAL SESSIONS THROUGHOUT THE WEEKEND

  • Adobe Phonegap Build Workshop (30 minutes)
  • Amazon Web Services Workshop (30 minutes)
  • Startup advice from Stuart Richardson, Founder of Adventure Capital (15 minutes)
  • Stories From the Trenches – What Our Mentors Have Learned About Product Development (15 minutes each)
  • BRAINMATES SESSION 1: Ideation - Idea Collection and Prioritisation (20 minutes)
  • BRAINMATES SESSION 2: Persona Definition - Know your Market (20 minutes)
  • BRAINMATES SESSION 3: Scenario Definition - Describing the Problem (20 minutes)
  • BRAINMATES SESSION 4: The Pitch - Selling the Idea to Others (20 minutes)
  • Pitch practice sessions with our mentors.

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

  1. Prior work is not allowed when competing for the ‘Best new product’ prize.
  2. Prior work is acceptable when competing for the ‘Best SAPI integration with an existing product’ prize.
  3. All Hackathon participants must register on this website before Saturday 23rd Nov 2012.
  4. The development tools, frameworks and application focus are entirely up to the participants but all final submissions must integrate the Sensis API to be eligible for any prize.
  5. Participants are expected to BYO tools & software necessary to build their entry.
  6. Rules are subject to change if necessary at the discretion of Sensis & participating partners.
  7. Participants must present their project concepts to the judging panel at 3:00pm on 24th Nov with working product prototypes presented to the judging panel at 5:00pm on Sunday 25th Nov 2012.
  8. All prizes will be awarded after 5:00 PM on Sunday 25th Nov 2012.
  9. All design and code assets remain intellectual property of the individuals who created them.
  10. Sensis may use your business name and the name of your product and screenshots of your product in our public statements and marketing materials.

Follow @SensisAPI and #sapihack for updates.

Any questions?api@sensis.com.au  

Get a headstart on the competition and register for your Sensis API key today!

events.name: HACKAGONG Recruiters and Reps
events.about:
HackAGong has attracted the best technical talent the University of Wollongong and the Illawarra region has to offer. 56 designers, developers and business types are already registered and were expecting between 80-100 people for the 24-25 November weekend.

The hackathon event starts at 10am Saturday 24th November and runs continuously through to 4pm Sunday 25th November. From 4-6pm on Sunday 25th November, there is a presentation & awards event held at the uniBar where teams will pitch and demo their products, and judges will award prizes to the best.

This is an unparalled opportunity to see fresh recruiting talent in action, using the latest technologies and resources at hand, working within teams to build real-world product prototypes within just 30 hours.

Send your organisations representative to attend the main event, network, promote and chat to HackAGong participants. Food is provided for the entire weekend, and youre welcome to attend at any time during the weekend.

Well also include your company as a sponsor and add your logo to the website and marketing materials.

For more details: http://hackagong.com

events.name: Teenweb Hackathon
events.about:
Starting from 12PM on Saturday 24th November and continuing through to 12PM on Saturday 25th November, youll be working around the clock to produce a working prototype of your web, mobile or desktop application AND a marketable business strategy accompanying it.

With industry volunteers available on the day for guidance, all meals provided and prizes that promise to be Awesome, we definitely hope youll take the opportunity to join us.

Therell be plenty of goodies to be had on the day too.

Check us our on Twitter or on Facebook to find out more.

www.teenwebhack.com

events.name: HACKAGONG 2012
events.about:
Wollongongs first major hackathon open to all designers, developers and business folk.

  1. Form teams
  2. Devise an idea

Food will be provided for the entire weekend.

For more details, checkout the website: hackagong.com

events.name: ShareHack - l'hackathon dedicato alla condivisione
events.about:
L’hackathon dedicato alla condivisione

24 ore non-stop per realizzare la vostra idea.

La sfida è aperta a sviluppatori, designer, comunicatori e innovatori per sviluppare un prodotto o servizio capace di promuovere la condivisione negli ambiti più diversi:

- soluzioni per il consumo collaborativo online e offline

- tools analogici e digitali,

- piattaforme collaborative e qualunque altra applicazione che la vostra mente creativa sappia immaginare!

>> Potete sviluppare il vostro prodotto/servizio con qualsiasi tecnologia e per qualunque device.

Come funziona?

H.10.00 di mattina: ci si conosce, si condividono le prime idee, si scelgono le più visionarie e ci si divide in gruppi multidisciplinari, composti da sviluppatori, designer e comunicatori.

Si progetta non-stop fino alla mattina dopo, quando fra brioche e cappuccino i progetti saranno valutati da una giuria di esperti di business, sviluppo e design.

In premio device tecnologici e servizi offerti dai partner (aggiornamenti sui premi a questo indirizzo)

Come premio speciale un Nokia Lumia 710 offerto da Microsoft BizSpark e Microsoft Dreamspark per coloro che svilupperanno il loro prodotto con Windows 8. Proprio per questo è stata organizzata una giornata formativa gratuita il 23 Novembre (se vuoi partecipare al workshop gratuito registrati qui, lappuntamento è in Toolbox Coworking, venerdì 23 novembre dalle 15 alle 19) 

Come partecipare allo ShareHack:

Il costo di partecipazione è di 15 euro, comprensivo di pranzo, cena e colazione!

QUANDO: dalle 10.00 di sabato 24 novembre alle h.10.00 di domenica 25

DOVE: Toolbox Coworking, Via Agostino da Montefeltro 2, 10134, Torino

COSA PORTARE: il tuo computer, le tue idee e la voglia di trasformare una intuizione in un prodotto

PROGRAMMA DETTAGLIATO

Sabato 24 Novembre

10.00 Registrazione partecipanti e consegna badge

10.30 Descrizione del format e presentazione dei premi

11.00 Pitching: i partecipanti con un’idea innovativa la espongono in 1 minuto

12.30 Mingling: i partecipanti votano le 10 idee migliori e formano i gruppi di lavoro

13.00 Lunch di Networking

14.00 Working:  sviluppo del prodotto o servizio. A supporto dei team saranno presenti consulenti di business, tecnici e designer.

20.00 Social Dinner

21.30 Working: i partecipanti si dedicano allo sviluppo del prodotto o servizio all-night-long

Domenica 25 Novembre

08.00 Caffè

09.00 Presentazione dei progetti

10.00 Premiazione

10.30 Colazione di networking

Per info su premi, mentor e giuria clicca qui

events.name: Sanitation Hackathon Dar es Salaam
events.about:
This December civic technologists will team up with subject matter experts in an intensive marathon to find innovative solutions to challenges facing the sanitation sector. The event, facilitated by the World Bank and international partners like KINU, Water and Sanitation for the Urban Poor (WSUP) and Eirëne, will take place around the World Toilet Summit (3 December 2012) simultaneously in Dar Es Salaam and several cities around the world.

The event will take place over the last week of December culmunating a 48 Hour Hackathon. There will be several events leading up to the hackathon; including field trips on the 24 & 25 of November and a brainstorming session on 28 November.

Were calling for all people to attend, from sanitation experts bringing their experience in solving issues to junior or senior developers seeking to learn or demonstrate new skills. By working together we can help solve the sanitation issues in Tanzania.

Please note that by signing up for the event you are committing to attending several events.

Ticket One:
Sanitation Field Trips on November 24 & 25
Sanitation Brain Storming Session on November 28 at KINU Innovation Space (www.kinu.co.tz)
Sanitation Hack on Dec 1 & 2 at COSTECH (Sayansi) 

Ticket Two:
Sanitation Brain Storming Session on November 28 at KINU Innovation Space (www.kinu.co.tz)
Sanitation Hack on Dec 1 & 2 at COSTECH (Sayansi) 
 

Plugin to http://lanyrd.com/2012/sanhack/ to keep in touch with all the social media.
For more information visit: http://www.sanitationhackathon.org/dar-es-salaam

events.name: SWAT4LS 2012 (Semantic Web Applications and Tools for Life Sciences)
events.about:
SWAT4LS is a workshop that provides a venue to present and discuss benefits and limits of the adoption of Web based information systems and Semantic technologies in biomedical informatics and computational biology.

The 2012 edition of SWAT4LS will be articulated on a one day workshop, preceded by two days reserved for hackathons and tutorials.

We are confident that the next edition of SWAT4LS will provide the same open and stimulating environment that brought together researchers, both developers and users, from the various fields of Biology, Bioinformatics and Computer Science, to discuss goals, current limits and real experiences in the use of semantic, web-based technologies in the Life Sciences and Biomedical Informatics.

Note on tickets: the event is spread over three days. Tickets for each day are sold independently.

The Hackathon and the tutorials and workshop days are organized in different sites in Paris. Please referer tohttp://www.swat4ls.org/workshops/paris2012 for more details.

Allocation of tuorials to each track will be guaranteed on a first come, first served basis.

if you need to pay by bank transfer please contact info@swat4ls.org

events.name: DemoCamp Niagara 2
events.about:
DemoCamp Niagara is back. Join local designers, developers, entrepreneurs, and investors for an evening of technology demos. You will have a unique opportunity to see tech built right here in Niagara.

DemoCamp 2 is taking place at the Red Hot Chili Pepper in Downtown St. Catharines on Wednesday November 28, 2012. Doors open at 6PM for refreshments, snacks, and networking. The presentations begin at 7PM.

Dr. Kevin Kee of Brock Universitys Centre for Digital Humanities will present a keynote: The Future of the Past, or Why Historians Need to Work with Digital Media Developers. Afterward, demonstrations will include:

  • Trevor Twining, Senior Dev and Team Lead for CGI Group, with a Drupal distribution meant to enable the simple publication and sharing of geographic data.
  • Glen Herdy of Protecht will demonstrate the XAT Tool, addressing the often unheeded threats posed by printer security vulnerabilities.
  • Ericka Evans from Phantom Compass will present Rollers of the Realm, a unique mashup of pinball and fantasy role-playing game, to be launched in 2013 for iPad, PC, and XBLIG.
  • Software Niagara’s very own app, produced during their Secret Hackathon!

Sign up for this free event now and make sure you dont miss being the first to see the hottest new software being produced in Niagara. See you there!

events.name: Usability Hackathon
events.about:
We are recruiting approximately 10 participants for a one-day hackathon style developer event in order to test the usability of our APIs. This programming event will take place on Thursday, November 29th.

Each participant will receive a $500 Visa Gift Card. Participants will also have the opportunity for another $100 Amazon Gift Card based on performance.

In order to participate, you must be a real developer with real experience and your skills must fall into one of the four categories below. You need to know how to use 3rd party APIs and incorporate them into your mobile applications. 

Please reply to this EventBrite.  We will contact you and provide an email address - please send  your resume to that address. We will contact you after we have had a chance to review your resume.

The Details:

The Event: Usability Hackathon
Location: North Austin, near the Arboretum
Date: Thursday, November 29th
Time: 9AM -- 4PM Breakfast and Lunch will be provided.
Additional: As a participant, you will be responsible for bringing a laptop with your tools of the trade. We will provide the internet connection and the credentials to the APIs that we are expecting you to use. We will provide a series of tasks for you to code and we would like to get their feedback on the usability of our developer portal and associated APIs.

Developer Categories:

HTML5 / Mobile Web App developer
• Active developer who spends most of their time developing HTML5 / web apps, preferably for mobile access
• Very fluent in frontend technologies, such as JavaScript, JQuery, HTML5, CSS3, etc.
• Fluent in backend/server technologies for hosting web apps and server side functionality, such as Ruby, Rails, PHP, Node.JS, Python, Curl
• Experience with other RESTful APIs, such as Facebook, Twitter, Foursquare, Twilio
• Has active and easily accessible web hosting solution for hosting web apps, such as Amazon Web Services, Heroku, etc.

Native iOS App developer
• Active developer who spends most of their time developing native iOS (iPhone/iPad) mobile apps
• Very fluent in writing, compiling and testing native iOS apps using native iOS SDKs, or else PhoneGap or Appcelerator or similar
• Fluent in native iOS design using Objective-C natively, or else Jquery Mobile, Sencha Touch, or similar
• Has full environment for native iOS development already set up, including Xcode, needed SDKs, Apple Developer account and iOS test device

Native Android App developer
• Active developer who spends most of their time developing native Android (phone/tablet) apps
• Very fluent in writing, compiling and testing native Android apps using Android SDKs, PhoneGap or Appcelerator or similar
• Fluent in native Android design using Java natively, or else JQuery Mobile, Sencha Touch, or similar
• Has full environment for native Android development already set up, including Eclipse, needed SDKs, and Android test device

Windows Server or Windows Phone mobile app developer
• Active developer who spends most of their time developing web based or native windows phone apps
• Very fluent in writing server side functionality using Windows technologies, such as VB.NET, C#.NET
• Very fluent in writing, compiling and testing native Windows phone apps using native SDKs, or else using PhoneGap or Appcelerator or similar
• Fluent in mobile Windows design using native technologies, or else using JQuery Mobile, Sencha Touch or similar
• Has full environment for native Windows phone app development already set up, including Microsoft Visual Studio, necessary SDKs and test device
• Has active and easily accessible Windows web hosting solution for hosting web apps, such as Amazon Web Services, with IIS installed

events.name: Roma Cleanweb Hackathon
events.about:
THE ROMA CLEANWEB HACKATHON

The spirit of the Cleanweb Hackathon is to show what you can create in a weekend; specifically, it is the opportunity to apply web, mobile and social media technologies to resource constraint issues, such as energy, waste, transportation, and water efficiency. For an overview on Cleanweb, checkout the presentations from the “Launching Cleanweb Italy” meeting in Luiss 19/9.

Thanks to our experts and partners involved, you will also have the opportunity to learn about current challenges, open data for sustainability and state of the art in Cleanweb in the US and elsewhere in Europe.

EVENT BRIEF

The Roma Cleanweb Hackathon takes place in 48 hours the weekend of 30th November through 2nd December 2012, initiating with the kickoff, briefing, idea pitching and team-building Friday afternoon and evening.

Participants are free to propose any projects relevant to the themes listed and may make use of open data, data provided by the event partners, or bring their own data. Sunday afternoon, “live” applications are demonstrated to the jury and the public. The best of these win awards.

For details, see the schedule and rules pages.

REGISTER

Participating to the Roma Cleanweb Hackathon is free, but registration is required, both for apps team participants and for public and partners attending the kick-off Friday and the presentations Sunday.

Register NOW via our registration page and secure your seat.

JOIN US

Once you’re registered, be sure to create your profile on Hacker League, review news, and wiki pages, and create your project if you have one in mind already. This will also help us all better connect and communicate during the weekend of the hackathon.
Joining us also on Twitter @CleanwebIT and Facebook. Hashtag is #CleanwebIT.

DATA SETS & APIs

You can find Data Sets and APIs for the hackathon over at Hacker League.

events.name: Windows 8 Unleashed - Los Angeles
events.about:
Windows 8 Unleashed - Full Day of Hands-On Programming, B.Y.O. Laptop!

Windows 8 is the single biggest opportunity for developers EVER! Come to a “Windows 8 Unleashed” event to kick-start your Windows 8 development. “Windows 8 Unleashed” is a series of FREE events run by your local community friends and leaders, and are great whether you are an experienced .NET developer, or even if you are just getting started. We’ll spend the morning in lecture and hands on labs. Half way through, you’ll get a chance to take what you learned in the morning and compete in a hackathon with a chance to win some great prizes!

Required Software and Downloads

Please make sure to get the required software and downloads BEFORE coming to the event. You can find everything you need on the “Windows 8 Unleashed Installs” page. 

Agenda

Session I – Overview

  • ·Metro Style Apps Overview
  • ·Developing Metro Style Apps
  • ·Working with Controls
  • ·Implementing Navigation

Session II – Location and Data

  • ·Working with Location
  • ·Data Binding
  • ·Roaming
  • ·App Bar

Session III – Metro Principals

  • ·Live Tiles & Toast
  • ·Contracts
  • ·Full, Fill Snap and Portrait Views
  • ·Advertising

Build an App and Win Money and Prizes!

Our sponsors have stepped up with some awesome prizes. Not only do you get a ton of information for FREE, but you have an opportunity to win some awesome stuff! You can’t afford to miss this!

DAY-OF prizes will be awarded (sponsored by PDSA):

  • ·1st Place: $500 Gift Card
  • ·2nd Place: $200 Gift Card
  • ·3rd Place: $100 Gift Card

“Best Overall App” Prizes will be awarded to the best app from ALL unleashed events:

  • ·$10,000 from Component Art
  • ·Windows 8 Tablet from PDSA, Inc.

In addition all attendees will receive a FREE eBook from O’Reilly

events.name: Make Web Not War & HTML5mtl Hackathon
events.about:
Joignez-vous à nous pour lhackathon! 

Si vous aimez coder autant que nous, vous allez aimer notre hackathon Make Web Not War en collaboration avec HTML5mtl. Dans une formule décontractée, venez coder une application Windows 8 en utilisant les technologies HTML5, JavaScript et CSS3. Deux options soffrent à vous:

  1. Développer une application reliée à votre blogue Wordpress à laide de notre gabarit qui vous permettra de réaliser celle-ci en très peu de temps;
  2. Développer toute autre application dont vous avez eu lidée!

Que vous développiez seul ou en équipe, vous aurez accès à des experts pour vous aider tout au long de la journée. Une collation, ainsi quun souper sera fourni. De plus, un service de bar sera disponible au courant de la journée, incluant des consommations gratuites! Nest-ce pas merveilleux?

Alors joignez-vous à nous, pour apprendre, coder et profiter de tous les avantages de déployer une application sous la nouvelle version de Windows. Code et plaisir garanti!!! 

Horaire de la journée

13:00 - Arrivé des participants (assurez-vous davoir mangé quelque chose)

13:30 - Mots de bienvenue & Mouvement des développeurs

13:45 - Mini-présentation (optionnelle) sur les opportunités du Windows Store

14h00 - Coder

15h00 - Pause, snack time

15h15 - Coder

15h30 - Mini-présentation (optionnelle) sur le Share, Search et Setting contracts

15h45 - Coder

18h00 - Souper

19h00 - Coder

21h30 - Présentation des applications développées durant la journée + sélection du gagnant dun SUPER prix

22h00 - Réseautage (boissons, Kinect, musique...)

24h00 - Fin de la journée

F.A.Q.

Q: Est-ce que lévénement est gratuit?

R: Oui et cela inclus une collation, un souper, ainsi que 2 tickets pour une bière ou un verre de vin (les consommations en plus ou autres types de consommation doivent être payé de vos poches).

Q: Dois-je absolument présenter mon application à la fin de la journée?

R: Non, mais gardé en tête quil nest pas nécessaire que lapplication soit terminée pour présenté devant les autres.

Q: Que dois-je apporter pour participer?

R: Un ordinateur muni de Windows 8 et du SDK, ainsi que vos talents de développeurs. Nous vous conseillons aussi de créer un compte sur le Windows Store question de réserver le nom de votre application et être prêt à déployer le temps venu.

Q: Je nai pas didée dapplication, puis-je venir quand même?

R: Bien sûr, car vous pourrez être inspiré par les autres, mais aussi nous pourrons vous aider à brainstormer sur le sujet.

Q: Je nai pas dexpérience de développement avec Windows 8 et/ou HTML/CSS/JavaScript, est-ce que cet événement est pour toi?

Absolument, même si les hackathons sont fait pour coder, nous accueillons tout le monde qui veut apprendre aussi. Nous aurons des tutoriels que vous pourrez suivre pas à pas vous pour aider à comprendre et développer pour Windows 8. Vous pouvez dailleurs débuter chez vous. 

Q: Je préfère développer avec C++ et XAML ou C# et XAML, puis-je venir aussi?

Aucun problème, joignez-vous à nous. Par contre, on ne peut garantir que nous aurons de laide dexperts connaissant ces technologies. 

Join us for the hackathon!

If you like to code as much as we do, youll like our Make Web Not War Hackathon in collaboration with HTML5mtl. In a laid back formula, come create a Windows 8 application by using technologies like HTML5, JavaScript, and CSS3. Two options are available to you:

  1. Create an application relate to your Wordpress blog with the help of our template that will help you to develop the application really quickly;
  2. Create any other application idea you got!

Whether you decide to develop by yourself or make a team, youll have access to experts who will be able to help you during the day. A snack, and a dinner are offered for free. Also, a bar service will be available during the day, with two free drinks, just for you! Isnt it wonderful?

So, join us to learn, create, and take advantage of deploying an application to the new version of Windows. Coding, and fun guaranteed!

Schedule of the day 

13:00 - Attendees arrivals (be sure that you eat something before)

13:30 – Welcome & Developer Movement

13:45 - Mini-lesson (optional): presentation on the Windows Store opportunities

14:00 - Coding

15:00 - Break, snack time

15:15 - Coding

15:30 - Mini-lesson (optional): presentation on the Share, Search, and Setting contracts

15:45 - Coding

18:00 - Dinner

19:00 – Coding

21:30 - Presentation of applications developed during the day + selection of the AMAZING price

22:00 – Networking (drinks, Kinect, music…)

24:00 - End of the day

F.A.Q.

Q: Is the event free?

A: Yes, and it include a snack, a dinner, and two tickets for a free beer or a glass of wine (more drinks or other type of drinks are available if you pay for them).

Q: Do I absolutely need to present my application at the end of the day?

A: Of course no, but keep in mind that you dont have to present a finished application in front of others. Present only what you were able to do in that time. 

Q: What do I need to bring with me to participate?

A: A computer with Windows 8, and the SDK in addition of your coding skills. We also highly suggest you to create a Windows Store account so youll be able to reserve the application name you had in mind, and be able to deploy as soon as youll need to.

Q: I dont have any application ideas, can I come either?

A: Of course as you could find inspiration from others developers, and we can help you to brainstorm, and find the perfect idea for you.

Q: I dont have any experience with Windows 8 with HTML/CSS/JavaScript, is it an event for me?

Yes! Even if hackathons are made to code, we welcome everyone who wants to learn. We will have tutorials that you will be able to follow step-by-step to help you understand, and create applications for Windows 8. You can already start to do them at home.

Q: I prefer to create Windows 8 application with C++/XAML or C#/XAMP, can I join you?

A: No problem, join us for the hackathon. The only thing is that we cannot guarantee that we will have experts for these technologies on site to help you.

events.name: AT&T Mobile App Hackathon - Atlanta
events.about:
Have an app idea or need an app built for your business?

Mobile App Hackathon is an event produced by the AT&T Developer Program  that is designed for attendees (technical & non-technical) to build apps/mobile apps, get fed, compete for prizes across different categories and most importantly: meet new people and scout for teammates to work on new or current projects. 

We Supply: Quick presentations and code samples that help to bootstrap your hacking, food to keep you going, and caffeine to keep you awake. Along with technical senseis to assist you in building faster, smarter, and with new tools.

You Bring: Your laptop, skills & ideas. Come with a collaborative, team focused mindset and/or team up in advance on Twitter/Facebook/Google+ via the #atthack hashtag. Whether you are a backend person and code in Ruby/PHP/.NET or are a wizard designer with Illustrator, you are invited to attend this event. Every group needs a good balance of talent and your development skills are needed!

Event Schedule.  The following is a list of the weekends agenda:

  • 6PM - Friday Evening - Kickoff event with drinks, networking, and developer dating which leads into idea pitches and team formation.
  • 10AM - Saturday Morning -  The fun continues with an all day hackathon. Work with the teams that you formed on Friday night to produce the app spec’d out the night before. Senseis will be available throughout the entire event to help you code up your solution. App submissions will be accepted throughout the day with a deadline of 7PM.
  • 7PM - Saturday Evening - Promptly at 7PM, teams will begin pitching their ventures. Pitches are limited to three (3) minutes per team.

Prizes. The following prizes are experiential and geared towards accelerating you towards a successful business as well as expanding your network and industry knowledge:

  • Best  App Using AT&T Call Management APIs
    • 1st Place - $500 in Gift Cards for the team and one (1) year of the Small service from Github for each team member
    • 2nd Place - $300 in Gift Cards for the team and one (1) year of the Micro service from Github for each team member
    • 3rd Place - $200 in Gift Cards for the team and six (6) months of Micro service from Github for each team member

Judging Criteria. Apps will be judged based on the criteria below and weighted accordingly.  

  • 33% Weight - Ability to clearly articulate the value proposition of your app
  • 33% Weight - Originality of idea
  • 33% Weight - Technical Ingenuity
Social Media. 
  • Follow us @hackathonlive for live updates and photos from the event
  • Like us on Facebook! https://www.facebook.com/AttMobileAppHackathon

 

Speakers

 
Alex Donn is a Senior Marketing Manager with the AT&T Developer Program, is based out of sunny Seattle! His passion is educating developers young and old about mobile application development best practices through events like hackathons that fuse the collective interests of multiple technology and business leaders. Ben Klang is the leader of the Adhearsion project. He came to Ruby about four years ago but has been involved in open source projects for over fifteen years. Recognizing the exciting potential for bringing Agile development practices and the power of the Ruby language to the telephony world, he created a company, Mojo Lingo, to do just that.
Glen Gordon is a Technical Evangelist with Microsoft. He brings free resources and events to the developer community in the Southeast. Glen is dedicated to helping developers be successful with Microsoft tools, technologies, platforms and other offerings. You can keep up with Glen via his blog athttp://glengordon.name or twitter@glengordon.
 Alex Gaber, is an API Evangelist for Layer 7 Technologies a company that manages over 200 APIs spanning business and government.  Starting as a web developer 15 years ago, Alex grew up in Silicon Valley and is an active member in the hackathon and developer community.  He has a passion for building web and mobile applications that integrate numerous APIs and ideas to create innovative and unique solutions.
   
   

Sponsors
