events.name: Slimstown Studios & Jibe Mobile Hackathon
events.about:
Do you have a mobile game youve been working on and want a little help to get it out the door? Do you have an idea for a game and just need some other talented people to help you create it? Do you simply love to code or create game art? 

Sign up for the Slimstown Studios & Jibe Mobile hackathon and create something amazing! Not only will you meet other great people in the mobile industry, but youll have the chance to win a publishing deal, cash, free QA testing, and more! Every participant will also walk away with a grab bag of goodies and will get to consume as many caffeinated and adult beverages as they want. Youll also get some good eats from one of the Bay Areas best food trucks, some mouth-watering BBQ, and, of course, lots of snacks.

Over the course of about two days, you and your team (whether you bring your own or form up with one at the event) will hack together a game that you think could be the next big thing due to its unadulterated fun, creativity, killer multiplayer, use of Jibes technology, or anything else amazing about it. Lone Wolves who can do it all on their own are welcome too.

Slimstown Studios and Jibe strongly encourage making a game using Unity. Jibes Unity plug-in provides low latency multiplayer capabilities for mobile gaming, available for Android at the hackathon. Games coded at the hackathon should be developed for either iOS or Android.

Sign up for the hackathon now!

(Note that each ticket has a nominal cost associated with it. Weve found that people who are willing to pay even a tiny amount of money are more likely to show up and be fully engaged, ensuring we can put on the best event possible for all of you!) 

Prizes

Well be handing out three sets of prizes to games picked by our panel of judges:

Grand Prize:

  • Publishing Contract with Slimstown Studios, providing marketing, PR, social media, cross-promotion, user testing, QA, and localization services.
  • Free use of the Jibe platform for the life of the app*
  • A $500 voucher for QA services from VMC Game Labs, the worlds leading independent games QA solution provider, to be used for any game the winner chooses, not just the winning game. 
  • Lunch with Slimstown Studios executives. Ask for advice and get answers to any questions you have about production, marketing, startups, and just about anything else!

Best Multiplayer Games Built Using Jibe Android Unity Plug-In:

1st Prize

  • $5,000 (sponsored by Vodafone). Half to be awarded at the hackathon, half to be awarded when the winning game is live on the Google Play Store.
  • Free use of the Jibe platform for the life of the app*
  • Lunch with Slimstown Studios executives. Ask for advice and get answers to any questions you have about production, marketing, startups, and just about anything else!
  • Free PR support from Jibe at app launch

2nd Prize

  • $3,000 (sponsored by Vodafone). Half to be awarded at the hackathon, half to be awarded when the winning game is live on the Google Play Store.
  • Free use of the Jibe platform for two years*
  • Free PR support from Jibe at app launch

3rd Prize

  • $2,000 (sponsored by Vodafone). Half to be awarded at the hackathon, half to be awarded when the winning game is live on the Google Play Store.
  • Free use of the Jibe platform for two years*
  • Free PR support from Jibe at app launch

Schedule (times subject to change)

Friday, November 30
7:00pm - Registration/Networking
8:00pm - Introductory speeches and Seeking-A-Team Pitches
Midnight - Go home and get some sleep, or start coding at home

Saturday, December 1
9:00am - Registration/Networking
10:00am - Introductory speeches
10:30am - Coding begins
Noon - Lunch provided
7:00pm - Dinner provided
Midnight - Go home and get some sleep, or continue coding at home

Sunday, December 2
9:00am - Coding begins
Noon - Lunch provided
5:00pm - Coding ends, Dinner provided, and Team Presentations/Judging begins
7:00pm - Thanks for coming! Grab a gift bag on your way out and well see you next time! 

 

Hosts

Slimstown Studios is a mobile gaming company whose mission is to make extremely fun, industry-changing games with a social emphasis. Led by video game industry veterans, the company develops, funds, and publishes internal and external products.


Jibe Mobile provides an open platform that brings the missing layer of discovery, instant play and communications to multiplayer low latency mobile gaming.  With Jibes global communications cloud and open APIs, game creators can develop low latency multiplayer mobile games and easily add address book friend discovery and instant play game challenges even when the game is not running. Using Jibes SDK its also easy to add multiplayer voice, video and chat right into game play. www.jibemobile.com


Sponsors

events.name: Sanitation Hackathon NYC
events.about:
Problem:

2.5 billion people--nearly 40% of humanity--live without access to improved sanitation, causing a child to die every 17 seconds. With the number of mobile subscriptions exceeding five billion, more people today have access to a mobile phone than to a clean toilet.

Objective:

Using technology, we now have the chance to create breakthroughs in sanitation.  Breakthroughs which can only be achieved by perpetual creative destruction.  To achieve this, and raise awareness of sanitation challenges, we are launching a global Sanitation Hackathon in partnership with the World Banks Water Practice and ICT units, mobilizing an unprecedented level of collaboration from disparate disciplines--sanitation and water experts, designers, software developers, engineers, health professionals, students-- to take on this giant-sized challenge and develop breakthrough innovations for improving access to sanitation for the worlds poor.

Join Us. Help create solutions to the world’s most pressing sanitation problems.

To have access to the problem statements visit: 

http://www.sanitationhackathon.org/problems

events.name: Dakar Sanitation Hackathon - By Coders4Africa
events.about:
(Text in English below)

Cet événement  organisé au Senegal par Coders4Africa est financé par la Banque mondiale en partenariat avec Water and Sanitation for the Urban Poor.

PROMOUVOIR L’INNOVATION DANS L’ASSAINISSEMENT: Durant le « Sanitation Hackathon », les développeurs devront créer des solutions novatrices aux problèmes inhérents au secteur de lassainissement. Pour en savoir plus sur le Sanitation Hackathon, visitez le site: http://www.sanitationhackathon.org.

LE HACKATHON

Il se déroulera les samedi 1er  (08h00-20h00) et dimanche 2 Décembre 2012 (08:00-18:00)  à IDEV-ic Patte doie Builders Villa B11, Dakar Yoff, Sénégal juste après la clinique Nabil Choucair.

PRIX

Tous les développeurs talentueux sont encouragés à sinscrire. Les deux meilleures équipes remporteront des prix  en cash:

  1. léquipe gagnante recevra  700 $ (350 000 FCFA)
  2. la deuxième meilleure équipe  400 $ (200 000 FCFA)

POST-HACKATHON

Les participants seront divisés en groupes de 5 maximum. Cinq projets relatifs à des problèmes réels  leur seront proposés. Chaque equipe choisira celui qui lui convient. Les équipes auront 2 jours pour créer un produit ou une solution qui répondra aux exigences des énoncés des problèmes. 

En plus des prix remportés, les équipes gagnantes seront incubées et bénéficieront dun soutien sur une période de quelques mois si elles veulent mener leurs projets mis en place lors de ce  week-end à grande échelle afin d’accroitre leur impact.

PRÉSENTATION ET PRINCIPES GÉNÉRAUX

Si vous souhaitez  participer au Hackathon, veuillez remplir ce formulaire en répondant au questionnaire. 

Nous avons décidé de rendre ce hackathon très selectif, cest pourquoi nous ne retiendrons que 70 participants. 

Le traitement de votre inscription nécessite au moins 24h. 

Léquipe de direction du hackathon étudiera votre demande de participation  et vous enverra une notification pour lapprouver ou la rejeter.

CRITERES

  • Créativité et originalité de l’approche ; respecter les exigences du problème posé ; avec un vrai prototype de solution
  • Fonctionnalité :  Une app qui marche ; le potentiel de l’app présentée d’être améliorée après le hackathon
  • Adaptabilité : Potentiel de développement international et ou à l’échelle mondiale
  • Impact : le potentiel pour le produit ou la solution d’impacter immédiatement le continent ou le monde
  • Design et Expérience utilisateur : Utilisation intuitive de l’application web ou mobile ou de la plateforme
  • Accessible : Quel est le degré d’accessibilité du site web de l’application aux utilisateurs potentiels

Bon codage!


(ENGLISH TEXT)

This event is organized by coders4africa in Senegal and sponsored by the World Bank in partnership with Water and Sanitation for the Urban Poor.

TAPPING INNOVATION IN SANITATION: At the Sanitation Hackathon, civic technologists will develop solutions to challenges facing the sanitation sector.

To find out more about the Sanitation Hackathon project please visit: http://www.sanitationhackathon.org.


THE HACKATHON

It will take place on Saturday December 1st from 8:00 AM to 8:00PM and Sunday 2nd 2012 from 8:00 AM to 18:00 PM at IDEV-ic Patte d’oie Builder’s Villa B11, Dakar Yoff, senegal en face de la Pharmacie Nabil Choucair.

PRIZES

All talended developers are encouraged to register. There are 2 top winner cash prizes:

  1. Top team winner will get $700 
  2. Second runner up team $400
POST-HACKATHON

The attendees will be divided into groups of max 5. Teams will be presented with 5 problems. Each team can then pick to the project of their choice. Teams will have 2 days to create a product or solution that meet the requirements of the problem statements. Besides wining cash prizes, winning teams will be incubated and given post-event support over a period of several months if they want to prepare their weekend projects for scale and impact.

SUBMISSION AND GENERAL GUIDELINES

If you want to be considered for this Hackathon please fill out the registration and make sure you answer every question. We have decided to make this hackathon very competitive, therefore we will only allow 70 participants. Allow at least 1 day for the hackathon management team to review your registration and send you a notification approving or rejecting your participation. 

CRITERIA
  • Creativity and originality approach: meeting problem equirements, along with an actual solution demo
  • Functionality: working app, and the potential for the submission to be improved post-hackathon
  • Scalability: potential for internationalization and / or global scalability
  • Impact: the potential for the product or solution to drive immediate continent or world impact. 
  • Design & User experience: for intuitive use of mobile or web app or platform
  • Accessibility: how accessible the App website to potential users

Happy coding!

events.name: Nevada City Hackathon
events.about:
Nevada City Hackathon at Sierra Commons

Cost: No Fee 0.00 

Hackathon Silver 15.00 

Hackathon Gold 30.00 

Sierra Commons, a non-profit 501(c)(3), is organizing The Nevada City Hackathon, where computer programmers and others in the field of software development, like graphic and interface designers, collaborate on software projects.  Hacker teams and individuals collaborate intensively over two days with the goal of creating functional custom applications that provide immediate value to customers.

The Nevada City Hackathon embraces engineers in our area that excel at their trade and are committed to delivering technology solutions to their customers,” said Robert Trent, Executive Director of Sierra Commons. “Nevada County and our region is teaming with technology-savvy professionals. This event will help strengthen our tech community and showcase local talent.”

The hackathon kicks off Saturday morning with a presentation on cutting edge mobile technologies. Then, programmers settle in and focus on completing their applications – working late into the evening.  After another full days work on Sunday, the event will culminate in a product demo and awards ceremony where products will be judged for winners in the Attendees’ Choice, Most Marketable, and Hyperlocal categories.

Benji Brown, owner of Studio B Flat Games and Sierra Commons member, is helping organize the event.  After going to the iPadDevCamp 2010 hackathon and winning Best Open Source, I continued to participate in various hackathons.” states Benji, “These events allowed me, over the course of just a couple days, to practice my rapid prototyping skills, meet and work with great talent, and all the while working on building something from the ground up that was totally exciting.  Its pretty fun having a cool idea become reality in just 48 hours. 

Follow the Hackathon at www.nevadacityhackathon.com and the Meetup site http://www.meetup.com/Nevada-County-Hackers/ for ongoing conversations about technology and the event.

About Sierra Commons

Sierra Commons is a non-profit 501(c)(3) organization that creates real jobs in Nevada County by educating and encouraging local entrepreneurs. By helping people realize their dreams of launching and growing their enterprises, Sierra Commons creates new businesses by accelerating ideas into realities. From concept to incorporation, the flagship Business Ignitor Course covers key businesses principles and necessities, combines class work with individual mentoring, and is taught by professional leaders in the community. Ultimately, through business and job creation, Sierra Commons fosters economic growth and stability. This benefits the entire county. http://sierracommons.org.

events.name: RHoK Global December 2012: Cape Town, South Africa
events.about:
Dear Developer

You are invited:

To join us on the 1st to the 2nd of December 2012 for the Random Hacks of Kindness (RHoK) Hackathon [09:00 till late on Saturday  and  09:00 till around 16:00 on Sunday] together with other innovative software developers, subject matter experts, researchers, and members of the community to design and develop open ICT solutions that will address real world social development and humanitarian challenges.

Who is organizing?

Datonomy (Pty) Ltd, Sanitation Hackerthon, GTUG-Pretoria and Computing Pro Bono (School of Computing at UNISA)

Where?

Bandwidth Barn, 66-68 Albert Road, Woodstock, Cape Town, Western Cape, South Africa

What?

Throughout the planned weekend, we will be Hacking for Humanity, that is, coding/programming around local challenges. Challenges will be made available on the RHoK website as soon as they get finalized. Challenges that were also tackled during the previous events (RHoK-Pretoria, June 2012, and other associated Hackathons)) will also form part of this upcoming event.

 Why?

  • Volunteer your time and skills to build technological solutions that will make the world a better place
  • Become a community-engaged developer, social innovator, researcher, scholar, and community hacker.
  • Innovative solutions and progress made during the hackathon will be acknowledged with great prizes
  • Expect to network and collaborate with other developers, researchers, and subject matter experts.
  • Expect some nice refreshments and drinks.

What to bring?

  • Bring your laptop (loaded with your open development tools), mobile phones, laptop and phone charger, 3G network [ in cases of limited wireless connection ]
  • Power extensions, your energy, your brains and Technology/Language to use?
  • Open source technologies and languages

Registration?

To reserve and confirm your participation. Register online for free:

events.name: RHoK Global December 2012: Trento, Italy
events.about:
Join us on December 1-2, 2012 and help us build solutions for a better world.

Throughout the weekend, we will be coding around problems related to ICT for development in areas such as food logistics and waste, social accountability, disaster management, and more. 

RHoK has been working with subject matter experts around the world to develop problem statements addressing global issues. These problem statements will be the hacking challenges thrown out to the developers at the RHoK hackathon. See those statements as they develop at http://www.rhok.org 

At the end of the weekend, we’ll invite you to share your RHoK application with the group with the potential to win prizes and see your work put to use on the ground to save lives and alleviate suffering. 

What Do I Need? We will provide facilities, power, food and refreshments to help you write your application.Just bring your laptop, ideas, and enthusiasm to complete the mix.

Check out how to reach us at: http://www.fbk.eu/getting/scientific_hub

More information about RHoK Trento available at: http://ict4g.github.com/rhok-trento/ (will open in a new window)

Photos from the previous editions http://www.flickr.com/photos/rhoktrento (will open in a new window) 

- The RHoK Team at FBK

events.name: Sanitation Hackathon India - December 2012, Pune
#4SQHackPH Foursquare Hack Day Philippines
events.about:
Foursquare Hack Day Philippines 2012 (Hashtag: #4SQHackPH) is an all-day hackathon featuring the Foursquare API. This is presented by the SMART Developer Network and WebGeek Philippines in partnership with Foursquare.

In order to give the Filipino developers the best of the foursquare API, we’ll be flying towards Foursquare’s platform engineering team of Sajid Mehmood from Foursquare HQ based in NYC. Your participation in this event will mean so much to us and for sure, you’ll never regret joining! With Foursquare APIs, developers can create several useful apps. Examples of well known apps today that use the foursquare platform are Foodspotting, Path Instagram, The Weather Channel and more.

If you think you and your friends have what it takes to rise up to the challenge of creating a location-oriented mobile app in a compressed amount of time, then heed our call.

Early bird rate: Oct 29-31 (80% Discount) Duo P400 | Trio P600

Promo rate: Nov 12-17 (50% Discount) Duo P1000 | Trio P1500

Regular rate: Nov 18-24 (Regular Price) Duo P2000 | Trio P3000


We also accept bank deposit at Metrobank. Just click Register via Eventbrite, then at the bottom click Other Payment Options, please read the instructions how to deposit then click Pay By Check. Thats it.

Cancellation Policy: Tickets are non-refundable. Apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

We encourage you to contact us for questions and inquries. Email us at events@webgeek.ph Or join the Smart DevNet Facebook Group

 

More details: http://hackday.webgeek.ph/

events.name: AngelHack Fall 2012 Silicon Valley
events.about:
Get excited Silicon Valley! AngelHack’s 24-hour Hackathon competition is back and this time we’re bigger than ever! Join us for our Fall 2012 edition, where you can find:

  • Over 400 amazing developers & designers to work with
  • Gourmet food, shwag, nerf guns, helicopters, and at select locations- AR drones and free massages
  • Over $650,000 in prizes, including acceptance into AngelHacks Hackcelerator program and trips to Silicon Valley (more details below and on our FAQ)
  • Media coverage and immediate attention for your hackathon project to get taken to the next level
  • An awesome community of mentors, influencers, and expert judges to help you along the way

Transportation shuttles from Berkeley - San Francisco - Paypal will be provided if you need a ride. 

What should I build?
Create a prototype (hack) of something that you believe solves a big problem. You dont need a business plan or anything crazy like that, but you should be able to show the big idea potential of your hack. AngelHack is a launchpad for you to flush out and validate projects youve always wanted to build. Previous winners include: Appetas, GiveGo, TapFame, SnapStore, ShareBrowse, Kloutron, & Blue Dragon Security.

What are the rules?
All code must be FRESH. Prior to the hackathon you can create your design, wireframes, logo, and user flows. You can even build hardware. But to make things completely fair you can not write any code whatsoever until the hackathon starts. All code must be built at AngelHack.

For more info visit our Rules and FAQ pages.

Good Luck,
Gregory Gopman
AngelHack Founder / CEO

As seen in

What are the rules?

events.name: #NYTechResponds Sandy Benefit Weekend: Hackathon & Relief Agency Conference
events.about:
ALL PROCEEDS FROM TICKET SALES TO THIS EVENT WILL BE CONTRIBUTED TO SANDY RELIEF VIA THE #NYTECHRESPONDS SANDY BENEFIT CAMPAIGN.

Over the last few years, and driven by an amazing array of people, the NY technology sector (i.e., technology companies as well as digital media, interactive agencies, VCs, and startups, along with various professional service firms that work with these companies) has exploded. New York is now a legitimate tech capital. Yet Sandy has delivered a serious blow to our home city - the city where weve chosen to build, code, and grow our businesses.

As proven by the tremendous collaboration and grassroots cooperation across different people and organizations in the wake Sandy, we are a resilient city and the NY tech community has stepped up to help drive recovery. But there is still so much more for us to do - both to recover now and to prepare before the next disaster hits. NYC has given us much -- we now must give back.

December 1 and 2 is our #NYTechResponds Sandy Benefit Weekend: Hackathon, Relief Agency Conference & Fundraiser. Our agenda is as follows:

Saturday December 1, 9am to 12:30pm. Location To Be Announced

  • 9am to 11am: Relief Agency Conference: 2-3 Panel discussions on:
    • … the recovery so far - what’s worked, what’s not worked
    • … whats needed next to support long term recovery
    • … what we need to better prepare for the next disaster, and what’s needed to allow us to respond more effectively
  • 11am - 12:30am: Project Pitches Hackathon Kick-off: Team Creation, API & Platforms Overview

Saturday December 1, 1:30pm to 6:30pm. Various Co-Working Spaces and offices around NYC, including General Assembly, NYU Poly Incubator - Varick St, and others to be announced this week.

  • Hackathon Day 1

Saturday 7pm to 9pm: Pizza “Thank You” Dinner for Relief Workers and Hackers Location To Be Announced
 

Sunday December 2, 8:00am to 2:00pm. Various Co-Working Spaces around NYC

  • Hackathon Day 2

Sunday December 2, 3:00pm to 7:30pm. Location To Be Announced

  • 3pm to 5pm: Hack Presentations / Hack Reviews and Awards
  • 5pm to 7:30pm: Sandy Benefit Event

 

Optional Hack Challenge: Interested in raising more money for Sandy Relief? Those who raise at least $50 through the #NYTechResponds Sandy Benefit Campaign on IndieGoGo are entitled to complementary admission to the #NYTechResponds Sandy Benefit Weekend. Additionally, the hacker who chooses to fundraise and then raises the most funds will win an award to be presented at Sundays wrap-up event - one award for most money raised by a hacker for the IndieGoGo campaign includes 30 minutes with Steve Schlafman of Lerer Ventures. This $50 minimum can be either your own donation to the IndieGoGo campaign or through funds raised and credited to you (note: you must use IndieGoGos social media tools to ensure proper tracking of donations). See the IndieGoGo campaign for more information.

events.name: Hack Québec
events.about:
Le Hack Québec est un évènement sans but lucratif, qui se veut une compétition dans un cadre rassemblant les différents acteurs de la communauté qui œuvrent dans le secteur des technologies de l’information. Il sagit donc dune invitation aux développeurs d’application web et mobiles et aux designers dapplications.

Des prix seront attribués par les fournisseurs parmi les projets qui auront utilisé leur API. Un prix du public sera aussi remis par Mirego au projet choisi par le jury parmi tous les projets bâtis durant lévénement. Plusieurs prix à gagner: bourses en argent, matériel des commanditaires et autres!

Participants:

Le samedi 1 décembre à partir de 9h jusquà 21h, les participants inscrits pourront programmer leur application dans les bureaux de Mirego (2327 du Versant-Nord, Bureau 200, Québec). Apportez votre ordinateur! Pour participer, linscription est obligatoire, au coût de 5$ par personne. La participation peut ensuite se faire à titre individuelle ou en équipe avec dautres participants inscrits. Pour être admissible à un prix, le résultat des 12h de programmation doit être au minimum un prototype fonctionnel et inclure au moins un des API rendus disponible par les commanditaires. Les participants qui ne rencontrent pas ces 2 critères ne pourront pas être admissibles à recevoir un prix. La remise des prix aura lieu après 21h. Les repas et rafraichissements sont fournis aux participants. 

 5 à 7:

Le 5 à 7 du 30 novembre au Tapis Vert (2323 du Versant-Nord) sera loccasion pour tous les participants de se rencontrer afin de former des équipes. De même, les fournisseurs dAPI seront sur place pour présenter leurs data sets et leur entreprise. Les participants auront droit à une consommation gratuite avec leur inscription mais le 5 à 7 est ouvert à tous.

 Commandite:

Pour les informations au sujet des commandites de lévénement, communiquer avec esther@mirego.com

events.name: ISIC Space Solutions 'Hackathon'
events.about:
The International Space Innovation Centre (ISIC), Satellite Applications Catapult, MetOffice and UK Space Agency are organising simultaneous Space Solutions ‘Hackathons’ at the Electron Building, on the Harwell Science and Innovation Campus, near Oxford and at the MetOffice, Exeter.

The two-day technology development Hackathons are taking place over the weekend of Saturday 1 and Sunday 2 December 2012. They will enable people to work together to solve challenges relevant to using space technologies, and how they can be exploited to benefit other markets such as transport, healthcare, natural resources, etc.

The Hackathons start at 9.00am and continue throughout the night (optional), finishing at 4.00pm on Sunday. The events are open to anyone who would like to participate – software developers, engineers, technologists, scientists, designers, artists, educators, students and entrepreneurs – anyone who has a passion for changing the world. Please note participants under the age of 18 can take part during daytime only.

The Hackathons have been set up prior to, and in support of, the European Space Solutions Conference taking place from the 3 - 5 December in London. The aim is to give participants an opportunity to work together to solve specific challenges relevant to the 11 sector streams featured in the EU conference. The sectors include: Healthcare and Health Protection, Local Authorities, Agriculture, Environmental Protection, Aviation, Ship and Vessel Management, Insurance and Financial Services, Emergency Response and Disaster Management, Renewable Energy and Rail. In addition, the UK Space Agency, Catapults, MetOffice and ISIC will have a number of additional challenges. If you have a relevant challenge you would also like to work on, then please submit it through the website and if suitable we will include it in the selection.

To register for the Oxford event please click here:  http://www.eventbrite.co.uk/event/4664531740?utm_source=eb_email&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=new_eventv2&utm_term=eventname_text 

To register for the Exeter event, please click here:  http://www.metoffice.gov.uk/conference/mozfest

Please note there is a maximum level of 80 people at the Harwell event, and 60 at the Exeter event, so early registration is advised. Deadline for registration to take part in the event is Friday 9 November 2012.  For general enquiries regarding these events please contact spacesolutions@isic-space.com.

Space Solution Hackathon Team

events.name: London Sanitation Hackathon
events.about:
The London Sanitation Hackathon is part of a global event that brings together technologists and sanitation sector experts to develop innovative solutions to challenges in accessing sanitation. The event, sponsored globally by the World Bank, and in partnership with Water and Sanitation for the Urban Poor (WSUP) in London, will take place simultaneously in cities around the world on December 1-2. 

The Sanitation Hackathon challenges programmers to develop innovative software solutions that address real-world problems in sanitation. During the months leading up to the event, subject matter experts and members of the public will create, submit and vote on problem definitions that highlight specific sanitation challenges that could be mitigated by innovative ICTs. Then, during a weekend-long marathon event, teams of programmers in cities around the world will develop innovative solutions to these problem definitions. 

HOW TO GET INVOLVED:

If you work in the field of sanitation or are a technologist that can contribute to the development of problem definitions beforehand, please contact LondonSanHack@gmail.com. The problem definitions will be posted at sanitationhackathon.com prior to the event, and we encourage you to check them out. 

We welcome people with a range of technology skills and knowledge of the sanitation sector to join us for the event- just sign up (attendance is free) to hold your spot. 

WHAT TO KNOW:

Food and beverages will be provided throughout the weekend (but if you have special dietary requirements beyond vegetarian, please bring your own). 

We ask that you bring your own laptop, power supply, innovative thinking, team spirit and sense of humour. 

Judges from the tech and sanitation sectors will apply criteria to award 1st, 2nd, and 3rd place prizes, which will include opportunities to further develop prototypes. 

Please contact LondonSanHack@gmail.com with any questions.

events.name: RHoK Global December 2012: San Francisco, CA
events.about:
Join us for the Random Hacks of Kindness San Francisco Hackathon December 1st and 2nd 2012

RHoK Kick Off Reception Friday November 30th from 7:00-9:00pm 

Enjoy wine, beer, light bites and meet representatives from Google, Yahoo, Microsoft and NASA while we discuss the subject matters and logistics for the hackathon.

RHoK Global December 2012-San Francisco Saturday December 1st starting at 9:00am and ending Sunday December 2nd at 4:00pm

RHoK is a community of innovators building practical open technology to make the world a better place.  Come be a part of the Bay Area community and participate in one of the most exciting hackathons in the world!

What is a hackathon?

A hackathon is a gathering of technically skilled individuals focusing on collaborative efforts to address a challenge, issue, or goal. They usually run from several hours to weeks, and can include rigid structure or organic emergence.

What makes RHoK special?

Random Hacks of Kindness is a simultaneous global hackathon which addresses issues of disaster and humanitarian response. Local subject matter experts are brought in to guide the developers in relevant issues and to further the use of developed tools after the event.

What makes GWOB’s RHoK even specialer?

Geeks Without Bounds brings a year’s worth of experience in facilitating unconferences and hackathons to these events, as well as heavy involvement in the Volunteer Technology Community (VTC). We set expectations and limitations in regards to what responders will be able to learn on short notice under stress and what networks and power situations are like.

Both the reception and hackathon will take place at Voxeo Labs @ NextSpace 1 Hallidie Plaza, 2nd Floor in the Union Square District of downtown San Francisco.

events.name: Blind Tennis Hackathon -- Building a Better Ball
events.about:
Blind Tennis Hackathon -- Building a Better Ball

This workshop is ideal for anyone interested in hacking tennis balls, sensors, or blind tennis. Blind tennis is much like sighted tennis except that the ball makes noise so that a blind or partially sighted player can track and return it. The ball that players currently use contains a rattle, so the sound it makes is intermittent. In addition, the movement of the rattle can affect the trajectory of the ball in unexpected ways. The aim of our workshop is to change that. Well investigate hacks along several tracks. First, mechanical hacks such as whistles or more balanced rattles. Second, electronic hacks ranging from a constant tone emitter to more complex solution involving sensors like accelerometers or gyroscopes. And third, methods of mounting our apparatus into balls.

Lunch will be provided. Those interested in sensors should bring their own laptops. Registration is $20 to cover materials and food.

events.name: Cape Town Sanitation Hackathon
events.about:
The Cape Town Sanitation Hackathon is coming! 

This December civic technologists will team up with subject matter experts in an intensive marathon to find innovative solutions to challenges facing the sanitation sector. The event is born of a global partnership among The World Bank, The Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, Random Hacks of Kindness, Eirene, Nokia, Open Cities, and Civic Commons, among others.

We are delighted to announce that Cape Town will be one of ten cities around the world in which the event will take place simultaneously over the weekend 1-2 December. 

Well be joining London, Nairobi, New York, Pune and 5 other cities, bringing together the cream of the Cape Town software community with sanitation experts from all over SADC.

Judging of the best projects / ideas developed during the hackathon will take place at 3pm on Sunday, with winners announced at 4pm.

Well keep you posted as the event takes shape, but if youre in Cape Town and interested in attending, please bookmark

1-2 December as a red letter date

Please visit http://capetownsanhack.eventbrite.com/  for more information and to register for the event.

Thanks to the Bandwidth Barn whove agreed to host, to Webtickets whove agreed to co-sponsor and to CapeTownTV.org whove agreed to film and broadcast the event!

Register now to Learn, Share & Connect !

Check us on Facebook 

Venue: Bandwidth Barn, 3rd Floor, Block B, 66 Albert Road, Woodstock, Cape Town

www.sanitationhackathon.org

Linking problems with solutions

The Sanitation Hackathon challenges programmers to develop innovative software solutions that address real-world problems in sanitation. During the months leading up to the event, subject matter experts and members of the public will create, submit and vote on problem definitions that highlight specific sanitation challenges that could be mitigated by innovative ICTs. Then, during a weekend-long marathon event, teams of programmers in cities around the world will develop innovative solutions to these problem definitions. To see the problem statements already submitted please click here.

The Sanitation Hackathon emerges out of the recognition that the rapid increase of penetration, awareness and literacy in information and communication technologies (ICTs) in the developing world can transform water and sanitation management. Mobile phones, the Internet and open data are creating new entry points to make sanitation services more transparent, inclusive and participatory while forging new connections between the government, its citizens and the private sector.

Solutions developed over the weekend hackathon may be any kind of software application, be it for the web, a personal computer, a mobile handheld device, console, SMS, or any software platform broadly available to the public. Participation is free.

2,6 billion people on earth don’t have toilets and need you to solve the issue! This year’s World Bank hackathon’s theme is sanitation. Sanitation is not only about toilets but about clean water and health. Challenges are enormous, opportunities are incredible. Lets make the world better place by hacking at Crapathon Helsinki.

The hackathon challenges programmers, designers, business people and sanitation experts to develop innovative software solutions that address real-world problems in sanitation.

Price: Free!

http://www.sanitationhackathon.org/

events.name: Hack4Reno 2012: Reno Open Data Hackathon
events.about:
APPS FOR RENO, BY RENO: A 24 Hour Hackathon 

There is an overwhelming amount of talent in Reno and the entire Northern Nevada area. Hack4Reno allows developers and designers to learn new technology, showcase their talent and ultimately build new apps that help make Reno a smarter, more engaged place to live.

We want you to build the next app that Reno citizens use to find the best bike routes, the best bars in town, the best food.

We want you to build websites that help your former colleague find a new job, learn a new skill or better experience the great outdoors.

We want you to build something that helps make life in Reno just a little bit better.

 

24 HOURS TO BUILD SOMETHING?!

Design and development of your apps will begin at noon on December 1st  and go through noon on the next day, so yes, an entire 24 hours! It can be done! We want you to build a minimum viable product and not get caught up in the details. 

 

DEMO PRESENTATION: COMPETE TO WIN FAME & FORTUNE!

At the end of the 24 hours, you and your team will have an hour to prepare a demo presentation on the Hack4Reno stage. Your entries will then be judges by the community.

Whats in it for you? We will have prizes for the top apps in various categories. The categories are still being determined but spending a weekend building something for the greater good might just pay off for you! So there is certainly some fortune at stake. Did we mention fame? Youll be building a website or application that will be used by hundreds, if not thousands of people in the Reno area!

Identify an issue or problem in the community and build a new tool or service to help alleviate that issue! You will be surprised at how many people also share your concern!

 

NEED AN IDEA?

Start talking to your friends, colleagues, family and neighbors! Look for pain points that you or your friends have that could be alleviated by more information or an app on your mobile phone.

We are working with the City of Reno and other government entities to create and publish existing datasets that include things like crime data, energy consumption and more. These datasets will be available for you to use in your apps or you can find your own datasets on web services like Twitter, Foursquare and Craigslist.

Some ideas to get you going:

  • What I love about Reno microblogging site (Think Twitter for Reno praise)
  • Local Event aggregation website
  • Local directory of bike shops
  • Reno Farmers Market iPhone app 

WHERE CAN YOU LEARN MORE?

Come to Hacknight at Reno Collective on November 14th at 5:30pm to mingle with other hackathoners, developers, makers and creatives before the big event!

 

STAY UP TO DATE

Get up to the minute updates on Facebook (search for Hack4Reno) or Twitter (@hack4reno).

 

WHAT IF I AM NOT A DEVELOPER OR DESIGNER, BUT WANT TO GET INVOLVED?

We want to be as open and transparent as possible but we also want people to come down and see what goes into building websites and mobile apps! Writing code is not the only way to get involved. We need content creators, journalists, city planners and writers to help make these apps useful.

If you really love the concept and want to help us out, please sign up as a volunteer and well be in touch!

 

HOW CAN MY COMPANY OR ORGANIZATION GET INVOLVED?

If your company or organization would like to get involved in helping to make Reno a smarter, more engaged community, we have three options:

  • Send a team! Register a team and show up in team t-shirts, make a flag, anything for team morale!
  • Sponsorship: Creating an open, more engaged community is not a problem you can throw money at. We are looking for organizations that want to roll up their sleeves and help build this city! Contact us and well discuss what you can due to pitch in and help spread the word!
  • Volunteers: We will need a number of volunteers before, during and after the event to help out. If you cant code or design but want to help us out, let us know!

 

WHY HACK4RENO? WHY OPEN DATA?

Quality news and information is required if people are to participate fully in the lives of their communities. Hack4Reno allows developers and designers to learn new technology, showcase their talent and ultimately build new apps that help make Reno a smarter, more engaged place to live.

Hack4Reno is brought to you by Reno Collective in partnership with the City of Reno. For other available workshops and more information about the main event, check out www.hack4reno.com.

events.name: Water Sanitation Hackathon
events.about:
I am pleased to extend a personal invitation to you to participate in SanitationHackathon Lahore Pakistan on December 1-2, 2012. 

Often neglected, the world’s sanitation crisis needs urgent attention across multiple sectors to meet the basic needs of the 2.5 billion people without access. With the global revolution in low-cost information and communication technologies, there is a huge opportunity to address information flow problems across the sector, helping to make improved sanitation services more accessible and sustainable for the world’s people.

SanitationHackathon will be the first ever global gathering of sanitation experts and technologists for an intensive weekend dedicated to creating ICT solutions to sanitation challenges.  In addition to lahore SanitationHackathon will simultaneously be taking place in Jakarta, Lahore, Pune, Dhaka, Dar es Salaam,  Helsinki, Chicago, San Francisco, New York, London, Lima, and Cape Town- as of Oct 16, 2012. 

Sanitation experts are working with local communities to define some of the most pressing sanitation challenges in each of those cities.  Programmers, software engineers and data specialists will then team up to put their technical skills to work mashing up data, building on open source technology platforms and developing apps that respond to those challenges, which the sanitation sector can put to use on the ground to aid the communities that need them. 

Please join us at Punjab Information Technology Board on December 1-2 to share your skills and expertise at SanitationHackathon Lahore Pakistan.

events.name: Growth Hackathon
events.about:
What is Growth Hacking?

  • Growth Hacking is early-stage lean analytical marketing that focuses on creating a viral strategy, building good content, and seeding that content to encourage rapid growth.
  • A growth hacker is someone who fuses traditional marketing techniques with a strong technical background to create low cost, inbound marketing solutions that are digitally-focused and quantitative in nature.

Why should me and/or my company join the Growthathon? 

  • Come to find the bestgrowth hackers--source the best lean & viral marketers in Silicon Valley.
  • Grow your userbase by setting a growth challenge that will be completed by a growth hacking team in 2 weeks (EX get 1000 new users in the field of healthcare, get 500 users to try our new XYZ feature).
  • Get brand exposure by being listed as a partner on our website and marketing materials.

What is required of my company?

  • Send a growth hacking employee to attend the Growthathon (8 hours on Dec. 1st)
  • Create a challenge that a team of Growth Hackers can attempt to complete in 2 weeks.
  • Offer a prize (can be coffee with a cofounder; does not have to be monetary. The better the prize, the more growth hackers will want to attempt your challenge instead of doing another one.)

events.name: BlackBerry Jam Sessions Warszawa
events.about:
Najlepsza okazja, aby zmienić Twoje pomysły w rzeczywistość właśnie nadeszła, dzięki BlackBerry Jam Sessions - serii trzech konferencji organizowanych przez polski oddział Research In Motion przy współpracy z firmą PROGET!

Zaplanuj swoją aplikację, stwórz ją w 10 godzin, poznaj innych programistów, ekspertów, baw się i wygrywaj fantastyczne nagrody!

Czym jest BlackBerry Jam Session? = Super Hackathon

Hackathon jest wydarzeniem, na którym możesz opracować swój pomysł na aplikację w kilka godzin. Właśnie tutaj spotykają się najlepsi programiści i eksperci, tworząc aplikacje w jeden dzień. To najlepsza okazja, aby zamienić przeczucie “to może zadziałać”, w coś prawdziwego, działającego i ekscytującego. Na koniec, sędziowie wybierają zwycięzców każdej kategorii, którzy wracają do domu z torbami pełnymi nagród.

BlackBerry Jam Session to jednak o wiele więcej niż zwykły Hackathon, robimy wszystko, aby te spotkania były NAJLEPSZYMI Hackathonami na świecie.

Dlaczego najlepszymi? Ponieważ słuchamy was, wiemy czego potrzebujecie i staramy się za każdym razem zapewnić wam absolutnie wszystko co niezbędne.

Przyjeżdżamy do was, umożliwiamy bezpośredni kontakt z ekspertami, oferujemy kawę, ciastka, pizzę, nagradzamy specjalnymi prezentami, ale jesteśmy tutaj w rzeczywistości po to, aby nawiązać z wami kontakt. Jesteśmy tutaj przede wszystkim dla was, bo chcemy, abyście odnieśli sukces. Wszystkie spotkania trwają często dłużej niż 10 godzin. Będą waszą szansą na to, aby nauczyć się czegoś nowego, przećwiczyć swoje umiejętności i stworzyć aplikacje z pomocą, jakiej jeszcze nigdy nie doświadczyliście.

Dlaczego warto uczestniczyć?

Dlaczego warto uczestniczyć? Powodów jest naprawdę wiele. Tak wiele, że nie sposób je wszystkie wymienić, tym bardziej, że widza zdobyta podczas takich konferencji, wspólna praca z innymi programistami czy możliwość spotkania się z innymi osobami zainteresowanymi programowaniem czy po prostu BlackBerry jest często bezcenna.

Postanowiliśmy jednak przygotować dodatkowy zestaw motywatorów, wśród których znajdzie się m.in.:

  • WYJAZD DO AMSTERDAMU NA BLACKBERRY JAM EUROPE 2013 dla zespołu, który stworzy najlepszą aplikację ze wszystkich 3 spotkań 
  • Prototypowe urządzenia BlackBerry Dev Alpha 
  • Smartfony BlackBerry 
  • Koszulki BlackBerry Dev 
  • Tablety BlackBerry PlayBook 
  • Zestawy nagród od partnerów 
  • Wiele, wiele więcej!

Do zobaczenia na miejcu!

events.name: AT&T Mobile App Hackathon - Denver
events.about:
Have an app idea or need an app built for your business?

This very special AT&T Aspire Mobile App Hackathon Education, an event produced by the AT&T Developer Program and St. Vrain Valley School District in coordination with IBM and Seagate Technology, is designed for attendees both technical & non-technical to build apps/mobile apps.  This event will provide students with the opportunity to choose between two tracks based on their technical school level.  They may attend sessions designed to provide them with the basics for Java and Javascript development or to join teams of adult developers competing to create the best mobile app of the weekend. We will have free food compliments of Ericsson, great speakers, and some awesome prizes.  Students, Developers, and Designers are heavily encouraged to meet new people, scout for teammates, and collaborate to create innovative mobile apps.

Objective C, Android, Java, ASM, Javascript, HTML, C #, Dot Net, XNA and all other languages are welcome. Your only objective is to get a mobile app running regardless of an HTML5, Mobile Web or native implementation. If you are a beginner or have become rusty with your programming, we will have live developer support from local senior developers as well as from AT&T, Layer7, and Tiggzi to help you code that much faster.

We Supply: Quick presentations and code samples that help to bootstrap your hacking, food to keep you going, and caffeine to keep you awake. Along with technical senseis to assist you in building faster, smarter, and with new tools.

You Bring: Your laptop, skills & ideas. Come with a collaborative, team focused mindset and/or team up in advance on Twitter/Facebook/Google+ via the #atthack hashtag. Whether you are a backend person and code in Ruby/PHP/.NET or are a designer and only work with Illustrator, you are invited to attend this event. Every group needs a good balance of talent and your development skills are needed!

Event Schedule.  The following is a list of the weekends agenda:

  • 06PM - Friday Evening - Kickoff event with dinner, networking, and developer dating which leads into idea pitches and team formation.
  • 11PM - Friday Evening - End of Day 1
  • 10AM - Saturday Morning -  The fun continues with an all day hackathon. Work with the teams that you formed on Friday night to produce the app spec’d out the night before. Senseis will be available throughout the entire event to help you code up your solution. App submissions will be accepted throughout the day with a deadline of 7PM.
  • 7PM - Saturday Evening - Promptly at 7PM, teams will begin pitching their ventures. Pitches are limited to three (3) minutes per team.

 


Prizes. The following prizes are experiential and geared towards accelerating you towards a successful business as well as expanding your network and industry knowledge:

  • Best Hackathon Overall App 
    • 1st Place - $500 in Gift Cards for the team and one (1) year of the Small service from Github for each team member
    • 2nd Place - $300 in Gift Cards for the team and one (1) year of the Micro service from Github for each team member
    • 3rd Place - $200 in Gift Cards for the team and six (6) months of Micro service from Github for each team member
  • Best App using AT&T APIs
    • 1st Place - $250 in Gift Cards for the team to split and one (1) Sierra Wireless for each w/1 month 1GB Dataconnect Plan (Max 3)

Judging Criteria. Apps will be judged based on the criteria below and weighted accordingly.  

  • 33% Weight - Ability to clearly articulate what your app does
  • 33% Weight - Originality of idea
  • 33% Weight - Use of iOS native, Android native, WP7 native, Blackberry native, Heroku, AWS, AT&T Cloud and APIs (i.e. pubnub.com, pusher.com, zappos.com)
Social Media. 
  • Follow us @hackathonlive for live updates and photos from the event
  • Like us on Facebook! https://www.facebook.com/AttMobileAppHackathon

Student forms.

For non-Silver Creek High School Students:  http://db.tt/wGhQgeak

 

Speakers

 
 
   
Alex Donn is a Senior Marketing Manager with the AT&T Developer Program, is based out of sunny Seattle! His passion is educating developers young and old about mobile application development best practices through events like hackathons that fuse the collective interests of multiple technology and business leaders. Peggy Graham has been interested in computers since her first computer class in high school. During her computer career, Peggy has been a computer programmer, a software tester and worked in both software sales and technical support helping customers with computer and software issues. She is now in technical software sales at IBM, helping customers find solutions to their software development challenges.
   
Jeremy Nash, John Murray, and Cameron McGary are firmware engineers at Seagate Technology. As programmers, Cameron and his co-presenters acknowledge that they’re just getting up to speed on the Java/Android environment, as their day jobs involve programming in C. Cameron, a recent graduate of the University of Maine, has programmed primarily in C/C++, with some experience in Perl, Python, and Verilog HDL through college coursework.
 Max Katz, Head of Community and Developer Relations for Tiggzi (http://tiggzi.com), a cloud-based HTML5, jQuery Mobile and PhoneGap mobile app builder. He loves trying out new and cool REST APIs in mobile apps. You can find out what Max is up to on his blog: mkblog.exadel.com and Twitter: @maxkatz. 
   
Tim Anglade, handles Developer Relations & Outreach for Apigee. In previous lives, he was a Research Assistant, a Project Manager, a University Lecturer and a CTO but he kept writing code all the while. You may have met him at a conference, during the NOSQL Summer or seen him host the NOSQL Tapes. He’s always up to chat about dev, hacks, apps & tech — so come say hi!

Senseis

   
Maitrey Soparia, a firmware engineer for Seagate Technology, developed his first Java (J2ME) application for mobile phones for an academic project in 2002. The app allowed a user to make a railway reservation by phone. Since then, Maitrey began using Java in most of his academic projects, one of which is theGameMaker (a tool to create 2D games. Maitrey tutored PHP and Python during his graduate studies at Indiana University. And while working for IU’s marketing department, he had ample opportunity to improve his skills in web development, especially in JavaScript and JQuery. For an independent study project, he experimented with Android SDK in developing an app that would allow the user to order snacks and drinks from stadium concessions using a phone.  Ryan Dejana is an IBM Certified IT Specialist and Software Engineer based in Boulder, Colorado. He is currently working in IBMs Advanced Cloud Solutions and Innovation organization, where he is responsible for architecture, development and end-to-end user experience for IBMs public cloud offerings. He has over a decade of experience in leading the design and development of enterprise applications, from mainframes to highly available web portals. Ryan holds a Masters of Engineering degree in Computer Science from the University of Colorado, Boulder, and a Bachelors of Science degree in Computer Science from Willamette University.
   
Alex Gaber, is an API Evangelist for Layer 7 Technologies a company that manages over 200 APIs spanning business and government.  Starting as a web developer 15 years ago, Alex grew up in Silicon Valley and is an active member in the hackathon and developer community.  He has a passion for building web and mobile applications that integrate numerous APIs and ideas to create innovative and unique solutions.  Chen Xie, a software engineer at Seagate Technology, was writing his first game (the Eight-Queens puzzle) in college, when he made a friend called Java. That friendship led to a series of academic projects in the field of computer animation, artificial intelligence, games, and so on. Chen himself is a recent graduate from the University of Southern California, where he tutored students in the database class, became a Trojan football fan and earned the opportunity to work for Seagate.

events.name: CreateCamp 2012
events.about:
Create the Future You Want to See in Albuquerque & New Mexico!

CreateCamp brings together aspects of barcamps, hackathons and similar events to create and deploy apps, websites and other tools to increase civic engagement and otherwise leverage local development, design and other skills to help build communities in New Mexico.

THE BASICS:

FRIDAY NIGHT: PROJECT DEVELOPMENT/HACKATHON KICK-OFF
Wel kick off things Friday night in more traditional hackathon style, identifying potential projects (visit our survey here) for groups to work on, connecting, forming teams and developing plans of attack.

SATURDAY: BARCAMP/UNCONFERENCE & PROJECT WORK
To help inform our teams and provide updates and information to the larger group, Saturday includes information sessions and workshops talking about the City of Albuquerques open data initiatives, developing for mobile platforms, Code for America Brigades, and other topics (contact us for more information) as well as continued project-focused work.
In addition to pre-scheduled speakers and topics, well invite others to propose sessions for the day.

SUNDAY: PROJECT WORK & DEMOS/UPDATES
Sunday is focused on project work with the goals of deploying sites and apps, and/or developing roadmaps for continued project work. The day concludes with a project demos and updates to an adoring crowd. 

THE SCHEDULE:

FRIDAY NIGHT

6:000pm - Launch & Connect 
Get more information about proposed projects, theme and purpose of the event. Network with others and begin connecting with a team. 

7:00pm - Pitches & Team Formation
Project champions describe their ideas and needs for their teams. Pitch your idea and form your team.  Each presenter has 3 minutes to present.  Time limits are enforced brutally.

8:00pm - Hackathon Kickoff
Teams discuss and develop their projects; sketch out plans for the weekend 

10:00pm - Doors (may) Close
Music from our nextdoor neighbors starts at about this time. Depending on interest and desire, we may choose to remain open, but at this time thats unlikely. 

SATURDAY:

8:30am - Doors Re-Open
Consider adding your talk/topic to the unconference grid. Drink some coffee. Consume some bagels, donuts or other pastries. 

9:00am - Scheduled Presentations Begin / Project Work Continues
Weve identified a handful of speakers to provide information and inspiiration for projects and future community-focused projects. 
Some project teams may choose to plow ahead. Onward!

1:00pm - Project Updates
Project teams provide updates on plans and needs.

2:00pm -??? - Unconference / Project Work Continues 
Unconference/impromptu sessions continue as available; Project Work Continues

7:00pm - Project Check-Ins
Informal check-ins with different projects 

12:00am: Doors Close, Sleepy Time.
Depending on interest, we *may* keep the space open this night - still working on details!

SUNDAY:

8:30am - Doors Re-Open
This day is focused on project work; Drink some coffee. Consume some bagels, donuts or other pastries.  

1:00pm - Project Updates
Project teams provide updates on plans and needs.

4:00pm - Project Development Concludes
Stop project work (mostly) and concentrate on final demos/presentations/updates.

5:00pm - Project Demos/Presentations
Teams present projects to adoring onlookers. Prizes are conceivable.
 
6:00pm - CreateCamp Concludes!
events.address: Facility CoWorking Space 215 Gold Avenue SW

events.name: Hack // Meat
events.about:
Reimagine, Prototype & 

Build the Future of Meat

 

Food+Tech Connect, GRACE Communications and Applegate are bringing together technologists, entrepreneurs, creatives, policy experts, non-profit leaders and industry executives to develop technologies and tools that help democratize meat.

Over the course of the weekend, “steakholders” will work with teams and The Design Gym facilitators to rapidly prototype innovative solutions to business or consumer education challenges in the following areas:

 

Production:  Develop tools to help small- and medium-sized ranchers more efficiently and sustainably manage herds, process meat and sell direct to consumers or wholesale buyers.

Health:  Minimize or eliminate the use of antibiotics and improve animal health.

Processing: Design ways for processors to more easily demonstrate that they are complying with federal regulations, manage processing demand and access financing.

Distribution:  Streamline the process of selling “non-choice” cuts of meat, and improve the efficiency and financial viability of getting meat from farm to buyer.

Foodservice:  Make it easier and more affordable for restaurants and foodservice to source sustainable ingredients, as well as to manage supplier adherence to worker and animal welfare.

Consumption:  Improve consumer insights research, education on the benefits of sustainable meat and empower informed consumption.

Learn more about the challenges on the event wiki. 

 

Join the #hackmeat conversation & follow @foodtechconnect for the latest  updates 


PRIZES 

A cash prize and business services will be awared to the top three winning hacks. Prizes are designed to help groups continue working with steakholders to actualize their prototypes.

1st Place: The winning team will receive $2,500 to complete their hack, as well as 1/2 day strategy session with 2-3 strategists from Purpose. The topics covered could include brand strategy, movement generation, designing to drive online action, driving participation, digital and online organizing.

2nd Place: TBD

3rd Place: TBD

 

THANK YOU TO OUR SPONSORS & PARTNERS

     

 

CONFIRMED JUDGES 

  • Stephen McDonnell (Applegate)
  • Hilary Mason (Bitly)

 

SCHEDULE

Friday, December 7: Kick-off Dinner

6:00  Registration and Networking
6:30  Welcoming remarks
7:00  Challenge brief presentations
8:00  Dinner with the “steakholders,” begin forming teams

Saturday, December 8

9:30    Registration and breakfast
10:00  API demos
10:30  Idea pitches
11:00  Forming groups and begin hacking
1:00    Lunch and guest speakers
2:30    Hacking
TBD    Office hours with technical, design and industry subject matter experts
7:30    Dinner and guest speakers
1:00    Venue closes

Sunday, December 9

9:00    Breakfast and hacking
11:00  Office hours with technical, design and industry subject matter experts
12:00  Lunch
2:30    Meat demos
4:00    End hacking
5:00    Product Pitches & Demos
6:30    Winners announced
6:45    Snacks and drinks

 

** Tickets are refundable with 24-hour notice

events.name: BeMyApp World Cup San Francisco
events.about:
BeMyApp WeekEnd is a three-day mobile app development competition taking place around the world since June 2010. The event’s goal is to foster a global community of entrepreneurs and to be a medium for team-formation and agile product development.

Hackathon with a spirit, BeMyApp aspires to promote an encounter between imagination and execution, where competition and collaboration go hand in hand.

The App Challenge

Follow mobile app news
& updates by BeMyApp

  •  Facebook
  •  Twitter
  •  bemyapp.com

Registered idea generators are given 1 minute to pitch an app concept to a tech audience on day one. Attending engineers and designers preselect the best ideas that will be developed into applications during the weekend. Teams are formed around the most promising projects and the competition is on. By Sunday evening, all competing teams should have a working prototype to demo in front of the panel of Judges.

 

The World Cup


Examples and Past 
Success Stories

  • Namerick
  • JesterChess
  • Starjar
  • Kinvolved
  • Lalilala
  • Deezy
  • Ujoolt
  • FoodReporter
  • PostrWall

The BeMyApp World Cup is open to all mobile platforms - both native and html5 apps - and will take place in 4 cities around the world: San Francisco, Singapore, Paris and Berlin.

A panel of judges in each city will nominate the best local app to continue in the finals and BeMyApp will be launching a 48hrs worldwide vote to nominate the Global Winner. The best prize youll get are the connections you forge and the challenges you conquer. That said, weve got some pretty sweet cherry-on-top prizes planned and more are coming up too, so stay tuned for the updates!

 

Schedule

FRIDAY 

7pm - Opening

8pm - Idea Pitches

9pm - Team Creation

10pm - Brainstorming and First Lines of Code

1am - Closing

SATURDAY

9am - Opening

12pm - First Video CheckPoint

12am - Closing

SUNDAY

9am - Opening

12pm - Second Video CheckPoint

7pm - First Demos Presented

9pm - Winner Announcement (public)

-----

MONDAY, DECEMBER 10

9am - Online vote opening

WEDNESDAY, DECEMBER 12

8am - BeMyApp World Cup winner announcement

 
Want to join in but have questions?  Read on...
 
What do I need to be an idea generator?
You can be anyone with an app idea who wants to build a team and a prototype. Plan to dedicate the whole weekend, help and lead your team. We would like to encourage original and innovative ideas that will be build from scratch, so please bring something fresh to pitch!

What platforms can I develop for?
Any! Whether it’s an iPhone, Android, HTML5, Windows Phone app or a tablet app, we’re there to support you in building it!

Do I need to have a certain level of experience to get involved?
No, the event is about learning as well as applying your skills so you can get involved no matter how experienced you are.

What’s expected of me over the weekend?
You’ll get most out of the weekend by joining a team and building a working prototype of a mobile app. Please, plan to dedicate the whole weekend as your team will need you.

What should I bring?
Your enthusiasm, your portable computer, the mobile device you’re building for and your camera to immortalize the making of your application!

What is the judging criteria for the apps?
The apps will be judged on their stickiness, innovation, business potential and execution.

Who owns the apps created?
The apps are owned solely by their creators – we’ll provide you with some terms which you can use so your team knows where they all stand. Do note that we do not get involved legally so it is important that you discuss this with your team before you start on the prototype so everyone is clear on ownership.

Got more questions or interested in sponsoring? Please, get in touch with vera at bemyapp dot com!

events.name: UP Singapore Arthur Guinness Fund Hackathon: Empowering Marginalised Women
events.about:
UP Singapore is partnering with the Arthur Guinness Fund (AGF) to host a Hackathon focusing on the Empowerment of Marginalised Women in Singapore. We will be asking participants to think of ways social enterprise can help single mothers and female ex-offenders get a better foothold in the workplace and society. For more information visit www.upsingapore.com/agf

Were looking for passionate participants from all walks of life, who want to put their skills to work to help marginalised women. Whether you are a developer, programmer, designer, creative, entrepreneur, corporate or government employee, or just a motivated citizen, we need your input at this hackathon!

Participation is FREE, but there is be a $10 refundable deposit required to secure your place.

There will be two pre-event brainstorming workshops. If youre interested in attending, follow these links to sign up:

Brainstorming how to empower Single Mothers

www.agfbrainstorm1.eventbrite.com

Brainstorming how to empower Female Ex-Offenders

www.agfbrainstorm2.eventbrite.com

Hackathon Weekend Schedule:

Friday 7th December, 7pm – 10pm, The Hub, Somerset 

7pm: Registration, dinner buffet

7.45pm: Speeches

8.30pm: Pitches and team formation

10pm: Close

 VENUE 

Were at 113 Somerset Road, National Youth Council Academy- the red building next to Triple One and 2 minutes from Somerset MRT.

Part of a global network of 32 HUBs, we are the first HUB in Asia! HUBs worldwide are hosted environments that actively connect Hubbers, help them to collaborate, accelerate their impact, creating a home in which to co-work, attend events, and run events.

Directions: singapore.the-hub.net/contact

About Membership: singapore.the-hub.net/membership

FB Updates: facebook.com/TheHUBSingapore

Saturday 8th December, 10am – 7pm (venue to be announced)

Teams work together on their ideas all day.

We will have mentor clinics, as well as support from roving experts. You will be

able to sign up to discuss your projects on the day.

Buffet lunch and dinner will be provided, along with tea and coffee breaks.

Sunday 9th December, 10am – 3.30pm (venue to be announced)

10am – 12pm: Teams refine their ideas and work on their presentation.

12pm – 1pm: Working buffet lunch

1pm – 2.30pm: Team presentations

2.30pm – 3pm: Judge’s deliberations.

3pm: Awards and celebrations. Guinness bar opens!

events.name: WeekEnd BeMyApp spécial objets connectés pour le Téléthon
events.about:
A l’occasion du Téléthon 2012, une édition spéciale des WeekEnds BeMyApp est organisée afin d’impliquer la communauté mobile pour cette cause. Il s’agira de développer des applications mobiles en utilisant des objets connéctés.

Le principe des WeekEnds BeMyApp est de réunir les compétences complémentaires pour créer des applications mobiles en 48h. 

Pour cette édition, il s’agira d’inventer et de créer des applications autour des objets connectés (mobilier urbain, vitrine communicante, robotique etc.) Chaque équipe participante s’engagera à verser ses premiers bénéfices à l’AFM.

De plus pendant tout le Téléthon, les spectateurs pourront suivre en direct les projets développés et voter pour leur application préférée. Le samedi 8 décembre à 22h, l’équipe qui aura récolté le plus de votes remportera le prix du public. Si les 25000 votes sont atteints avant cette date limite, un don de 5000€ sera fait au Téléthon.

Le prix du jury sera décerné quant à lui, par des professionnels de l’écosystème du monde mobile et des objets connéctés. Le lauréat de ce prix se verra remettre par Orange la somme de 5000 euros d’aide au développement, pour finaliser l’application.

Si vous avez une idée d’application, si vous êtes développeur, designeur ou marketeur et que vous avez envie de rejoindre cette noble cause et le bon esprit de BeMyApp, inscrivez-vous sans tarder.

events.name: BlackBerry 10 Super Hackathon - Greece
events.about:
Τι είναι?

Η ευκαιρία να κάνεις τις ιδέες σου πραγματικότητα έφτασε με το καινούριο BlackBerry Jam Session, το Super Hackathon. Σχεδίασε την εφαρμογή σου, ανέπτυξε την σε 10 ώρες, γνώρισε ανθρώπους του χώρου, έλα σε επαφή με ειδικούς της BlackBerry, διασκέδασε και κέρδισε πλούσια δώρα.

Το Hackathon είναι το μέρος όπου μπορείς να μετατρέψεις την ιδέα σου σε εφαρμογή μέσα σε λίγες μόνο ώρες. Είναι το μέρος που μπορείς να γνωρίσεις ανθρώπους του χώρου και  ειδικούς σε θέματα τεχνολογίας, και να γράψεις τον κώδικα της εφαρμογής σου σε μία μέρα. Είναι η δυνατότητα να φανταστείς κάτι  και να νιώσεις τον ενθουσιασμό της δημιουργίας του. Στο τέλος της ημέρας οι κριτές θα επιλέξουν τους νικητές για κάθε κατηγορία και κάθε νικήτρια ομάδα θα λάβει σπουδαία δώρα.

Τα BlackBerry Jam Sessions είναι πολλά παραπάνω από ένα απλό Hackathon.  Είναι σχεδιασμένα έτσι ώστε να αποτελούν την καλύτερη δυνατή εμπειρία για τους συμμετέχοντες. Γιατί αυτό? Γιατί ακούσαμε αυτά που θέλατε, τα βελτιώσαμε σε κάθε σημείο, και κάναμε ότι είναι δυνατό για να είναι όσα ζητήσατε διαθέσιμα. Ερχόμαστε στις  πόλεις σας, φέρνουμε τους ειδικούς, παρέχουμε πρωινό/πίτσες/καφέ και RedBull και τιμούμε την παρουσία σας με δώρα και βραβεία. Αλλά το πιο σημαντικό είναι η δημιουργία σχέσεων με εσάς. Είμαστε εδώ για εσάς, επειδή θέλουμε την επιτυχία σας.

Αυτά τα Hackathons είναι μια ενότητα με περισσότερες από 10 ώρες προγραμματισμού. Είναι η ευκαιρία σας να μάθετε , να δοκιμάσετε, και να δημιουργήσετε τις εφαρμογές σας με υποστήριξη που απλά δεν έχετε βιώσει ποτέ.

Σημαντικό : Οι ομάδες θα αποτελούνται από 5 άτομα μάξιμουμ.


Βραβεία:

·       BlackBerry Jam Session Badge

·       BlackBerry Dev  T-Shirts

·       Success Stories και Video Interviews

·       BlackBerry Developer Kits

·       BlackBerry Playbook Tablets

·       Και πολλά ακόμη


Κατηγορίες Διαγωνισμού και κριτήρια επιλογής:

Οι ομάδες μπορούν να έχουν από  ένα(1) έως πέντε(5) μέλη και οι κατηγορίες που θα διαγωνιστούν είναι οι παρακάτω ( ενδέχεται να υπάρξουν αλλαγές):

·       Καλύτερη Εφαρμογή

·       Καλύτερο Παιχνίδι

·       Καλύτερη Εφαρμογή RedBull

·       Καλύτερη E-Commerce App

·       Καλύτερος Σχεδιασμός UI


Κριτήρια:

Τα κριτήρια που θα κριθούν οι εφαρμογές είναι με το αντίστοιχο βαρος στη βαθμολογία τα παρακάτω :

·       Επιχειρηματικό Μοντέλο 25%

·       Ποιότητα Σχεδίασης 25%

·       Πρωτοτυπία 25%

·       Πλήρης Λειτουργικότητα 25%


Πρόγραμμα:

8.00 Εγγραφή και Πρωινό

9.00 Έναρξη – Δημιουργία ομάδων – Έναρξη προγραμματισμού

13.00 Pizza Time – Συνέχεια προγραμματισμού

17.00 Coffee Break

18.00 Τέλος  προγραμματισμού, έναρξη 3λεπτων παρουσιάσεων των εφαρμογών και ψηφοφορία.

20.00 Απονομή Βραβείων και λήξη

 

 

Τεχνολογίες που μπορείτε να χρησιμοποιήσετε

 

Συχνές ερωτήσεις:

1) Πόσα άτομα θα αποτελούν την κάθε ομάδα?

Από ένα μέχρι πέντε

2) Μπορώ  να  φέρω έτοιμη εφαρμογή?

Όχι. Μόνο εφαρμογές που θα δημιουργηθούν εξολοκλήρου στο Hackathon θα μπορούν να διαγωνιστούν. Αλλα η BlackBerry θέλει να σας βοηθήσει να φέρετε την εφαρμογή σας στο Playbook  ή στο BlackBerry 10, οπότε αν αυτός είναι ο στόχος σας θα σας βοηθήσουμε να τον πετύχετε

3) Πόσα άτομα θα είναι?

Μέγιστη χωρητικότητα είναι 100 άτομα.

Προτείνουμε να εγγραφείτε όσο πιο νωρίς γίνεται για να πιάσετε θέση.

4) Ποιες είναι οι απαιτήσεις?

Η μόνη απαίτηση είναι να φτιάξετε μία εφαρμογή που να λειτουργεί σε BlackBerry Playbook ( simulator ή συσκευή) ή σε BlackBerry10 ( simulator ή DevAlpha). Από εκεί και πέρα η φαντασία σας βάζει τα όρια.

5) Υπάρχουν περιορισμοί?

Πρέπει να είναι κάποιος μεγαλύτερος των 14 ετών για να συμμετάσχει.

6) Μπορώ να φέρω τους φίλους μου?

Δυστυχώς όχι. Λόγω  περιορισμένων θέσεων. Μόνο οι συμμετέχοντες θα μπορούν να εισέλθουν στην αίθουσα.

7) Θα υπάρχει Wi-fi?

Ναι θα υπάρχει Wifi , τραπέζια και καρέκλες ώστε να μπορείτε να δουλέψετε όσο πιο άνετα γίνεται.

8) Τι να έχω μαζί μου?

Φέρτε το laptop σας,( και ότι άλλο νομίζετε ότι θα σας φανεί χρήσιμο ( έξτρα οθόνες, πίνακες κλπ)) και οτιδήποτε πρόγραμμα χρειάζεστε για τον σχεδιασμό και την ανάπτυξη των εφαρμογών σας.

ΣΗΜΑΝΤΙΚΟ!

Σιγουρευτείτε πως ο υπολογιστής σας είναι έτοιμος με όλα τα προγράμματα που πιθανώς να χρειαστείτε.

Θα υπάρχει φαγητό-ποτό?

Ναι. Θα υπάρχει φαγητό και μη αλκοολούχα αναψυκτικά θα παρέχονται στους συμμετέχοντες.(πρωινό και γεύμα)

Δεν έχω Playbook ή DevAlpha. Μπορώ να δανειστώ ένα για την παρουσίαση της εφαρμογής μου?

Ναι. Θα έχουμε Playbook και DevAlpha διαθέσιμα για να δοκιμάσετε, αναπτύξετε και παρουσιάσετε την εφαρμογή σας.

Τα λέμε από κοντά σύντομα και Happy Coding.

events.name: Alameda County Apps Challenge 2012  #Hackathon
events.about:
Event Agenda

Morning 

8:30 -9:30               Breakfast and sign in

Ticketing FAQs:

I registered online, how will I RECEIVE my ticket ?
You will receive an e-ticket after registering online. Check your email inbox for your Order Confirmation from Eventbrite. Your e-tickets will be attached to your order confirmation email.  IMPORTANT: if you do not see your order confirmation in your inbox, make sure to check your junk/spam folder.

Do I need to PRINT out my tickets?
YES. Print out your tickets or registration summary and bring them to the event entrance or Download the mobile app to display your ticket on your phone.

I still dont see my order confirmation, what should I do?
I am having trouble printing my PDF ticket, what should I do?
Please click here for more information on finding your order confirmation or printing your ticket(s).

I bought two tickets and they both have my name on them. Will this be a problem?
No. Tickets are transferrable. The name on your ticket only signifies who purchased the tickets. Just make sure the bar code on your ticket(s) are not damaged when you print them out. If you would like to update the name or email address on your order, click here. 

Visit www.acgov.org for additional information and services provided by the County of Alameda.

events.name: Global Day of Code Retreat: Ithaca
events.about:
At the end of September I went to a conference (Ruby DCamp 2012) whose first day featured a code retreat. While I had heard of code retreat from Corey Haines on Twitter, I had not been to one before. I knew only that it involved hacking on Conways Game of Life with other coders. 

Think of a space in which you play with other coders on a problem too big to solve at once but small enough to make some interesting progress. There is no pressure to finish anything, instead to experiment, do things the right way or the fun way, any way but having to complete an assignment or finish a project on a budget. Not a hackathon or startup weekend (although those are fun too!) but a place to socialize with coders while testing your mettle and polishing your skills.

The code retreat started the day with breakfast and a hey, how are you. Then we paired with someone - preferably one we didnt know - and hacked on the game for 45 minutes. We then had to delete our code and come together as a group to talk about the experience. At this point it was mostly getting into the groove of pair programming.

Then the facilitator said something like, now find a different pair and solve the problem without using conditionals. After 45 minutes we deleted our code and discussed the experience as a group. Then four more times, each with a different twist. The exercises are all defined to improve your object oriented and functional design skills, introduce you to pair programming, and to test-driven development. It is language agnostic. 

In my code retreat experience, I worked with coders both more and less skilled than myself. For me it was about levelling up on RSpec, and to have fun writing a script that didnt output a web page. As I was driving home from that conference weekend, I said to myself, I WANT TO DO THAT IN ITHACA. Hey, isnt there a Global Day of Code Retreat coming up? Maybe I should organize it. And here we are! 

We have some generous sponsors who will make sure we dont go hungry or thirsty during the event. Special thanks go to GORGES, Singlebrook Technology, Incandescent Software, and Think Topography.

Travis Vachon will be the facilitator. Many of you know him as one of the driving forces behind the Ithaca Web People meetup, as well as Clojure, Python, and Ruby guru. 

You should come having read the Wikipedia page on Conways Game of Life. Have your preferred development environment set up, including your preferred testing framework, whether its RSpec, Test::Unit, phpUnit, Jasmine, or qUnit. (Apart from exercising your TDD skills, you probably wont get far enough into your program to know if its working other than through test assertions...)

So lets get together and have some fun! Space is limited so please sign up today.
