events.name: Data Journalism Summit | A two-day Datafest on immigration
events.about:
Dates/Times: Saturday, December 8th, 2012 from 10:00am and continue through Sunday, December 9th, 2012 with hacking completing at 4:00pm and winners announced at 5:00pm (PST)

Cost: FREE, plus we will provide food and prizes

Event Focus:  Fun, food and numbers mash-up to build a data visualization tool or mobile application using open data on immigration.

Journalists, developers, coders, designers, and open data activists – you are all invited!

If youve never been to a hackathon before, this is your opportunity. We will explore open data sources and mix them with a little coding, design, and a little web tech to create something new.

Hackathons are also a great place to meet other people and start new projects!

What skills are needed?

All the skills youll need are your enthusiasm and willingness to have a great time at our hackathon. If you know a few programming languages, this event is for you; but if you have a desire to learn digital map design, basic programming, cellphone video production, or interactive graphics; this event is for you as well.

Bring ideas, your laptop, and help shape the future of information.

Data:

The organizers will provide the data for the hackathon. The data will be in CSV, Excel and SPPS formats to speed up the event.

Goals:

Create teams with at least one programmer, journalist and designer. The goal for each group is to build data visualizations on immigration that will be accessible to media outlets and non-profit organizations in a short period of time

Please spread the word!

events.name: Make-a-thon: Create for a Cause
events.about:
Overview

Make-a-thon: Create for a Cause is a fun day for makers, artisans, crafters, and tinkerers to come together as a community and make gifts for underprivileged families for the holidays. Youll get to mingle with other creative creators and make things that will be donated to Toys for Tots (toys) or the Salvation Army (non-toys). 

  • 11:00am: Arrival: People start arriving and begin their projects.
  • 11:30am: Welcome!: Just a quick hello and welcome to everyone.
  • Noon: Lunch: We will be offering pizza and beverages for people at the event.
  • 1pm-5pm: Create:  Continue making and mingling with other makers.  
FREE FOOD, BEER/HOLIDAY BEVERAGES, & NON-ALCOHOLIC DRINKS will be provided!
WANT TO COME FOR FREE? See below section, get support & sponsorship from your community.

What to Make?

You can make whatever you like as long as it is appropriate as a holiday gift for less privileged individuals or families. We recommend toys since we are collaborating with Toys for Tots, and if you decide to do so, see below for guidelines on handmade toys. You can make toys, clothes or jewelry, cards, electronics, educational items, or anything you feel inspired to make! Unleash your creativity!

BYOM:

This event is Bring Your Own Materials. Because you will have the flexibility to make whatever you want however you would like, we suggest bringing your own materials for the project. 

Get Support & Sponsorship from Your Community:

If you want to get friends or families to sponsor you for the materials for the event,

you can use CrowdTilt (see example)

OR you can have them purchase a gift card from Joanns here .

TAX WRITE-OFF: For your materials contribution, you can get a tax-write off since the items will be donated to charity. We will have forms for you and any of your contributors at the event.

 

Plan on Toy Making? Please read the guidelines:

6.9 Homemade Toys. Of growing concern, is the donation of homemade toys, and whether or not Toys for Tots will continue to accept such toys, even though they may not have undergone the new testing process required for toys. The Foundation is taking the position that since homemade toymakers are not producing toys for the purposes of making a profit and have no reason to cut corners to increase profit margins or reduce their inventory, and that the toys are generally safe with minimal moving parts that could cause injury, that we will continue to accept homemade toys.  In doing so, there are three layers of safety that must be in place to ensure this policy can continue.

  •  Layer One: Toy makers must understand the requirement that homemade toys be safe (no small parts; rounded edges; lead-free paint; etc.); 
  • Layer Two: Toys for Tots coordinators (and their volunteer assistants) must take steps to ensure the makers are informed of the Layer One requirement, carefully inspect homemade toys when they are donated, AND make every effort to distribute such toys appropriately; and
  • Layer Three: Parents must ensure that any toy given to them to, in turn, present to their child, must be age appropriate. [Guidelines from: Toys for Tots]

Toy or Item Drop-Off?

If you only have time to drop-off a toy or gift, feel free to stop by and drop off items. If you plan to stay for longer, we will ask you to purchase a ticket so that we can manage our capacity. The drop-off HOURS will be 11am-5pm (same as the event).

Who Are We Supporting?

More Info: Toys for Tots               

More Info: Salvation Army 

In Collaboration With:

Project Society

Project Society is empowering a community of crafters and makers to come together and make items as well as earn money doing what they love. If you want to find out more about the opportunities as the PS team stitches things together, please sign up here.

Citizen Space 

Citizen Space is a coworking space in SF, and San Jose.The idea of Citizen Space is to take the best elements of a coffee shop (social, energetic, creative) and of a workspace (productive, functional) and combine them to give indie workers the chance to have their own, affordable space. 

AngelHack 

AngelHack unites developers around the world for a hackathon competition, where they can learn developer tools, start new companies, and win prizes and funding for their ideas.

Sponsorfied

We’re building the worlds largest database of brands, and connecting them with amazing sponsorship opportunities.

SPONSORSHIP:

If you would like to sponsor or have your company represented at this event, please contact: info@projectsociety.com .

FUTURE MAKE-A-THONS or Making Events?

If you are interested in organizing, hosting, collaborating, suggesting, or participating in future Make-a-thons, please contact us at info@projectsociety.com .

QUESTIONS or CONCERNS?

 If you have questions or concerns, please email info@projectsociety.com.

events.name: HackDay Miami - 2012
events.about:
HackDay Miami is part of a series of International hackathons organized by the HackDay Foundation, aimed at fostering the development of technology startups in select cities around the globe.  The event will take place at LAB Miami on December 8-9th, 2012.

The event registration will start at 11am on Saturday, Dec. 8th, and will run non-stop through the night, finishing on Sunday at 1pm, followed by the demo of the hacks at 2pm and the selection of the five finalists.  

Finalists will be invited to pitch at the Americas Venture Capital Conference (http://avcc.fiu.edu), the premier technology event in South Florida, where they will present their hacks as potential new startups to a panel of Industry leading VCs and tech executives. 

The judges will select the winner of the $30,000 grand prize based on its potential to become a full-fledged technology startup.  If the winning team commits to working full time on the project for the next 90 days and participate in the HackDay Accelaration Program, they will receive an addition $20k cash prize, free co-working space at LAB Miami and prizeless mentorship from some of the worlds top technology entrepreneurs.

Food and beverage will be available throughout the event for the participants and attendees.  HackDays are meant to be a celebration of the digital culture, and serve as an engine for startup creation within the local technology community

Important HackDay Dates

  • Nov. 27th - Pre-HackDay Event Senzari Offices.  Open to everybody.  You can see details and register here.
  • Dec. 3rd Registration for HackDay Miami closes.  
  • Dec. 5th - All accepted participants to HackDay will be notified.
  • Dec.8-9th - HackDay 24hr hackathon at LAB Miami.
  • Swc. 9th - HackDay finalists selected.
  • Dec. 10-13th - Finalists prepare for Demo Day to pitch their hacks as startups at AVCC with the help of HackMasters.
  • Dec.14th - Demo Day at AVCC in front 400 attendees and top notch judges.  Winner Announced!

For more information, please visit HackDay Foundation

events.name: AT&T Mobile App Hackathon - Austin
events.about:
Have an app idea or need an app built for your business?

Mobile App Hackathon is an event produced by the AT&T Developer Program  that is designed for attendees (technical & non-technical) to build apps/mobile apps, get fed, compete for prizes across different categories and most importantly: meet new people and scout for teammates to work on new or current projects. Our hackathon will introduce you to the latest cutting edge tools to help deploy your own app with a website backend, fully hosted in the cloud.

We Supply: Quick presentations and code samples that help to bootstrap your hacking, food to keep you going, and caffeine to keep you awake. Along with technical senseis to assist you in building faster, smarter, and with new tools.

You Bring: Your laptop, skills & ideas. Come with a collaborative, team focused mindset and/or team up in advance on Twitter/Facebook/Google+ via the #atthack hashtag. Whether you are a backend person and code in Ruby/PHP/.NET or are a designer and only work with Illustrator, you are invited to attend this event. Every group needs a good balance of talent and your development skills are needed!

Event Schedule.  The following is a list of the weekends agenda:

  • 6PM - Friday Evening - Kickoff event with drinks, networking, and developer dating which leads into idea pitches and team formation.
  • 10AM - Saturday Morning -  The fun continues with an all day hackathon. Work with the teams that you formed on Friday night to produce the app spec’d out the night before. Senseis will be available throughout the entire event to help you code up your solution. App submissions will be accepted throughout the day with a deadline of 7PM.
  • 7PM - Saturday Evening - Promptly at 7PM, teams will begin pitching their ventures. Pitches are limited to three (3) minutes per team.

U-verse Enabled IPTV Edutainment Challenge.

Do you love TV? I mean do you really love TV? You might be a U-verse Enabled developer. With the U-verse Enabled SDK and APIs you can allow a personal device to associate itself with a U-verse set-top box. Using the UvE SDK and APIs for iOS you can develop a mobile application that can: 

  • Make pictures, video, and music play on the TV instead of on the small mobile device
  • Keep your app small, easy to download, and nimble. The U-verse receiver directly retrieves and displays your web hosted content, so there is no need store large video files on the device.
  • Remain in control of your content. You can update or remove content at any time without needing to communicate with the device.
  • Have your app receive information about the programming being watched and respond intelligently.
  • Make your app turn a mobile device into a TV remote control.
  • Use the TV as a secondary or alternate screen and send UI elements to be rendered on the TV including compatible multimedia content like photos, music, and video.

Your Challenge: We are looking for creative mobile developers who want to take a test drive on the new U-verse Enabled platform. We will start you off with a sample application and all the testing equipment you will need. We will also provide tutorials on the SDK throughout the day. You will need to come up with a stellar edutainment app that shows off all the sick features of the U-verse Enabled platform. Embrace your inner geek child and create an app that is educational, but fun for a kid that is 2-10 years-old. The app should be iOS based and served from either a mobile phone or tablet device. You must use at least two distinct UvE API calls to be eligible for judging (e.g. host mode and remote control).

If you are interested in this challenge, we highly recommend becoming familiar with the SDK ahead of time. Find more information on the AT&T developer portal athttp://developer.att.com/developer/forward.jsp?passedItemId=10100307.

Prizes. The following prizes are experiential and geared towards accelerating you towards a successful business as well as expanding your network and industry knowledge:

  • Best Hackathon Overall App 
    • 1st Place - $500 in Gift Cards for the team and one (1) year of the Small service from Github for each team member
    • 2nd Place - $300 in Gift Cards for the team and one (1) year of the Micro service from Github for each team member
    • 3rd Place - $200 in Gift Cards for the team and six (6) months of Micro service from Github for each team member
  • Best App using AT&T APIs
    • $500 in giftcards for the team to split and one (1) 4G LTE Momentum device with 1 month of 1GB dataconnect service for each team member (Max 3)
  • Best U-verse Challenge App
    • $500 in giftcards for the team to split 

Judging Criteria. Apps will be judged based on the criteria below and weighted accordingly.  

  • 33% Weight - Ability to clearly articulate what your app does
  • 33% Weight - Originality of idea
  • 33% Weight - Use of Node.JS, Sencha, cloud9ide.com, Heroku, and other technologies
Social Media. 
  • Follow us @hackathonlive for live updates and photos from the event
  • Like us on Facebook! https://www.facebook.com/AttMobileAppHackathon

Speakers

 
   
Alex Donn is a Developer Evangelist with the AT&T Developer Program and is based out of sunny Seattle! His passion is educating developers young and old about mobile application development best practices through events like hackathons that fuse the collective interests of multiple technology and business leaders. John ODowd is part of the U-verse Enabled Developer Support Team based out of Seattle. He attended NUI Galway, Ireland and graduated with a degree in Electronic Engineering. He is an iOS Developer who specializes in the U-verse Enabled SDK, but has interests would range from programing microcontrollers to researching the advancements being made in the web especially in related to usability and accessibility.
   
Kyle Simpson is a JavaScript Systems Architect. If something cant be done in JavaScript or web stack technology, hes probably bored by it. Kyle runs several open-source projects, writes books, and speaks at meetups and tech conferences. He also helps drive the local startup/entrepreneurial community through events, coworking activities, etc. Anthony Cuellar is the Developer Relations Manager for Pearson on the East Coast. Based out of New York City, Anthony is active in the citys thriving tech, startup, and developer communities. Anthony is passionate about technology, content creation, community management, and music festivals.

events.name: Splunk Hackathon
events.about:
On Wednesday, December 12th at SplunkLive New York, Splunk is hosting a hackathon for developers to get together and build applications that make it easier and more effective to gain insights from machine data with Splunk. Splunkers will be on hand to help with any level of technical question and provide support.  The hackathon is open to developers with any level of familiarity with Splunk, the REST APIs and SDKs.  Whether you’re a Splunk ninja or just want to learn to apply your Python, Java or JavaScript skills to building data apps, attending the hackathon is a great way to grow your skills, meet other Splunk developers and build cools stuff.

Participants can decide to participate as an individual or join a team. Prizes will be awarded for “Best Application” and “Best Application for Social Impact” by a panel of judges at the conclusion of the hackathon on Thursday night.  Please ensure that your company policies allow you to participate.  

Developers interested in building apps to solve challenging data problems with Splunk are welcome, you don’t have to be a registered for the conference to take part.  Read the Official Rules. 

NO PURCHASE NECESSARY TO ENTER OR WIN. A PURCHASE WILL NOT INCREASE YOUR CHANCES OF WINNING.  Must be 18 and the age of majority to participate.  Void where prohibited by law.  “Best Application” entries will receive a score of one (1) to ten (10) in the following categories: innovation, technical implementation, presentation, and coolness. “Best Application for Social Impact” entries will receive a score of one (1) to ten (10) in the following categories: innovation, technical implementation, presentation, coolness, and social impact.  Must be present to participate and win.  Sponsor is Splunk Inc. 250 Brannan Street, San Francisco, CA 94107.

events.name: BlackBerry Jam Session Wrocław
events.about:
Najlepsza okazja, aby zmienić Twoje pomysły w rzeczywistość właśnie nadeszła, dzięki BlackBerry Jam Sessions - serii trzech konferencji organizowanych przez polski oddział Research In Motion przy współpracy z firmą PROGET!

Zaplanuj swoją aplikację, stwórz ją w 10 godzin, poznaj innych programistów, ekspertów, baw się i wygrywaj fantastyczne nagrody!

Czym jest BlackBerry Jam Session? = Super Hackathon

Hackathon jest wydarzeniem, na którym możesz opracować swój pomysł na aplikację w kilka godzin. Właśnie tutaj spotykają się najlepsi programiści i eksperci, tworząc aplikacje w jeden dzień. To najlepsza okazja, aby zamienić przeczucie “to może zadziałać”, w coś prawdziwego, działającego i ekscytującego. Na koniec, sędziowie wybierają zwycięzców każdej kategorii, którzy wracają do domu z torbami pełnymi nagród.

BlackBerry Jam Session to jednak o wiele więcej niż zwykły Hackathon, robimy wszystko, aby te spotkania były NAJLEPSZYMI Hackathonami na świecie.

Dlaczego najlepszymi? Ponieważ słuchamy was, wiemy czego potrzebujecie i staramy się za każdym razem zapewnić wam absolutnie wszystko co niezbędne.

Przyjeżdżamy do was, umożliwiamy bezpośredni kontakt z ekspertami, oferujemy kawę, ciastka, pizzę, nagradzamy specjalnymi prezentami, ale jesteśmy tutaj w rzeczywistości po to, aby nawiązać z wami kontakt. Jesteśmy tutaj przede wszystkim dla was, bo chcemy, abyście odnieśli sukces. Wszystkie spotkania trwają często dłużej niż 10 godzin. Będą waszą szansą na to, aby nauczyć się czegoś nowego, przećwiczyć swoje umiejętności i stworzyć aplikacje z pomocą, jakiej jeszcze nigdy nie doświadczyliście.

Dlaczego warto uczestniczyć?

Dlaczego warto uczestniczyć? Powodów jest naprawdę wiele. Tak wiele, że nie sposób je wszystkie wymienić, tym bardziej, że widza zdobyta podczas takich konferencji, wspólna praca z innymi programistami czy możliwość spotkania się z innymi osobami zainteresowanymi programowaniem czy po prostu BlackBerry jest często bezcenna.

Postanowiliśmy jednak przygotować dodatkowy zestaw motywatorów, wśród których znajdzie się m.in.:

  • WYJAZD DO AMSTERDAMU NA BLACKBERRY JAM EUROPE 2013 dla zespołu, który stworzy najlepszą aplikację ze wszystkich 3 spotkań 
  • Prototypowe urządzenia BlackBerry Dev Alpha 
  • Smartfony BlackBerry 
  • Koszulki BlackBerry Dev 
  • Tablety BlackBerry PlayBook 
  • Zestawy nagród od partnerów 
  • Wiele, wiele więcej!

Do zobaczenia na miejcu!

Build an App and Win Money and Prizes!

Our sponsors have stepped up with some awesome prizes. Not only do you get a ton of information for FREE, but you have an opportunity to win some awesome stuff! You can’t afford to miss this!

events.name: Athens Green Hackathon
events.about:
Greenhackathon is a series of events where developers get together to create and implement new ideas for a more sustainable future.

Working towards a more sustainable and resilient world is one of the biggest challenges that we face. We believe in a hacker approach to sustainability. Participating, getting excited and building things, being creative. Computer technology is both part of the problem and part of the solution, it all depends on how we use it. Let’s get together and use it for good.

Athens is hosting the Green Hackathon on the 14th, 15th and 16th of December. Registration is required to attend the two first days of the event. Entrance for the Sunday plenary is free to everyone that is interested but also requires a registration (see above). 

Latest hacks: 
Company Carbon Death Map
Energy Efficiency in Buildings
Greensta

more can be found here...

events.name: self.dev hackathon
events.about: self.dev Hackathon is a monthly hackathon day at Geekdom. Upcoming: Friday December 14th, 2012 from 10am to 5pm (repeats every second Friday of the month). The event is for devs only and will be highly focused on devs helping other devs through paired programming, code katas, and group discussions. We welcome any developer who wants to help other developers or who needs help themselves. Lunch will be provided and it should be a great event for all involved! Lets start the best hackathon in the city at Geekdom!

events.name: Christmas Hackathon & Drinks
events.about:
Its time to wrap up your existing Windows 8 apps! No matter whether youd port it from an existing one or creating a brand new idea, Santas gonna show you some love! We are there for you. You will learn, enjoy and build the greatest apps ever sold!

HO HO X-mas hackathon is a one day opportunity for Windows 8 and Windows Phone app creation. Consulting from Microsoft experts, presentations about Windows 8 and Windows Phone development and, most important, plenty of time to hack. The basic case for you would be to port your ready app from other platform to Windows 8 or Windows Phone, but you can also participate by starting from scratch.

Are you IOS, Unity, Android or HTML5 developer?
Want to reach over 650 M potential customer globally? Come to port your existing app to Windows 8 thats a touch optimized system for tablets, laptops and PCs where your same app can run on all of these devices

 Christmas Hackathon & Party

We will bring the drinks, food and coding experts to help you turn your idea into an app or to port your existing windows phone, iOS or Android app to Windows 8. or Windows Phone 8 We will have some drinks and mince pies to fuel the creative spirit.

Coding starts at 12 noon and drinks and presents follow.

GET READY FOR THE EVENT

Before you arrive to the Geek Christmas party hackathon make sure that you have the tools to create Windows Store apps. Here are some resources to get you started:

GETTING STARTED GUIDE: Download a Getting Started Guide to find tools, tutorials and resources to build Windows Store apps. You can also find some great resources at Channel9.

WINDOWS 8: You must have Windows 8 installed on your computer. Windows Store apps require the Windows 8 API for design and testing. Ways to get Windows 8 Include:

  • MSDN - if you are a MSDN subscriber
  • Free 90-day Windows 8 evaluation for Developers Note: This version will expire and you cannot upgrade
  • Download a Windows 8 Pro upgrade for €29.99 from www.windows.com
  • DreamSpark Premium Web Store - If your school has a DreamSpark Premium subscriptionBizSpark - If you are startup and BizSpark member

VISUAL STUDIO EXPRESS 2012 FOR WINDOWS 8: FREE - Download and install everything you need to build apps for Windows 8 - the Windows 8 SDK, Blend for Visual Studio and the Windows App Certification Kit. 
CREATE A WINDOWS STORE ACCOUNT: Create your account in the Windows Store. Verified users can publish and sell apps in the Windows Store for free with a registration code from MSDN orDreamSpark or BizSpark. 
SETUP A TFS-ACCOUNT: Use TFS-preview to plan your app, collaborate with your team, and manage your code online from anywhere. Its free! Start by inviting your team and creating your backlog.

Are you familiar with iOS development and looking to take your app to Windows 8? Check out theseresources. Migrating a web or Windows Phone 7 app to Windows 8? Take a look at these resources or check out this recording if youre migrating a HTML5 game.

events.name: AT&T Mobile App Hackathon - Miami in coordination with ESENEM
events.about:
Have an app idea or need an app built for your business?

This AT&T Mobile App Hackathon, an event produced by the AT&T Developer Program in coordination with ESENEM, is designed for attendees (technical & non-technical) to build apps/mobile apps, get fed, compete for prizes across different categories and most importantly: meet new people and scout for teammates to work on new or current projects. Our hackathon will introduce you to the latest cutting edge tools to help deploy your own app with a website backend, fully hosted in the cloud.

We Supply: Quick presentations and code samples that help to bootstrap your hacking, food to keep you going, and caffeine to keep you awake. Along with technical senseis to assist you in building faster, smarter, and with new tools.

You Bring: Your laptop, skills & ideas. Come with a collaborative, team focused mindset and/or team up in advance on Twitter/Facebook/Google+ via the #atthack hashtag. Whether you are a backend person and code in Ruby/PHP/.NET or are a designer and only work with Illustrator, you are invited to attend this event. Every group needs a good balance of talent and your development skills are needed!

Event Schedule.  The following is a list of the weekends agenda:

  • 6PM - Friday Evening - Kickoff event with drinks, networking, and developer dating which leads into idea pitches and team formation.
  • 10AM - Saturday Morning -  The fun continues with an all day hackathon. Work with the teams that you formed on Friday night to produce the app spec’d out the night before. Senseis will be available throughout the entire event to help you code up your solution. App submissions will be accepted throughout the day with a deadline of 7PM.
  • 7PM - Saturday Evening - Promptly at 7PM, teams will begin pitching their ventures. Pitches are limited to three (3) minutes per team.

 


Prizes. The following prizes are experiential and geared towards accelerating you towards a successful business as well as expanding your network and industry knowledge:

  • Best Hackathon Overall App 
    • 1st Place - $500 in Gift Cards for the team and one (1) year of the Small service from Github for each team member
    • 2nd Place - $300 in Gift Cards for the team and one (1) year of the Micro service from Github for each team member
    • 3rd Place - $200 in Gift Cards for the team and six (6) months of Micro service from Github for each team member

Judging Criteria. Apps will be judged based on the criteria below and weighted accordingly.  

  • 33% Weight - Ability to clearly articulate what your app does
  • 33% Weight - Originality of idea
  • 33% Weight - Use of Node.JS, Sencha, cloud9ide.com, Heroku, and other technologies
Social Media. 
  • Follow us @hackathonlive for live updates and photos from the event
  • Like us on Facebook! https://www.facebook.com/AttMobileAppHackathon

 

Speakers

 
Alex Donn, Senior Marketing Manager at AT&T, is based out of sunny Seattle! His passion is educating developers young and old about mobile application development best practices through events like hackathons that fuse the collective interests of multiple technology and business leaders. He loves bacon and is allergic to all types of gluten. Milana V. Kuznetsova, CEO at ESENEM and a lawyer, is an experienced law practice management and technology entrepreneur leading ESENEMs Xibid to be the trend-setter for seamless mobile practice for legal professionals. She is also a frequent lecturer and published authority, advising on law practice management, technology, and ethical considerations.
Timothy Clem, a developer at GitHub, was formerly a Director at Blue Dot Solutions, Inc. His specialities consist of software and user experience design, mobility, robotics, human interaction with technology, and real time computing and control systems. Mike Cuesta, the Director of Design & Community at CareCloud, was formerly the Senior Designer & Webmaster at Avisena, where he grew the online marketing, branding, and product management that directly contributed to a 62% year-over-year increase from 2007 to 2008. His passion for user experience has garnered multiple awards and recognition.
 
Carolina Rendeiro, the CEO and Owner at Right Space Management, Inc, specializes in strategic consulting, such as business plan and sales strategy development. She trains, consults, and ows independent business centers in 18 countries.  

Senseis
Sean M. McNamara,  the Chief Technology Officer at ESENEM, is leading all things engineering and product development for Xibid, a mobile cloud-enabled platform designed to organize cases and power a mobile legal practice. He is an experienced software developer, with over ten years of experience in building enterprise mobile solutions and is a frequent speaker in Miami and Denver on topics related to mobile software development and agile process. Diego Lapiduz is a Director of technology at Intergi and has over ten years of experience building web and mobile applications. At Intergi he leads the technology department in developing products like gamezone and Playwire. His toolbox includes Ruby on Rails, HTML5, Javascript, and Objective-C.
Bryce Kerley is a Developer Advocate at Basho, is a highly skilled Rails developer. Prior to joining Basho, he worked as an independent Rails developer, consulting on everything from AJAZ to ZFS. Nelson Melo is a Software Developer and Founder of CodeModLabs LLC, a software consulting firm in Miami, FL. Nelson has been coding in a mixture of Python & Java for AppEngine and Android since 2008, and working on the web and mobile spaces for more than 10 years. He also organizes the South Florida Google Developers Group.

Leonardo Correa is a recent FIU graduate in Computer Science that has extensive experience with Java and Ruby on Rails. He is currently a Ruby on Rails developer for Citrix and is a founder and backend developer of Unboxed Labs, a company that develops mobile and web applications with ROR backends. Andrej Kostresevic has over 10 years of development experience, and has developed apps that have over 10M downloads. He organizes the Miami Lean Startup Circle and the South Florida Android Developers. He is currently busy running the New Frontier Nomads, a mobile development company focused on helping startups launch innovative mobile products.

Sponsors

 Windows Azure Challenge. At Microsoft, were motivated and inspired every day by how our customers use our software to find creative solutions to business problems,develop breakthrough ideas, and stay connected to whats most important to them. Windows Azure is an open cloud platform that enables developers to quickly build, deploy and manage applications across a globalnetwork of Microsoft-managed datacenters. Mobile Services allows developers to quickly add a scalable and secure backend hosted in the Windows Azure cloud to an iOS, Windows Store, or Windows Phone 8 app.  Learn more at www.windowsazure.com/mobile. 

Prizes. The following prizes are experiential and geared towards accelerating you towards a successful business as well as expanding your network and industry knowledge:

      • One (1) year of the Micro service from Github for each team member
    • 3rd Place 
      • Three (3) month membership at RightSpace2Meet (Valued at $1,050)
      • $200 in Gift Cards for the team 
      • Six (6) months of Micro service from Github for each team member
  • Best Blackberry App - Requirements TBA
    •  Trip to the AT&T Developer Summit Hackathon in Las Vegas, where you will have the chance to compete for over $50,000 in total prizes
      • Maximum of four (4) team members will receive airfare to/from Las Vegas, NV and a maximum of two (2) rooms at the Palms Casino Resort for the team*
  • Best App using AT&T APIs
    • $500 in Gift Cards for the team to split and one (1) Sierra Wireless 4G LTE Momentum Device for each team member with 1 month of 1GB DataConnect Service (Max 3)
  • Best Objective C, Windows Store, or Windows Phone 8 app using Mobile Services
    • Each member of the winning team walks away with a Jawbone Big Jambox or Beats by Dr Dre headphones, their choice.  The only fitting way to celebrate a big win is with big sound, of course.
  • Best use of ESENEM API/Most Useful App to ESENEM
    • $1,000 in cash for the team to split
  • Sphero Best in Show
    • 1st Place - $250 in cold hard cash+ Spheros
      • An additional $750 when your app goes to market!
  • Best Native Android Application
    • one (1) Sierra Wireless 4G LTE Momentum Device for each team member with 1 month of 1GB DataConnect Service (Max 3)
  • ListNOW! for Glozal - The top real estate mobile app. The app will be used by real estate agents and brokers to quickly and efficiently initiate real estate listings and, when they are in the field, list new properties on http://golzalrealestate.com (Global Listing System = GLS). Additional functionality specification to be provided onsite.
    • $1,000 in cash for the team to split

 

*Please see official rules for full details

events.name: Sprout - Hackathon
Support the Troops Hackathon
events.about:
We have created the Support the Troops Hackathon for three reasons.

1.) Get the burgoening NY Tech community creating applications to help support military personnel who put their life on the line defending our nation.

2.) Show developers that military personnel are  a highly concentrated, adoptive, tech savvy group that is easily reachable and a perfect group on which to rapidly test and deploy web applications.

3.) Raise awareness of the organizations in the New York area that are currently working to support veterans and active/reserve military personnel.

How to get invovled:

1.) Sign up on the eventbrite. We are charging $5 because in our experience, if you pay a couple bucks you are more likely to show up. All proceeds will go to the Wounded Warrior Project who is helping secure prizes and food for this hackathon.

2.) If you have an idea for an app that supports the troops, go to the google spreadsheet and enter your idea.(https://docs.google.com/spreadsheet/ccc?key=0AqOAbFShj0XpdHBVZ3VpNXFYQ3AwczZRcW1FcGs1dkE)

3.) If you dont have an idea, but want to join a team go to the google doc and enter your name under one of the team member slots.  Be careful to look at Column E to see how many team members the captain wants on their team. (https://docs.google.com/spreadsheet/ccc?key=0AqOAbFShj0XpdHBVZ3VpNXFYQ3AwczZRcW1FcGs1dkE)

If you have any questions, email the organizer and we will get back to you right away.

Food will be provided. We are in the midst of talking with sponsors and will list the prizes when they are locked up.

We look forward to seeing you at the Event!

events.name: All night Hackathon @START
events.about:
Houston START Hackathon 

Celebrate 6 months of Start by creating something awesome!


   

Join us on Friday 12/14/2012 for 12 hours of hacking awesomeness. Well take care of the food, beer and coffee.Write cloud apps, mobile apps or surprise us with what you are working on! 

Challenge of the month - Hack Xbox Kinect and write apps that can be used by businesses. 

Experts from ChaiONE, Houstons leading mobile solutions agency and leaders from Houstons top meetup groups who will be on hand to mentor and dig in with you. There is only one condition - you have to participate to win!

events.name: Code + Mansion + Art Bus + Social Impact + Job Offers = PF Hackathon
events.about:
Imagine the possibility of fun and innovation when you take 15 engineers, house them in the Embassy Networks mansion in Hayes Valley SF for the weekend, transform theHUB SF into your Saturday hack-a-torium and have the Artis Mobilus as your transit + mobile party bus. 

Well, Progreso Financiero has imagined it and we are hosting 15 engineers for a weekend of coding, great food, entertainment (did we mention the basement bowling alley at the mansion) and social good - - taking our team and business model to the next level to do more of what it does best.  The event will center arounf three themes :: data visualization, consumer facing apps and using social data to infer credit risk.

How is this relevant to Progreso?  Progreso is kicking off a new platform build and we are looking for amazing engineers who want to help us build this from the ground up using bleeding edge technologies.

So the catch... we’d like to offer participants the opportunity to join the Progreso team; at the end of the weekend, if you like us and we like you, we’ll be making offers. 

Venues ::

Embassy Network :: Where we’ll be staying + eating :: http://embassynetwork.com/

theHUB :: Where we’ll be hacking :: http://bayarea.the-hub.net/

Artis Mobilus :: How we’ll be rolling + having fun :: http://www.artismobilus.com/

FAQs

What kind of shop are you?

JAVA, MySQL, Hadoop, HTML5

What are my transport/parking options getting to the event?

Well be transporting event attendees to and from The Embassy Network and theHUB.  Our recommendation is to take public transport or a cab to the event location given that street parking is limited.

Where can I contact the organizer with any questions?

Just call David @ 415.548.3977 or email david.needham@progressfin.com

events.name: Hack My Shop - hackathon by Hi ! Human Inside !
events.about:
Paris, le 21 novembre 2012 – La 1ère édition du hackathon Digitail « hack my shop » est organisée par Hi ! Human Inside !, parrainé par Martell. 

Toujours avec la volonté d’encourager la rencontre entre Humains et créativité, l’agence Hi ! Human Inside ! présente la première édition du Hack My Shop,  une course de fond technologique de 48 heures. L’évènement se déroulera  du 14 au 16 décembre 2012 au sein même de l’agence Hi ! Human Inside ! – Paris Xème.

Le principe de l’évènement peut se définir en trois points : 
• Manger
• Boire 
• Hacker

L’ensemble des participants, de l’organisation et du jury se rencontrera le vendredi  14 décembre au soir pour échanger et prendre connaissance de la thématique. Les équipes se formeront et les participants se lanceront dans un marathon de 48 heures pour livrer une idée d’applicatif web, mobile, magasin autour d’un sujet donné le jour J.
Le dimanche 16 décembre, le jury sélectionnera le meilleur projet proposé par les hackers.

A gagner :
• 1 iPad Retina WiFi 32go pour chaque membre de léquipe gagnante (5 membres max)
• Possibilité de passer un contrat avec Hi ! Human Inside ! et Martell afin de développer la technologie présentée.

Pour participer à cette première édition, les participants sont invités à sinscrire le plus rapidement possible.
L’entrée est fixée à 20€ (ça va les gars, y’a à manger, à boire et des iPads à gagner hein !). 
La date limite pour les inscriptions étant prévue le 11 décembre, les candidatures formulées après cette date ne pourront malheureusement pas être validées.

Premiers arrivés, premiers inscrits.
 

Contact : Romain@human-inside.hn 

http://human-inside.hn

events.name: Windows 8 Unleashed - Folsom
events.about:
Windows 8 Unleashed - Full Day of Hands-On Programming, B.Y.O. Laptop!

Windows 8 is the single biggest opportunity for developers EVER! Come to a “Windows 8 Unleashed” event to kick-start your Windows 8 development. “Windows 8 Unleashed” is a series of FREE events run by your local community friends and leaders, and are great whether you are an experienced .NET developer, or even if you are just getting started. We’ll spend the morning in lecture and hands on labs. Half way through, you’ll get a chance to take what you learned in the morning and compete in a hackathon with a chance to win some great prizes!

Required Software and Downloads

Please make sure to get the required software and downloads BEFORE coming to the event. You can find everything you need on the “Windows 8 Unleashed Installs” page.

Session I – Overview

  • ·Metro Style Apps Overview
  • ·Developing Metro Style Apps
  • ·Working with Controls
  • ·Implementing Navigation

Session II – Location and Data

  • ·Data Binding
  • ·Roaming
  • ·App Bar

events.name: Hackathon 2012 - Open Data Albania
events.about:
Përsëri Sfidë – Hackathon Day in Tirana 2012

Instituti Shqiptar i Shkencave promotor i Open Data Albania ka kënaqësinë t´ju anoncojë se përsëri këtë vit të rinj inteligjent dhe kreativ mund të bëhen pjesë e aktivitetit Hackathon Day in Tirana.

Një vit më parë të rinj nga Republikat e Shqipërisë dhe Kosovës u mblodhën sëbashku për të punuar e prezantuar me sukses të dhëna të çliruara nëpërmjet shembujve grafik si aplikime, mashups, harta vizuale. Ky event që zhvillohet në shumë vende të botës në Tiranë bashkoi aktivist e student të rinj të talentuar në një maratonë të njohur si Open Data Marathon ose Hackers Marathon - Hackathon. Pjesëmarrësit në event kanë ende në kujtesë sfidën e të rinjve që sollën prezantime të suksesshme (http://www.open.data.al/sq/lajme/lajm/id/477/Ndarja-e-cmimeve-ne-Open-Datathon-Albania---Hackathon-Day-in-Tirana) dhe krijuan atmosferën e inovacionit dhe inteligjencës në Tiranë.

Data e Hackathon Day 2012 është 15 Dhjetori 2012. Shënojeni në axhendën tuaj.

E reja e Hackathon 2012: Këtë herë konkurimi do të bëhet në grupe. Disa mund të regjistrohen si grup ku të jenë organizuar më parë e të punojnë sëbashku një ekonomist/aktivist/staticjen/gazetar me një programues/zhvillues apo dizenjues. Por ju mund të

regjistroheni edhe individualisht dhe grupi i punës të formohet ditën e aktivitetit duke i dhënë kështu mundësi kujtdo të tregojë aftësi edhe në punën në grup.

Për informacion të mëtejshëm vizitoni http://ais.al.

Për tu frymëzuar mbi mënyrën se si çlirohen dhe vizualizohen të dhënat vizitoni http://open.data.al/ . Gjithashtu aktiviteti do të promovohet në media konvencionale, në një kanal në You Tube dedikuar aktiviteteve të AIS si dhe tek portali i mirënjohur ne gjuhen shqipe www.shqiperia.com .

events.name: HolidayJS 2012

events.name: Hackathon Open Data
events.about:
HACKATHON OPEN DATA

15 et 16 décembre 2012

 

 

      

 

 

Vendredi 14 décembre 2012, la Région Pays-de-la-Loire, le Département de Loire-Atlantique, Nantes Métropole et la Ville de Nantes ouvrent leur nouveau portail open data. A cette occasion, les 4 collectivités, en partenariat avec Atlantic 2.0, Stéréolux et Libertic vous invitent à participer à un Hackathon Open Data le samedi 15 et dimanche 16 décembre 2012, de 10h à 18h à Stéréolux (La Fabrique).

 

Un hackathon est un événement sur lequel des participants aux compétences variées se réunissent pour développer des projets. Le terme est un mot-valise constitué de hack et marathon. Ces évènements ouverts à tous fédèrent des développeurs mais également des journalistes, designers, porteurs de projets, amateurs et curieux qui développent un projet numérique en équipe, sur des thématiques variées telles que le tourisme, la mobilité, lenvironnement, la démocratie locale, etc.

Au cours de ce Hackathon, les participants devront réutiliser au moins un jeu de données issu dune des plateformes des collectivités engagées dans louverture de leurs données. Près de 400 jeux de données seront disponibles sur la plateforme mutualisée.

Pour consulter la liste des jeux existants, rendez-vous sur data.nantes.fr et data.loire-atlantique.fr

La liste des jeux de données supplémentaires sera envoyée aux inscrits au préalable de lévénement.


 



Qui participe habituellement ?

Des développeurs, designers, journalistes, chercheurs, agents des collectivités, habitants, associations... Cest ouvert à tous.

Certains viennent développer leurs compétences sur des outils techniques et coder, dautres viennent développer leurs projets en cours ou développer leurs réseaux de connaissances. Cest aussi loccasion denrichir un CV de nouvelles expériences. Certaines structures passent recruter des compétences, dautres encore ont des idées de projets dutilité publique à développer et tous reviennent pour la bonne ambiance !

 

 

Quelques exemples de productions

Une visualisation:Les bouchons nantais

Une oeuvre journalistique: Létalement urbain à travers les années

Une application: Calculateur ditinéraire pour se déplacer dans Nantes


Rejoignez-nous les 15 et 16 décembre sur lespace Stéréolux !

 

 

Si vous souhaitez constituer une équipe au préalable afin de commencer à travailler sur un projet, contactez-nous par email claire.libertic[a]gmail.com nous vous mettrons en relation.

events.name: StartupBus: Accelerate NYC 2012
events.about:
StartupBus NYC will be holding a six hour intensive workshop for entrepreneurs at all levels.

This is not a hackathon or a competition; it is a rare chance to meet the community behind The StartupBus, to network with other people interested in startups, and to share knowledge, get advice, and learn from the experiences of others.  The event will follow a fluid agenda in an unconference-like fashion, and topics of discussion will be decided upon by participants for multiple sessions.  Topics could include:

  • Crafting a pitch
  • Finding investors and funding
  • How design can make or break your startup
  • Business models
  • Revenue generation
  • User acquisition
  • Being lean
  • Testing (user profiling, A/B, market research)
  • Finding collaborators
  • Demoing and Demo Driven Development
  • Marketing

The day may look like this:

10:00a.m. Conference start!  Get coffee & energy bars, mingle
10:30a.m. Opening remarks from facilitators
11:00a.m. A Word From Our Sponsors
11:15a.m. First session
12:00p.m. Lunch break
12:30p.m. Second session
1:30p.m.   Third session
2:30p.m.   Break - Enjoy some snacks, mingle
3:00p.m.   Fourth session
3:45p.m.   Final Remarks
 

Proceeds from ticket sales go towards the New York City StartupBus for 2013.


Some of our sponsors:

events.name: Windows Phone Championship
events.about:
Welcome to the first ever Windows Phone Championship event.

We want you to show off your Windows Phone development skills at this event. Get those cerebral juices flowing, compete with your peers and take away some awesome prizes.

There will be plenty of good food and parking available. If you’re arriving by Caltrain, the location is only a block away from the Sunnyvale station.

Whether you are a developer on another platform or an experienced Windows Phone developer; whether youve been thinking of doing your first app or you are a seasoned developer with many apps under your belt; this is the event to showcase your skills.

There will be Windows Phone Champs available on hand to help you with your development conundrums. You will also get to checkout the new and amazing Nokia Lumia Windows Phone 8 devices.

Dont forget to bring your laptop with the development environment setup, and a power adapter.

Here are some links to get everything ready:

Windows 8 and Visual Studio 2012: http://bit.ly/DevDownloads
Windows Phone SDK: http://bit.ly/WinPhone_SDK

Please note that Windows 8 and Visual Studio 2012 can be used for development of Windows Phone 8 as well as Windows phone 7.5 apps. In addition, Windows Phone 7.5 apps can also be developed on Windows Vista or Windows 7 with Visual Studio 2010 installed.

events.name: art hack day: lethal software exhibit & party
events.about:
Support GAFFTAs year-end campaign by attending this event!

Help us to continue to keep our class costs low, our public programs free, and our research the first of its kind so that our mission stays true: We apply digital art and technology to create positive social impact. All memberships that are purchased by December 15th will get you priority access and a free drink at this event. This event is sliding scale and we will be running a full cash bar. All proceeds directly benefit our 2012 fundraising goal. https://www.gaffta.org/support-us/

Overview

Art Hack Day is an event dedicated to cracking open the process of art-making. 

Between December 13-15, artists and hackers will inhabit GAFFTA to create a flash exhibit on the theme of ‘Lethal software. Software now has a license to kill, as advances in computing have made drones and other weapon systems autonomous. This development was long presaged by popular culture (Hal, Robocop, Terminator). 

Fortunately, most of us don’t have to write this software (or suffer from it) although we interact daily with software that is lethal in other respects.There is software that prevents other software from executing (spam vs. anti-spam, surveillance vs. sousveillance) and there is software that shields us from the influence of fellow humans (e.g., Google’s auto-complete algorithm). 

On Saturday, December 15th, we encourage visitors to engage with the projects for a closing public exhibition, performances, and party at GAFFTA on 923 Market Street from 7pm-Midnight.

Confirmed Participants include:

Josh Nimoy, Stijn Schiffeleers, Toby Schachman, Ryan Alexander, Matt Ganucheau, Syed Reza Ali, Jeff Easter, Igal Nassima, Dan Moore, Max Ogden, Andrew Benson, Gabriel Dunne plus many more to be announced!

Performances by:

Holly Herndon | DJ Set

Pitchfork - one of the years most exciting new voices

Holly Herndon left her Tennessee home as a teenager to immerse herself in Berlin techno culture, eventually returning wide-minded to the States to pursue a Masters in Electronic Music at Mills College. While at Mills she earned the 2011 Elizabeth Mills Crothers award for best composer and developed Movement, her debut collection of material released November 2012 on RVNG Intl. On Movement, Holly hybridizes her modern composition training and undying devotion to club music, using custom instruments and vocal processes developed in the visual programming language Max/MSP. Holly has collaborated with the Iranian philosopher Reza Negarestani, Hieroglyphic Being and Chicago footwork producer Jlin , and is currently a doctoral candidate in composition at Stanford University.

Kit Clayton | DJ Set

Joshua Kit Clayton is an artist, musician, and computer programmer, living and working in San Francisco. He is a graduate of the Bard College MFA program in Film/Video. He produces dance music for post-rave casualties both on his own and in the band Pigeon Funk. He is responsible for the development of Jitter, a video and 3d graphics extension to Cycling 74s Max visual programming environment. His performance and video based projects explore communication, speculation, value, directive, and the space between artist and audience.

Mark Slee | DJ Set

Mark Slee is a resident DJ and co-founder of House-Heads, a San Francisco collective throwing unique underground and private events focused on forward-thinking dance music. He is also one half of Manju Masi, a collaboration with long-time partner in crime Atish. 

Born and raised outside Chicago, Mark grew up on a steady diet of electronic music. Early influences came from eclectic acts like Orbital, Aphex Twin, and Underworld, balanced against an exposure to the more dancefloor-oriented sounds of Chicago house. A student of the piano from a young age, he quickly developed a keen interest in audio production and DJing - an interest he has now cultivated for 15 years.

Living in San Francisco since 2005, Mark has evolved a style of DJing that uniquely reflects his personality. Technical and introspective, he brings a thoughtful approach to constructing sets that tickle both mind and soul, at the same time topping things off with a healthy dose of groovy, quirky fun. Understanding audio to be one avenue of a larger experience, 2011 has seen him return to original production, crafting custom-tailored tracks for the unique events he produces with House-Heads, often complementing them with interactive LED sculptures that he also creates.

Thanks to sponsors IFTTT and ICED DEV for their sponsorship of this event!

events.name: The Anatomy of a Hackathon
events.about:
The Anatomy of a Hackathon
Monday, December 17th from 7:00 pm to 9:00 pm
Pearson + General Assembly

Ever wonder what it takes to run a successful hackathon? Ever wonder what it takes to build a winning application in less than 48 hours?

A hackathon is an intense event during which teams comprised of designers, developers, and people with other skill sets come together to solve a problem or turn ideas into an application. The success of a hackathon comes down to having a great event organizer, content experts, and most importantly developers to make these ideas a reality.

Just over a year ago Pearson launched its API developer platform with the goal of opening up content to fuel the innovation of new applications. Pearsons APIs have since been integrated in applications built at hackathons worldwide.

Join our all-star panel of developer evangelists, event organizers, and successful hackers for an in-depth glimpse into the rapidly growing hackathon world.

Panelists include:

  • Anthony Cuellar, Developer Evangelist, Pearson
  • Jonathan Gottfried, Developer Evangelist, Twilio
  • Anna Curan, Organzier, Startup Weekend
  • Haris Amin, Developer

Questions? Check out our FAQs. 

Our Refund Policy: Plans change? We get it. But if you cant make it to a class/workshop, please email us at classes@generalassemb.ly   5 days before the scheduled event date. No refunds or credits will be given after this timeframe.

Cant make it? Sign up at http://generalassemb.ly to stay in the loop on future events and classes.

events.name: BlackBerry Jam Sessions Katowice
events.about:
Najlepsza okazja, aby zmienić Twoje pomysły w rzeczywistość właśnie nadeszła, dzięki BlackBerry Jam Sessions - serii trzech konferencji organizowanych przez polski oddział Research In Motion przy współpracy z firmą PROGET!

Zaplanuj swoją aplikację, stwórz ją w 10 godzin, poznaj innych programistów, ekspertów, baw się i wygrywaj fantastyczne nagrody!

Czym jest BlackBerry Jam Session? = Super Hackathon

Hackathon jest wydarzeniem, na którym możesz opracować swój pomysł na aplikację w kilka godzin. Właśnie tutaj spotykają się najlepsi programiści i eksperci, tworząc aplikacje w jeden dzień. To najlepsza okazja, aby zamienić przeczucie “to może zadziałać”, w coś prawdziwego, działającego i ekscytującego. Na koniec, sędziowie wybierają zwycięzców każdej kategorii, którzy wracają do domu z torbami pełnymi nagród.

BlackBerry Jam Session to jednak o wiele więcej niż zwykły Hackathon, robimy wszystko, aby te spotkania były NAJLEPSZYMI Hackathonami na świecie.

Dlaczego najlepszymi? Ponieważ słuchamy was, wiemy czego potrzebujecie i staramy się za każdym razem zapewnić wam absolutnie wszystko co niezbędne.

Przyjeżdżamy do was, umożliwiamy bezpośredni kontakt z ekspertami, oferujemy kawę, ciastka, pizzę, nagradzamy specjalnymi prezentami, ale jesteśmy tutaj w rzeczywistości po to, aby nawiązać z wami kontakt. Jesteśmy tutaj przede wszystkim dla was, bo chcemy, abyście odnieśli sukces. Wszystkie spotkania trwają często dłużej niż 10 godzin. Będą waszą szansą na to, aby nauczyć się czegoś nowego, przećwiczyć swoje umiejętności i stworzyć aplikacje z pomocą, jakiej jeszcze nigdy nie doświadczyliście.

Dlaczego warto uczestniczyć?

Dlaczego warto uczestniczyć? Powodów jest naprawdę wiele. Tak wiele, że nie sposób je wszystkie wymienić, tym bardziej, że widza zdobyta podczas takich konferencji, wspólna praca z innymi programistami czy możliwość spotkania się z innymi osobami zainteresowanymi programowaniem czy po prostu BlackBerry jest często bezcenna.

Postanowiliśmy jednak przygotować dodatkowy zestaw motywatorów, wśród których znajdzie się m.in.:

  • WYJAZD DO AMSTERDAMU NA BLACKBERRY JAM EUROPE 2013 dla zespołu, który stworzy najlepszą aplikację ze wszystkich 3 spotkań 
  • Prototypowe urządzenia BlackBerry Dev Alpha 
  • Smartfony BlackBerry 
  • Koszulki BlackBerry Dev 
  • Tablety BlackBerry PlayBook 
  • Zestawy nagród od partnerów 
  • Wiele, wiele więcej!

Do zobaczenia na miejcu!

events.name: RHoK Nyeri, Kenya
events.about:
Please join us on December 20th and 21st for a RHoK Hackathon in Nyeri!

Hacking for Humanity 

Throught the two days, we will be coding around real world problems from all over the world. RHoK has been working with subject matter experts around the world to develop problem statements address real world development and humanitarian challenges. These problem statements will be the hacking challenges thrown out to the developers at the RHoK Nyeri hackathon. See those statements as they develop at www.rhok.org

At the end of the hackathon, we’ll invite you to share your RHoK application with the group with the potential to win prizes and see your work put to use on the ground to save lives and alleviate suffering. 

What Do I Need? 

We will provide facilities, power, food and refreshments to help you write your application. Just bring your laptop, ideas, and enthusiasm to complete the mix. 

When and Where?

The Nyeri hackathon will take place from Thursday, December 20th at 8:00am until Friday, December 21st at 5:00pm. It will be held at Kimathi University College of Technology (Main Campus).

Space is limited so sign up now: www.rhok.org

To najlepsza okazja, aby zamienić przeczucie “to może zadziałać”, w coś prawdziwego, działającego i ekscytującego. Na koniec, sędziowie wybierają zwycięzców każdej kategorii, którzy wracają do domu z torbami pełnymi nagród.

BlackBerry Jam Session to jednak o wiele więcej niż zwykły Hackathon, robimy wszystko, aby te spotkania były NAJLEPSZYMI Hackathonami na świecie.

Dlaczego najlepszymi? Ponieważ słuchamy was, wiemy czego potrzebujecie i staramy się za każdym razem zapewnić wam absolutnie wszystko co niezbędne.

Przyjeżdżamy do was, umożliwiamy bezpośredni kontakt z ekspertami, oferujemy kawę, ciastka, pizzę, nagradzamy specjalnymi prezentami, ale jesteśmy tutaj w rzeczywistości po to, aby nawiązać z wami kontakt. Jesteśmy tutaj przede wszystkim dla was, bo chcemy, abyście odnieśli sukces. Wszystkie spotkania trwają często dłużej niż 10 godzin. Będą waszą szansą na to, aby nauczyć się czegoś nowego, przećwiczyć swoje umiejętności i stworzyć aplikacje z pomocą, jakiej jeszcze nigdy nie doświadczyliście.

Dlaczego warto uczestniczyć?

Dlaczego warto uczestniczyć? Powodów jest naprawdę wiele. Tak wiele, że nie sposób je wszystkie wymienić, tym bardziej, że widza zdobyta podczas takich konferencji, wspólna praca z innymi programistami czy możliwość spotkania się z innymi osobami zainteresowanymi programowaniem czy po prostu BlackBerry jest często bezcenna.

Postanowiliśmy jednak przygotować dodatkowy zestaw motywatorów, wśród których znajdzie się m.in.:

  • WYJAZD DO AMSTERDAMU NA BLACKBERRY JAM EUROPE 2013 dla zespołu, który stworzy najlepszą aplikację ze wszystkich 3 spotkań 
  • Prototypowe urządzenia BlackBerry Dev Alpha 
  • Smartfony BlackBerry 
  • Koszulki BlackBerry Dev 
  • Tablety BlackBerry PlayBook 
  • Zestawy nagród od partnerów 
  • Wiele, wiele więcej!

Do zobaczenia na miejcu!

events.name: Sixth Annual Tampa Winter Games and NETMF Hackathon
events.about:
Its back again! Come out and get away from line of business and enterprise applications for the day and reignite your passion for programming. Better than ever, well be providing starter kits for game development for Windows 8 and Windows Phone so that you can pick the framework that works best for you, or for an extreme challenge you can hack a circuit board using the .NET framework.

Oh did we mention that the event is on the day of the Mayan Apocalypse? You wont have to worry about your day job after this anyway so you might as well come out and have some fun. Well provide the food, Bill Reiss will be making his famous lasagna for lunch, so even if you cant get out first thing in the morning come out when you can. No matter when you show up, even if its after work, youll have an opportunity to win a prize! Come at lunch, or after work (hopefully work will let out early for you for the Friday before Christmas), or hopefully you can spend the whole day with us.

Please register early (and often) so that we know how much food to make.

events.name: Sprout - Hackathon 2
RHoK Nyeri, Kenya
events.about:
Please join us on December 22nd and 23rd for a RHoK Hackathon in Nyeri! 

Hacking for Humanity 

Throught the two days, we will be coding around real world problems from all over the world. RHoK has been working with subject matter experts around the world to develop problem statements address real world development and humanitarian challenges. These problem statements will be the hacking challenges thrown out to the developers at the RHoK Nyeri hackathon. See those statements as they develop at www.rhok.org

At the end of the hackathon, we’ll invite you to share your RHoK application with the group with the potential to win prizes and see your work put to use on the ground to save lives and alleviate suffering. 

What Do I Need? 

We will provide facilities, power, food and refreshments to help you write your application. Just bring your laptop, ideas, and enthusiasm to complete the mix. 

When and Where?

The Nyeri hackathon will take place from Thursday, December 22nd at 8:00am until Friday, December 23rd at 5:00pm. It will be held at Kimathi University College of Technology (Main Campus).

Space is limited so sign up now: www.rhok.org/
